reviewText: Love the filters. Match the filter Pitcher well and with reasonable price. Brita is a good brand for this kind of product!
Soft and fits the bed well. Thought that the grey under would look weird but it looks good on the bed

I received this product for free for the purpose of a review. However, all opinions expressed here are honestly my own.I love this pan! It is now my favorite. I have yet to have anything stick to the inside of it! And it doesn't feel cheap and flimsy. It feels very high quality and well put together. I have only had to use very little oil when I fry in this pan. Everything cooks evenly and cleaning is as easy as rinsing. Seriously the food just slides right out of it! My first dinner I made with my Ozeri Green Earth Pan, fried potatoes and onions with country gravy. Fried potatoes are notorious for sticking. Not this time. My man can't even ruin this one! He has ruined so many of my pans! I would highly recommend it. It is worth every penny. I have used it 2-3 times a week for a couple months, and it still looks like it did the day it was delivered to me. I would love to have their full line.

I love this coffee maker.  I don't think I'll make another pot of coffee again.  It brews well and quickly and the unit came with 2 single serve scoops.  It is easy to clean and you will always have a fresh hot cup.
These bags are the better quality bags than the ones made by Ziplok. The Ziploks are thicker and unwieldy plus you can't see the bags contents as well as the foodsaver bags.

I use it wen sharpening my machete ad also knives, Wasusing od motor oil but this seems to be better for me and I will end up getting more. Rub some on blade after finishing as holds of rust and movment in cutting is better also,

This is the best foil cutter I've used and I've gone through a lot of them.  Others have come apart after only a few months of use but this one has stood the test of time.  It's also the best looking one I've ever purchased.  Very nice and costs about the same as the inferior ones I've purchased previously.
Excellent!  You can make brownies using this puppy, pull out the metal separator, put the cover on, and put this directly into your fridge.  Very versatile.

I am the envy of all who enter my home thanks to this nifty little contraption.Besides being a status symbol this taco rack holds tacos.  Never had a taco fall out.  The downside is that the gizmo fits together with little slots like Lincoln Logs so it is difficult to pick it up and move.  I don't know of a lot of other taco racks to compare this one to, so I'll just say if you don't have a taco rack, get one!
summary: Wait til your friends see how cool you are with this

reviewText: I gave this as a gift.  The crock lifts out for easy cleaning.  It has a spill proof top which has a really great seal.This is awesome.  I may buy one for myself when I get home.

this is a product that is definitely needed in our area due to the high calcium and mineral content in our water. I can see and taste the difference as soon as I brew the first pot after replacing the old filter. received the product fairly quickly and in good condition.
I enjoy the soft rubber grip and the rigidity of this peeler.  I would recommend this to anyone that is looking for a peeler.

I wanted to make bite sized food for my kindergartener to take to school.  So far, I made mini corn dog and  mini quiche with this pan. Both times, the food came out cleanly and easily.  It's really Nonstick, because I haven't greased the pan at all.  I hope it stays nonstick for long time.  Quality seems good so far.

I bought a 4 quart A414A Presto pressure cooker at a garage sale for only three dollars.  It needed a good cleaning and this seal kit.  It took a little work to get the seal into place, but it definitely is a perfect fit.  I haven't yet cooked or canned (1/2 pints only), but I can tell fron closing the cooker that is is going to be absolutely fine.  The lid fits very tightly when assembled.  Now I have this small cooker/canner for those smaller jobs where my 22 and 23 quart monsters would be overkill. I like these older weighted models better than the six quart TTK cooker that I found at Target store a few years back.  I don't like my TTK for cooking, because I don't trust that it's really pressuring up like I want it to, but with the heavy bottom on it, I can still use it for an A-1 popcorn popper!  :-)
I purchased these for our baby on the way and will be purchasing more they fit for the smallest baby clothes we have now and seem to be able to be used for quite some time after.

I could not be happier with my Rival Hotpot Express. I only wish they would offer it in black. It is very safe, easy to clean and easy to use. And it is f-a-s-t! I recently ordered a Sunbeam hotpot made of stainless and black plastic as it would better match my new kitchen. It was a complete disaster. The outside gets very hot and is dangerous, it is difficult to pour and holds less water. I recycled it into the garbage.
summary: At least 5 Years and Going Strong!

reviewText: Very tiny indeed. Tinker Bell might appreciate these. They did cook just fine and were easy to clean. If you do blueberry muffins, expect no more than one berry per muffin, and that's crowding it.

After using the forks for two years they broke off at the handles. We bought 8 sets of Ivory; that color is no longer made. Spoons and knives are ok so far but three of the regular forks broke 1 inch above the metal collar. They were always washed by hand and broke cutting food of a normal consistency. We like the look and feel but don't want to go through this again.

This seems a completely adequate waterbed conditioner at a reasonable price.  I can't say what my experience would be without the conditioner, but with it I sleep soundly.  Credit the conditioner or the water bed as you see fit.
summary: I'll buy this on one condition

reviewText: This pasta ladle is excellent; it is well made and easy to clean.  The design is excellent, it allows you to scoops pasta quickly and easily.  The polished stainless steel is so beautiful you could definitely serve with it as well.  It is excellent quality that will last a lifetime.  An All Clad must have! Highly recommended! A+ !

I liked most everything about this toaster except for what is MOST important - It does not toast the bread evenly on both sides of the bread! I also tried the more expensive Breville version of this toaster and got the same results. I don't know what the five star reviewers expect from a toaster but this is no five star product.Pros: Just about every feature; stylingCons: Uneven toasting; cord is too long and stiff and hard to concealI've only given it one star because of the uneven browning.

I have been buying these for year because they are so handy and easy to use.  Light, flexible and clean with hot soapy water.  They don't last very long so I replace them often, every couple years.  For the price you can't beat it.

Having previously owned a Zojirushi rice cooker with fuzzy logic I am familiar with the great advantages of this technology.  The appliance can actually sense the cooking of the rice.  It knows when the moisture level is just right and will adjust if you add a little too much water etc.  It then automatically goes to a "keep warm" mode, until you are ready to serve.This cooker has several advantages that make it a more useful product.  Being able to steam a vegetable at the same time the rice is cooking is a terrific feature that we often use----The summer is hot here in Arizona and we like to limit use of the stove when the air conditioner is running.  The veggies along with the rice come out to a T!  Thought we would try a cake.  The instruction book recipe seemed weird and wrong!  We threw all caution to the wind and used a box of regular 18.25 oz. Duncan Hines Devils Food cake mix, following the instructions for ingredients.....it came out perfect.  I will say it was not quite done when the cycle was over, but keeping the cake in the cooker an extra 5 minutes after it went to the keep warm mode did the trick. The cake was as high as a two layer cake (approx.3-4")and was beautifully moist.  We now have cake without firing off the oven----perfect!We purchased the "Ultimate Rice Cooker Cookbook" by Beth Hensperger from Amazon which contains many recipes for soup, puddings, polenta and more which are fairly easy to  prepare using the rice cooker instead of the stove.  I will have to say that yes the rice comes out perfect, this cooker does so much more, including slow cooking, veggies---well, it just makes food prep easier and more enjoyable.  So from here in the land where it can reach 115 in the summer I can truly recommend this product.If you do purchase this be bold, very bold and bake a cake, do a stew, steam veggies, make a pudding, let it make your life just a little easier.  I think you will be impressed with your purchase, as I am, and will use it a lot.....
summary: Not Just For Rice!---it's so much more.

reviewText: I use these glasses for hot and cold drinks. They do not sweat with condensation. I do not burn myself with my morning coffee. The glasses keep my cold drinks cold and my hot drinks hot. I wash them in the dishwasher without any problems. What more can you ask?

This was fairly easy to put together! I was looking for a media cabinet that I could fit inside a tiny alcove next to my tv, because my tv is in a section that was once a Murphy bed. (Old building in Hollywood). This worked perfectly because it's tall and slender enough to fit.

After looking at the reviews I thought I would give it a try. This is the 7th toaster I have tried in a range of $30 to $139 and they are all the same nothing but JUNK.  Really people is it that hard to make a toaster that works??  I did like the looks of this toaster it actually looked and felt better built than the $139 one I tried. But the toast still comes out toasted on 1 side. Looking in while it is toasting you can see the elements do not even get red in the center slots. Who would of thought a working toaster would be this hard to find???

This does work. However, I use Sharpton glass stones and it took me almost an hour to flatten 1 stone. It just isn't fast enough for me. I bought the DMT dia flat. That things gets the same job done in about 2 minutes.

This jewel inflates quickly, deflates even faster and provides the oldest bones with a wonderful nights rest at whatever firmness the user decides the mattress should be. It is the same heights as a regular bed, so for older folks, getting in and out of the bed is greatly facilitated. This item is a welcome sight for all who have experienced its comfort, and for those who are unaware, a most pleasant surprise awaits them. Storage is a snap, and the bed solves a host of problems for any host or hostess.

Very dependable. I like my espresso and this machine delivers. Did a lot of research before buying. I even ordered another machine which I returned after using once. It leaked. When this one wears out I will move up to one that does not have to have the grounds removed with every cup. Getting lazy in my old age.

I love it for the fondant to decorate my cakes but it is also good for rolling out dough of any kind make beer-rocks and it works great to roll out the yeast rolls then just take off top and there they are ready to fill

I got this because I didn't want the hassle of taking my knives somewhere to have them sharpened.  They seemed quite dull to me.  I have a Wusthoff and a Global Santoku.  This sharpener worked very well for them.  They are again sharp and cut through stuff like butter.  It did leave some marks on the edge of the knife and this might have been due to user error also.  I have to say I am totally happy with it and if you want your knives to be perfect then take them to a professional sharpener.  If you just want them sharp..... I think this is a good choice.
This will be short and sweet.  I really like this brush, it work great on all that I bake that needs brushing.

One thousand times better than fiber bristles.  Use this to line pans and also to spread olive oil over vegetables before they go in the oven.  Can't beat the price for something that is so easy to clean and wastes almost no oil.
I love the details of this pan.  My cakes look so beautiful and the details is nothing but beautiful.  Good quality pan that is heavy and will last for a long time.

This pillow was recommended to me by my chiropractor and at first it felt way to thick but then I came to appreciate it. I like the fact that it is heavy enough to stay put and helps me keep cooler. This gives a good alignment and although the price was a bit eye popping with a 5 yr warranty I've decided it was worth the investment. I ordered a similar one from another company but prefer this one and my husband likes the other.

I bought this model because it was the convenient push in (others are screw in) problem is it doesn't seal very well and makes a HORRIBLE high pitched squeal when it has too much co2 (which is barely carbonated) have used the other models and they are much better.

reviewText: The Hanna Kay mattress protector top is very soft. The waterproof material is also soft and not obvious like some others I've tried.  I've washed it twice and so far it looks like new.
nonstick fluted tube pan! good for making cakes and it has a easy clean up. I got it at a good price too.
This wire whip mixes all the ingredients! The one I received with the mixer did not mix it in around the bottom of the bowl, which was no fun.Jesus' Blessings and Peace
summary: much better than the one I recieved with the mixer!

reviewText: I bought this for four dollars at Big Lots. I figured for the price, I'd give it a shot.I have only used it one time so far, so I am not sure how long the blades will last as far as the sharpness, but I definitely will come back and update if and when they go dull and no longer work.This device DOES work and does make perfect french fries. You must cut and place the potato properly, in order for it to NOT get jammed in there. The reviews which state that the potato jammed, was stuck, couldn't cut etc is because the potato was not straight in the device.You have to cut off an end of the potato - making the end flat. Do not cut it slanted, you need it as flat and straight as possible. If it is slanted, that is when it jams and gets stuck - it's because the potato is being pushed in at a slant then and yes it will get stuck on the blades and you will have to use the tool to pop it out.If you cut a nice flat end off, you will have no problem with a potato getting stuck at all. You place the flat end against the blades and then place the top piece on.You have to push (slam) the top part down onto the bottom part which contains the blade grid. You kinda have to put a little "oomph" in it. I am pretty sure I threw out my shoulder and I still have a sore neck, but the fries were soooo good. The good news is that you will be surprised how few potatos you actually need for a huge heap of fries. A typical size potato makes a nice serving size of fries. So, you only need to take a few whacks at this thing to feed your family.Overall I am actually quite happy with this handy dandy little device. For four bucks, it is a deal. Ten is ok, but a little steep. If you can catch it under ten bucks, I say go for it. It does what it is supposed to do. The fries really do turn out the perfect size. Just be sure to always cut a nice flat end off - no slants - and you will not have any troubles at all.

The NORPRO Grip-Ez Garlic Press works well for a basic, general-use garlic press.  It is not the best, but it also is not as expensive as some of those better garlic presses.  I've been using this press weekly for about two years now and am happy and pleased.  Sturdy manufacture and holds up to dishwasher cleaning almost always.  The handles are a great grip and easy on your hands, especially when you are doing a lot of garlic pressing at a time.  Good product!

I usually don't give 5 star reviews.  The product really has to be quite special for that... and this mattress fit the bill.  My husband and I were on the lookout for a new mattress for over 6 months.  We were sick and tired of our mattresses basically failing within 5 years.. even with the 10 year warranties which ended up not covering anything that actually broke.  I wanted something more like a sleep number bed, but my husband was really leaning toward a foam bed.  I had heard that foam beds were uncomfortable and hot.  Most of my friends who had gotten foam beds in the past, had returned them within 3 months.  So admittedly, I went into buying this bed with a bit of a bad attitude.What I like about this bed.  It is really quite comfortable!  I am one for a firmer type of mattress. Granted, I don't want to sleep on a board, it should have some give, but I don't want to sink down into it.  This mattress was perfect.  It conforms to your body, but you definitely don't 'sink'.  It was much more firm than I thought it would be.  I will say, I used to wake up a bit stiff and since getting this bed, I don't anymore.Another thing that is great about this mattress is that you do NOT get hot in it.  Again, one of the main complaints I had heard over and over about other foam mattresses was how hot they were.  Not so with this one.  My husband gets very hot at night and he has not had any issue with this bed being hotter than any other mattress we've owned.Some other things I was very happy with was... We used our regular box springs underneath and that hasn't effected the quality of this bed either.  It is a true to size king sized mattress.  I liked that all our sheets were able to fit over the mattress (i.e. the thickness of the mattress although quite thick wasn't so thick that I had to go out and buy new extra-depth type sheets). Then there was the price!  We did a lot of comparison shopping and the price compared to other foam mattresses (along with traditional type mattresses) really couldn't be beat!  Lastly, I loved how this was delivered and how easy it was to just put on the bed.  I thought it was a bit heavy, but my husband says it's no heavier than any other mattress.  I also liked that we got two pillows out of the same foam as well (a nice little bonus).One thing that really bothered me when we first got this mattress was the smell.  Now, the manufacturer does say to 'air it out' for a number of days and the smell should disappear.  Frankly, I smelled the odor for quite a long time and was worried that it wouldn't go away.  My husband smelled it too, but after about a week he said he couldn't smell it anymore.  I, however, smelled it for a good month afterward.  Granted it eventually totally faded away, but was still there for a lot longer than I anticipated.Overall, this was an A+ purchase and one we have not regretted in the least.  It's very comfortable, not hot, and was priced right!  I will note here again, this mattress is more FIRM than I think most people would imagine a foam mattress to be.  It does 'break in' a little over time, but it's still firm.  Also, the odor will eventually go away, but it takes a little longer than the manufacturer says (at least that's been our experiences).We have had this mattress now for about 9 months and have really been happy with it.  We actually ended up getting a twin sized version of this mattress for one of our children (whose mattress had pretty much died).  She, too, has been really happy with it.  If we need another mattress in the future, this will be our 'go to' choice.

It's big, non-stick and I love it!  I use it often since I make double and triple batches of food for church coffee hour.  The only little problem is that it slides on my gas burners.  But that's a small inconvenience for this wonderful pan!

Use the sharp end to cut the skin and the dull end to pry the skin off. I tried this on a naval orange and found it harder to use than a knife.....and it cut my hand. I think it will work better on fruits whose skin isn't as thick as a naval orange. I know people that swear by these gadgets, but I didn't have a great experience.

I was looking for a large pan to replace my 8" teflon pan that was wearing out.  Mainly for cooking eggs.  It worked great.  Only issue is the handle is not firmly attached to pan so there is a little jiggle.

I cannot believe the low price of this blender. It compares very well to other offerings from Cuisinart and Braun (and even feels more powerful on the high-speed setting). The cord is long and flexible (very handy in a crowded kitchen environment) and the motor is unusually quiet. This was such an incredible deal, I ordered another one as a gift.
We just bought this a few weeks ago. It's been working really well so far. It's very precise in weighing even tiny amounts of food in four different units.

I own a Breville juicer. I think it's a fantastic machine. I remember reading reviewer's complaints about the clean-up, and I thought they were just being picky. Once we started juicing several times a day, though, cleaning up the Breville became really annoying. You can't just rinse out the parts - you have to scrub out the pulp. Dishwashing won't get it out, you have to do it by hand.Anyway, we decided to try the Nutribullet. So far I love it. It blends things very smoothly and clean-up is just a good rinse. Here's the thing, however: if you were juicing you cannot use your recipes the same way with the Nutribullet. For instance, one of my favorite juices was ginger-carrot-apple. In a juicer it comes out nice and smooth. But with the Nutribullet you are getting the apple fiber, so you are essentially making apple sauce, not juice. But, on the other hand, you will be using less fruits and vegetables overall and getting more out of it, saving you money. AND - the biggest thing for me - you will actually feel FULL after a Nutribullet "blast" versus a juicer "Juice" because of all the fiber. So you will also be saving on calories.My advice to former juicers would be to use the recipes in the book that comes with it first, instead of your own juicing recipes, because you may get a bad first impression. Your juicing recipes will definitely have to be adjusted. You will need to reduce the amount of spinach or kale you were using because since you are now getting the full amount of the vegetable, it will be too bitter. I'm still working on apple mixes because of the thickness. But it's so much more convenient than a juicer, and you use so much less produce.

It's been a few years since we owned a roaster-rack set and this was a great selection.  Our previous set was fairly heavy duty with a non-stick finish but we didn't want that surface this time.  This Cuisinart roaster has used twice for turkey and twice for standing rib roasts.  Our standing ribs are cooked at 450* before lowering to 350* for a rare cook and the pan had no problems or warping at these temps.  We especially appreciate the fixed outward angle of the handles so there's no need to place hands too close to hot food when lifting out of the oven.  Use a cooking oil spray prior to roasting and the cleanup is quick and easy with shiny results.

This looks like an excellent product.  My goal was to find something that could be used in the event of a power outage - I've tried various types of lanterns and none are that great to read by.  This looks like it will fit the bill nicely.  However, the one I received came in a box with nothing but Japanese text, no instructions in English, nothing...  Fortunately I was able to find out how to recharge by reading the reviews, but that was not what I expected!
I have finally abandoned measuring ingredients by volume and now use this to measure by weight. This scale is very accurate and for $15 it is obviously a great value for the money.
summary: Works very well and great value

reviewText: If you mainly use a food processor, or WANT to use a food processor for blending, chopping and pureeing foods, the Mini-Prep is such a good idea. It does about 80 percent of what a large food processor does, and it's easier to clean and takes up less space.If you find you typically chop herbs, make pesto and blended sauces, herb butters and the like and do NOT use the food processor for batters, doughs and slicing, you might consider the Mini-Prep. The motor is very strong, the blade very sharp. I made a fresh tomato coulis out of tomato, dried tomato, oil and herbs in seconds and it had the right texture (chopped but not liquified.)One thing I hate about large food processors is scraping small amounts of chopped herbs or nuts out of the large bowl. If your typical job, like mine, is chopping small items in smaller quantities, this is perfect. It takes up a lot less space on the counter, too.The unit comes in steel color and white. Before you buy a food processor, consider what you typically process. If you do coffee, smoothies, pesto, chopped herbs and nuts and salsa, this may just be enough, saving you dollars and space.
summary: Does most of the jobs of a larger unit except for slicing

reviewText: When you step out of the shower and wrap yourself in these wonderful bath sheets you can feel how substantial they are.  They're very large and very thick.

I've not had this pan very long and at least one previous reviewer complained it lost lost its non-stick over time and cited a Consumer Reports' similar conclusion. I wonder if he/she/they may have turned the heat up too high, which is against the rules and not recommended.So far, I'm very happy with its look and feel, and although I always use a little oil even in a non-stick pan, this one has so far lived up to its promise. Fried eggs are so slippery and easy to flip! So much better than my stainless one!Highly recommended for those like me without a dishwasher!

I love Hoover vacuums. This replaces a dual chamber that I got for a gift several years ago.First, I will say that it picks up nearly EVERYTHING on the first pass. It does sometimes take an additional pass or two to pick up bird feathers. We have a short-haired dog, and I am always amazed at how much hair it picks up! We have been using it for about a week now.For the most part, it is simple to use. The button for releasing the canister took some getting used to (it wasn't intuitive) and the latch for keeping the canister closed is not the best quality. I am worried that it might not last as long as the vacuum will work.I have a few very minor issues, though:1. The cord is not long enough. I don't know why manufacturers have decided to shorten cords in the past few years, but on our carpet cleaner and now vacuum, the cords no longer reach the entire length of our great room, whereas they did on older models. So I either have to plug in to our TV power strip or unplug and replug on the opposite end of the room during vacuuming.2. The "power" brush attachment leaves much to be desired. The one on our old Hoover did a much better job (there was a "Power burst" setting for it on the old machine). It takes twice as long to get the dog hair off of our couches now. You can't push down at all while using it or the brush stops rotating.3. The hose is the kind that self compresses, it does NOT like to stay stretched open. While it makes it convenient to put away, it gets irritating when you are trying to clean something and you are always yanking at the hose to expand.4. This is very minor, but since the cord is self retracting, there is no hook for it up by the handle, so you have to reach down and grab it if you want to keep the cord out of the way while vacuuming.All-in-all, this is a great vacuum that I would recommend, especially to pet owners. I just have to adjust to the few minor inconveniences of the new model.
summary: Great vacuum with very minor issues

reviewText: Ooh, a nice red and green tablecloth that is big enough, with one leaf, for our dining room table and looks crisp, colorful and washable. Very, very good quality! Glad we found this!!! Actually,it gets used NOW, summer, and looks great!
This T-fal toaster works well and toasts evenly. Like that it has a digital display and has a stay cool exterior.
I've washed this filter gently in warm water three times so far and it is still going strong.  When the time comes for a new one, it'll be this one.
Great coasters for home, patio or work. I have to protect my wood furniture and use these coasters everywhere!  Work great and reasonably priced.
summary: Gripping, flexible and easy to clean

reviewText: Aluminum used in anodized cookware is a health concern.Too much can cause toxicity and lead to conditions such as rickets, colic, anemia, bone deterioration, memory loss and diminished kidney and liver function. Alzheimer's has been linked to aluminum overexposure.The hard anodized coating on aluminum cookware quickly wears off from repeated washing and scrubbing leaving bare aluminum to leach into your foods.According to Brandy Wine Science Center Inc. anodized aluminum does leach. This information is the result of a heavy metal leaching test performed on various cookware. The results show it leaches 7.10 mg per liter.The EPA has taken administration action against DuPont for not warning consumers of potential health risks.For the same price as anodized aluminum, you can purchase stainless steel cookware which does not have these health related issues. Better yet, use Cast Iron cookware. It's uses less energy, holds heat longer and will outlast you and your great grandchildren.I sincerely hope this information helps you to make a healthier decision when purchasing cookware for your family.:-)
summary: Please don't use anodized aluminum cookware.

reviewText: When you buy a quality mattress, the last thing you want is for it to be damaged especially by getting wet. This product (the Luna Waterproof Mattress Protector) is PERFECT for the job of protecting your investment in a good mattress. This pad can be used alone (the soft, terry suface is comfortable) or in combination with any other pad. The waterproof membrane resists liquids of all kinds and -- very important and different from other pads -- isn't noisy or rough underneath your bedding. Highly recommended.
well made and arrived on timemy daughter loves her pillow caseno one's allowed to use itwell worth having

My last roommate took the cutlery organizer with her.  I didn't think there was much difference between cutlery organizers, but it would seem that I was mistaken.  This has several major advantages over organizers I have used in the past.It has compartments large enough for very large utensils.The organizer itself is larger than most.With 6 compartments, it has more than most organizers.Being mesh, it doesn't collect dust or water like other organizers.This organizer is much cheaper than nearly any expandable type organizer.I haven't ever seen a utensil organizer that competes with this one, I strongly recommend it.

This is the original and by far the best stovetop popcorn popper I've ever used. It heats up quickly and never burns the corn.With heavy use they do tend to wear out after a few years, but if you're handy you can fix it yourself.

Purchased this as a gift for my mother, to replace one that had broken.  She likes it and says that it stores easily and weighs things accurately.  The only reason it's getting 5 stars instead of 4 is that it doesn't register very small quanitities.
summary: purchased as a gift; recipient likes it a lot

reviewText: It slipped. I threw it away.I have decided to add the following to all my reviews:Beware! Some "reviewers" will trash a product for no reason simply because they are paid to or because they sell competitive products. Other "reviewers" will give products - that they have never seen and never used - glowing 5 star ratings - for a fee.  Some honest reviewers do not understand what a product is for or how to use it and will trash a product simply because they are just plain dumb.

I have been using a Nuvave for some time.  This is much better in style and efficiency.  It is really quite a bit much quieter compared to the Nuwave.  The difference between 1500 watts and 1800 watts is unbelievable.  definitely a must buy!!UPDATE:The Nuwave is much noisier; but the temperature indicator is much more visible.  You have much more control of temperature with the Nuwave.  If you slip your pan to flip your food with this unit, it will change the temperature you set.  This is a very very bad flaw!!!
summary: Daily use and still going strong.. Can't imagine cooking without

reviewText: Compared to Max Burton, this one rates second for two reasons.  The timer jumps from 0 to 5 minutes and it's noisier.

These pillows are well made and the price is excellent. I think it all boils down to what you intend to do with them & how anal you are about hygiene.I purchased these because I've been on an 18 month search for something that would eliminate some chronic neck pain...and since that search has been minimally successful, I've been on a simultaneous search for a pillow that will allow me to at least get comfortable enough to sleep at night. I've lost count of the neck pain gadgets I've tried and I've tried at least as many pillows.Compared to many of the other products I've experimented with, these pillows allowed me to get pretty comfortable. They're pretty sturdy but they're not rock hard like a foam roll or anything. my primary complaint is that I've had a hard time finding pillowcases in this size, and I really don't like using pillows without a pillowcase. I'm a big stickler for pillow hygiene because pillows are pretty disgusting. obviously, sleeping on them under your neck or head is going to quickly dirty them up with oil from your hair...and drool (even if you don't think you drool, everybody does a little bit sometimes). I have problem skin and dirty pillows transfer all sorts of nastiness onto the face. My complexion sounds the alarm whenever I've been slacking on washing the bed linens.I went to the Newpoint website and searched all over the internet for covers in this size & I could only ever find decorative ones that wouldn't work for sleeping. I just put standard pillowcases on them but that's actually more annoying than you'd think it would be. I don't have a sewing machine & I don't have time to sit down and stitch together a cover that would fit. this may not be important to other people, but for me, it is significant.I have washed these in the washing machine and dried them in the dryer and that actually worked pretty well....but that's not convenient. I'd rather have a half dozen pillowcases to rotate between than bother with washing and drying the whole pillow over and over.If you want these for lumbar support, then I think hygiene becomes much less of an issue & theyd likely be a great choice. If you want these to fill decorative pillow covers, then it's a bargain....but if you want to sleep on them - you better like to sew or know somebody that does.
summary: I like the pillows themselves, but the lack of pillowcase availability in this size has negatively impacted my experience

reviewText: It wiggles loose pretty often, so make sure that you tighten it every time you attempt to grab something above your head.

I developed a bad back which pinched a nerve that gave me pain down my leg. A firm mattress helped quite a bit, but then it was too hard to sleep on my side, which is necessary to rest and stretch my back for part of the night.I decided to not go cheap and get this latex topper (although it's not that expensive, really). This didn't help completely - in fact, it may have been worse. On may back, I didn't have enough support, and on my side, my hip was not supported and caused too much pain to remain on my side.The final part of the solution was a cheap, thin, back pillow typically used for a car seat (bought on Amazon for 15 bucks). While on my back, with it just below my lower back, I feel a bit uncomfortable (it's probably slightly too thick). On my side it's perfect. End result is a good nights sleep and a back that has felt better than it has for over a year.
summary: This was one part of the solution

reviewText: Fall in love with butter again!  Holds one stick of softened butter on your table for easy spreading on rolls, just change the water every three days!
summary: A must have for the butter lover!

reviewText: I owned another garlic press the Oxo, and it never really pressed out all the garlic.  I read about the Trudeau press which was reviewed in a cooking magazine.  Love, love, love the press! It does exactly what it is supposed to do, without wasting any garlic.

I love this bottle.  It's very well made.  Keeps my water cool for hours even in the New Orleans heat in the middle of the summer.  I bought one, loved it and bought another one.  It's small enough to carry around easily and large enough for quite a bit of water.
I know they are different from the old ones, but have been unable to see any difference in the function when I compare it to the previous style one i still have. cheaper to make, but still works.

These pillows are illegal.  There is NO REQUIRED TAG telling what the filling consists of ("Do Not Remove Under Penalty of Law.)" The shredded foam inside could come from previously-used memory foam mattresses for all we know.Aside from that, the pillow cover itself has a sewn in layer of some kind of squishy stuff (is this the "gel"?) about 1/8 inch thick, which makes the cover quite firm and creates the "dent" of memory foam.  When the cover is removed, however, you have a whole bunch of shredded foam, a real lot of it, in a flimsy stretchy sewn case, and some of the foam shreds are even quite hard to the touch, which makes me wonder about its source.The pillow as sold is way too thick and firm to be comfortable. However, after taking the cover off and using the encased inside in a double pillow case, it is acceptable.  After the foam settles down, I may put the covers back on.There were no included instructions on how to care for these pillows, and the cover was stamped with "Lucky Home," which makes me think immediately of China. So, think before you buy these!

I bought this since it was one of the better ones recommended by America's Test Kitchen. I haven't been disappointed with it so far. It does get a few nicks and cuts in it, so don't kid yourself. However, it does some to take the wear and tear a little better than your average generic cutting board. I would like to get the other sizes and the charcoal grey version of this board when I get a chance.

I use these every day.  The larger one is much more useful, but both are super easy to clean in the dishwasher and bake really well.  I bought these in a fun orange color and plan to buy another set in a different color.
So far, the case seems to do exactly what I hoped it would do, keep out bed bugs. The case was easy to put on my box spring, and is made from a sturdy material.

This towel is great because it gives you enough to dry alot of wet surfaces, and good for staying with guests incase you want something more to cover up with I guess. It's a thick fabric and very absorbent.

Great color, absolutely HUGE, and matches the rest. Absorbs water like a champ!Only downside is how heavy it is. Being a woman with waist length hair, I cannot put this on top of my head (I tried, I toppled over almost). Great for wrapping yourself in to lounge, as it's almost more blanket than towel. :)
summary: Super HEAVY is the ONLY downside

reviewText: This is my perfect toothpick holder.  It has a clean stainless steel look, a very functional design, and holds lots of toothpicks yet makes it easy to pick just one when you pull up the lid

reviewerName: Raquel S. "Avid Amazon Fan and Kindle User"
reviewText: It did not take long for me to fall in love with the T-Fal compact food steamer. My previous steamer worked great and looked pretty, but it was clumsy to work and store. I'm throwing that thing away now that I have my T-Fal steamer. This T-Fal steamer is smartly designed and kitchen friendly. It has a small footprint and neatly compacts down for storage. Yet, it doesn't skimp on it's ability to steam a little or a lot of food as needed.What I like:- The trays nest neatly for storage or stack sturdily for steaming.- The water tray is easy to fill and drain.- The water collection tray is easy to handle and drain. It's able to retain a lot of water without spilling. Easier to handle compared to the last steamer I had.- small footprint, doesn't take up a lot of counter space.- Easy to program and use.- Everything compacts down neatly together so you can store it away. Love this especially.- Trays are dishwasher safe.What I don't like:- Dark semi-opaque water tray is hard to see where the water level is at.Kudos to T-Fal for this smartly designed steamer. All the joys of cooking with steam without the frustration of cleaning and storage.
summary: Fantastic compact design. Finally, an electric steamer smartly designed, beautiful, and functional.

reviewText: We owned our last Russell Hobbs electric kettle for 21 years, and it was excellent. Got this one 3 months ago, and it works about the same, but is noisier boiling the water. It's way better than a lot of the plastic models out there, but is definitely not made with the same quality as its predecessor. Meanwhile, my sister is on her second pricier Chef's Choice kettle in six years. Russell Hobbs is definitely the better deal for efficiency and value.

I have always had Hoover, as a child my mother would have nothing else so I was delighted to see this one and with a retractable power cord.We have 3 dogs and the vacuum is good, the filter needs cleaning frequently but the ONE BIG PROBLEM is the belts.The first one slipped off within 3 weeks, thereafter every other time we used it. Then they started to break (all genuine Hoover parts) so far 9 new belts in 9 months with putting the belt on numerous times in between.I have called Hoover, they say they have never encountered this before but suggested buying some more belts!!!!!Eventually we have given up - it is going to Goodwill for somebody who doesnt mind putting the belt back on every week and we are heading for a Shark.

I got a variety of these Contigo Autoseal Travel Mugs to give for Christmas presents. They are a big hit. They really do seal and not leak even though my kids just throw them in their backpacks or on the car seat. My only complaint is that I drink my coffee black and it stays hot so long that it is easy to burn my lips when I take a sip. The kids who add milk or creamer don't have this problem though.
This is the finest cookwear I have ever used.  It is truely nonstick inside and out.  It is very well constructed and cooks beautifully.  I would highly recommend the T-fal professional line.
summary: T-fal E9380264 Professional Total Nonstick Oven Safe Thermo-Spot Heat...

reviewText: I like this item to hang my mops and brooms on.  It keeps everything neat and clean.  Always there when I need them.

I'll start with the word of caution: do not put the trays in the bottom rack of your dishwasher. They'll warp due to the extra heat. So wash the trays one or two at a time in the top rack instead. It's not the end of the world if they warp a little -- using them once will get them mostly back in shape -- but just save yourself the frustration. Wash them flat in the dishwasher, on the top rack.As for the dehydrator:  what can I say of such things? This was my first, and I've been wanting one for about twenty years. It's great as a way to make jerky (my favorite use), but you can dehydrate basically any organic matter in it. Of course, you probably don't want to dry chicken or pork in it! But I've really enjoyed mine.I can't speak to long-term durability or anything like that, but for my purposes as an amateur food dryer guy, this dehydrator works great. It's a great starter unit, I think. Even if I end up getting a new one that's bigger and fancier, I think I'll hang onto this one for small and experimental projects.Do make sure you read up about using your dehydrator, though -- there are a lot of things to know about drying foods. For example, trim as much fat off your beef as you can before you dry it. Sometimes, apples dry better with a little dusting of sugar and cinnamon on them. That kind of thing. Good luck, and have fun!

This is a good knife as long as you remember it was only $10.00. very well put together with steel running all the way down to the base of the handle then held with 3 large rivets. I don't think the handle is wood but it is made of some solid wood " like " product. The blade is a bit thin compared to higher end Japanese and German knifes I own, but they also cost 2 1/2 times more. Knife came dull and not sure how it holds an edge as I have only had it for 1 week. Had this now for several months blade chipped and does not hold an edge very long.  Maybe better to spend the money on a higher quality knife.

I read a lot of reviews before purchasing.  I'm so happy I purchased this item.  Its made really well! Its hangs on the closet bar better than any I've ever seen.  Its wider also so small boots or tennis shoes fit perfectly.  For smaller shoes like sandles you can put more than one pair in the hole. Great color also.
summary: High Quality and wider than most

reviewText: I absolutely love it.  We recently put in wood floors and we also have a dog.  Dog hair is very visible on the wood, but with my Hoover Flair it sucks right up.  I quickly go around the whole house, get into corners and under beds etc.  It is light and easy to handle.  No battery to wear out and have to replace.  Just flip out the container to dump the dirt and hair, snap back in and it's ready to go again.  Worth every penny!
Bought this as a gift.  It is:  Lovely  Heavy  Lid fits tightly  Can be used for any storeage  Another great Le Creuset

got this new fangled DUXTOP 1800. thought it would be good for the log cabin and camping out. it uses up to 1800 watts so your meter spins faster than a LAS Vagas wheel of fortune.  your pans must be magnetic AND good conductors of heat or else it only heats the center of the pan==omlets cook in the center and liquid on the outside. the  loud fan is good for scaring the coons from the campsite but they mess up grannys hearing aids.  take my advice ==marry a good god fearing woman that can cook and donate the price of the DUXTOP to the CHURCH of your choice..you will be much better ahead if you do.  GOD BLESS all that read this.

reviewText: It became my main pot for pasta. Love the straining lid. Angel hair slips through a bit, I wish they had a smaller straining opening.
Great accessory for the food slicer 615.  Used it to cut a lot of bread...quietly and did not tear up the loaf
I bought 3 sets of these for my 7.5 ft tree and mixed with another 3 boxes of lights [150 lights each] the tree had just the perfect amount of shimmer.  I was very glad I bought these.
summary: Exactly the right amount of shimmer.

reviewText: These knives work quite well an look very nice to boot. I like the solid construction and found the case they came in to be useful since I did not hve room in my silverware drawer for them. A great find!

This really works!  I  know it LOOKS like one of those Ronco "It Cuts, Dices, AND Slices," but the truth is it's easy to use, and works perfectly.When you buy make SURE that you get all three sizes in one package.  (This is what's on this web page -- other companies are selling just one size at the same price!)Glen
I have had no issues with this product.  I have used everything except the cake/pie tins.  Great price.  Easy to clean

I purchased this a bit over a year ago, after having fabulous results with the bissell pet eraser (awesome). However, bissell fell short on this one. The motor died after about 8 months, bissell would not honor the warrenty and i was stuck with a cleaner that only ran if i pushed it hard forwards....like awind up toy :( when it worked it did work well, but to have the motor die and bissell do nothing....thats unexceptable in my book.

This can hold a lot of silverware, but the downside is that it is inefficiently large.  I'd have given it 3 stars for being half an inch too wide to fit into my drawer, but that's my fault for not measuring.  It gets 4 stars because each section is overlarge except for the miscellaneous - they could have trimmed down the width of each by about 1/2 an inch and had more space for the miscellaneous, but I suppose not everyone has slim utencils.I recommend this if you have bulky, large-handled serveware and have another drawer to hold your spatulas, etc.
The scraper is very easy to use (handle) and well made. The scraper end edges are very sharp and have a tendency to catch on the chopping surface.I recommend that they be filed to a rounded profile.

I bought these for my Sears Kenmore Canister Vacuum.  I have been using these after market bags for three years and there is zero performance difference in these versus the OEM bags sold at Sears other than the price.  Well, unless you just happen to like yellow bags versus white ones in your vacuum.  They fit perfectly, hold as much and never rip. I love Sears appliances but I refuse to pay twice as much for their after market products that have no measurable advantage.  Model compatibility check was super easy at this vendor.

This is a great organizer for off-season shoes and shoes that are worn only occasionally.  It does take space in your closet but it is neat and you can finally throw out those messy cardboard shoe boxes.  My shoes are now dust-free and I can wear them immediately instead of needing to polish and brush them.  My closet looks great for a change!
It was I wanted except the partitions are really not needed unless maybe for young kids who might like their food separate.Durable and easy to clean.
I am a bit disappointed that the bottle opener and screwdriver do not retract, but I haven't used them yet so I can't say if it will be an issue.

Very affordable, yet pretty microfiber duvet queen set. The material is a little on the thin side, however, it is nice to use during summer.. hotter months as it is light. I like the pattern and i think it is pretty. It washes alright, it would fade a little. I would recommend to others on a tight budget.

reviewText: This stuff makes the perfect yogurt!!!  Just enough tartness, doesn't bite you back like some other starters and wonderful texture and firmness!  I'll never use another starter.

I was a bit concerned about buying and using a pressure cooker. I've heard the safety nightmares they are. However, this seems to have a ton of safety features, is easy to use, and is pretty easy to clean. The lid is not dishwasher safe, owing to the components on the inside you don't want to damage. reviewText: Bought this to go in our camper to hold our charcoal to not only keep it dry but to contain the mess/dust.  It does the job well and fits in the front compartment of our fifth wheel nicely.  Very nice thing to have.  I can see that it could serve many other uses and might purchase another one to keep dog food stored in the camper for the dogs.

reviewText: I have had the hand held Food Saver vacuum for over two years and used these on jars of my dehydrated and fresh food stored in the refrigerator/freezer.  It's the best way I know of to keep chopped lettuce fresh for a week!  Because I had such great success with that method, this year I bought one of the large Food Saver machines that uses a port and a tube to attach to a jar sealer, and it works even better.  These things are the only way to keep food fresh for the maximum amount of time.  Peel and chop fresh vegetables, vacuum seal them, and when time is short the hard part is already done.  Make freezer meals to reheat when you have no time at all to cook.  This is true convenience cooking; no preservatives, low sodium, low fat or whatever you choose for your needs, with you controlling all ingredients and herb/spice enhancements.  Cook ahead for a month or more, vacuum and freeze.
summary: I Have Both Sizes - Love Them

reviewText: These bags are a heavy mil and stiff for a disposable bag.  You don't have to worry about poking a hole or splitting out with pressure.  I would use a bigger bag for some applications, but these work well for decorating cookies after flooding has dried.  Would work well for cake highlights as well.  Makes clean-up a snap.  Stiffness of bag allows a fairly easy refill of the bag with the same color.  Inexpensive which is a definite plus too!

These are very nice soup spoons.  They have a simple design which makes them blend in with my regular silverware set. The bowl of the spoon is very shiny and a good size for soup.  They would be too large to fit in a childs mouth, but are good for an adult.

Originally i purchased these racks to BBQ ribs in the oven and/or cool cookies or fresh bread.  The only drawback is the cleaning of the grids when meat is cooked directly on them. They are too big to soak in the sink and only come mostly clean with a durable soft brush. None the less, I will utilize them.

I love this grill/griddle. I have had it for a couple of weeks and I use it almost every day. It makes perfect pancakes. I have made burgers and even grilled veggies. It works great. It is easy to turn the side to either grill marks or smooth. It is easy to clean. It has a pan in the bottom that is easy to take out and clean if you spill something over the side. I even like the orange color but I don't think it would be for everyone.

reviewText: I love this colander!!! It was so worth the money! It doesn't take up nearly as much space in the cupboard, or in the dishwasher. It's easy to push open and closed. I also love the stand on bottom. This makes it so you can rest it in the sink when using it, but the food doesn't have to touch the bottom of the sink, which is very unsanitary.

My toaster broke some time ago so I was happy to get to check out the bodum bistro 2 slice toaster. While I haven't used the bun warmer on it, I have used the toaster many times. It has 5 settings for light to darkness. People in my house like their things toasted at different levels so we have used many of the settings. For making normal toast, this toaster is fantastic. I like mine on the lighter side and I set the toaster to 2 and it comes out perfect. Other people in my house like their toast dark, so I set it to 5 and the toast comes out nice and dark for them without being burnt. We also put English Muffins in the toaster and they also toast fantastic. The slots are wide enough for what we have put in it that things do not get stuck in it. The black also looks nice and blends into the items in my kitchen and doesn't stand out like a stainless or white toaster.
Love the pot rack and 4 more hooks gave me enough for all the pots I wanted to hang.
summary: Perfect addition to the pot rack

reviewText: I took this to work since I like to eat a banana each morning.  It slices quickly and cleanly through your banana and gives you exact same wedges each time.  If you are making a salad this would be a great little device for getting equal slices quickly.So far no problems it works just great.
Great curtains to have. They do a really solid job at being shower curtains. Can't really complain about anything with these.

I was stationed in Germany (Brita's International HQ) and have noticed the US gets the sub-par designs compared to what is in Europe.  Funny, since all the US products I got there were the sub-par versions.  Anyhow, I don't recommend this water pitcher.  The filters are ridiculously expensive for carbon bits in plastic (they are about 6x the price of the superior Euro design).  I had to duct tape the top to the pitcher-body to keep the top from coming off.  It didn't fall off when pouring, but instead it always slid off when my thumb made contact with the lid (I dare you to hold this pitcher without any thumb-contact).  In my opinion PUR makes a better designed pitcher that is closer to Euro Brita.

I think this is a good buy because the price is cheap enough with the free shipping, but I wasn't impressed with the quality of the set.  Seems a little flimsy but they should hold up for a while with careful use.

exactly what it is, the one egg wonder! It makes a perfect one egg. great for single breakfast or collage kids. great for grilled cheese

Bottom line: This is a pretty average waffle maker that doesn't excel in any area, but doesn't fall significantly short either.Full review: The Nesco waffle maker makes traditional (i.e., thin) waffles rather than the thick Belgium-style waffles. The manufacturer says the plates are designed to produce "heart" shaped waffles, but I'd describe the shape more like a pie wedge. Still, a nice change from the traditional square or rectangular shape.There are several pluses to this model. The non-stick coating works well, and releases the waffles easily. Heat-up time is decent, and it has an indicator light that shows when the temperature is correct for usage. The "stay cool" handle is a nice design feature and does help keep your hand from hitting the hot surface. It has a browning level dial at the top.On the downside, the plates are not removable, which makes clean-up a bit more difficult. The fixed plates also mean it can't be used for anything other than waffles. The handle, while it does stay cool, would benefit from extending further from the housing so you could get a better grip (especially if you have large hands). The browning level is not very accurate - there's a large "dead spot" in the middle of the dial range that seems to have little effect on the waffle doneness.The cooking was generally even. It clearly has some hot spots near the center that produce a bit of a mottled level of doneness, but nothing that was what I would describe as significantly uneven.Tip: clean the plates well before using it for the first time. I didn't, and the plates got rather smelly (sort of a plasticy scent) when they heated up. I unplugged it, let it cool, and gave the plates a good cleaning. The second time they heated without any smell.While it does not excel in terms of build quality, features or performance, it gets the job done. It's worth considering if you're looking for an occasional waffle and don't want to spend a lot on a more advanced, but more capable, waffle maker.
AGAIN BISSELL DOES STAND BY IT'S PRODUCTS, HOWEVER I DID USE BOTH BELTS WITHIN 3 MON FROM BREAKAGE, TO MY DISAPPOINTMENT

I installed this hook in my garage to get a rake and shovel out of the corner of the garage.  The item is very well made and sturdy when mounted.The small spike on the back of the flat metal portion of the hook allows you to easily stick the hook into the wall before mounting so that you don't have to hold it while driving the screws.The screws went into the sheetrock easily and hold the hook securely.  Just be careful not to overtighten, as they will strip sheetrock.I have posted a photo of the hook holding my rake and shovel, and a photo of the screws that come with the hooks.

reviewText: It matches my kitchen appliances nicely!The outside stays very cool during toasting because of the gap between the coils and the outside. There's a small blue light under the buttons so you can see which one is pressed.Toasts VERY evenly.I spent days hunting around for a good toaster and this is tops. Unless you're willing to spend $50+ on a Calphalon, which is only marginally better, buy this guy. The cheap $10 toasters at Target won't toast right, have a weird smell, and you'll definitely wish you had something that worked better.The plastic tongs in the back are an added bonus. Better than me having to stick my fingers down there or having to unplug the toaster and stick something down there to reach fallen pieces. Seriously, do not stick a fork into a toaster.Well worth the money.
summary: needed for apartment move, worth every penny

reviewText: This pot is wonderful!  It's the perfect size for pasta and for making soup and just about anything else you want to use it for.  I had purchased a different one last year and the it didn't last long with normal use.  I really do love this pot.

I had the carpets cleaned on my lower level and there was suddenly a musty smell. I bought two of these for about 1,000 sq ft and they did the job. The smell disappeared and there was about an inch of water in each of the containers!  I am keeping them around permanently. A cheap solution for wicking moisture out of a room.
One of the best items for your home humidor. Keeps everything stable and makes it easy to maintain you RH with no effort. Decent for use in a travel humidor but I would go with the Xicar system
summary: a must have for the humidor

reviewText: Non-stick surface is awesome, and it's slightly deeper than other "egg pans" we own thereby allowing us to warm and stir our baby's food evenly.We always hand wash (everything comes off easily) and always use wooden spoons or silicone spatulas.
summary: Easy to clean, perfect size for warming our baby's food!

reviewText: I have the Bionaire as well, and the Holmes has a weaker air flow. The lowest setting on the Bionaire is as strong as the highest setting of the Holmes. That being said, this is just supposed to bring in fresh air from outside and expel the warm air. It just takes a little longer to refresh the air in the room than the Bionaire, but eventually does what it is supposed to.Pros: The Thermostat actually works.  If you just want to improve the ventilation, this will do the trick for most standard sized rooms. The room is not stuffy at all. It is quieter than most window fans. You can hardly tell it is on.  A very gentle breeze.Cons: The air cannot be directed because there are no directional vents. The fan is weak so during hot days, you will have to turn on another room fan to cool yourself.So in summary, if you don't mind turning on another room fan, this will do. Otherwise, buy the Bionaire.

This has been my favorite bundt pan for years.  Actually I bought the Nordic Ware Platinum one when it first was up for sale. I bake my apple cakes in it and many others that are with fruit and heavy ingredients.  It releases the cake great if you grease completely with Crisco all crevices, edges and up to top. The cakes come out golden brown, moist and beautiful. If you ever decide to buy one or replace another type, be sure and buy this one. Mine is still like brand new and I have had it for years.  The quality of it is well worth the $30 and I mean it.  It cleans up great. Just place medium hot soapy water in it and let soak for a little while. Then wash out in warm clear water and it comes out bright and clean inside and outside stays shiny of course.

I have had a few of these in my kitchen for years now. I can't imagine cooking without them.  I use them for everything that goes into my oven when I don't want fond (browned bits in the bottom of the pan).I roast chicken breasts with a honey and garlic glaze on them.  I also use them on my counter to knead bread dough and pasta on.  They are fabulous for cookies.  They work well when I make whole-wheat biscuits on them as well.  They are also nice to roast vegetables on in the oven.  I use mine most frequently with high heat (500 degree) oven roasting of vegetables (onions, asparagus, sweet potatoes).  The vegetables always turn out great and the pan is easy to clean.I only wash these by hand, due to their size.  So I can't tell you if they will hold up in the dishwasher.  I know another reviewer recommended two (one for savory and one for sweet) but I have not had any problem with mine absorbing flavors even though they are hand washed.I find that they store best flat.  I keep in mine in the bottom of my half sheet pans.  That way they are ready to go, and don't try to curl up on the edges.If you use your oven often, or bake a lot of cookies I highly recommend this product.
summary: Incredible Invention, buy more than one

reviewText: I purchased the Cuisipro Silicone Whisk because it is recommended by Cook's Illustrated. I made a maple syrup glaze yesterday using the Cuisipro  Silicone Whisk. I had to switch to my Le Creuset silicone whisk in the middle of making the glaze because the Cuisipro is just not strong enough to be effective for glazes. It did fine when I beat eggs but could not handle whisking powdered sugar into maple syrup. I think it is flimsy.  The tines are flimsy and there are not have enough tines to be effective. The tines are not strong enough and tend to bend when they hit the side of a bowl. That has never happened with any other whisk I ever owned, including other silicone whisks.UPDATE 9/22/12: I've been using this whisk primarily for scrambled eggs. Last night I had to make a roux in my good cookware. The flour had to be gradually added and whisked into the simmering fat. I didn't want to mar my cookware and turned to the Cuisipro 10-inch Silicone Egg Whisk...what a mistake. The tines are so bendable it was unable to combine the ingredients without the tines bending. The  flour and oil splashed out of the pan onto the stove top and my clothing. I should have used myLe Creuset 10-Inch Silicone Balloon Whisk, Cherrywhich is much more sturdy and allows me to control the ingredients without marring my cookware.  I am at the point where I want to throw this whisk away. I really don't need it to scramble eggs because all my egg recipes call for the eggs to be lightly beat with a fork.

I really like these.  I tried the smaller size ones, and they didn't work very well (the ones with the loose crystals).  This one worked very well and pulled a ton of moisture from the air in my house.  I will purchase these again!

It is huge, they really meant it when they said jumbo. And if you like a lot of space inside the pan to work with when you cook your food, it is perfect for that. Quality is also super good, the handle seems pretty sturdy. And it is nice that the fry pan comes with a glass top, which most of fry pans do not have. So when the hot oil gets angry with water, at least you have something to cover it up.
summary: Wow, when they said jumbo, they really meant it.

reviewText: I love this little machine.  I've made three batches so far and they've all come out great.  It's very easy to do and I've worked out the timing to fit into my schedule.  I heat the milk/dry milk mix to about 190-200 degrees at about 9:30 pm.  I leave it for about an hour to cool to 100-112 degrees.  Mix in the reserved yogurt starter from the last batch.  Place it the jug, which is then placed in the preheated container.  When I get up the next morning at 7:30 am I have a perfect batch of yogurt to put into the fridge to cool in time for hubby's lunch.  I've used both 1% and whole milk.  I prefer the whole milk's texture and taste, but the 1% was fine (it was a little mild because I didn't leave it in the heating unit long enough.Oh, and I use a thermapen to track the temperature.  A really essential item.I have one silly question, though (doesn't affect the rating at all).  I bought it from a third party seller and paid shipping.  Yesterday, I looked at it again on Amazon and it was advertised as being eligible for Prime free shipping.  Today I come back on and it's once again only available through a third-party seller.  What gives, Amazon?  Weird.

I britter that I have didn't fit on the shelf of my new frig I had to put it on the door.  This fits perfectly on the shelf and I love it.  The filter that came with it looked like it went through a hard time but cleaned up and I am using it.  Worth the price

These fit the Lodge skillets very well.  They are extremely helpful when trying to use both handles on the skillet to lift the pan.  They protected my hand and fingers well and felt very secure and snug around the handles.  Glad I got these instead of trying to use a towel or pot holder.  These are better for the iron skillets with that extra handle.

This is a great pillow.  I just took the best nap of my adult life.  And for the first time in years I awoke with out any shoulder pain. I have been having pain under my shoulder blade for months, I've taken muscle relaxers, anti-inflamatories, done physical therapy. After I slept on it last night I woke up this morning for the 1st time in months with no shoulder or back pain!  I'm a side sleeper, and I would recommend this pillow highly to anyone else who is as well. The pillow covering has a high thread count.  I think that is important in down pillows because it keeps the down from pocking through.  This pillow really does need a seperate cover placed over it, however, because down is very hard to clean.  So I do strongly recommend a seperate cover as this pillow is an investment of money.
summary: Just had a nap on it!

reviewText: This is Steve the cool mist humidifier. He's easy to use and maintain. I covered that annoying green light that comes on to show that he is turned on. Honestly with the lights off (and you should be sleeping in pitch black) the light is pretty annoying.Anywho, I keep steve in my bedroom, I notice with my hygrometer he will raise humidity maybe 7-10% RH (I'm a mechanical engineer) after 8 hours or so.

This is a nice small organizer that's perfect for keeping your favorite cosmetics within reach.  It has 9 small squares to hold lipstick tubes or small eyeliner brushes.  If you happen to use nail polish that comes in very narrow bottles, this would keep them upright while in use.  Regular size polish bottles are too large.  The larger square shaped areas are good for your compacts of blush or eye shadow.  I actually keep safety pins, hair bands, etc. in one side and cotton pads for makeup removal in the other.  The back of the organizer is only 2 inches high, so you really can't store long brushes or makeup sticks in this one.  I use a mug for those.The acrylic is clear, sturdy, and easy to clean.  An attractive addition to the bathroom counter or dresser.

We originally got the first one like this from Walmart years ago and they no longer carry them.  Found them on Amazon love them well priced and work very well! I feel like I'm in a room full of A/C when I turn these on.

I WILL MAKE CANDY FOR GIFTS AND NEEDED A THERMOMETER TO HELP ME WITH THE CANDY MAKING.  WORKS LIKE A CHARM…  IS SO EASY TO BUY FROM AMAZON AND LET THEM MAIL IT AND I DON'T HAVE TO GET OUT IN THE WEATHER AND TRAFFIC...

I wrote a crummy review for this little gadget after I first tried it. After tinkering with the old family recipe l changed my review from negative to positive. I now use it every morning to make my coffee. Instead of microwaving it until the water is hot and then putting the coffee in, I put the coffee in first with the water and then microwave it and make cowboy coffee. It ain't as good as an old can over a campfire but what is? I didn't like it very well when I followed the instructions, but once I started doing it this way I just love this little thing and if I ever drop it and break it I will get another. It also saves on the amount of coffee you have to use to make a stout cup of coffee. I'm sure the gourmets would not like it but I like it just fine.
summary: a change of heart, bad to good

reviewText: The Amazon reviews are mixed, and for good reason.  Mine arrived with a couple small scratches in the otherwise very cool candy-apple red surface.  Oh well.  But the really bad news was yet to come.  After doing the suggested burn-in (one cycle with no bread - and yep, there really is a noxious odor from that), I set the darkness control to about 4.5 (ranges from 1 to 7).  Burnt, completely burnt.  So I set it down to 3.5.  Burnt again.  2.5 - barely brown.  3 - burnt.  And, as other reviews note, it doesn't toast evenly on both sides.  One reviewer thought that was great; I think it sucks.  I guess Oster is owned by Sunbeam, and who knows who owns them, but these products that are thrown together in China or elsewhere where they pay $.02/hr for labor can hardly be expected to be reliable, can they?  Aint the global economy f'in' wonderful?!

I liked the idea of this and was excited to buy it.  It gets stuck very easily.  I have a very slight gap between carpet and tile, and it can't get over it.  It ended up running its battery out after getting stuck, or even sometimes in the middle of the room.  Its supposed to go back and recharge itself before it dies, but I kept finding it dead in the middle of the floor.  I returned after a couple days of use.

There are a lot of things to like about the Electrolux EL8807A; ease of assembly, easy to wield slim dimensions, slick silver color, one-touch quick release wand, blue LED status indicators, and in theory, the Brushroll Clean technology.  The Brushroll Clean technology sounds like a great idea.  However, the Brushroll on my vacuum failed out of the box so I was unable to try the Brushroll Clean feature.  I tried the troubleshooting suggestions in the manual without success.  I called the telephone help line but was disconnected on two occasions so I gave up on trying to have it repaired under warranty.Without the working Brushroll the Electrolux is not able to effectively clean my carpets.  I'll stick to my Hoovers and Bissells.****UPDATE 02/10/2013****The above was written prior to replacement under warranty.  Electrolux Care noticed my disappointed review and expedited my contact with customer service.  I mailed in the serial number sticker and reference number and roughly two weeks later received a replacement vacuum cleaner.  So kudos to Electrolux for their warranty service; I'm glad they take note of customer complaints on Amazon seriously.  The 5 year manufacturer's warranty certainly adds peace of mind.With the replacement vacuum cleaner, the Brushroll IS fortunately working.  The Electrolux seems better suited to apartment dwellers, with it's smaller canister size and overall footprint.PROS:- Super easy (100% tool-less) assembly; didn't have any misfitting pieces like in several Bissells I tested previously.- Handle easily detaches to form telescoping cleaning wand- Neat Brushroll Cleaning feature; really does work!- Easy to empty canister- Small footprint- Blue LED indicator lights on the front indicate selected settings- "futuristic" sleek colors and look- Washable HEPA filterCONS:- The vacuum cleaner is heavy- surprising, given its compact dimensions.  Better hit the gym, yo!- The Versa-tool sounds good in principle, but doesn't work all that well in practice- The suction seemed inconsistent; while it picked up lots of tiny dust particles, it left some macro particles stuck to my rug.In conclusion, I think the Electrolux has some great features (ease of assembly, Brushroll Cleaning, warranty service, blue LED indicator lights, small footprint, telescoping wand enablement), but the relatively higher price offsets these advantages.  I would still purchase the Hoover UH70600 first since it's $90 cheaper and has better suction power, but the Electrolux would be a close second.
summary: I had high hopes for the Electrolux- (REVIEW UPDATED AFTER WARRANTY REPLACEMENT)
