I bought this same Kapoosh block just recently.  I picked it up to hold a set of new Yoshi ceramic knives that I had bought here on Amazon just a while back, and to handle some small santoku steel knives as well.  The block I had when I bought the knives had the usual variety of slots as all blocks do that frustratingly wouldn't hold all my knives.  Some of the knives were too fat and just stuck out.  The slots on the block needed to all be the wide variety.  Unfortunately all knife blocks insist on giving you this distributed style.  When I saw one of these Kapoosh blocks in a store, I knew it the answer to my problem.  The kapoosh is really nothing but a block of skinny flexible plastic rods tightly packed that just spread and hold onto any knife or other object that is stuck in them. Its sorta like a modern kitchen version of quicksand. The advantages over this material and system is that one can not only make any shape knife fit securely in the kapoosh, but you get the added benefit of fitting in twice as many knives in the same size area that a slotted block would handle. No longer will an odd size or number of knives be a problem.  The knife block is made of a nice heavy oak or maple like just about all blocks are, and its handsome looking as well.Personally I don't experience any of the slippage that some of the other reviewers here have mentioned.  That is, a heavy knife sliding down the through the rods over time.  On the other hand, my collection of knives are not made up of a heavy variety.  Bigger knives I have tried in the block do indeed slip down a little over time, but not so much that it becomes a real liability, or any kind of deal breaker over this fine block. Also, some other comments at the time of this writing asked about the dimensions of this block. (And frankly I am surprised that no one has fully stated it up till now).  I don't know where Amazon gets its dimensions from, for although this block is indeed about 10" high, the other numbers are way off.  For the record, this block face, (the part that really matters the most but not mentioned) is 4 1/2 inches square.  Plenty of room and versatility over a 4 inch square slotted block to be sure.  Lastly the kapoosh material can be removed for washing whenever it really needs it, or one gets the notion.  Personally this knife block is number one in my book.  I love it, and I highly recommend it over the traditional variety...
summary: Soild, And The Best For Numerous Knives

We have mainly sealed wooden floors and this worked fine on them.I read an excellent review which said this is not a weekly or daily cleaner, more like a bi monthly deep cleaner.  I'm glad I bought it because I love the idea of using only clean water to clean with and the used water being sucked back into the machine.  And our used water tank was dark!  So clearly our floors needed a deep clean. But it's not effortless to use,  it is quite heavy and cumbersome.  So it won't replace the mop,  but it also stops the swishing of dirty water onto the floor (I actually replace the water several times when I am doing regular mopping because I so hate that idea)  and gives a deep solid clean.  The first time I used this it did leave some residue on the floors,  I think there is a learning curve in how to make the best of this machine,  the next time was better and I imagine the time after that will be better still.
summary: Not for everyday/weekly use but definitely useful for deeper less regular cleans

reviewText: I have these in our new closests to help with organization and so far, they are becoming very helpful with making sure that clothes stay organized.

I'm convinced that the people who designed this have never had a pet. There are so many design flaws... if we hadn't received this as a gift, we'd be returning it.The pros:- light weight; very easy to carry around- love that you can switch from a long stick vacuum to a compact handheld vacuum just be changing the attachments- the low profile of the sweeper attachments are good for getting under furnitureThe cons:- Very small canister compartment that fills quickly. Long pet hair gets trapped inside. When I open the canister, nothing comes out. I have to stick my fingers inside to pull out the mess of fur and dirt. Gross!- the brush rollers quickly become encased in fur and are a pain to clean off.BOTTOM LINE: Expect to get your hands dirty when you empty the canister or clean the brush rollers on the attachments. Really, I might as well clean the floor with my bare hands. Not what I was expecting for such an expensive vacuum.

These aren't of the best quality metal, I find that I taste a slight metallic taste when eating with them but that may be just me. I tend to be sensitive to tastes.They are cheap, functional and sturdy however the design itself doesn't seem all that conducive to eating eggs. I use these for soft boiled eggs. I assume that is what all people use egg spoons for (at least when it comes to eating eggs) I'm not sure when else you would need a spoon? If you are using these for another purpose this review may not be for you.My issue is that the width of the spoon means that you have to cut / crack off a larger top hole that normal. I grew up using more narrow spoons which allowed me to keep more of the shell on. This seems like a small issue however if you happen to have a runny yolk that is near the area you cracked the top off of as soon as you pierce the yolk it will run out of the egg shell and onto the egg cup.In order to get the wider hole in the egg you will have had to cut lower onto the egg itself and thus you have a greater risk of being at the level or below the yolk. This equals messy disaster of trying to scoop up all the yolk or delicately eating around the yolk enough so that this doesnt occur. I personally would prefer more narrow egg spoons. But to each their own.If you like your yolks runny perhaps try a different spoon?
Just put it up but it has meet all my expectations in a shower liner so far. I am hoping to see no mildew in the next month.

This machine is so simple to use, uses regular (inexpensive) coffee (no K Cups or pods) and creates a delightful frothy foam. I've noticed several people complain that you cannot put the carafe in the dishwasher. While this is true, there is a very simple solution... After I am done making my coffee, and the pot is empty, I fill it with cool water and two drops of dish soap then I put it back into the machine and set it to "heat and froth" and the machine cleans itself. The little whisk in the machine beats the soap into a froth, getting the glass carafe and the whisk very clean. When it stops, just dump the contents in the sink and rinse and the pot looks brand new. I've made hundreds of cups of coffee with this machine and cleaned it this way every time, and my carafe and whisk are spotless.

We have used Hoover vacuum cleaners before and have had very good experience with them especially compared to Bissell vacuum cleaners. This Hoover bagless vacuum cleaner works very well and we are very happy with it so far.This vacuum cleaner is extremely easy to put together. It took me about 20 minutes to unpack and start using it. There is just one screw that needs to be fastened (Phillips screw driver needed.) It is desiged well, looks tidy, and all the accessories are neatly placed. Canister seems bigger for its class and there is just one washable filter to maintain. There is really no "consumable" item there, meaning no ongoing costs.The device produces a higher pitch noise (probably because higher powered motor). The power button is hand operated and my wife mentioned that she prefers a foot operated one.We also have aDirt Devil Vigor Turbo Bagless Upright  Vacuum, UD70110- which is very similar to Hoover WindTunnel in design and technology. So, I am going to compare the two. As of this review date, Dirt Devil was cheaper than Hoover vacuum cleaner, but prices tend to change over time.Hoover WindTunnel 2----------Dirt Devil Vigor---------------------------------------------------12 Amps Motor----------------10 Amps MotorMore Noise-------------------Slightly less noise (comparitively)Neat and tidy looking--------Awkward looking with extender tubes visibleBigger canister--------------Relatively smaller canisterAssembly is simple-----------Assembly is relatively complexHand operated power button---Foot operated power buttonBottom line: both are good vacuum cleaners. Personally I would buy Hoover because (1)canister capacity (2)power and (3)appearance.
summary: Hoover WindTunnel 2 - Quite good bagless vacuum cleaner

I've had this rice cooker for more than 6yrs and use it to cook rice every single day. It is basically for 5 1/2 cups of uncooked rice.The 5.5 cup volume is a little misleading for us Indians. We normally cook rice, rice:water = 1:2 ratio. So basically this rice cooker cooks to a max of 3 3/4 cups of rice (using the cup provided).You will be astonished at the difference in taste between the rice cooked here versus some other cooker. I'm not exaggerating as I've two different rice cookers, the other one being Sanyo.I love the fuzzy logic feature where you can cook different rices & porridge's. The delayed time setting is a blessing... when I bought it at the end of 2005, nobody else had the delayed time setting. Obviously there are newer models now.For a family of 4 (2 kids below ages of 8yrs), this is just the perfect size!

reviewText: I'm always searching for a great vacuum because I have a new daughter and 3 dogs in our house. I thought I got it right when I bought the Hoover Platinum.... nope.I got lucky and got this and the Oreck at the same time. We have 3 dogs in this house. A white, deaf American Bulldog, a Black Rottweiler, and a Tri Australian Shepherd. The dog that has the worst hair is the American Bulldog. Not only is his hair white, it's thick and short. It embeds to EVERYTHING. He's not even allowed in my daughters room and his hair ends up in her carpet.This vacuum may be called a Pet Plus but it came in last place between the Oreck and my Hoover Platinum. It did the worst job out of the three in picking up dog hair.This maybe a great vacuum for the price and if you have 1 dog, but it just doesn't pass the test in this house with our three. I know there isn't a miracle for dog hair but I don't like to inspect my carpet to see that there is still quiet a bit of hair left. I am also not a fan of bagless. I think bagless is gross. I have that same problem with the Oreck, but it did such a fantastic job, I can grin and bare it.

first, let me say ,even with the pictures  and description from s. meadows i still didn't get the part about TIGHTENING the side screws. the printed instructions mention it, but a simple diagram would clear everything up. as it is , i still had to call customer service for an explanation on how to keep the side tables from falling off- here it is- the small side pieces that have the large three screws already in them need to be tightened. the look like three screws are already in place  without the need to turn them- they actually  do need to be tightened or the wing parts will just fall off. anyway, once  it was finally figured out this table is a nice solution for the correct sized laptop(no bigger than a 15.6 screen). it is easy to wheel around to different chairs or the edge of a bed. it is stable and never feels like something is about to fall apart. the height  adjustment works fine and is a nice plus with this table. it  doesn't take up much space(what we needed) and can be stored out of the way in a small room or even a closet. would definitely recommend.

We had to anchor the lower shelf for stability so it did not bang when we opened the door but that was a simple, quick fix.  We loaded the shelf with our light products (pasta, coffee, tea, cereal and the like).  It is a great organization alternative for small spaces.

I got this little do-hicky on a whim, but I am so glad I did!  No more rancid butter while trying to keep it soft!  I lined the inside with  plastic wrap and filled it with fresh, soft butter.  Then I wrapped the butter in the plastic wrap and have 5 more like it waiting in the fridge all ready to pop right into the crock when needed.  It holds 1 stick of butter.  VERY NEATO-BEATO
summary: Nice way to keep butter soft and tasty!

reviewText: I'm not the greatest cook and to be honest zesting is new to me.  But receiving the 2 in 1 Zester + Grater was like receiving a new toy for the kitchen and I needed to use it for all kinds of things.  I zested some lemon for my tea, I grated Parmesan Cheese over my Manicotti and it has caught on in the family.  The kids have wanted to try it too.  We even zested some cinnamon into hot cider.

I bought this because I wanted the living room in my place to smell good. We have two parrots in our house and they tend to have moments when their cages aren't the most attractive thing to be around if you have clear nasal passages (we clean them multiple times a week. This is just due to them doing their natural thing). Unfortunately, this unit ended up being really small, and while it did do a great job for its size it wasn't really built to handle a whole living room. So, this got moved to the roommate's room where he smokes cigarettes and it does an AWESOME job with that smell in a smaller space. After seeing how well this unit worked we ended up getting the Hamilton Beach TrueAir Compact Pet Air Purifier for the living room and it too works extremely well. I would recommend either of these products, but for a room that is larger than 10x10 I would recommend the Hamilton Beach TrueAir Compact Pet Air Purifier. Now, many people complain that they feel ripped off by the fact that this takes 3 filters to run. Yeah, it's kind of expensive.. but if you are going to purchase something that cleans the air you're going to need some form of filter, and these only need to be replaced every 3-4 months if you leave it on every minute of the day. I spend more than $16 every 3-4 months on so much useless junk that it seems a bit ridiculous to complain about that sum when it ends up averaging a roughly $5/month investment to keep your place smelling fresh. Realistically, that's less than a glad plugin will run you for a full month of utilization and the hamilton beach odor dealio actually filters the air and doesn't just cover up the smells.In the end, it's up to you. If you're looking for a solution to a smell issue that has to do with smoke, animals, etc. then this is a great solution for a small room - and the Hamilton Beach TrueAir Compact Pet Air Purifier is a great solution for a larger room. If you never want to have to replace any filters or anything like that then you are probably going to have to spend a bit more up front - I think the Hamilton Beach TrueAir Compact Pet Air Purifier does have some reusable filters, but they have to be purchased separately.I have been using this product for 4 months straight at its maximum output without ever turning it off and have not had a single problem. I have now replaced the filters twice and don't really mind the expense because it works well.

I've ground meat and bread (for bread crumbs) and have had no issues with it. I like knowing what I eat so I find it very useful to be able to grind my own meat and make my own sausages.1) how fastIt's true you can't just dump and 5lbs piece of meat and say "grind it", but it's good enough for home use. I slice the meat in long cubic sticks (probably ~1 in x 1 in x as long as I can make it) and feed it through. It's fairly quick, probably not commercial standard, but great for your home.2) cleaningYou can take apart that baby no problem, and that makes cleaning (by hand) a breeze. I don't have a dishwasher so I can't say how well it does there. But it's only a few pieces so even if I did have a dishwasher, I probably would clean it by hand.

No hassles and no fuss.  Perfect for one person.  I  live in an area where the tap water just isn't okay to drink and this water pitcher is just right for ice cubes, coffee, etc.  It's worth the money and easy to refill.
This is an excellent tenderizer. It doesn't squash the meat as much as an earlier model did.I highly recommend this tenderizer.
summary: Weaker spring than the lost one this one replaces

reviewText: I've had my eye on a similar Dyson for about a year, but just can't validate spending that much on a vacuum.I thought I was settling when I purchased this bad boy at a fraction of the price, but was pleasantly surprised.My main issue with vacuums is usually their inability to stand up to the mountains of dust and dog hair that I have in my house. This machine conquers through our mess like a champ! I was pretty disgusted how much hair and dirt this thing picked up after my other vacuum the first time I used it. which is very sad since I used to vacuum every day.It is super user friendly and easy to operate. Very easy to transition from floor to attachment modes, and despite having only a couple attachments, I have yet to find a mess that the ones included don't clean. I especially like the little mini tornado of an upholstry attachement. It gets ALL of the hair off of my couches and dog beds.I am so very pleased with this purchase. Dyson Smyson!!!
This was a birthday present for a good friend.  He raises cattle.  They graze and roam on his farm.  Needless to say, the meat is alwaystasty but tough.  We use a similar jaccard and love it.
I had been wanting one of these for a while, and have found that I love it. It is a very easy way to enhance the flavor of a bottle of wine.

This was a Christmas gift from my wife to me, We use it everyday.This kettle heats water to one of six settings ranging from full boil down to below what you want to use for tea or coffee. It has a keep warm feature that will keep heating your water to a set temp, so you are ready for another cup whenever. It reads in both DegF and DegC making a great product.We have used this extensively for some high quality loose leaf tea that requires precise temperature to bring out the flavor without over brewing. This kettle has worked very well for this purpose.Also, this is used to make single cups of coffee with our Aeropress and it works very well for this purpose.We have used it more than once a day for over three months and it is preforming excellentlyPros:1.7 Liter Capacity means that you can get a few cups before needing to refillSix programmable temperature settings that change in 5 DegF incrementsKeep temp timer allows you to have heated water when you want itEasy to remove Kettle from the base and return.Seems durable and high quality for the priceCons:Took me a few minutes to figure out how to program the settings (Read the manual)Settings are lost if you unplug the device.Overall this is an excellent product, Highly recommend it for anyone who is tired of stove top kettles.
summary: Used Everyday to make coffee and tea

reviewerName: Ray F. Mihulka III "Ray F. Mihulka III"
reviewText: I ordered these to go with my Presto dehydrator for greater capacity. I did not want to waste electricity processing small batches. Not much else to say.

It works as it should. It had a big scratch on the plate though, but I wasn't going to go through all the hassle of sending it back to get another, but that's why I prefer to buy stuff from a store as opposed to online. I'm so tired of people sending me damage stuff online because they know most people won't want to go through all the trouble to return the merchandise for another. QUALITY CONTROL PLEASE! My other complaint is that I've made the mistake of grabbing the upper part (the plate) to pick it up, only to have the base fall on the floor. The top plate and base are not connected, and the base is very heavy, enough so that it would easily break your toe of foot. I now have a big gash in my hard wood floor due to the cheap design of this cake stand. REALLY, we couldn't find a way to connect these two pieces, ridiculous. If I could do it over, I never would have bought it.

This is great, the price is awesome and you get what you pay for.  The only problem you will have is if you plan on putting a lot of weight on it.  Keep décor/etc. to a minimum. Looks good in my bathroom and houses extra necessities.

Ahhhh.  Can you say comfort?  The pad is not just a thin piece of material between the sheet and the bed; it is a thick gel padding, like adding another pillow top to the mattress, a cross between gel and memory foam -- memory gel.The gel is evenly distributed throughout the mattress pad and provides a nice, sinkable loft to the bed.  The pad fits nicely on our deep mattress.  My husband is in charge of changing sheets and he said he did not have to struggle with this pad, it's easy to put on.  Even better than that?  It's machine washable!

So my daughter has a twin mattress that she is complaining isn't comfortable anymore.  In an effort to avoid spending hundreds on a new mattress we thought we'd try putting something soft over it first.  I opened the box and immediately noticed that the package it came in isn't a whole lote bigger than a packaged sheet set... not promising so far.  So I take it out and it's not any thicker than a regular mattress protector, not a thick gel filled pad that will help you sleep better.  Yes, the fabric it's made with is soft to the touch, but the gel (which I now see described as "gel fibers" in the description, whatever that means) is non-existent.  I folded it back up and put it back into it's little zipper bag, I'll be returning it and buying a memory foam topper.If you're looking for a mattress protector or cover, this will be great with it's super soft fabric.  If you're looking for a mattress enhancer, look elsewhere.
summary: Not at all what I expected.  Will be returning.

reviewText: I must be honest about this item, it appeared that this item has been used, I was not happy getting this item it does not and did not have the "Kitchen Aid" signature on it. I think this was a used item and I paid for a new item.
summary: Kitchen Kat 13505 B Cook's Series Egg Slicer

reviewText: I have my coffee stored and I have a fresh cup every morning, I will see how it does for a few weeks of storage.
We got invaded by moths after we stored an open bag of birdseed in the pantry closet.  The traps are easy to set up and work well.  No more moths!

I've had a duplicate of this dish for at least 10 years. It is unbelievably convenient. It can go from the microwave to the table. It looks great as a serving piece. It keeps the heat in, it's easy to watch food cooking in it, and is great for steaming vegetables.

Best overall basting brush, as the silicone is ideal, being just flexible enough to work well while being easy to clean quickly and free from other problems like bristles falling off. After trying this I would never buy another kind.
Came on time, exactly as expected.  It is good to have them in the drawer for all of the double walled tumblers I have for the grandkids.  Looks like good quality.

This is a nice warmer (I've seen it at Teavana) and really cheap. The candle I put in does burn well and keep burning.However, be aware that your teapot may not fit properly...especially if you have an asymmetric teapot like me. The sides are raised presumably to keep the teapot in place, but if you have a larger teapot or one with a square base, reconsider.
But fabulous for roasting chicken.  You won't regret buying it.  AND it fits in your dishwasher!  Yeah!  I don't know why I waited so long to buy this.

First one received was broken but Amazon quickly replaced it. The second one is perfect and works great! My husband uses it with his fresh made pizzas and says using it makes the process much easier. Highly recommend it!

This tote works great on the floor for my dogs' toys.  They can reach right in and pick out what they want. The "toy box" is durable, just the right size and the dark brown color very nice as it doesn't show dirt. Just what I wanted and the dogs needed!
These are fun little cookie cutters.  They are a little smaller than we thought but the boys likes them all the same.  Thanks!

In addition to other reviews, I need to say that I cant get that little flat/white screw off to replace the battery.  I have gotten it to twist some, but not remove it. It just keeps spinning and is stuck. No, tape wont pull it out.  Maybe prying it with a screwdriver, but then it may crack or just break.So, its a SHORT TERM Thermometer.. I will TRY to return, does anyone else really want another Walmart quality item for 3 times the cost? I did not think I was gambling on junk designs with all these good reviews. None have used their battery up I expect. Who waits that long to review, right?  I was curious about the battery type, my bad.Well, I got one like it that works for $5, not at Walmart, but there is competition that you dont have to pay this price for.  Unless returns are no hassle to you.Go Walmart, whom I dont care for as they shut down main street/ small businesses, and they expect taxpayers to cover their employee insurance costs! The pay is lousy even for supervisors, and everyone works weekends and late shifts. Yes they have bargains but we pay in the end.  Jobs that go nowhere are just wrong.  Now lecture me on staying on track, as if subsidizing the world dominant retailer is a non-subject right now.
summary: CANT get the 'screw' off to REPLACE BATTERY

reviewText: First of all I really like the stainless steel handle on the Tovolo products. Made pancakes and eggs right away and it worked well. Like the heat resistant quality and the easy to clean handle.
I do a lot of baking that requires rolling and cutting. These have nearly everything that I need. not gadgety nor over fancy. They just cut. Easy to clean and store.
Great foil cutter, works as you'd expect, easier than some. I pair this with my Screwpull table corkscrew and I'm good to go.

IN use them in my electronics shelves to keep the equipment cool. Good airflow for this purpose as the circulation is now throughout the closet. I have one I use for personal use from time to time in the living room when it is hotter then normal, during periods of conservation air conditioning shutdown by the power company I signed up for to save on my power bill.

I received the Mhynter IC-2L Ice Cream Maker only a few days after ordering it.  It was delivered on 2/10/12.  I first tried to use it on 2/17/12.  The boxes that the ice cream maker was shipped in were trashed.  It is not Amazon's fault, but the fault of the USPS.  It looked as it someone had thrown it into the truck to see if would survive delivery.When I first tried the Whynter, the motor did not operate.  What I had to do was position the removable bucket in a certain way before the motor worked properly.  So, I tried it again with the bucket in the same position, and the motor did not run.  The motor and the positioning on the bucket was a pain.  The Whynter was too fickle for all practical purposes, so I returned it to Amazon for a refund.  Amazon has always been great to work with in the past and I will continue to be a loyal customer.The major problem that I see with the $250 motor driven, compressed refrigerated models is that the motor will eventually burn out.  I had the Cuinsinart ICE-50BC for about a year before the motor died.  The thickness of the ice cream apparently causes the motors that burn out.  The $250 ice creams makers appear to be a poor overall product.  Few have extended warranties, and probably for good reason.  The more expensive models in the $600 range probably have motors that can operate through thick ice cream without burning out.  So, as a warning to consumers, be real careful before purchasing any of the motor driven, compressed refrigerated models in the $250 range.  Most of the complaints are generally related to inability of the motor to last more than a year or two.

I was a little nervous buying this because it was expensive and some reviews were negative. But the machine has been perfect for every batch of ice cream, sorbet, and sherbet. It smelled a little at first like machine oil, but the smell went away.

This fan must have two pages, because I know I reviewed it last week; and at the time, it wasn't being offered by Amazon with free shipping.  If it had been, I probably would have gotten a second one.  I bought one last year from an online hardware store. It is a super powerful fan that works well on super hot, humid days. I've never felt a more powerful fan, except in places that use huge commercial type fans. It is loud, but I like loud fans. And metal fans do work better than plastic ones, in my opinion.  I recently got a 14 inch Patton high velocity floor fan with a plastic CVT blade, which is no where near as powerful as this fan. It's designed better, and is safer around children and pets, but even in the highest setting, it seems to me to be less powerful than this Patton on the lowest setting.This Patton is not as heavy, and the metal not as thick, as fans I have bought in the past like it.  But that is not a bad thing; the heavier fans I had always eventually collapsed on their stands, making them unsafe around children and pets. They also only lasted 2-3 years. Hopefully, this one will last longer.  Because, believe me, if you live in a a place with HOT summers, you miss these powerful metal floor fans when they die!Bottom line--if you need fans to survive the summer, and don't mind loud ones: Go with the biggest metal floor fan--with the biggest blades and most powerful motor--that you can afford!
summary: A Powerful Fan for Hot, Humid Days!

reviewText: This dutch oven is fantastic, easy to clean & keep clean and it's made in America, a tip I have been warned when buying cast iron as the safety standards may not be as good and cast iron is so heavy, it can cause serious harm, but it's affordable so you can't go wrong with Lodge as it's simply the best cast iron around and the cost is about the same, but I'd pay more for Lodge just to be on the safe side. It's a good thing I don't have to pay more here:-)This one even takes to tomato dishes quite well, although I try not to, but the dishes I make in my cast iron dutch oven are the best! This is my 1st and only piece by Lodge as my iron frying pans are imported & 1 is not too good and 3 are a bit better, but compared to this......well there is no comparison! I need to replace my imports with Lodge and until I do, I'll just use this wonderful lodge dutch oven.Thanks again, Amazon for the fast, free S & H and another fine product.

I love my Kitchen Aid standing mixers and I have another attachment that I use quite often.  I also have an automatic ice cream maker...a Braun that works on the same principle...but for some reason this one does not work as well as I had hoped.  The paddle attachment freezes up as soon as the churning/spinning action starts and then it will not turn to make the ice cream and as a result it freezes in one big lump in the bowl instead of making nice smooth ice cream and you can not get it out of the bowl until it is totally and completely thawed and melted! I have contacted the company to make sure I am not doing anything wrong but they have not been much help...I have been doing exactly what they have told me to do with it! I just don't understand why it does not work as well as the Braun model that I have had for over 20 years!!
summary: I really wanted to LOVE this one!

reviewText: sunday gravy, stew, chili, fish n chips...anything is possible with this thing. a 9qt dutch oven opens alota doors. you'll thank yourself, then wonder how you ever lived without one.
summary: if you will it dude, it is no dream

reviewText: UPDATE 2012 09 24 (original review below):  I use this steam mop about once a week on my main floor; probably about 300 square feet of cleanable space. Today, about one year after purchase,the handle snapped off in my hand! It broke where the plastic handle attaches to the stem. I am not hard on the thing and I don't drag it up and down stairs. It is stored neatly in my broom closet. The machine swivels but I guess the handle just couldn't take it anymore. I suppose I can still use it but this is extremely annoying. I can no longer wind the cord up since the top winder is no longer part of the column. Sheesh!Original review: (2011 11 06)I purchased this steam mop over a month ago. At first, I was using it everyday, but now use it twice or three times a week. My floors are combination ceramic tile and laminate flooring.Pros: fast and easy to set up, easy to fill, comes with 3 cleaning pads, heats quickly, light and easy to store, electric cord is quite long. It does a nice job cleaning the centre of the floor. Does a decent job on the ceramic tile.Cons: On my laminate, pushes fine dirt and hairs not sucked up by the vacuum cleaner, away from the pad, but does not pick it up, so half the time I have to wipe these lines up with a paper towel. As well, on the laminate, it sometimes streaks and makes the floor look dull. Because the floor is damp, you have to swipe walking away from the surface just cleaned. The machine is not easily swivelled to pick up what has just been pushed away, so it's a little awkward to clean the floor perfectly. In fact, except for long north to south strokes, the unit is not very maneuverable. Because of this, it does not do a great job around edges or near walls.Overall, I am happy with the purchase at $50, but would have had greater expectations had I paid more and not read the previous reviews.
summary: Ooops! Updated: Good investment at Gold Box price

reviewText: This is a nice sturdy smallish fan, but don't let that fool you.  It *really* moves the air, much better than any of the box fans I've owned, a lot better than the standard el cheapo oscillating fan I used to have.  Yes, it's a little noisier than some folks will like.  It doesn't bother me at all -- it's like "white noise" -- and I only had to boost the volume on the television by two points (from 28 to 30) to accommodate it.Mine works great pointed toward the ceiling, on the lowest setting, and effectively keeps a 15' by 28' living/dining room comfortable.  It got up to near 90 degrees today, and I was perfectly comfortable all afternoon (most folks don't have air conditioning up here in the Pacific northwest).If you're usually bothered by background noise, this probably isn't a good choice for you.  But if you usually tune out background noise, this is a decent alternative.  Wait for it to go on sale (check the Friday sale, deal of the day, etc.).
summary: Solid fan, really moves the air!

reviewText: The cups' shape is relatively deep compared to the width, which makes spills less likely.  And I've discovered the magnets in the handles are strong enough that I can stick the 1/2, 1/3, and 1/4 cups directly to the side of the fridge for convenient access.  (singly, not stacked)  This makes it really quick to pick up the one I want.  My fridge is textured painted steel - I'm not sure this would work with smooth finishes.

I just noticed that the cutters are full of rust even though I made sure they were dry before I stored them. I think they rusted because I put them in a ziplock bag which must have sweat and created humidity. I am very disappointed. I have used them once or twice only. Also, they bend a lot. You constantly need to adjust them so that they become perfectly round.
summary: They rust if you put them in a plastic bag

reviewText: While Panasonic may not be known for its vacuum cleaners, this offering is an extremely refreshing take on the trusty household cleaning tool. As an owner of a different Panasonic vacuum cleaner (model # MC-UL815), I have to say this vacuum performed much more admirably than its higher priced predecessor. While the other model claimed to have superior flexibility, it was in fact extremely difficult to maneuver. This new vacuum from Panasonic gets back to basics and the result is a vacuum that is very easy to use. The vacuum is relatively light (4 pounds lighter than my last Panasonic vacuum to be exact) which makes a huge difference when lugging it up 10-15 steps. Also, it picks up great and isn't as loud as my other Panasonic vacuum. If I had one complaint to make regarding it, it would be that the size of the filter is on the small side and constantly needs to be cleaned, so if you have a pet, keep this in mind. Overall though, this is a great offering from Panasonic and a definite step in the right direction for their vacuum cleaner line.

post-apocalypse arrive and you want waffles, look no further.  I absolutely love this item.  We started using it on an electric stove, which is really hard to do, and several months later stated using it on a gas range.  IT KICKS BUTT!!  Be sure to season the heck out of it.  Maybe even make some bacon in it, or make bacon and pour the oil in.  Once you season it it is good to go.  Don't use a lot of batter.
Its heavy but it gets you very dry. -1 star for initial very light shedding/fuzzy lint until about 5-10 washes. Sometimes cool to the touch.
Got this as a gift for my granddaughter's 1st apartment since she didn't have a grill!  She loves it! Great gift!
Perfect for one person, and the coffee is great.  Just wish it had a larger capacity for a 10 oz cup of coffee.
This is great for the apartment or home and makes a killer panini! I highly recommend this product. It makes a great gift.

Anyone who's used theCuisipro Donvier Electronic Yogurt Makerknows that after, let's say, 50-100 batches one or 2 lids may begin to crack and that really impacts the quality of the end-product so, short of buying a brand-new Cuisipro set (silly but I've done it once) this set takes care of the problem.I've been using my latest yogurt maker for at least 3 years and, thanks to this set lids, I no longer need to worry about lids going bad.5-stars for the peace of mind.

This is the second set I have purchased.  The first set I purchased over 4 years ago and have lost some of the pieces throughout the years. They last a long time (if you don't lose pieces) and are very convenient to take to work (probably where I lost some of the pieces!).  Only problem with this set is that some of the tops are very tight and I cannot put the lids on by myself!  I have to ask my husband for help.  Other than that, they do not leak, are dishwasher and microwave safe, and a real quality set of plastic containers.

So I'm a little weird when it comes to sheets. In the summer we use flannel sheets and in the winter regular cotton sheets. This is probably the opposite of most people. You are probably asking yourself why? I'm glad you asked.In the summer I keep the air cranked in the house so its cooler, and therefore I don't want a heavy blanket to sleep with, so flannel sheets keep me just warm enough at night. In the winter the heat is on and the house is warm, so I like to sleep in slightly chillier sheets. Yeah, it may not make sense but it works for me.So what does this have to do with anything? I like to change my sheets on a regular basis and while I have several sets of flannel sheets, I only have one set of regular cotton sheets. Enter Exceptional Sheets. I recently received a set of their 400 thread count chocolate brown cotton sheets and I absolutely love them. Not only are they beautiful (hard to say that about sheets usually), but they are very soft and very high quality.  I love to snuggle down in bed in these sheets with my daughter and the hubby, just relaxing. And with the winter weather and short days, this is the perfect time for snuggling.I have shopped with Exceptional Sheets a few times and each transaction has resulted in a speedy response, quick delivery, and phenomenal customer service. I definitely plan on purchasing from this company again in the very near future!

This is the best thermos that I have ever had the pleasure of using. This keeps my coffee steaming hot for hours on end and my pop cold for as long as six hours. I do not think that you could find a comparable thermos in any other product line. Just make sure that you purchase a good cleaning brush so that you can clean the entire inside of thermos.

I started using this from the day I received. Dumped all old cheap stuffs I had. This looks great and I love the lids stacks together.  I received this in 2 days from Super saving shipping. You can not beat the Amazon's price. I went to walmart to see how are they selling (as they say they sell for less) they are selling 24 pcs package for the price I purchased this.

We have a no frills small footprint treadmill, which came without a cooling fan.  This clamped on and with the different ways it will twist and turn seems to work fine to keep us cool without blowing off our toupee or drying our eyes.

This minces garlic very nicely as long as you only put one clove at a time into it, otherwise it jams up. And it is really cute, and I can't help but say "vroom, vroom" whenever I wheel it across the cabinet.However, I find it hard to get the minced garlic out of it (but garlic is sticky like glue), and the wheels left marks on my countertop (that were easily removed with a magic sponge). It cleans up easily in the dishwasher, as long as you put the small parts in the baby bottle cage so that they are not lost into the bottom of the machine. (I think it would be a real nightmare to hand wash)
I like these strainers. I use them to get noodles out of the pot and for frying. Only downfall i have if you don't wash them right away they are hard to clean.

I was looking for something that could heat up water as well as make coffee.  I like this as it is 12 cup and Krups is a good company.  I like the look of the machine, the product it puts out and the size.  I have to say I am pretty impressed with the whole setup and you could do a lot worse then getting this machine.  I have been using this machine for several months now and I use it to make hot water.  It is perfect for what I need.  You can make coffee with it and it does make a mean cup.  I use it for oatmeal, hot chocolate, noodles and anything else you can put hot water in.  The water stays hot for 2 hours and it stays hot.  I am very impressed with the Krups coffee maker and I can not say enough about it.  I would buy another in a heartbeat.  I only used distilled water in it as I dont want the mineral buildup and it works.  Several months after getting this machine I am still using it every day.  I probably make 24 cups a day and it always is consistent.  I found out something neat today, if you take the pot out while it is brewing, it stops brewing.  I wasnt paying attention and put to much water in.  That feature alone makes for a great machine.
I like these trays a lot. 4 stars because the cubes can be hard to get out sometimes and they trays tear if you twist too much. But I would buy again.

After about two months of constant use, the fan rattles. I got this to replace a similarly designed, much cheaper ($60 vs $300) purifier. I can't say they perform any differently, and now this one is louder. I would give it two stars for not out-performing my old one, but this price is rediculous.Folks, do yourselves a huge favor, if your drywall (ceilings, too) gets wet and the outdoor humidity is higher than about 40%, take the time, grab your credit card, and replace the drywall, this week.  It won't dry on it's own, and once the mold gets a foothold you'll be fighting it as long as you live there.If I did this over again, I'd buy one for 70% less that got 'pretty-good' reviews.

The DPT150 from MeasuPro is a great addition to any kitchen. The probe is 8" long, meaning that for a thermometer, it is LONG. This is the perfect length for measuring grilled meat (at least it is for me) and it does a good job at it.You can choose to use Celsius or Fahrenheit for the measurements.The box claims it will go to -14 F and all the way to 230 F. That's a darn good range and should work for almost anything you wish to use it on in terms of meat.You can also set the thermometer to sound an alarm when the desired temperature of whatever it is you are cooking is reached. This is great for a kind of :"set it and forget it" when it comes to being able to start cooking something and then going off to wait for the slow simmer to reach the right temperature.The display is quite large and easily legible.This is a fantastic thermometer and if you have the need for one of this length, it's an excellent choice.I received a free sample for review purposes from MeasuPro.

I love this soap dispenser because I can use any soap I like in it.  It is easy to adjust the amount of soap dispensed with the plus and minus buttons on top.  It is easy to refill with the large opening on the top of the dispenser and the lid just pops on and off.  Also easy to change the batteries as no tools are needed.  I also love the fact that it is no touch for when my hands are covered with raw meat or dough or something sticky and messy.

I wasn't expecting much for less than 20 bucks, which is even cheaper than you could find at Ikea. But the picture looked decent so I figured I'd give it a shot. Needless to say, I was pleasantly surprised when the package arrived. This is a very very good quality end table for the price - looks like it would cost 3-4 times as much.

I purchased this item recently, and am very pleased with it. I didn't realize that this was plastic, I thought it was wicker, based on the title of the item. I am  happy with the quality and look of the item. I am not using it for laundry things. I purchased it to put between the fridge and cabinets in my kitchen. I have set it up to store all my cake decorating things for easy finding. I even have extra room, so I can put more than I thought I could. I will be purchasing an extra for the bathroom, maybe even the laundry room. Great Item!!!!!!!
The vacuum arrived on time.  It is light weight and extremely good quality.  It maneuvers so nicely with its tilting feature.  Battery life is good.  Highly recommended.

Gave this to my mom for christmas....she really liked it a lot.....they kinda worked, but they never looked like the pic....then she put them in the dishwasher.....don't put them in the dishwasher (she says the box didn't say not to put them in the dishwasher)....the whole face thing pealed completely off

I hadn't heard of this brand so my expectations weren't high.  To my surprise this coffeepot turned out to be of very good quality.  It has an elegant look and is nice and sturdy without being heavy.  The press works well and makes a nice well brewed cup.  It holds a nice amount of coffee but is able to easily turn out single cups too.For those of us who are staying away from plastic brewing equipment or have broken too many glass pot this is a very good choice as well as for those who are just looking for a well made and elegant French press.

I bought this because my wife needed something to store and organize her accessories: scarves, belts, costume jewelry.  She loves it.  It's very well made, very sturdy, and holds a lot of stuff.  The double pockets are nice too.  The door hanger at the top is thin so it did not interfere with the door closing - it's hanging on our walk-in closet door.Securing the bottom was a little more trouble.  As others have noted there are two Velcro straps at the bottom of the organizer.  Included with the organizer are two little suction cups and two rings, like keyrings.  There's no way the suction cups will stick to a textured door, and I doubt they would hold very well to any door, unless you've got glass closet doors maybe.Here's how I securely attached ours to the closet door, without damaging the door.  I removed the rings from the suction cups, then I attached two Command Micro Utility Hooks upside-down to the bottom of the door.  The rings go over the inverted hooks and the Velcro loops through the ring.  Easy, secure, and removable.  I uploaded a couple of pictures to this review to show how I did it.With the bottom secured this doesn't move around at all.  My wife stores a ton of stuff in it.  In fact, right after I installed this and she filled it I started seeing her wearing things I didn't recognize.  I asked her if she'd been out shopping for new things but she said no, with the organizer she now sees things she forgot she had because they were stuffed in the back of a drawer.  If this organizer keeps her from buying new things it will pay for itself many times over!
summary: How to secure the bottom to the door

reviewText: I used to have a Black & Decker toaster that worked marvelously for about 10 years, paying less than 10 dollars at the time for it on a special sale. As it didn't look modern or nice anymore after 10 years of heavy use, I made the brilliant decision to buy this Krups toaster for about 50 bucks, horribly expensive I thought but looked very nice and the brand had -again, HAD- a fairly good reputationAfter about 1 year and 10 days this toaster stopped working without reason, it just went bust briefly after the warranty period expired. Nice. Now I'm stuck with a piece of junk that would be worth only if to throwing against the window of the office of the genius that runs this company and the smart guys that design their products. Way to become successful stealing people's money selling them rubbishThis was my first and last Krups product. They just lost a customer forever
summary: First - And Last - Krups Product. Went Bust Fast

reviewText: I bought two of these pillows to fill pillowcases I already had. They're very comfy, and are still very fluffy.

Oh My God i am a cast iron convert this is my pan of choice now follow the directions and it will be awesome for you mine has hit the "sweet spot" fellow cast iron junkies will know what I mean am in love with this pan.  I even bought a real small one for eggs and small batches of cornbread.Highly recommend

This is an example of another appliance meant for our throw-away society -- this is the biggest disappointment.  The toaster we found to be a good overall fit in many ways others have written about however, within 5 years, the two top elements burned out and there's no good way to access them and replace them.  The feature of using it as an oven or for top browning is lost and I fear it's landfill bound for reasons that should be easy to fix.  We bought this not only because it was one of the more sturdy ones on the market, we'd had another B&D toaster that worked for 15 years before we gave it to a student and bought a fresh one for ourselves.  Seems the newer models aren't meant to last -- a very sad and frightening trend.
This fits perfectly in one side of my double sink. Haven't used it yet but looks sturdy. The only reason not 5 star is because its very hard to "uncollapse it.  Hopefully it will improve with use.

I hope this review helps others. I wished I had read the reviews here before my purchase. I too loved the convenience of the machine -- no question abt that. However, after daily use for 3 weeks the prime pump no longer works. When I opened the user manual to trouble shoot I was very surprised to see Keurig's Warning abt lead and chemicals causing cancer . Personally, this information should be posted on the box -- in my opinion.Anyway, I am returning my unit and I hope this review helps others.
summary: Stopped working in 3 weeks AND cancer-warning in their manual

reviewText: Excellent for keeping water hot on the go for our little one's formula.  We used to use one of those portable bottle warmers, took 30 minutes to warm a bottle of milk and it had to be plugged into your car's 12V port.With the thermos, we just put in hot water in the morning, and it stays that way until the next day at night!  Take it with you anywhere and you always have clean hot water for making baby formula.We now even use this at home, instead of using the bottle warmer.  26 ounce capacity is enough for the whole day.Havent tried cold liquids yet, but I assume it would be just as effective.
summary: This is the best thermos I have ever used -- Keeps liquids HOT!

reviewText: This Keurig single-cup coffee maker is great for people who want American-style coffee made fresh with each cup, although you'll need to have the counter space for it to keep it set up all the time.  Because water gets pumped immediately through the machine upon pressing one of the buttons, the ease of this machine is lost unless the water reservoir is kept filled and ready to brew.For brewing, simply insert a pod/K-cup and select the serving size.  In less than a minute, you'll have a hot, forced water-brewed cup of coffee.  Tthe unit has three buttons that correspond to the desired size of the cup: small (demi-tasse), medium, and large.  Since the amount of coffee in each pod remains constant, the size also determines strength of the brew.  I prefer the middle size because the large is too weak for my tastes and the small produces too little coffee.  (If you are looking for espresso and cappuccino, tryNespresso D290 Concept Espresso and Coffeemakerfor similar ease of use and better coffee.)If you drink a lot of coffee, this coffee maker may not be for you since it can be expensive per cup.  If your household doesn't drink a lot, however, then it saves the waste of having to brew more cups than you want.  The good news is that the K-cups come in a variety of brands and coffees.  In addition, you can brew teas (try the Twinings teas) or hot chocolate.I recommend the following coffees:Caribou Blend K-Cup Single-Serving Coffee 108 ct.,Timothy's World Coffee, Midnight Magic, Extra Bold, K-Cups for Keurig Brewers, 24-Count Boxes (Pack of 2),Timothy's World Coffee, Colombian, Decaffeinated, K-Cups for Keurig Brewers, 24-Count Boxes (Pack of 2),Twinings English Breakfast Tea, K-Cups for Keurig Brewers, 25-Count Boxes (Pack of 2),Twinings Earl Grey Tea K-Cups, 25-Count Box (Pack of 2),  Green Mountain K-Cup Single-Serving Coffee 108-ct.- Sumatran Reserve, andTimothy's World Coffee, Colombian, Decaffeinated, K-Cups for Keurig Brewers, 24-Count Boxes (Pack of 2)-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: Couldn't be easier!  Perfect for small households

reviewText: Got these for my husband, who didn't like the smaller, non-separating pair I use. These are particularly adept at dealing with most birds for prep and come apart for easy cleaning. The screw driver tips on the handles seem more in the way than useful (who needs a screwdriver tip on the back of scissors? Perhaps it is useful to pry open lids but the small tips don't look up to that task for long.) The bottle opener additions are more useful and fit with the design and utility of kitchen scissors. I would recommend these to a friend but like my Caphalon pair better for their weight and balance, even if they don't come apart for cleaning.

Love my BonJour frother - again. I was looking at other models just to see if there was meanwhile something better around, but still decided that this one has my name written all over it, even though it may be a little heavier than other ones. But it's definitely also- Sturdier- Easy to handle- Powerful !!- Fast !!This frother uses 4 x AA batteries and that would make it heavier over ones that use one or two batteries. But it's a power-tool!In my opinion, this model was improved over my old one by making the top section smooth - it now aligns with the grip and they call it  "quick-touch soft button design". My previous model had a silver button on top so you had to lift-up your finger and press down. Now you just press down and I prefer that.I do not prefer the counter stop storage solution of any of the frothers. I don't know about you, but space on my counter is very limited. Smaller frothers would perhaps more easily fit into a kitchen drawer. However, since my first BonJour model came with a hanging storage solution it was another reason I bought a new one since I can use it.Overall, I very much like this frother. My old BonJour lasted nearly 10 years and I expect this one to last a very long time too.

The Dyson DC16 Handheld vacuum is the biggest piece of garbage I have ever seen in a hand vac.  I admit, I was pretty excited when Dyson released this product, but as most Dyson products, the T.V. commercials were better then the actual vacuum cleaner.  I should say up front that as you can see from all of previous reviews, I work in the vacuum cleaner industry, so I have more experience with different vacuums then the average Joe.Pro's:The vacuum has an on-board brush attachment for cleaning blinds, furniture, etc.  That's about the only good thing I can say about the machine.Con's:First the absolute biggest con is the price tag.  Most hand vacs sell for between $39-$79.  At about double that price, the Dyson DC16 sells for $150, the price of most manufacturers full sized upright or canister vacuums.  We have gotten MANY of these machines in for repairs, and after the first time I took apart and saw pea-sized motor in this vacuum I asked myself where is the $150?  I have come to the conclusion that more then half of the $150 is coming from the T.V. commercials Dyson runs for their products.The biggest problem that we are seeing on this machine is motor burning out.  The motor is cheap, Chinese made motor (don't let the British accent fool you) that runs at such a high RPM it burns itself out very quickly (if you can get the battery to last you that long).  Also if the filter in front of the motor is not cleaned regularly the motor will burn out quicker.If the vacuum cleaner actually cleaned well, I could justify the price, but for a cordless hand vac, the suction power is very weak.  The machine is extremely bulky, and will actually hurt your wrist if you use it for more then 5 minutes at a time.If I could have given this product a 0 star rating, or better yet a negative -5 rating, I would have.  This product is such a waste of money, please BEWARE OF THIS VACUUM.  We actually saw so many of these vacuum come back in for repair, or be returned that we actually stopped selling these vacuums, and are recondsidering our descision to sell Dyson vacuums period, because of the amount of repairs we are seeing.A much better choice for a hand vac would be a Black and Decker, or better yet my favorite hand vacDirtTamer V2510 Ultima Wet/Dry Hand Vacuum Cleaner Powerful Suction, and 2 Year Warranty!which at the price of the Dyson you can buy two of these vacuum for the price of 1 Dyson.
summary: COMPLETE WASTE OF MONEY, BUYER BEWARE!

reviewText: I have had this mat in my kitchen for over three months and I am completely satisfied with the product.  The anti-fatigue mat makes a HUGE difference in comfort level when  standing in the food prep area or at the sink.Spills clean easily.  The Nantucket design blends in well with the earth tones in the kitchen. We'll never go back to ordinary kitchen "rugs" again.I highly recommend.
summary: Sublime Imprint Anti-Fatigue Nantucket Series 20 inch by 72 inch

reviewText: Found this, didn't think I really needed it but it was a good deal so I thought I'd keep my great vacuum working well.
This is such a useful pot.  I don't need to use my plug in fryer any longer and it is is much easier to clean.

The mesh back is especially nice on this chair and it has good lumbar support. All black and looks pretty sleek.However, the height of the arms is not adjustable. Also it cannot lean back (the chair can tilt - but the position of the seat and back relative to each other is always at 90 degrees).But the biggest negative is that the chair does not stay at the height you set it to. After a while of sitting in it, it sinks lower. It's annoying after only a few uses to have to reset it every few days, and it seems like the problem is only going to get worse.
summary: doesn't stay at its height setting

reviewText: it's the hario brewing system that is the winner. i haven't found any that fit better. the 02 size is the best.

First let me say, that I am a mechanical Engineer who designs Electro-Mechanical products for a living.  I know when something is well built, and when it is not.To sum it up, this product is nearly useless.  6 minutes of battery life for $150???  Are they joking???  My $79 DeWalt tools last hours!!!  And the suction is not "powerful" compared to non-cordless handhelds; their advertising is misleading, it should say "2x as powerful as other *cordless* vacuums".  We bought this item to vacuum one small 11 step carpeted stairway.  The vacuum is so weak, that it takes major "Scrubbing" to get all the debris off the carpet; and because it takes so long to use, the battery dies before we can finish the job.  This vacuum goes down as one of the most disappointing purchases I have made in 40 years. I am going to Target, to buy a $50 corded model...

I like ALL the Oxo knives and utensils very much. This paring knife, though, doesn't seem to hold an edge as well as the other Oxo knives. I have to sharpen it before each use. Of course, I probably use it more often than the other knives. The "fat" handle really helps (I have arthritis in my fingers), but I wish the blade were smaller -- more narrow and shorter. I still recommend this knife.
summary: Handle Is Great for Those with Arthritis

reviewText: I purchased this product because my cats seem to throw up alot.  They send you a presoak spray with this machine and that spray breaks down the cat throw up and this machine sucks it up like it never happened.  I have only used it once but so far and I am extremely happy with it.  It is cute and easy to use and I read a lot of reviews before I bought this one.  The other brands had a lot of bad reviews but this one had mostly good ones and now I see why.  Don't hesitate to purchase this one because you will love it.
summary: This is amazing, I love it!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviewText: What can you say - they work, they are bleached white and leave no aftertaste in my coffee. I'd buy them again.
summary: Coffee filters- fitting 8-12 cup coffee makers in the basket filter form

reviewText: OXO has good Customer Service.  They offered to let me send this back with no problems.  This is a pretty stopper and is made nice but it does not fit any bottle that I have.  It is too large.  It did fit a wine bottle but it slows down the amount of liquid flow as it should for oil but not for wine so the wine takes a long time to pour a glass.  I tried it on a bottle from Rachel Ray for oil and vinegar and it almost fit.  But it never went completely into the bottle securely so I was afraid it would fall out while pouring oil into a hot pan or into a salad dressing.  It needs the design to be reworked.  Sorry.  Otherwise it is nicely made.  I will be sending back 2 of these.  I'm still looking for some that work.  BTW, the restaurant called "The Table" sells good ones, I was just there a week ago visiting out of state so I can't go back and get more.  :o((

I've seen my friend using mini martini glasses for New Year's h'ordeuvres. They looked great! The best I could find on the internet was this set. From one hand, I'd prefer the "stems" to be thinner and more elegant. From the other hand, this set contains cute little spoons, which are very useful. These mini glasses can be used for desserts as well as for h'ordeuvres. I've made this desert: a tea spoon of homemade chocolate mousse, 3-4 raspberries, whipped cream. It looked and tasted great! Another one was meringue + whipped cream + raspberries + toasted hazelnuts. Yummy!
This is a wonderful quality tool for the pro cook. The diameter is quite large, but it is as described! Makes some BIG donuts! You'll love it.
summary: Great quality tool for the pro cook

reviewText: One of the best "as seen on TV" products ever. A quick and easy way to cook pasta. Really works and is the only way I cook pasta since purchasing.

these mats are 1 of this years best purchase.  i've had them awhile now and i am still very happy with them..  i read a lot of feedback on several different brands of anti fatigue mats because they are somewhat pricey but these were worth every penny!  received them very quickly.
I lost two sweaters this year to moths!  Big money!  My solution is to use this organizer to protect my good sweaters - wool and cashmere .  Fits about 4 sweaters per shelf.  Smells good.
summary: taking better care of my cashmere sweaters

reviewText: I bought this for my son because he thinks he doesn't know how to shop on the Internet <s> He said it fit in his pan perfectly, which, of course, I told him it would. Why do they doubt their Mom? LOL
I like this thermometer, it works great, but you can absolutely not get it wet!  I accidentlly got the top part wet and it quit working and I had to get another one.

I prefer my Capresso Infinity burr grinder (I give that one five stars). This one has a lot of static to the holder, and the lid gathers grinds. The result is more of a mess. Also, the Capresso just feels a little more solid - lids and parts fit together more snugly. One nice feature with this one is the on/off switch.

My mom used to have one of these when I was growing up and when I needed to get a kitchen timer I was really drawn to it out of nostalgia.So far, it seems to work well, but it's obvious that this is a cheaply-made product. I will be gentle with it in the hopes that it will work for a bit longer. Once it breaks I might try one of the digital timers.
summary: Cheaply made but working so far

reviewText: A life long Hoover owner I always trusted to this brand name. Five years ago I purchased the Windtunnel Supreme.  Within 5 months the on/off switch quit. It took two weeks to fix, and broke again.  The last fix held.  I just purchased this model locally on sale because Consumer Reports rated it so highly. Well it is 12 hours out of the box and I am taking it for "authorized" warranty service because the on/off switch doesn't work.  I am temped to pack it up and take it back. I read several complaints for this problem on other websites. The handle itself jiggles up and down with the self propell switch.The extra long cord flips off it's peg easily.  It appears to do a good job of cleaning, but the devil is in Hoover's details.  After getting it fixed today, I keep my fingers crossed I can get at least a couple years out of this one. I know it won't last 14 years like my original Hoover.WEll, it's been a year now and this vacuum is still working fine. Other than the initial need to fix the on and off switch, I would add another star to my rating.

This vacuum is pretty nice.  In some ways it seems very similar to Dyson vacuums but I can tell a difference.  This vacuum isn't as easy to maneuver as the Dyson.  It actually feels like quite a work out to use the Hoover.  This is my only real complaint about this vacuum.The vacuum itself works great.  I find it easy to empty and I absolutely love the automatic cord rewind.  This is a very handy feature.  Having several different floor settings is very useful.  I love the Bare Floor option.  Normally I just use a broom and dust pan for my hard wood and linoleum floors but I've found that this vacuum does a great job itself.  I have 2 dogs and it does a great job sucking up the pet hair.  Some vacuums just blow it all over this place but this vacuum gets it all.Although I would recommend this vacuum it may be a bit more of a workout than some might like.
summary: Love the auto cord rewind but hard to maneuver...

reviewText: I have used these types of heaters to supplement my gas furnace for several years now. I have a few different brands. I bought this heater at Walmart for half the regular price since the weather is starting to warm up here. I can say without a doubt that it heats well. That's the end of the good.We haven't had this heater long. The "silver" you see around the control panel on the front? It's actually plastic and after the second time using it, it is melted and warped. That cannot be good. Also, 3 of the 4 casters on the bottom have broken off. Occasionally, it gives off an odor too.I have another Honeywell heater like this. It is a white model and it is at least 10 years old. It doesn't have the digital control panel and there is no plastic on it. It works GREAT!
summary: Heats well but the construction is incredibly shoddy.

reviewText: If there was any little thing that you wanted in a toaster, this provides it. You can peek and then it draws it down for further toasting, no guessing. It has a light gauge that tells you how far along in the toasting process it is. All those little goodies that make toasting fun....toasts bagels on the inside only... smooth operation... big slots for things like large slices of homemade bread.There's only a few things that bother me is, because the light is on on the buttons, I unplug it for energy saving and I just MISS that old toaster pop up noise that you get when it's done. BOING! It does 'ding' to tell you it's done, like if you're cooking breakfast and don't want to watch, but if you're out of the room, you'd never know it had popped up, but that may only bother an old schooler like myself. Plus it is large... which goes with the bigger slots, but if you are short on counter space, keep note of that.But it's definitely a cadillac of toasters! I hope it lasts a long time!
These bags are so easy to use - easy to install in the vacuum cleaner and easy to remove.  I purchased them along with the scented tablets and am very pleased with both items.
A little big. I probably should have gotten a 10" but it is nicely made and of good quality. Nice price.

We bought this for my daughter when she was a baby, 2 years later and it's still kicking.  The tank is huge and we only need to refill it once or twice a week.  The shut off feature that activates when the water runs out is super effective and we no longer worry about overheating issues.  The design itself is cute, functional and gives a wide variety of vapor options.  The only issue we have really isn't the humidifier's fault but our water is hard so the top does get marked up with calcium spots and deposits.  A quick wipe down with CLR usually does the trick.  I have recommended this humidifier in many animal shapes to all of my friends.
summary: Cute, easy to fill does not leak.

reviewText: I bought it and amazingly nice piece, not to big or small, just right . good price. You wont regret it.
Works great in my basement craft room, even though the temp is slightly lower than manufacturer's recommended temp for best performance.  I use it in conjunction with damp rid refillable tubs.

The plastic works well outdoors against rust and the lid keeps a good seal against bugs and flys.  Like the internal plastic can that I put a liner that makes changing and cleanup easy.  Important when using as a dog poop can outside.
summary: Use it for outdoor dog pooper can...

reviewText: These cases arrived in a very timely manner, wrapped well, and are of excellent quality.  I was very pleasantly surprised at the quality for the very reasonable cost of each item. Each case came with dividers to protect the dishes and cups from each other.  I would definitely recommend them to anyone needing these kind of storage containers for their china.
summary: quilted zipper dish and cup  storage cases frim Amazon.com

reviewText: A Taco Salad at a restaurant is almost a punch line just in the name. Over a days worth of calories are housed in just one taco salad with a fried shell that you'd order out. However, you can get the same taste with these and be able to change up the ingredients inside the shell as well.For example, you can use queso or vegan queso rather than cheeseyou can use soy meat cooked with onions and taco seasoning rather than ground beefYou can add in a healthy monounsaturated fat with some avocado (although I don't overdo that as it still is a higher calorie item)I add in my favorite salsaYou can substitute refried beans for the meatSometimes I use fresh baby spinach rather than chopped lettuce for more nutrientsIn the winter, it is a great chili bowl with potatoes and your choice of cheeseAnd, better yet, you can keep several toppings in tupperware, cook the shells, and just let your family fix up their own with whatever they want in them for the easiest dinner ever.It creates a low calorie, low fat, whole meal in a bowl regardless of how you switch up what goes inside.I heat up the tortillas a few minutes in the microwave so they fit perfectly in the shell and are soft...then just follow the directions on the box and you have crisp taco shells in a few minutes. If you keep tortillas frozen in the freezer you can have dinner made in a few minutes any time you want.

if you put iron skillets in a hot oven, you need this to take it out!!!!!  I make corn bread like my mom, get an iron skillet hot in a 450 oven, before you pour in the batter...........makes great crusty cornbread  but it is tricky pulling that red hot skillet in and out of the oven. I got burnt badly through a mitt that was supposed to work......but the skillet was too hot for a regular mitt. Out of all the things I have tried this really works and it is not as awkward as trying to use the flat silicon square or the cutesy hand puppet like silicon mini mitts......  and i can leave this on the skillet while i store it.. and it is there on the pan ready for use whenever i decide to make cornbread  my husband had a good laugh when he saw this, he thought it was stupid....but this really works
summary: if you put iron skillets in a hot oven, you need this..especially if you make cornbread

reviewText: I purchesed two of these and they both quit working after two uses and had to return to Amazon.The Waring stick blenders are fabulous. have no idea why these are klunkers. I loved this mixer when it worked.
summary: Two strikes and now its out!

reviewText: I have had this colander for - oh, 8 to 10 years now. I originally purchased this item at Bed Bath. Based on the reviews here (and the price), I am sure I will return to BBB if I ever have to replace it and hope they are of the same quality. My version has red silicone and I have not had issues with it cracking (knock wood!). The collapsibility feature is essential for storage and the large size is essential for cooking for my family. The handles adjust to fit the sink and I have not had any of the mildew issues other users describe. Mine dries out fine.The little holes are great for most items, but I do have to line the colander with paper towels if I want to use it for big batches of tiny grains like quinoa. Because the sides don't have holes it takes the water just a little longer to drain than your average colander, but you can nudge it along by stirring your pasta or veggies with a spoon or something. It's well worth the trade off for the storage space saved! This is one of the smartest kitchen purchases I've made and I didn't realize it at the time. If I had I probably would have bought a couple more for family members back then.

I had another yogurt maker which was horribly ineffective and took a lot of effort to make a batch of yogurt. I used it once and threw it out. This one on the other hand is very easy. The instructions are not well laid out. Read through them a couple times and you'll understand them much better.I prefer to make the full batch instead of using the small jars included. I wish the "Baking" container had a pour head on it so you can fill your own containers much more easily. It's a tad bit messy when dividing up the yogurt later if you're not putting it into a large container. I prefer to make different fresh fruit varieties for the work week.So far I've used only vanilla flavored soy milk as the base, and it's been quite good.

Works fine, does not clean as well as I hoped but does clean. We used it for the rug in our living room, did OK job, I think mat be different detergent needed, because one that comes with Cleaner not particulary good cleaner.

I had one similar to this that I've only had a few months, but it would tarnish every time I washed and dried it, and the grey film would come off onto my hands.  NOT with this one, and it's heavy enough to pound what I need, but not too heavy that it's hard to hold onto.
I love almost all product from Kitchenaid and offcourse this handy tool also.....Matching with my kitchen theme n other kitchen gadget.

This is the third immersion blender we've used over the past six or so years (the others are still working and being used in different parts of the house). It's also the one that seems designed to be used by heavy-duty users and/or professional chefs/cooks (as in a restaurant or other type of professional establishment).Depending on your needs and usage, this is either overpriced overkill or one of the best additions to your food-prep appliance line-up.From my perspective as an at-home, non-commercial cook who uses an immersion blender several times a week, here are the pros and cons:Pros:* Clean, stylized design. Most folks would have no problem keeping this on display (A plastic vertical, wall mounting unit is included.)* Ease of adding and using attachments. Unlike some immersion blenders, the whipping whisks and the main knife piece are easily attached to and deattached from the power base.The extra long 10-inch knife attachment is a plus or minus depending on the type/size of vessel that contains what you are trying to blend.* Sturdy--and substantial. The main unit and the attachments (especially the knife, which is the most heavy-duty type I've ever used) don't feel as if they will fall apart with frequent use. As always, a lot depends on how you treat items. We haven't dropped any of our other immersion blenders but the other two seem as if they would break a bit on hard impact, from a fall or otherwise. Not this unit!* Power: You can vary the blender attachment speed from low to high and it also includes a Turbo setting. We make a lot of soups and even the low speed made for fast, smooth (and spatter-proof) blending. Easy cleanup.You can also chop ice with the tri-blade knife and this is a feature I really use as it is faster (and requires less cleanup) than doing it in our old-style vertical blender.* Versatile: You've got the all the traditional uses with the knife and then there are the two whisks (Secured into a separate mounter that is easily attached to the power unit.)* Accessories: The tall pitcher makes it easy to blend/pour liquids (and we've also used it when whisking as well.) And I'm glad that it comes with a separate, extra large dual blade chopper unit as we are always looking for ways to avoid using our Cuisinart(heavy to drag out; a pain to clean as we don't have a dishwasher.)Depending on content, using the tall blending pitcher allows for some quick smoothies. And again, fast cleanup.Cons:* Size/weight: The extra-long knife attachment paired with the heavy power unit could make it less comfortable to use for some folks. However, given the speed of the unit, and average home-cook use, I doubt you'd have to use it long enough to have your hand get really tired. But it may be a consideration for some, so I point it out.* You need to be sure you're using a deep enough container when using the Turbo speed or you could have some splashing/mess. Also, you've got to hold the unit very firmly on Turbo or, again, a possible messy situation. In general, a firm grip is essential.* Cost: It's high for average home-cook use given other options on market.
