But, if your needs are heavy-duty in terms of both frequency and types of things you cook, it could be a solid investment piece for your kitchen.Why four, not five stars given all the pros? One basic consideration: Price. However, to repeat, if I were a professional chef or someone who prepared a lot more food (volume and frequency), this would be five-stars as this would be a good investment piece.
summary: Powerful and versatile and maybe overkill for the average user

reviewText: I have an XV-11 that's around 2 years old, so I bought this upgrade kit a few months ago, extremely excited to install the new firmware and have a quieter brush on my hardwood. Unfortunately, the brush will NOT WORK without the new firmware - it recognizes a different brush/filter and will not vacuum without new firmware. My XV-11, though, is not detected by Neato's firmware updater app on their website. I have followed every bit of advice on their site, I've tried multiple computers with different OSs, etc. The first time I contacted their support, they admitted they were having problems with Windows 8, so I figured I could wait a little bit and I put the upgrade kit in the closet, to come back to later. Then last week I tried again - this time with a clean install of Windows 8.1 - still no joy. So I tried another computer, Windows 7. Then another Win7 machine. I tried 3 different browsers. I tried everything. And support won't help me because the warranty is only good for a year after purchase. Seriously? I've spent over $600 on Neato products, including filters and this upgrade kit. Unless they give and at least TRY to help me or offer me a discounted replacement for my device, I'll be skipping all future Neato products and advising my friends and clients to avoid Neato. Their product is awesome, but it's too expensive to gamble on with support like that.
summary: Word of caution if you're upgrading an XV-11

reviewText: We were debating between this 13oz model and the 8oz model.  We are definitely glad we purchased the 13oz model since the size of this model already seems compact.  The construction seems to be made well, and the top has a good size opening to pour the soap.  Changing the batteries can be a bit awkward if you have soap in the unit since the batteries are inserted from the bottom, which means you have to turn the unit upside down to change the batteries.  I had to do this because I initially inserted the batteries in the opposite direction, so I turned the unit to the side without tipping it upside down as much as possible...no leaks, so that was good.  The amount of soap dispensed can be adjusted by pressing the "+" or "-" on the top of the unit.  Additionally, there is a low battery indicator on the top that will blink red when the batteries are getting low.We've been using this unit for only a few days, but we absolutely love it.  The spout that dispenses the soap is long enough to hang over the sink, which means wet hands will drip in the sink...excellent.  The brushed nickel on the outside looks sleek and stylish.  So far, there have been no leaks.  And, the sensor works flawlessly.  There was lavender soap included with the unit, which actually smells very good...so good that we are likely going to purchase additionally lavender soap, although we may look for a different brand since the Simplehuman brand is very expensive.After using this unit, we are so spoiled, that we intend to purchase several more in order to replace the remaining manual pump dispensers in the house.  The manual dispensers are messy and water goes all over the sink when using them, unlike with this unit.  Additionally, if you have anything on your hands that could contain bacteria, with this unit, you don't have to touch anything and potentially infect others.  We are really enjoying this dispenser so far, even though it is on the pricey side.
summary: Works Well...Glad to Have Decided on this Bigger Model

reviewText: Item is just as described. Great for many cooking projects. We use it all the time. Easy to use, clean and store. I would recommend this product to my friends.

This upright is an improvement over my Dirt Devil Vibe in that it's lighter and smaller, and bagless. It's so much easier to maneuver, as it's not as heavy and the cord is not as ridiculously long. I also like the automatic floor height adjustment, which goes easily from carpet to kitchen floor without losing suction (i.e. gliding over the dirt instead of picking it up). The suction is very impressive, similar to the Bissell Pet Hair Eraser, if you've ever used that machine.But having all the tools/attachments not connected to the machine is inconvenient. The accessory bag is a hassle, and I end up just not using the tools. However, I will probably use the bendable wand (for underneath furniture) in future, if I can get the hang of it, because I found it to be a bit unwieldy. That attachment is at least stored on the vacuum itself. Also, there's no "headlight," which I've become accustomed to... but that's a small detail.All in all, I like the machine, and it will be my main vacuum due to the size, weight and maneuverability improvements over my current one, plus the fact that it's bagless.

I bought this device when I started drying apples.  This little guy makes it so fast and easy.  Just pop the apple on and spin away.  Catch the peels as they come off and toss them in the compost (or to your dog).  Slide off the sliced, peeled apple and break off pieces to put on the drying tray.  Slide off core and compost.  Repeat.I spend much less time prepping apples for drying, plus it's much safer as there are  no sharp peelers or knives for me to cut myself on.  Clean up is a breeze.December 2011 UPDATE:  I've been using this device for six months and it looks and works like it is new.  It is well-made with a simple design, and I expect it will outlive me.I've been using it to make applesauce and can whip out a batch in under an hour.  The thin slices cook quickly, so the sauce doesn't need much time on the stove.I love this thing!

I've had more popcorn since purchasing my Whirley-Pop Stovetop popcorn popper, than I have had in years! It tastes good, and it doesn't feel as if I'm eating processed chemicals the way I do when I eat microwave popcorn.In minutes I can pop up a large batch and drizzle a little REAL butter over it and sprinkle on a bit of salt and have a big bowl of seriously fresh popcorn just like you USED to have as a kid before technology came along and ruined all of the best foods by making them faster and giving them a really long shelf life!I would have given it five stars, but for the tiny flaw in design that allows for a kernel of corn to nearly always get trapped under the arm of the popper and burn on the bottom of the pan as it is turning.This is a great product and a lot of fun to use. It makes terrific popcorn (especially when you buy decent popcorn to put in it) and I highly recommend it.

I ordered 3 of these, but not for counters or cabinets. I put them in my refrigerator! I measured the inside first and this proved to be the best size. These are perfect so I can reach everything and hopefully not waste as much food. These are quite sturdy. Thankyou for sending them less than 2 days after order. This was a pleasant surprise!

I purchased this stand since I was looking for a contemporary tv stand. What convinced me to buy this stand was its frosted glass doors, which I love. The stand took me a some time to assemble since I found that the instructions were not very clear. In other words, if you aren't very handy get someone who is to help you assemble it.For the price this is a good buy, but I must admit I was disappointed with plastic feet of the stand.I know this is an inexpensive stand but they could have used a better quality material for the feet.Overall, I am happy with my purchase.
We currently have a dial type thermometer.  We greatly prefer this nice big clear digital display!  For curiosity we compared readings and they are very consistent.  Highly recommend!
Wish I had a big rectangle one but this stone works great. It arrived in perfect condition and works as advertised. Dont forget a pizza peel as well!

I hadn't used bar soap in 10 years due to hating that gross soggy feeling that all bars inevitably get. While out shopping one day I found a fantastic smelling organic bar soap that I just had to try and the search was on for a holder that wouldn't make it mushy. The saver's solid design is perfect to let the runoff go right into the sink, but still keep the soap solid. I will be buying more for my bathroom sink and tub.

great value for the money. The micro fabric is soft. I ordered a king for our queen bed as I wanted it extra large to hang over more of the sides of the bed, perfect size for us. It is lightweight enough to be comfortable and still warm & cozy. We might have to get another one for our boat!
I use this scoop for granola and it looks cute hung next to my big canister, and portions out the cereal perfectly!
This is one of the prettiest throws I have bought so far. Looks like the quality is there and the size is right. I do recommend it.
Nothing like fresh brewed tea but when don't want to brew a whole pot this comes in handy . Just fill with tea leaves and stick in a cup and pour hot water over and let it brew, great!!!

We've had this for a few months and mostly use the timer, without problem.  We have used the temp probe a few times and it seems to be accurate.  The temp probe does not remove from the unit, unlike others I have owned, but it doesn't seem to be an issue.  However, the temp probe wraps neatly around the unit on the back, out of site, with the probe sticking up as seen in the picture - a feature I love.  The readout is easy to see, and the magnet that secures it to the front of my fridge is strong, the unit does not slide down.

These are the same beaters that came with myCuisinart HM-50 Power Advantage 5-Speed Hand Mixer, and you can look at the specifications to see which models they fit before you order them as replacements.They are quite sturdy, perform as they should and clean up quite well in a dishwasher. And as noted in the title, they are quite multipurpose: I ordered a second pair, as you see here, for the sole purpose of mixing paints.And who said that a kitchen tool can't be multipurpose?
summary: Multipurpose beaters for your Cuisinart Hand Mixer

reviewText: While I love the quality of the pan itself, if you are going to ice cupcakes, you will be unable ot use the lid at all.  The only time you can use the lid is if you truly just make muffins... and even then you might squish the top of the muffins a bit.  Great quality pan, I just wish the lid was a lot taller!
summary: Muffin pan... cannot use lid if you made iced cupcakes

reviewText: A lovely product with a vibrant color and genuine woven feel, versus some factory extruded junk.  The color is vibrant, we chose the blue one, and it really is multi-purpose, as wearable as it is dine-on-able.
This  is now the favorite skillet in our kitchen. We cook without oil or butter all the time, nothing sticks. It heats evenly and is a dream to use, Wish I could find more kitchen ware like it.

Can not wait to get my new sink installed. I want to use this rack now but I'm waiting since I bought it to go over a large single sink. The arms extend a good width and it's definitely sturdy. I love the fact I can also use it on the counter for when I'm washing larger items and want the space of the full sink.
I really like the design of this product. it doesnt hurt my hands to crush the garlic. the brush it comes with is super handy! i use the brush to help me clean many other kitchen gadgets!
summary: Nice design, love the little brush

reviewText: As a newbie when it comes to bread baking I quickly got the impression that owning one of these brick ovens is a "must have". Isn't that the truth!! Baked two loaves so far and it is as everyone else says, no spraying with water necessary, perfect oven spring and perfect crust. I am new to sourdough baking and couldn't be more satisfied with this item. I have to say though that the first brick oven I ordered came broken and in my opinion due to lack of sufficient packaging by amazon. I was worried about the replacement being broken too but I was lucky because the packaging was still not any better. Sassafras box is ok but amazon needs to put way more bubble wrap in their box and a "FRAGILE" sticker would be a good idea.

I use this mostly for julienned veggies. It does a great job, but you have to watch your fingers!!! Saves a ton of time for the cook in the kitchen and the price is very reasonable. It's like a computer... just be patient until you get used to working with it.
I know they tend to break easily (in  a few yrs or so) so I got two.They say when u like something, get two.

I read some reviews saying it's hard to get the lid back on securely. That's a little true, but you really just need to be careful and patient, and it will screw on properly. Of course if you are trying to do it in the dark in a movie theater where you've snuck in some booze, it may not go so well.Other than that issue, the opening is pretty small, so it makes it a bit hard to clean. Our solution is to just fill it with hot soapy water as soon as we've brought it back home, and let it soak for a couple hours or overnight.Then it rinses clean just fine.These are quite sturdy (we bought two), and they're kind of tall... bigger than your usual hip flask. Just be aware they don't fit as well into a pocket (inside pocket or hip pocket or otherwise) because of the height.Other than that, it serves its purpose perfectly for us.
summary: works well, a bit hard to clean

reviewText: I love to make pizza and do so frequently.  This pizza crisper works well for homemade pizza and store bought pizzas.  You can also use it for left over pizza to crisp it up again in the oven.
I'm scared of plastics leaking into my foods, so I'm using glass and stainless steel now. Great for packing my lunch. Perfect size and the divider helps.

After only 7 hours in this thermos, food is merely warm, not hot.The dark blue coating is very slippery, making it easy to drop since it has no handle.It's a nice size, and looks nice, but does not do the job it was designed for - to keep foods hot!I followed the directions - heated the thermos with boiling water for several minutes before adding heated soups, but they still end up merely warm, definitely not hot. Also, soups tend to stay warmer due to the high liquid content, so I imagine that solid foods with much lower water content (such as rice dishes) would be cold in this thermos.
summary: Even soups are merely warm after 7 hours, definitely not hot!

reviewText: I absolutely love these velvet hangers.  They're going to be used in the granddaughter's closet probably till she's 8 or 10.  Even after her dresses are bigger, the velvet will hold her jumpers and sleeveless items.These hangers are well made, they are sturdy and man are they pretty.  They're pink with little polka dots on them and I think this is the perfect way to organize her closet and keep those little 18mo clothes on hangers where they belong.On another note:I do not intend to sound materialistic - but when my daughter started in the professional phase of her career and I bought her matching cherry pant hangers, it was impressive to look at her clothing lined up and organized.  I never gave it a though when she was young...Some things aren't given much though - such as that of  "matching hangers."  I feel good knowing my granddaughter has a pretty set of matching hangers in her closet and enjoy that it's just as pretty and girly behind the closet door.  Maybe, just maybe, this will instill in her a sense of organization and silent confidences/importance as she grows. I'm not saying it's the single most important thing in molding a child's character but if something this simple and affordable may help her, what do we have to lose?!

Put this in your bathtub and not only will you be able to stand up with little risk of falling, but you'll also get a nice little foot massage.  Only complaint is that it traps water at one end of my tub, but that may just be my tub and not a product issue.
I should have paid better attention to the size--much smaller than I expected and --wish they came apart for ease of use.

For the money, I was hoping for a few more features. For example, there is no "energy-saver" mode letting the machine power on and off intermittently. All of the buttons are not back-lit in the dark. The direction of airflow is not changeable since there are no moving vents.However, it cools down the family room reasonably, and that's all I really want in the end. I love that I'm able to cool down the room without the hassle of lifting a huge machine in and out of the window space. I don't even have my screen removed from the window where I have the vent for this portable air conditioner. It's easy to put together and roll wherever I want to. There is no movable vent  to direct the air, but even sitting well to the side, I can feel the cool airflow. The air reaches well to many spots in the room besides directly in front.I've run into trouble with the timer. Whenever I set it to go off for shorter times (2-3 hours), the timer fails to turn off the machine. Several nights, I've woken up to the machine still going when I expected it to turn itself off hours before. I wish the power button was back-lit so the times when I have to unexpectedly hurry to the machine in the dark to turn it off manually, I don't have to stumble around feeling the machine or turn on the house lights to turn it off. The timer works fine when I use it to go off at a longer time (8-9 hours). I still haven't figured out exactly what the sweet spot is for the timer to stop working.I've always left the machine on "auto", but have never heard it adjust its fan speed. It's always running at the highest setting no matter how long it's been on or how the temperature in the room might have changed. I'm not sure if that's because the room has never gotten cool enough to move to a lower fan setting or if the "auto" function isn't working properly.A little short on features, but this machine gets the job done for me.

I read the various reviews and decided I should add mine. I just purchased this yogurt maker in April 2013. I like the glass jars because you can make different kinds of yogurt at one time. (plus no plastic concerns) I made 3 vanilla, 3 blackberry (using home made blackberry jam) and then left one for starter for next batch. I followed the recipe in the book for the blackberry, found one on the internet for the vanilla. The vanilla recipe called for dry milk which I used. It said it made it thicker. I followed the directions and allowed the yogurt to cook in the maker for 10 hours. It turned out perfect! I started it in the morning, it was done in the evening. Put it in the refrigerator and it was ready for breakfast the next morning. I don't mind it NOT having an automatic shut off. The time reminder works fine...I made it on a day I was home. (The price makes up for no timer!) I read about temperature problems some people reported.  I tested mine today with jars of water. I checked the water after 5 hours then again after 10 hours. It stayed at 110 degrees. This is the first yogurt maker I have owned. So far, I have no complaints. I would recommend it to buyers. The yogurt is SO good and so much better than store varieties. Plus, no plastic yogurt containers to toss into the trash! It's a win - win!!FYI- I contacted Euro Cuisine about the plastic cover and unit itself. They told me no BPA is used in these pieces. The lids are also food safe.

I have been making my own yogurt for years.  I have a dehydrator (Excalibur) and I would heat the milk and the starter, fill the canning jars and put in the dehydrator for about ten hours.  That process worked fine but I needed to have the huge dehydrator out all the time.  I have an extremely small kitchen and it was a huge inconvenience to lose space.  I often resorted to just buying yogurt instead.  Last week I saw this little machine.  For the price I thought it was worth a try, I loved the compact design.  This arrived yesterday, I made my first batch last night, in the fridge this morning and I just tasted it - YUM!  The yogurt is thick and creamy and oh so smooth!  I can't wait to try adding some different fruits to the bottom before processing.  The design and compact nature make this a perfect fit for me.  The only draw back is that I wish I could buy and extra set of jars.

This beautiful ice bucket has made a very nice contribution to my kitchen. It looks nice and sleek and definitely serves its purpose. The tongs are the perfect size and I've had several compliments on the bucket already. It also does not slide around on the counter.

I received these in August and they are what I expected.  In reading other reviews some ordered these thinking they would be bigger -- they are not going to make you a large, oversized cupcake, they are the size of traditional old fashioned cupcakes we all ate and loved prior to all the gourmet cupcakes, so they fit a standard sized cupcake pan and not the bigger sized pans.They clean up easily, my cupcakes turn out great in them and I do not have to pay the ridiculous prices they want for cupcake pan paper liners these days.  They are great to use for a housewarming or apartment warming, birthday or any other kind of celebration as you are giving both the cupcakes and the liners -- a nice little gift.I would recommend these to anyone and have to my friends and acquaintences.
Made from white platic with a non-skid type black rubber on the shelf.  Great addition to my counter to better organize and see items.  Would purchase another.
Have tried a variety of quick slicer gadgets for the times when we don't need the power of the food processor.  This is the one.  Very glad we bought it.
summary: Sharp - just the way it should be

reviewText: First of all I got these at an amazing value. I bought these as a birthday gift for my father, who desperately needed them. His old knives were junk even before time made them even more dull and beat up.It is a very large set, that has all of the knives most people would need for normal kitchen use, and maybe one or two you will never actually use. They are made of quality materials, and feel very solid. Their weight distribution and handle shapes are well balanced for stability and precise movement as well. They are very sharp, and the built in sharpening tool works well. (I tested it on some older knives.)These of course are not the very top of the line knives or anything, and will not perform as well as a much more expensive set. But these are very good knives that are great for everyday use. I can't imagine finding a full set that even compares in quality for the same price.

I've owned them all - stainless steel with anti-stick coating, the classic Chinese version and a wide casserole type WOK with non-stick coating that didn't even get the food hot enough. This is fantastic: Sears the meats and tofu perfectly, creates great crunch on veggies and nuts and most importantly, when covered with any fitting lid really heats the food through plus keeps it warm.

It takes a little effort to put it together (e.g., a handy girl with a screwdriver 1.5 hours). The instruction is clear. Once it is together, it feels very sturdy. Opening and closing is easy and the wood is very smooth to the touch. I was a little concerned that the color of the wood won't fit to the room but once the futon mattress is on top of it. you really don't see much of the frame anymore. Excellent piece of quality furniture!
summary: Full size bi-fold futon sofa bed

reviewText: works just like i expected it too no issues no problems seals good. For the price i paid its worth the money.
This filter holder is beautiful and works perfectly.  I could not be more happy with it.  I would definitely recommend this.
I purchased 25 hangers for myself and 15 for a friend. They work great for pants just clip them above the cuff at the bottom of the pant leg. My friend uses them for her skirts.

Big Boss Torpedo Multi Purpose 10 in 1 Kitchen Appliance, Black works well. I like the stylin and easy to use controls. It works really well for mixing up smoothies and drinks. I think it is very useable, The onlt thing that is a slight drawback is that it is a little taller than most but still fits in my kitchen well.I'd say all in all it works as well as my kitchenaid blender and is just as easy to clean.

This works so well! I enjoy the smell of my home again. I have a cat whose litter box happens to be just off the kitchen. Even with cleaning it daily, there is an odor. But with this air purifier, I don't smell the litter....or what I cooked yesterday! It keeps the whole main level of my home smelling fresh and clean. Cat? What cat?? I am also dusting a lot less and I live in the country on a gravel road. Very happy with my purchase!

This is the best bowl I have ever used. It stays in place, easy to measure. Comfortable to pour or hold while blending ingredients.I wish they made all the OXO bowls with the handle. I have the 3 piece set and they are nice too.
These work fine.  They look utilitarian but made a nice stocking stuffer for Christmas.  What else can you say about a pot holder.
summary: Pot holders to keep your hands from burning.

reviewText: I've had this cheap little thing for a couple years now, and for some reason it just keeps going. It seems flimsy, but it works. When you press down hard, the motor reverses with a loud clacking noise, and you think you've broken it. But that's the way it's supposed to work, according to the manual. And that reverse motion gets more juice out. I'm using it now to make juice to drink but also for making sorbet and ice cream with my new Cuisinart Ice-21 (had it only two months but using it 3-4 days a week, and also so far, so good: http://www.amazon.com/Cuisinart-ICE-21-Frozen-Yogurt-Ice-Sorbet/dp/B003KYSLMW/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid;=1344879775&sr;=8-1&keywords;=cuisinart+ice+21). I keep wondering when it's going to break down because it seems so cheaply made - well, it is, but it's also well made. I think the important thing is to give it a slight rest when juicing a lot of fruit so the motor doesn't get too hot (that advice also may be in the manual - can't remember, can't find the manual). It's very easy to use, to put together and take apart and clean, the pitcher is very handy (though the markings for the volume are almost invisible - 16 oz. is about halfway up the little transparent window). I understand the complaints of breakage and burnout, but that happens even with high-end products. For what it costs, this thing is a steal.UPDATE 1/25/14Well, four years or so since I bought this, and it's still going great. No issues. I hope I haven't jinxed it by saying nice things about it, but it always does the job, even with me putting so much pressure on it.

When I order my breakfast sandwich maker, they recommended this little knife. I've never see a knife like this before, but found that it is a great knife dealing bagels, muffins, or any large biscuit. In comes in handy. Recommend for everyone that makes breakfast sandwiches.

Recently, I had been given the opportunity to try out this pan, from the manufacturer, and I wanted to share not only my experiences with the pan, but another fun recipe that might put you in the baking mood as well!To begin, this pan arrived very quickly from Amazon.com, and upon close inspection of the pan, this product seemed very heavy duty, for being a silicone pan. The pan itself had a soft, yet firm grip, was not slippery, has deep muffin cups, and I love how cheery the color of the pan is as well! The pan was also very ample in size, larger than the varieties of pans that I usually find at my local department stores or at local craft stores, such as Joann Fabrics. What an even nicer surprise, is that the pan, compared to other silicone pans I've purchased, did not come with any offensive plastic odor, and was immediately ready for baking!I then set out to make one of my families favorites, my recipe for Triple Berry Breakfast Muffins:Ingredients:1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour3/4 cup sugar1/2 teaspoon kosher salt2 teaspoons baking powder1/3 cup vegetable oil1 large egg1/3 cup reduced fat milk1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract1 cup fresh berries; I use a medley of blueberries, raspberries, and cranberries.Instructions:1) Heat oven to 400 degrees2) Next, combine flour, 3/4 cup of the sugar, baking powder and the salt in a large bowl with a whisk. Whisk at least 10 times to make sure the baking powder and salt have evenly dispersed.3) Add vegetable oil to a measuring glass.4) Add the egg to the measuring glass, and incorporate; while incorporating add your vanilla extract.5) Add milk mixture to the bowl with flour and sugar then use a fork to combine. Do not over mix.6) Fold in your berries.7) Divide batter between 8 muffin cups; I used my OvenArt Silicone Bakeware Muffin Pan. As I am using silicone, you will not need to use liners (unless giving to others), or add water to the bottom of your muffins.8) Bake muffins 15 minutes or until tops are no longer wet and a toothpick inserted into the middle of a muffin comes out with crumbs, not wet batter.9) Once done, tip your OvenArt Silicone Bakeware Muffin Pan on its side, and your muffins will simply fall out!10) Transfer muffins to a cooling rack and cool completely.11) To store muffins, place them in a plastic bag, seal, and store at room temperature for up to 2 to 3 days, or freeze tightly wrapped for up to 3 months.The muffins came out cleanly, without burning, and the pan was a cinch to clean up! I would highly recommend these pans, and will be purchasing several to give as gifts as well!
summary: These pans are a necessity in every kitchen!

reviewText: My husband bought us a Mavea pitcher nearly a year ago, and it's been great.  Saves tons of money and waste from buying bottled water.  The filters are very affordable, and the first one lasted nearly 8 months, so I would save its a great value.
Great filters, easy to install, love that they can be recycled.

Had the previous version of this and the kids broke it after 6 years. They have changed the design and the button is no longer on the top (why they still painted the top black is a mystery). The button now rests on top of the bottle...which is find if you are using the bottle. But if you use this to mix something in a small cup, you almost need two hands to do it.Other than that, this is a must have if you love making your own salad dressing.

Received this yesterday and cooked a Delmonico. Followed all the rater's suggestions on cooking/searing (thank you) and I cannot believe I am saying this was the best steak ever. Better than any grilled steak. Steak tasted like fine quality restaurant steak houses. Only issue I have, and if anyone can post--how to get a rare steak? Cooked 2 minutes each side on med-low and after resting was well-done. This pan is extremely well-made, but it is very, very heavy. The two handles are definitely needed along with oven mitts. I needed both hands to lift the pan. I cooked on a glass-top and found the pan did slide a bit so I have to watch and make sure the pan is directly on the heat element. As suggested, purchase the larger size. With the smaller pan, cooking a Delmonico at 1.3 pounds there would not be room to spare to add veggies. Washed up great, no scrubbing or burnt bits on the pan. I am going to only buy Lodge from now on.
summary: Yes, as all said, "best steak ever!"

reviewText: I usually suffer from allergies, and I'm always very careful when buying pillows and cases. Since I bought this product, I haven't had any allergy problems during nights. Also, very easy to wash.
I love Rubber maid products and I really thought this one would do the trick.  It DID, when I figured out I should lay it flat - so pans are on their side, not stacked.
Helps keep the water contaned with a decorative flare
I have these on all of my pillows. it keeps them new looking no stains and they are cool and comfy

Finally, an LED desk lamp that looks good (modern), gives excellent light, adjustable brightness & easily adjustable neck.  It even has a memory for the last brightness you used so next time you turn it on, it lights at that setting.The light quality is excellent.  It's very bright on the brightest setting (1300 lux) & the color rendition is very good.  I've personally not seen an LED light with this quality before.  It has a very good  "V-Cut" filter to cut down on glare.  And no buzzing sound.The dimmer is really easy to use.  Just hold the on/off switch for a couple seconds, it beeps incrementally as it goes up/down in light & then double beeps when it hits its highest or lowest setting.It is shiny black finish everywhere (shows fingerprints) except the gooseneck which is a dull black grippable rubber.  It's bigger than I was expecting; about 27.5" tall if it's extended fully upright/straight.  It's about 16" bent at a 90 degree angle, from the bend in the neck to the end of the light area and then it's about 12" tall. The LED light lens area is about 7.5" long x 1.75" wide.  The footprint is approximately 5" long x 4.25" wide so doesn't take up a lot of space on the desk top.  The base is a nice weight so it doesn't tip over when you adjust the neck.
This works great! It's good for chopping and mashing an avocado. The sturdy handle makes is easy to use too.

I bought these because I wanted to keep my cookbooks in the kitchen, and the only place I could keep them is on top of my kitchen cabinets. I was looking for a tasteful "kitchen-themed" set of bookends that would be able to hold multiple very heavy cookbooks. When I saw these, I was delighted because they are not only beautiful but also multifunctional. I set them up about two weeks ago, and have been very pleased.These bookends are heavy enough to hold books even without the wine bottles in them, but with, they are extremely stable. They are nicely made and just as pictured. I have absolutely no complaints, and would recommend these to anyone!
summary: Exactly what I was looking for

reviewText: Arrived on time, feels good in my hand, getting to accept the curve in the fork (last one was not curved), and good price.  Would buy it again.

I bought the medium size in eggplant and I absolutely love it.The medium size can fit 2 packages of cooked pasta - you can drain 2 packages worth at a time. This colander is square and deep, so it is space saving.I was tired of my roundish-oval shaped colander always spilling cooked pasta out when I would dump it back in the pan after draining. I also wanted a purple one to match everything else in my kitchen. This colander is absolutely perfect in every way.It holds a lot of food at once, I can dump everything back in the pan without anything falling over the side of the pan onto the stove or into the burner, the color is beautiful, it takes up much less space in the cupboard and is much easier to store.It is made very, very well. I expect it to last...forever.Love, love, love it! I am going to get the matching colander spoon now, too. I wish they had more items to match in this color!

After owning several Sharp microwave ovens, I decided (reading reviews) to try Panasonic and don't regret my decision one bit.  I like the family-size microwave ovens 1200-Watt to 1300 Watt and this 1250 Watt is much quieter, is easy to program, has more features than most users will probably ever use, is easy to clean, and fits very nicely on our kitchen counter along with the coffee pots, etc.  The only negative I have so far, and it is probably just me, is that when the glass tray is removed for cleaning it is tricky to reload on track-a problem I have never had with any microwave oven.  Otherwise, it is a winner and a keeper for me!

***The first unit I received from Amazon stopped working after two hours of usage. I tried all the troubleshooting tips in the manual but none were effective. I then called Vornado's customer service line. I explained my situation and the rep quickly told me that I would be unable to fix the unit. I provided my units serial number. She said that she would send me a replacement unit. Vornado only required that I email them a photo of the unit with the power cord clipped to process my claim. I was so happy that I was not required to ship the broken unit back to Vornado. My replacement unit arrived within five days.  I am thrilled with Vornado's prompt customer service!Now on to my review:This unit is large and designed to work for a room up to 335 square feet. The unit measures about 28 inches high, 12 inches wide and the depth in about 11 1/2 inches. With those measurements this unit is a large presence in a room. Build quality is nice though it is largely plastic. The glossy black finish attracts dust so you will need to wipe it down daily to keep it looking nice.The unit has many nice features. It has two HEPA filters and two carbon filter. The filters are the replaceable only type. The unit has filter change indicators for each filter type. The indicators are based on how many hours the unit is run. The carbon filter is designed for 4000 hours. The HEPA is designed for 9000 hours. The indicators are NOT based on the dirtiness of the filters. The filters are easily changed as they are right behind the front cover. The control buttons illuminate to a bright blue color. The unit automatically dims its illumination after a short time, it will brighten if you touch any button. The unit has low,med,high and a quick clean mode. There is also a dust sensing mode. The dust sensing mode defaults to a lower setting but ramps up when dust is detected. There is also a nighttime setting that detects low or no lighting in the room. It will then power the unit down to the low setting  I also like that this unit does not have an ionizer. Many people are sensitive to the effects of an ionizer. This is a large unit so it is loud on the higher settings.Performance wise I am very happy with the unit. I have a small one bedroom condo but I have five cats. The five cats and their five litter boxes produce lots of dust,dander,hair and filth. I love the dust sensing mode! Every Time one of my cats goes into the litterbox and kicks up dust this unit senses it and kicks into action clearing the air! It also does the same when I scoop the boxes. The bedroom where I run this unit and have the litter boxes has  much fresher and cleaner air.I only have a few quibbles with this machine. I worry that it may greatly affect my energy bill since it is NOT an energy saver model. I will update my review regarding that issue after I receive my next bill. I recently checked the current cost of the replacement filters and they are quite high. I am hoping I can find cheaper off brand filters when the time comes to replace them.Overall, I love the unit and the results that I am experiencing. I am also happy that the company stands behind its product. I will update my review in few months.****EXTRA INFORMATION****I also have the smaller model Vornado AC300. The AC300 is half the height of this unit and about half the cost. It also uses one HEPA filter and one carbon filter (same filters as the AC500) but it has less features. It is rated for a 225 square foot room. I just want to suggest perhaps think about getting two of the smaller units if you have a large home or you are concerned about the size of the larger unit.
summary: Do you have a dusty home ? Cats ?

reviewText: I gave them  to a friend! They go out in their boat a lot so the chillers will come in handy.

reviewerName: Michelle R. Vickers "A Tony Stewart Fan"
reviewText: I don't know how I went witbout this wonderful little knife! I know love cutting tomatoes instead of dreading it.

easy to select my grind size, easy to work; even with wet hands.  I love that it stores "upside down" so there is no pepper leakage when I put it away.  I dont love the look of it, so it probably won't be what I put out when having company, but it has earned a spot in my over stove cabinet, where real estate is precious and these things aren't decided lightly.

Absolutely love it!!  This company provides quality products.....I have more than one of these, and I would definitely recommend.  Some people complain about the size, but it fits my beds perfectly.UPDATE:  I thought I had found the perfect item but after use, found that the sewing comes loose.  Very poor quality.  The colors are just what I wanted, but I've already had to repair one place on the spread and will probably have to do others.  Disappointed.

I never thought I would have so many people say 'That is so cool, where did you get that, I love it' when I bought this for my wife last x-mas. She used it immediately that day and everyone who saw it wanted one and didn't even want to wait til the next holiday to get it. There's probably a good chance we may give this for some gifts this year but we first have to make sure they already didn't rush out and get one themselves already. Highly recommended. Just make sure you carefully clean out the cutting channel so cheese or other food doesn't accumulate in there. This was a definite hit for a x-mas gift when I bought it, not just with the recipient either.
The quality of these far exceeded my expectations for the price.  Shipping was quick and resonable. These are more like something you would find at the Hyatt.

Comes with a dull edge but who cares, get him sharpened up and will cut your ribs like butter as well as a lot of other BBQ! My uncle who is 70 and lives in the country fell off his chair when he saw this knife. He says "when you got an Old Hickory, you have a knife". He went on and on with me on how to care for it and to be sure to carve my initials into the handle, LOL! It is sure a good knife and will have it for as long as I live, carve chicken's and turkey's with ease, cut ribs, roasts. All Old Hickory asks is that you oil him before putting him away so he does not rust, treat him like your cast iron and he will be with you forever, along with the occasional sharpening.I took it into the meat market to get it sharpened, the clerk said, "whoa!! look at that knife, what is it"? He will get you some attention!

I have many knives of all types, some as much a $150 for one knife, but this knife is a good deal for what you pay.  It is made carbon steel AKA it stains, that is normal for all carbon knives.  It holds a good edge and all in all has worked for me to cut up several deer and cook many meals.  Buy it and if your friends or family trash it trying to open a paint can, it is no big loss.
summary: This is a good knife for a great price

reviewText: I would have rated this four stars had I not read other reviewers' tips to delay inserting sticks until the pops are partially frozen. I make fruit smoothies (usually yogurt, orange juice, berries, a banana and a peach) and fill the pop molds with part of the mixture. The pops release easily when the mold is run briefly under hot water; the pops themselves remain frozen. I ordered four more molds for my children and grandchildren.

I'm not one to "over sell" an item, however this vacuum is AWESOME!!! I really LOVE it!!! Its lite, its easy to empty, its got great suction even picks up cat litter instead of blowing it around!! It also works great on getting pet hair off furniture and carpet. It really is a great vacuum!!!

This coat/hat rack is tall and looks just like the picture provided.  The wood is solid and has some good heft to it.  However, the central post comes in three separate pieces and mine would not screw on completely straight.  Instead, each section of the post is about a half millimeter off the one beneath it so that the it looks sort of like this: -_-Okay, I know that wasn't the greatest illustration, but that's the best I could do.The bottom legs' joints were also a bit long so that the wood piece that screws into the bottom of the post to secure the legs would not screw in all the way.It's all still perfectly functional and not bad looking, especially from far away.  So, I'm going to say you get what you pay for.  It's a relatively cheap rack and thus equally cheap construction.
summary: You Get What You Pay For...

reviewText: Used these for cupcakes and a race car cake and it was a HUGE hit. Excellent condition, came in great shape and on time.

Works really well, holds A LOT of liquid, and doesn't spill! The only drawback I see with this product is finding drawer space somewhere for it, but it performed like a champ during Thanksgiving and with the removable tip and enclosed brush it cleaned up easy enough. Great product and I would recommend!
Sits very nice in my kitchen sink area! I use it to keep the odds and ends in one spot and out of the way. Helps me to keep things organized.
This knife is not worth it.  It's way too small to be useful.  You'd be better off using a plastic lettuce knife.  And you can get one of those at a dollar store for a lot less money.

We moved and I needed something to protect my clothes.  Ha!When we arrived at our destination, not only had they let all air in (not one of them was still sealed), most of them had ripped.  It damaged quite a bit of my clothes and I had to rewash EVERYTHING in my closet.Do not buy these!  They don't keep sealed and are pretty much worthless, a trash bag would be preferable.

This is a wonderful idea, I was wanting this for my homemade breads; something that was reusable.  It works fine for a loaf of bread, but I put my homemade individual hoagie rolls in this and it's really rather cumbersome to try and open it and just get one out while keeping the others in.  This is really only a good fit for one loaf, not multiple loaves, rolls, etc.  It is rather short also.  It would definitely not fit a sandwich loaf in, a regular bread pan loaf touches both sides and is just closing.

Good pillows for the price, well made, and no weird smell.  I have slept on them nightly for over 3 months, and they have retained their shape.As a side sleeper I find them almost too fluffy, but that is not the pillow's fault.

Pro:Heavy DutyStay cool handles including lid.Easily cleanedCon: a bit slower to get hot due to more metal at heat source.  Not bad just noticeable from other pans.Wife would prefer Glass lids - no matter to me.

I have owned at least 5 Bodum frothers and given several as gifts.  Even though I have a steam frother on my expresso machine, the Bodum frother requires less milk product, takes less time, and is easier to clean up.  Unfortunately, the glass portion has always been made of very thin glass that is easily broken or cracked.  Well...Bodum finally made one with thicker glass that I am hoping lasts longer.  Sad to say, though, that the metal screen that creates the froth doesn't seem to create the nice, small frothy bubbles as well...
works great, still works after a couple of years.  makes dicing things easy.  would purchase it again, no problems with it

I have a Hamilton Beach pod coffee maker. I use these replacement filters together with a small sealer to make coffee pods. I use 1.25 -1.75 tablespoons of coffee per pod. I find that the finer the grind of coffee, the less I need per pod. I do seal around the edges. This is more work for these filters than for others with a single funnel type opening. However, these filters are easy to fill and fit very well in my coffee maker. I like getting to chose the coffee I use and will continue to purchase replacement filters.
summary: Good for my pod coffee maker

reviewText: This thing is awesome. It heats up fast and holds enough water. It's a little loud but that's ok. We use it when we're on vacation to make instant coffee because hotel coffee is never good. Recommended for sure.

Pretty straightforward product -- very long tongs for certain jobs like flipping things in the back of the barbecue or even moving wood in a fire.  Typical good quality that Oxo usually provides.  Perhaps not the easiest tongs in the world to control, but only due to the length, as I would expect.
Very usuable size . Secure closure . Now it is a snap to take cakes ( or pies , tarts, etc )  to their destination without squishing them .

You get a lot for your money here and they work just fine; just keep in mind that if you can cut with both sides then both sides are pretty sharp.  In hindsight, I don't need this many cutters so I would have preferred a blunted side to use as a handle instead of double-sided.  Also, if you don't need a million more pieces in your kitchen, this might not be the set for you.  On the other hand, they store easily and clean up easily as well.
summary: A LOT of cutters but no real handle.

reviewText: Great timer. Easy to use. Best feature is the "count up" after time expires - so you know how long you went past the time you originally set.

I am sorry that the last reviewer has not had such good results with this mill.  I have had mine for over a year now and it is WONDERFUL! I do admit like the last reviewer that this mill does get rather loud. However it isn't anything that isn't bearable for the few minutes to few seconds it takes to grind the grain. The flour does come out of the mill warm but not hot and I have had no problem at all with flour dust.  I love this mill because it is fast, and easy to operate and clean.  This mill is given a life time warranty by the manufacturer. Shortly after I bought mine, it needed repairing.  I sent it in for repair and the manufacturer repaired it and quickly sent it back.  They were very helpful and courteous. And didn't seem to mind me calling every other day to check its status. I would definitely recommend this mill.

I bought this even though I already have an electric waffle maker, but I figured the kids would really like the stick form for dunking in syrup - boy, was I right! They love it, it is easy to clean and you can't beat the price.
This is a gorgeous duvet. I highly recommend. Washes well, looks amazing, and is super soft. We ordered the grey and it's a perfect seal grey. Best value out there for hotel stitch duvets.
Sturdy, easy to assemble, just as described. Depending on the shoe and maybe your shoe size whether or not five pairs of shoes go on a row but most of my 7 and 1/2 do.

I bought these about 2 years ago at an outlet store for about the Amazon price.  I was a bit discouraged at first as they warped into interesting shapes but were always useable.  It never occurred to me that these should be eaten from [not that I don't do it, c'mon].I've read the objection that using resistive containers melt them; ok, mine have battle scars.  Fold a paper towel or napkin under the container, it will protect the plate and will heat product better.With the unfortunate spectacular results I've had using random plates, I prefer to toss product onto the microwave plate, zap it and slide it onto something more attractive ['tho definitely less interesting] and go.Do miss the purple glow from the 4th of July paper plates but I'm glad I had the fan on!

I really like these coasters. They look good and go great sitting next to the matching decanter and old fashion double glasses.  I'm still trying to figure out what kind of "holder" is available for them or if they even need to sit in one at all.  I would hate for someone to bump into the table and they go flying off and hit the floor because when you stack them they don't actually "sit/fit" in any type of groove.

Not sure what happened to KRUPS. The coffemaker was ok, at first. It made coffee.But it has glitches. Sometimes it turns itself on after awhile, when it's preloaded, even if the lid is up, and the coffee is not in, but the water is, and it spatters everything with scalding hot water within five feet, and then proceeds to make a pot of coffee if you put the lid down, without ever being turned on. Seriously. No lit up pretty blue button.The pot itself dribbles hot coffee down the front when you go to pour that first cup or three, and it's messy. Trying to hold the lid shut to keep the coffee in does not stop this. I do think that, for the price, there should be a better fitting pot lid, because the coffeemaker itself is extremely basic, no frills coffee making. Not even a clock. Just that blue button to push on. And apparently it doesn't need that, sometimes. But that seems to be erratic.I also really am not fond of the fact that I cannot see how full of water the reservoir is from the front, easily, yet the pot only goes in through the front. Poor design. Looks good but not very practical, or efficient.Topping it off, three months later, it died. Totally. No reason to be found. It was not used that heavily. I am shocked that Krups is allowing it's formerly good name to be so corrupted by chintzy products, like this. A waste of money. I'm off to try another brand.

We have a Tempur-pedic mattress on our bed and its very nice.  And super expensive.  We do love the memory foam though, so when we were looking for a mattress for our cabin, we looked at memory foam.  I am so happy we went with this LUCID 10" Memory Foam Mattress!  It's more comfortable than our more expensive one.  And it was 1/4 of the price.
summary: I would buy this again - if I needed to

reviewText: This pantry organizer rack is sturdy and good quality but it did not work well for my intended use.  It holds cookie sheets and muffin tins fine but if you plan to use it for pot lids make another choice.  it does not hold many and they roll out of the rack.

This is a nice little mixer.  It's lightweight and easy to operate.  I did a great job whipping mashed potatoes last night and was very easy to clean up.  Overall, I am very satisfied with this mixer.
I've bought several of these over the years.  The pumps work well and the corks hold up for a good while.  I've seen other brands, but will stick with a winner.
This pitcher has a good profile so it takes up little space in the fridge.  I have been using it to store my homemade almond milk, and it keeps it fresh because of the seal.  Recommended.
Nice light-weight knife. I can chop for hours with this knife. Great for chopping all kinds of vegetables. I love it.

My wife and I bought one of these spoonulas (the name cracks me up) about 8 or 10 years ago and it has seem much use.  I use it when making tuna or chicken salad and it's great for getting those last bits of onion and mayo off the side of the bowl.  It's perfect for scraping down the inside of a Kitchenaid mixer bowl and will get all those little bits from the base of the little dome in the bottom of the bowl.Unfortunately, it finally wore out and I was afraid we'd just have to live without one but I got the model number off the handle and put it in the search window here at Amazon and there it was!  A little more costly than I expected, but I don't care, it's a good tool that's served us well for several years so we'll pony up and buy a new one.

I can cut onions now without crying! Before I got these, it would take at least twice as long to cut onions. I tried to wear swimming goggles sometimes, but they fog up. These goggles work much better and are much more comfortable too.They are a little small on my head, but nothing to really complain about. My husband has a huge Irish head and he didn't think they bothered him very much either.

These measuring spoons are a must for the chef and baker.  I have many round measuring spoons, but until I read someone reviewing that these spoons fit into spice jars and cans, I thought the round spoons were the standard.  I prefer the rectangular spoons because I don't need a small spoon to scoop out the spice to put into the round measuring spoon that didn't fit into the spice jar.  What a great find!  I think I need another set.
It was okay, but I didn't think it cleaned very well and kept leaking water. More a pain then helpful.

This is one of the few shower caddies that works for our type of shower attachment. All the other shower caddies would make it difficult to use our shower head. After going thru 3 other shower caddies I was real happy to find this one.
By far the best bakeware I have ever used. So easy to clean after months of use, no issues. To say I love this bakeware, and would recommend to anyone.

Its funny. I didn't read the description right. I thought I was getting pillows! To my delight these are the best allergy pillow cases I have ever seen. I am very glad I got them and recommend them highly

I was looking for something to bring homemade soup to work and keep it warm.  The stoneware containers are a little small but definitely did the job.  The soup stayed nice and warm and everyone thought the "little triple dipper" was neat.  Very easy to transport with the handles in just the right spot, the insulated bag is easy to carry and worked amazingly well.  The warming base is also very easy to use and heats up nicely in about 10 to 20 minutes.  I wish the stoneware was a little bigger but the size is probably perfect for dips or maybe chocolate.
summary: This is the best "traveling chef" gear ever!

reviewText: I purchased this to go with the Teen Hot Pink Zebra Comforter collection. Perfect match and good quality. Needed to be ironed before it could be put on the bed but that's to be expected.
Loved that it came with two gloves. You still can feel a bit of heat so I wouldn't recommend just holding something hot, but it does prevent burns.
summary: Very useful item when baking and grilling

reviewText: this is a great easy to use product.  it seems to take the chlorine smell and the calcium out of our tap water.  it is not like our well water (we just moved) but it is better than what the township provides.

The dutch oven arrived on time (last minute order, thank you amazon prime!). Wish the box was worth saving...it was very flimsy so I don't have a box I can keep the dutch oven in while not using it. I will have to figure something out about that because carrying it loose in the car on a camping trip is a pain. I had to wrap it in a towel (which is now covered in black grease) and weight the lid so if I had a sudden stop nothing would possible fly off (unlikely).  On that note, the thing is VERY heavy and while I can carry it, I try to make my husband do it. Bought a tripod with it but the hook started to go and had to get creative before we lost the stew! You can carry bricks and build a staggered circle but who wants to carry bricks as well?  We seasoned it twice before using on a group camping outing (25 adults of which 2/3's were very active college kids) and had LEFTOVERS. (and yes the food was good!) It is the first time we have had a pot big enough to feed a whole group AND they had seconds.  Highly recommend but will probably have to custom make a tripod as the one we bought on amazon, (Bayou Classics Dutch Oven Tripod Stand with Chain) while heavy enough except for the hook (easy fix), it really needs to be taller for this dutch oven.

I bought this as a gag holiday exchange gift. I couldn't beat the price. When I saw it I wondered why anyone would pay more for this. It's cheap material and super long. Drags everywhere! Granted I'm only 5'3 but still. It does keep you warm I guess. The sleeves are also too long to be practical.
They get the job done.
Very soft and smooth.  Glad I bought these!  Price is right and the quality is good.  Best buy yet.  Enjoy

I purchased this steamer because we recently moved into a new-to-us home and it was filthy. The previous homeowners didn't take care of the home and cleanliness was obviously not a priority. I knew that I would have to scrub for hours to get everything clean enough to want to live in. I purchased this steamer thinking that any little bit would help, but it was amazing. I cleaned a very dirty bathroom, grout, tile, tub and sink in an hour and half and it was sparkling! I would have never thought that this was possible. I went over everything with an organic cleaner just to be safe, but this steamer performed much better than I was expecting! Definitely worth a shot if you're considering it.
This is a good thing for young people who live in small place.very good. I used it twice a week.

I mounted this to the ceiling and, with the remote control, I don't have to get up to turn it on and off all night. Great for night time hot flashes ;)Perfect on the lowest setting. No rattles. It's a little loud, but I like white noise.
We have the hand vac this goes to, so decided an extra filter won't hurt. Thank you for having these available.

As a few other reviewers have mentioned, my temperature probe also died shortly after I used it the first time.  In my case, after less than 1 hour it read "Hi" and got stuck there.  I removed the probe from the oven, unplugged the probe, removed the battery from the unit and let it all sit overnight.  Even with all that, it is still stuck.  (At no time did the temperature in my oven exceed 475 degrees.)While the thermometer itself seems very clever, the shoddy quality of the temperature probe is a deal-breaker.  It also makes me wonder whether some probes that do not actually fail may be falsely reporting higher temperatures as the common problem from the reviews here seem to indicate a propensity for getting stuck on "high".I am returning my unit.
summary: Died after less than one hour.

reviewText: I've been a die hard Pyrex fan all of these years. One year I had to replace the one cup measures due to chips and the red volume indicators faded away. I found one cup Anchor Hocking with 3 lips to pour from and while I was dubious because there was not painted volume indicators thought I would give them a try.I absolutely loved them! They were strong, durable, did scratch or chip and the raised volume indicators easy to read. Now, years later I find they have two cup measures. Yayyyy!These things are just great - As with the one cup measure, the 3 lip pouring option comes in very handy. These things take a real beating. They are constantly used and stacked together (despite my efforts to get folks NOT to do that), yet they do not scratch or chip or seem to degrade in any way. Sorry Pyrex. Sorry Mom (taught me to be Pyrex only), but these are just better.-Actually, not just better, the best. The one cut measures I bought years ago look just as new and fresh as the two cup measures I just bought.Why rave so much about a simple measuring cup? Anyone who cooks a lot will know! :)
summary: Love these! Like new after much service!

reviewText: These ice molds are really a great product.  The material is very heavy quality that seems as if they will be long lasting.  They delivered as promised.  Filled to the water line, freezing time, ease of use and they popped right out.  The ice looks fabulous and elegant in a short highball glass and took forever to melt so my fave rum did not get diluted. Will definitely order these as gifts for my friends who enjoy cocktails this way!

Very nice air conditioner cover.  Wish it came in 38 in height however the central air cover from the cover store is a great addition and looks great on my unit.  After spending a small fortune to install a new Broan 24 SEER IQDrive System, wanted to ensure it was protect.  This thing is thick, repels water and attaches easily.  Again only way to make it better is to make it longer to cover the height of new High Efficiency Units

I've gone through a lot of cutting boards in my life, and this one isn't the best.  It's not the worst, either, but there are many better choices out there for around the same amount of money.  If you're really serious about using only wood cutting boards, then probably get this one.  It's affordable, made of a renewable resource and is comparable to other wood boards.Pros:  it's dishwasher-safe, which is a must for me as I hate doing dishes.  It's easy on knives.Cons:  it requires more maintenance than I want to do, i.e. regular oilings (which is pure laziness on my part, I admit).  It gets scratched very easily--after only a few weeks of use, it looked as old as a cutting board I'd had for years.

This is an amazing product. Just kidding. It holds bread. I have never lost a loaf of bread since I bought this bread keeper. The bread from my Cuisinart CBK-200 2-Pound Convection Automatic Breadmaker fits.

I seriously don't know how I ate store bought hard taco shells for so many years! These are easy to use but there is a bit of a learning curve. You have to have a pot deep enough to submerge it and hold it for a couple of minutes while frying. But the end result is SOOOOO worth it!!!I wish they had a two taco holder to make shells quicker, and if they ever make one I'm buying it!
summary: Never buy storebrand hard taco shells again!

I had a size-range in mind when ordering.  To add more Prep area by the kitchen range, I have a typical 1 ft. counter & cabinet base with a drawer along one side of the cook range.  I store this cutting glass along the sidewall of the lower cabinet.  When I need the extra counter top for prep and cooking, I place the cutting board across the open side drawer and I have what I need.  The pads on the cutting glass keep the glass from shifting off the open drawer.  Dishwasher safe; it does not retain food odors and is easy to sanitize.

It's difficult to find a longer length shower curtain, much less one that isn't the go-to heavy gauge vinyl. (Yuck!) So when I stumbled upon this, I thought I'd give it a go. It does its job. No complaints there. But I would never classify it as a "fabric". It's more like a thinner type of plastic. I was expecting some special weave of something or other. Nope. Just plastic. reviewText: I purchased this to go on my gray apartment sized couch with the Sapphire Blue Peacock Design pillow. They are quite lovely together.

Easy to put together, nice size to fit in my laundry room. I cook/bake a lot and don't have a lot of space in my kitchen. I use this as a pantry for my kitchen. It holds enough. Again, I keep it in my laundry room which is right off the kitchen. This is plastic and not something I'd want in my kitchen, due to the looks.
This is easy to use, compact, and apparently accurate since my recipes turn out well.  How did I live without it before?

It's nice to have a scissors meant for the kitchen. This one goes overboard a little in it's attempt to be a Swiss Army knife. I particularly dislike the screwdriver tips at the end of the finger loops. The ability to take the shears apart for cleaning is great, and the action is solid.

Not all inexpensive products are junk, but this one is.  I had to return the first one after two months because the drop-down door wouldn't shut properly.  B&D replaced it.  The bake pan is made of a questionable metal.  The first one developed rust spots after two months' use.  The replacement pan developed a gray coating that wipes off.  I'd never put any food on it.  B&D wasn't concerned when I called and about this -- I was afraid it was lead (the right color).  They sent another pan same as the first two.  Don't think so.  Now I'm looking for another toaster oven, preferably not one made in China.

It's well made, functional, and a generous sized baker for au gratin. It makes a beautiful table presentation and is lead/cadmium free and hand made in France, not China. The best part is that it cleans up so easily! I always enjoy cooking and baking with Pillivuyt products.

Oh, my gosh, I love this little tool!  I watched the video on this and saw how easy it looked and gave it a try.  It works EXACTLY like the video, it minces the garlic so very well, buy it, you won't be sorry.
We love this slider press.  The lifter is a perfect addition.  We can't wait to make something with it.  Thanks

Emile Henry Flame Top Tagine 12.5", RedI got a wonderful price on this item...74.95 plus free shipping! I couldn't decide if this was really what I wanted, hubby is sick of the kitchen gadgets I buy, no room left in the kitchen. But this was worth the investment by far. This is sturdy, but light weight stoneware I have ever seen. Cooks even, and moist, clean up NO problem, and it is a eye stunning piece. Eggs are wonderful in this, and meats fall off the bone. This was a great investment for my kitchen, and I recommend everyone try using this . The cooking is sooo flavorfull !

I am the latte drinker in my family and have owned an espresso maker for quite a while.  After years of owning several steam ("el cheapo") types of machines, I finally bit the bullet and asked for a pump style two years ago for Christmas.  I received a Delonghi and really loved it.  (After all it was a HUGE improvement over what I had owned in the past.) It finally bit the dust in September of this year.  (Not quite two years old... but I do use it everyday, sometimes multiple times...) I did my research and decided to buy this one locally, really because I needed it NOW!  (I mentioned I use it everyday....) My first attempt started rather well, I like the design, the water basin is great, you can remove it, but you don't have to.  The unit heats up very quickly and pulls a great cup of espresso and then the frothing feature is amazing...  I have never owned a more powerful unit.  My Delonghi could froth well, but nothing like this bad boy.  I found that my standard sized frothing pitcher was not near large enough.  I can only froth 1/3 to 1/2 a cup of 1% at a time or I get serious overload.  Since I need a whole cup frothed for my drink, I am having to froth two or three times for one drink.  I understand that this is not the fault of the machine, I am thrilled that it has the power to create froth as well as the coffee houses do.  However, I am concerned about being able to find a larger pitcher that is not too deep as the frothing wand is not very long and extends pretty low on the side of the machine.  This feature alone is not enough to cause my star rating to drop to four.  As I mentioned in my title, this is round two for me.  About three weeks after I purchased my first unit, I had a day when the machine seemed to "flip out". I was pulling the shot of espresso, it started sputtering and making a weird noise.  I turned the knob to the off position and pushed the froth button and all seemed to go fine, then I thought I would try to pull another shot just to be sure it was working.  I started over with new beans and all went fine.  So then I went to froth the remaining milk and the frothing feature would not work!  I would push the froth button, it would flash a few times and then switch itself to the shot light and you could pull another shot, but not froth.  Later in the day, I tried it again and it seemed to work fine, but after that it began to leak like a sieve on my counter.  So, I took it back.  I exchanged it for the same unit and I notice it leaks a bit too, but not like the other one.  I like the taste and quality of the espresso I brew so much I will not be taking it back for the puddle it creates, but I sure wish it didn't do that!**Edit** After reading some of the reviews, I decided to try to remove the black rubber tip from the frothing tube.  This did NOT work for me.  It still steamed, but it did not froth at all.  One of the biggest perks of this machine for me is the high frothing output obtained when steaming.  So, I promptly returned the rubber tip to it's rightful place.  Just remember to take it off daily to clean under it, it will get nasty if you don't.
summary: This is round number two for me!

reviewText: I use these to hang my headphone collection in the closet. I don't know how they are for clothes, but they are perfect for headphones.

I ordered this model because it was similar in appearance and feature to older Black & Decker CitrusMate plus.  It was a bad mistake.  After opening the box, I noticed the plug was very short compared to my old juicer.  When I tried to juice an orange, the motor made noise that was much louder than CitrusMate plus and it was slower making juice.I was thinking I could save money by purchasing lower priced juicer but after experiencing less than pleasant juicing, I will go back searching for higher quality juicer and pay more to get it.

Solid and sleek looking muddler. The size is great, you always feel like you have complete control while using it. The teeth on the bottom firmly grip whatever you are mashing and mixing, making your job so much easier. Made with really nice sleek looking stainless steel, built to last.

Cheesecloth is cheesecloth. It's exactly as it should be and works for it's intended purpose just fine. A little pricey thought considering you can buy good quality cheese cloth at the dollar store almost anywhere.

I have always used All Clad stainless steel cookware, but I needed a non stick pan for eggs and omelets, and my All Clad non stick skillet had some scratches on it from long time use. So I had to return it for a replacement, but they said that it would take 4-6 weeks. I couldn't go without a non stick skillet for that long, so I went out and bought this skillet. To my surprise, I found that this is a great non stick pan. Nothing... I mean NOTHING sticks to this pan no matter if I use oil or butter or just nothing at all. This is a pretty heavy little pan, and is perfect for eggs and omelets. Then I started reading reviews on this brand of cookware, and was pleasantly surprised that a lot of other people like this cookware as well. Now I'm not sure if I should replace all my All Clad non stick cookware with this Anolon non stick cookware. I'm very impressed.

reviewText: They not only work as described, but I love the design that allows easy cleaning! I don't have to worry about bits and pieces getting stuck in the joint, and ruining the snips over time.

over the older version we had.  This one does not sit 24 X 7 cooking the battery and wasting juice.  It has a smart chip inside that ONLY charges the battery when needed.  Get one.

This is a great vacuum!  I have an Electrolux that I have been using and I went over the carpet with this Hoover and was stunned by what the Electrolux was leaving behind.  It was so easy to put together and start up.  I love, love, love the retractable cord!!!  Just follow the directions carefully when you press the cord return button, as to not allow the plug on the end to snap back into the machine or you may break something.  Hold the end and press the button and gently release from your fingers when it rewinds back to the machine. It has attachments for dusting,tube extenders, that sit nicely on the side, for hard to reach places and a mini beater bar stair or upholstery brush.  it is lightweight and easy to move around and carry up and down stairs. The only dislike I have regarding this vacuum, is when I place it in the upright position, the beater bar is still running and I personally don't like that.  I prefer it is off in the upright position, otherwise  I highly recommend this vacuum!
summary: Great suction, amazing retractable cord, easy to put together and light weight.

I got this as a wedding gift, and I was amazed at how much of a difference it makes in the kitchen! Good knives make cooking such an enjoyable experience, and Wusthof is well-known to be one of the best out there. The 8-piece set is perfect for people who want to start with a good set and build up on it. Of course I use the chef's knife the most, but I also use the bread knife and paring knife a lot too. I think a santoku knife would be a nice addition to this set, and perhaps steak knives would be wonderful to fill in the 6 slots on the bottom of the block, but in terms of practicality, I never feel like I need more than what I already have (but this is coming from a person who is a beginner in the kitchen). I have been using my knives for about 1 1/2 years now, and the knives are still as sharp as they were when we first bought it. I'm sure we will have to sharpen them eventually, but with good care I expect these to last a very long time.
