reviewText: I get so tired of refilling these tiny bottles they sell for fostering kittens. So I finally figured out how to make my own huge bottle! Just cut the nozzle off this squeezie bottle and pull a tiny nipple in it and presto! Instant giant kitten bottle! Im using a nipple from an AG bottle kit from the pet store. You might have to try a few different nipples to get one that works but this one works perfectly. No leaks and no leaks from the lid threads either. I make my daily KMR amount in the bottle and keep it in the frig till I need it. I remove the lid nd mic the entire bottle for a few seconds till its warm and screw the lid back on. And the Bonus is that the kittens dont catch thier little claws in my cuticles anymore because my hand is further away from them when they go on the bottle attack. If you foster you know what I mean! Ill try to post a picture

I bought this as a gift 2012.  We have had this unit for a year now and use it on a daily basis. .My house is all hardwood and tile  and This unit works well on them  I have four short haired dogs and cleaning up after them was a chore..  Having this unit now ,we can set it up in a bedroom ,hallway, study ect., leave the house, and let it work.  .I've replaced the brush and pickup once and the filters about four times.  We still have a central vac, but don't use it as much as we used to. The only problem we have found that it leaves matting from the rugs on the edges when it transitions from the rug to the hardwood.  Not a big deal, we just vacuum it up..Over all were happy with it.  I will look at the Irobot floor mopping bot this year.

The Peugeot pepper and salt mills have a beautiful gloss finish that is a rich none yellow mustardy color, they call this curry.  The color in the picture does not do these mills justice.  The mills themselves are about 22 cm tall or 8.75 inches tall the metal knobs are not a significant part of the height, being that they blend in so well with the contours of the mill, but they are part of this measurement.  They measure about 19 cm/ 7.5 inches around at the base our 5.5 cm from edge to edge, the diameter. The height and width make these mill perfect as they are not so big as to be a nuisance or so small that you lose them on the table amongst your food, and again the beautiful color and finish makes them wonderful functional accent pieces for a kitchen or dinner table...The grinding mechanism is just like those of the past and made of metal rather than hard plastic. The setting for fine and coarse grinds works true enough with a tight-ing of the knobs giving you a finer grind and loosing coarser larger pieces.  I tossed out the salt and peppercorns that came with it, I had no idea what these where stored with our how long they had been with Amazon.  When you do fill them please be sure you use rock salt and enough black peppercorns in a pepper mix.The price is a the really deal here one only needs to walk into any fine cookware store to see that each one of these mills sells for $35 to $45 dollars. A great buy that will last for years to come.
summary: Quality French made Pepper and Salt grinder at an AMAZing price, A+ all the way!

reviewText: Uhh uhhh, these pans transfer the heat the best and produces THE BEST BROWNING on a tart crust and I've been baking tart crusts since the '70's.  Fat Daddios pans are the ultimate best.  All that you need to do to produce the best crust is raise your heat +25F to 400F and bake for 40 minutes.  Just remove the ceramic baking weights at the 15 minute mark.  For baking, I use a crumpled parchement paper loaded with ceramic baking weights for 15 minutes before removing them from the shell.  Parchement paper does not stick to the crust and faggetaboutddit the aluminum foil brushed with butter.  Naked parchement paper loaded with ceramic pie weights is the ultimate to use for your crust.
summary: Fat Daddio's is the ULTIMATE tart pan.

Our old Eureka self propelled has been a real workhorse for over 25 years.  Unfortunately, its self propelled drive broke for the second time.  It is a very heavy machine to push without the drive working and not worth repairing.  We were looking for a lightweight vacuum with good cleaning power.  I heard a lot of good reports from friends who owned Dysons, but the idea of seeing all the dirt through a plastic container and then dumping the dirt in a trash can, did not appeal to us.  Also, the appearance of the Dyson products had a total look of all plastic and was loaded with gadgets that were lugged around with the vacuum.  We wanted a lightweight vacuum that was easy to maneuver and could be carried up the stairs easily.  The Hoover Platinum met our goals and was highly rated by Amazon owners and Consumer Reports.We have owned the product for two months and are very pleased.  We do have a housekeeper in once a week and she has been very happy using the new Hoover when compared to our old Eureka.  The small over the shoulder canister is very easy to use, once you get used to carrying it around versus pulling a typical canister.  So far so good.  We found Amazon pricing to be the best.  The same product at Sears was almost $100 more.  I think we made an excellent choice.

I love Roomba. It doesn't do a perfect job, but what it does really well is keep the daily dust to a minimum. I'm constantly surprised at how much dust and hair this picks up every day.Sometimes Roomba is naughty! It succeeded in falling down the stairs the first week I got it. I was horrified. To my pleasant surprise, Roomba was not broken and continued on it's merry way. Points for strong build quality!Overall I love this and it's helped a busy working mom just a little more sane.
It has been great for keeping things looking nice between deep cleanings.  It picks up more than I thought it would

After spending way too much time researching coffee makers (and despite reading some of the negative reviews of this particular model) I decided to buy this one, and it was a great purchase!  My criteria was cost less than $150 with a insulated carafe.The most important thing is that when I fill the reservoir with cold tap water, the water consistently comes out between 185 and 190 degrees F when it hits the grinds.  In the pot, it measures about 175 degrees.  Preheating the carafe would probably prevent the 10 degree temperature drop, but seriously, who has time to do that in the morning?The coffee stays pretty hot for at least 3 hours.  As an experiment, I drank half the pot (about 2-3 mugs) and came back 3 hours later to measure the temperature and it was 160 degrees.  At 6 hours, it was 130 degrees... a bit too cool, but who wants to drink 6 hour old coffee anyway?  I'm guessing most people will drink a pot of coffee in 2 hours or less (we do), and the carafe will definitely keep your coffee hot.I use this machine twice a day, in the morning with the timer and then in the evening with manual start.  I've used this coffee maker daily for 3 months with not a single overflow incident that others have commented on.  Despite what people have said, there is no need to precisely center the carafe under the filter basket.  It's designed with a lot of wiggle room, so I'm not sure what others are doing that causes the machine to spill coffee everywhere.  Perhaps accidentally placing 2 paper filters instead of one?  Even with a full basket of fine espresso ground beans, I didn't see any overflow from the basket, or grinds in the coffee.  I haven't tried brewing with 2 filters, mainly because I have no desire to purposely cause a spillover and mop up the counter.The timer and controls are intuitive and simple to operate.  The reservoir window is large and it's easy to quickly see how much water is in it.  The filter basket pulls out for easy cleaning.The only thing that is partially aggravating is that if the lid to the carafe is screwed closed too tight before brewing, it's nearly impossible to unscrew to pour coffee out. I guess the plastic lid expands slightly from the heat, and it becomes the equivalent of opening up a vacuum sealed jar.  The simple fix:  don't close the lid too tight.  Works great.This is a well engineered and effective machine that works quite well and brews a great cup of coffee.  My wife and I use it daily, we've had no problems, and are very happy with this purchase.  I'd recommend this coffee maker.
summary: Great coffee maker, ignore the naysayers

reviewText: This is one of the largest and best "indoor" grills I have had.  Although I do use it outside too!  Since my apartment complex doesn't allow normal grills this is definetely something I would suggest you buy as it's one of the largest (for it's price) grills since the top can fold down and be cooked on as well (it doesn't just act as a press but also as a skillet itself)!  Hence, you get twice the room!  These are all the positives.There are some negatives:  this cooks WAY slower than on a stove or on an actual grill but that's only because it takes a long time to get hot enough to cook, once it heats up all the way it actually cooks quickly enough.  Be prepared to adjust your cooking times because of this!  In addition, it is't very easy to clean with fatty food and it can be messy (sprays easily everywhere if it's fatty food).  So, be prepared for some serious clean-up unless you use this on an outdoor balcony or something where the spray won't matter.If you can deal with a slightly messy grill and longer cooking times, then this is a pretty good grill, otherwise I would look elsewhere or avoid cooking fatty foods on this grill.
summary: Superb looking grill with functionality issues.

This is sturdy & well made, but I prefer the consistency the 4-blade creates in my smoothies to this 6-blade. This 6-blade makes it almost too thick. But I'm glad I have this as an option.
