reviewText: Purple stoneware? Yes, the bright, bold color caught my wife and I off-guard as well. However, these `Bubble and Brown' round bakers are handy additions to our kitchen due to their versatility. The stoneware is safe to use in a microwave, dishwasher, freezer and oven up to 500 degrees. The instructions state the only place you can't use it is under a broiler.As with other stoneware, additional care is needed so as not to knock the dishes around in the sink or counter. The dishes are heavy and appear to be as durable as the stoneware insert we use with our crock pot.In summary, a lack of enthusiasm about the celebrity brand -- we've grown tired of the Food Network's endless chain of veneer-toothed celebrity chefs -- led to low expectations, which were pleasantly exceeded by these stoneware bakers. The contemporary design, comfortable handles and attractive purple finish has made a nice splash during the holiday season. We look forward to using them in the summer as well for chilled dishes like summer salads and mixed fruit.Please take a look at the product photos I submitted that include our baked chicken dinner.Rating: Five starsDISCLOSURE: This review is courtesy of the Amazon Vine program, which provides products at no cost in exchange for my independent and unbiased feedback. My objective is to provide you with helpful information that improves your shopping experience.
summary: Overlook the celebrity and appreciate the stoneware

reviewText: Our 10 year old iteration of Panasonic’s high end MW finally went kaput. My wife and I decided that we likely used it 5-10 a day for 10 years. We discovered our dependence on the MW between the kaput and the receiving this one.Before choosing this one, we read and considered user reviews. On the 1-5 rating scale and a lot of reviewers in the distribution it’s still a crap shoot. Most negative views regard the dial control or DOA’s.Ours worked fine right out of the box. There are little things we notice that make this a step function improvement:1. Popcorn – pops all the corn it appears and outputs a fluffier product without that super-heated steam blast that used to deliver 2nd degree burns to the knuckles when you open the bag.2. Inverter defrost – 10 years ago this was iffy for thawing hard frozen chicken or steak before grilling. Now, I’m getting a uniform thaw. Whatever the sensor improvements over time, inverter defrost works as one would expect.3. Sensor reheat – My default button. However, the old one could turn soup to molten lava if you left the machine to its devices too long. Not anymore. Panasonic has succeeded in calibrating the sensor heat for humans rather than lava dragons. You have a sensor reheat button for frozen stuff and another button for room temp reheat. These are on the top button row and are basically the only two buttons I’ll need.4. The dial – It’s a touch sensitive, intuitive device.  It doesn’t stick out. It’s not a knob. It’s superior to the old touchpad that seemed to take its origin from a programmable flight computer.Now I like farm machinery and there’s a lot of farm tech that I’d like in the house. With farm equipment … the Big Green button is on. The Big Red button is off. I really understand that. There are only 2 options between full blast and off. Unfortunately, the household MW requires a spectrum of options dependent on the MW target food and the user desire. If Panasonic could build a sensor that used an AI to know what I’m nuking and the way I want it … we could have those big Red and Green buttons. Someday maybe but in the meantime, this unit is a lot closer.5-star … exceeded expectations.

I bought this for the cats' litter box. I was tired of having to deal with the bits that the cats would track out after they did their "business." The mess was too small to pull out the big vac, but near to impossible to sweep up. This little vac takes care of it in seconds. I am very happy with this!

There are two reasons to order this casserole set:  you really really love purple or you watch Rachael Ray and love the look of this bakeware.I really love purple and had seen these bakers on the show and thought they looked fun.The color is a deep purple, a little brighter than eggplant.  Some foods look better in them than others.  The cheesy potato bake I made looked very good because yellow/orange is a complementary color to purple.  Things that are white like rice or green like broccoli also look good.  But the tomatoey red sauce of another casserole I made didn't look as pretty in this dish.I wish the bottom of these bakers was glazed.  I store them nested and worry the smaller one will scratch the inside of the larger one.  Also, when I saw Rachael Ray use these on the show, I liked the idea of the holes on the side to grip them.  In practice this isn't as helpful as I expected.  My oven mitts are too thick to fit well in the holes and the placement of the holes means I have to be careful not to overfill them or my food will bubble over and through the holes.The shape of the "handles" and holes also means it is more difficult to cover the bakers if I want to keep the leftovers in the dish and put it in the refrigerator or freezer -- you can't just put aluminum foil or plastic wrap tightly over the top of the baker.  They are listed as being safe for use in the freezer but I wouldn't use them for freezer storage if I can't cover them tightly.So my bottom line feeling about these is that they are pretty but not as practical as I would like.
summary: Pretty, but not as practical as I'd like

reviewText: I used this in a chicken pot pie and immediately, the bottom misformed because the pie was, of course, hot. The company was great about immediately refunding my money. i still use the gate, but only occasionally, and usually only in cool pies. It's a really neat idea, though! :)
summary: can melt if you insert it in hot pie!

reviewText: I use these microplane grater all the time.  They are the greatest.I would recommend these to anyone who likes to cook.

This was purchased as a bookshelf for a first grade classroom library so it gets lots and lots of attention on a regular basis. It was easy to put together and it has held up very nicely. The price made it a great value. Would purchase again!
Great set of cookware at a great price.  Heats evenly, cleans up easily, will last forever and very attractive set.

I bought the Zojirushi EC-BD 15BA about a half a year ago. So far I am getting a warmer coffee and the carafe holds it hot for longer time  than the others I had. My other two different common name coffee makers lasted 14 months, and the other 7 months. Since they are made in a far away land it is a common problem of longevity. My Zojirushi is simple to clean  because the top  silver filter enclosure  is very easily removable from the body. The water level is very easily seen compared to my other coffemaker. The carafe design is better insulated than others I had. No need to line upopenings to pour coffee. Most importantly the cap screws back very easily. As a retired CHE I am impressed with the simple practical design and I HOPE IT WILL LAST!
they don't say it wont fit a smaller pie shell, so it was unusable.
Works well in microwave and fast.  Much cheaper than buying all the bagged popcorn.Easy to clean.  Can use most popcorns.

MCP-12 MultiClad Pro Stainless Steel 12-Piece. Works great and built to last longer than me I think. Evenly cooks with no hot spots and works just like they claim that you don't need to use the high setting to boil because they are so conductive. Very handsome out of the box but don't worry, that wont last. I'm sure they will clean up quite well but I bought them to cook food. As long as they cook my supper I don't care about discolorations. Made in ChiCom though, but hey, so is our government! (insert frown here)
summary: Love cooking with these. Thank you Communist Chinese!

reviewText: Based on the reviews, I knew I'd have to be prepared for a LOT of LINT in the dryer after laundering, and this was the case.  I washed and dried it 2 times before using it and it came out nice and soft. Higher quality flannel might not do this, but this product was the only color-size I could find. I just bought a second duvet in a different size and will prepare it the same way.
summary: NICE & SOFT but lots of lint at first

reviewText: Coming from Europe at first I hated upright vacuums (we use canisters) because they mostly heavy and can not reach everywhere. Once I used my sister upright vacuum and saw that they are powerful.I wanted the lighter version and picked Hoover Platinum one and LOVE it. It is light, powerful, easy to work on the stairs, it folds down to clean under coffee table with no problems, long cord is convenient. The light is awesome, I don't turn on the light in the rooms to see the floor. The canister is handy when little accidents happen and to clean the car.The minus is that sometimes it hard to transition from floor to rugs and I have to lift vacuum a bit. Also I make sure not to have toys or clothes on the floor because this monster will eat it!I saw the same vacuum in the store for over $350 so amazon price is great.Overall this vacuum is great and also look modern. I am convert from canisters only, and truly love to vacuum the house now.

An easy device for creating smoothies, including smoothies with frozen fruit.  The key is to not  put in too much frozen fruit to start, rather, in 2-3 installments.  Otherwise you have to pause it to stir ingredients.  Even with that extra step, however, this is easy to clean up, doesn't take up much counter space, and is a powerful little blender.  Nice extra to have two cups/travel lids.  Good buy.
This thing is great! Does eggs just the right size for English Muffins for breakfast sandwiches. Super easy to clean.

I got a sample of this product in my new Hamilton Beach Brew Station. The first time I used it, I could not believe how great it is.Things I like:Dissolve in 4 cups of water, pour in coffeemaker. Dissolves easily.Run through the coffeemaker, then wipe and rinse parts. I said "wipe", not "scrub"! First one I ever used that I could do that. I was very impressed.Two subsequent run throughs with clear water. The cleaner is tinted with a blue color, so that you can see if you have got it all rinsed out.Then you are done. That's it. No more muss, fuss, or mess.It does say to use it once a week. I find once a month is plenty for us, but that would depend on coffeemaker usage. Fabulous product.

I LOVE this waffle iron.  I HATE belgian waffles with the deeper pockets and this cooks waffles just like mom used to make, so to say.  The plates wash easily in the dishwasher and are very durable.I recommend using plenty of Pam to make sure you don't get a waffle stuck to it like I did once accidentally but that was my fault for forgetting.

The Snapware 64-Ounce Square-Grip Canister is an example of good design and quality materials.  It has o-rings that seal the lid and the snap-lid that, in my uses, have not leaked liquid nor aroma.  i have tried shaking the thing with liquid in it -- nothing. Perfectly dry outside.  I have stored items that have a strong odor.  Still, nothing leaks out.  Importantly, before re-using the Snapware, I normally shake it with a bit of water and detergent, rinse and dry, after which the Snapware does not retain odors of  food-type items (I have not used it with chemical/petrolium products) and you can begin clean with something new in it.The flip-lid is extremely handy; its hinge i sturdy;  I have never cracked nor broken one; nor have I felt that they were weak. The flip lid does not leak.  The cannister is made of a very sturdy, non-flexible plastic.For storing food-grade liquids or solids, this product is tops.
summary: Study, well made, well-sealed, excellent for food storage

reviewText: If you need more than just one of these they are definitely cheaper to buy in a set.  However, I had plenty of the other sizes but always found I could use just one more of this large size.  Pyrex is great and very versatile for cooking and storage.

I finally wore out a family version of this that was over 100 years old.  It was made of stamped galvanized metal and provided a lifetime of service. Trying to find a replacement was difficult, most models now are plastic, toy type tools.  This model from HIC is very well made of stainless steel and appears to be built to last.  This tool was never intended to provide volumes of grated cheese into a recipe, it was designed to deliver grated cheese over a individual dish or serving.  Most of us, myself included, are guilty of buying bulk grated cheese, which can be full of fillers and who knows what else.  It is not cheap and the flavor is good enough to make you not think about what your missing.  Using this type of grater you can now purchase  small chunks of more expensive, but excellent hard grating cheeses like real asiago, or romano.  A small piece the size of 3-4 butter pats goes a long way in this grater.  Wrap up the remaining chunk of cheese tightly in plastic wrap and it will last a long time, in fact if you can vacuum pack it, it will be almost immortal.  How often do you reach for the grated cheese a month?  Why not enjoy the full flavor of these hardy grating cheeses in your cooking and leave the pre grated stuff for the teenagers at the local pizza joint.

As this product says, it's intended for small rooms.  When I say small, I mean about 10*15 max or so, otherwise this will have absolutely no effect on your room, or no noticeable effect.  Other than that it's easy to fill, set-up, use, and clean.

Our 12 year old model just bit the dust; works like a champ the whole time; handles being tossed in the top rack of the dishwasher just fine.  The biggest advantage is one-handed operation; and it's fun too!  They say you can use the outer container as a serving dish, but after lots of use, you'll have circular scratches that nosy mothers-in-law might point out.
Does what it is supposed to.  It has yet to fall off even with couple of soaps and a razor piled on there.  It works great.

They are nice glasses but, as everyone else has noted, the color is extremely subtle in real life.  I was hoping for a good bright color like in the picture but when I first unwrapped a glass I thought they'd sent me clear by accident.  The purple color is extremely subtle and more pink.  I'm rather disappointed.
summary: They really need to change the picture of these

reviewText: This is heavy, easy to clean and keeps my baking utensils in good order.  Price is good for what you get.

Impressed with the solid wood on all but the internal support (horizontal slats appear to be pine or other plywood) good quality finish with no blemishes.  I originally purchased this for a guest room but am reconsidering using this in the master suite.  Recommended for a  variety of situations anywhere from a kids room to college dorm to master suite if the style fits the quality is there.  Delivery was two long and narrow packages and you'll want a friend to help move,  assembly can be a one person effort however an extra set of hands didn't hurt.

When this arrived the box was so small I thought there had been a mistake.  The towel holder comes in three parts that screw together.  Easy enough to do and it looked really pretty.  However, after finishing one roll of towels I took the empty tube off and found that the screws had worked loose while I was pulling off towels.  This isn't really a problem as I was able to tighten it again.  I'm not sure if this will continue to happen after each roll or if I hadn't tightened it enough to begin with.  The towels do unravel because there is nothing to keep that from happening.  If these aren't problems for you go ahead and buy because it is  pretty and the price is good.
This is a good iron. It does the job. It makes a lot of steam and doesn't drip. Very happy with it.

Don't get caught up in all the reverance these favorable reviewers gave this product.......it is just a dust buster with a little more suction.  It is an over priced heavy difficult to manuver hand vac that runs out of juice in a hurry.  It is a mess to empty and clean the filters, which you will have to do often.  Why because if you pick up even a flower petal or a small bit of paper this machine will immediately lose suction until you remove it.  Keep looking.

I thought this would be a great glass mug for coffee, but I have some misgivings.  First, the top diameter is fairly small; I like a wider rim. (Yeh, I know, look at the picture, what did I expect?)  Second, the glass is very thin and delicate; you drop it a few inches and it is history.  On the plus side, it looks good, and it does hold hot liquids without problem.  Of course the glass gets hot, but that's what the handle is for.  There are better glass mugs on the market, so I would shop around some more unless you really just like the looks of this one.
summary: Great looking glass but also fragile

reviewText: Bought this replacement carafe to replace a Braun 12-cup carafe that dripped every time we poured from it.  This carafe is fine.  Couldn't stand the idea of buying a brand new coffee maker just because the carafe dripped.
summary: replaced carafe instead of coffee maker

reviewText: I haven't used this yet, and this will be my first experience with a stoneware baking pan. I will update this review as I used it. Right now it's five stars because I haven't used it and because it doesn't have any damage and arrived on time.
summary: Looks good, arrived on time not damaged

reviewText: I have several of these in various sizes and the match or exceed anything else I have ever used at any price
summary: Best money you cn spend on a kitchen knife

reviewText: I have large persian carpets on wood floors. The vac makes a horrible sound and basically does not allow me to go even 5 feet without this horrible loud sound. At first I thought something is wrong with the machine, which it is, but they call it a "feature". The loud noice is a "feature" that is actually letting you know that you should not be keeping this machine.Even on wall to wall carpeting, it makes this loud rattling sound if there is a slight change in level. A $500 vac should be able to clean without making a racket.The vac is also not as quiet as everyone here is touting. Tad quieter but nothing that makes you go ah! The plastic housing does seem cheap looking also. I am returning it.
summary: Do not buy if you have area carpets on wood floors

reviewText: I love this heater. It's so cute and so quiet. It sits perfectly under my desk and keep my toes toasty but the heat definitely rises.
Bought this to measure out weights for making Macarons.  Works very well and the metal finish looks nice too.  Recommended.
Used them before and liked the results, so I ordered them again.  Hope they work as they did before.  Easy to use.
Don't know about the others who had any problems here but the thing works fine for me!
I purchased this for my fiance's birthday.  We noticed that after we washed this for the first time, the markings had started to rub off.  A measuring cup with no markings is pretty useless.
These hooks are awesome. They stick great, they don't mess up your walls. You can buy replacement sticky backs so you can use them over and over. These are great.

I LOVE these ice cube trays and think they would make wonderful housewarming, advanced student, or bridal gifts. A member of my family has Reynaulds which impacts her ability to use her hands. These are IDEAL for helping. The trays are wide instead of long, so be warned they take more side to side space than I am used to. I did not find them stackable, but the ease of use more than makes up for that. They take some getting used to, as I found I had to balance a tray on my hand to get it to the fridge. If you have baking aides such as casserole or cup cake dishes made out of the new bendable types of food grade materials, then the change will not be hard for you at all. I will experiment more with the water levels of the trays to see if stackability improves, but am currently placing frozen trays over top of unfrozen in the opposite direction to conserve freezer space. I will update if changing levels proves to help.
Great for items like onions and carrots or really any kind of sturdy fruit or vegetable. However, if you are looking to cut foods with a softer consistency you may consider alternative products
summary: Cheap and effective but hard to clean

reviewText: Very handy!  I bought this based on the recommendation from Cook's Illustrated.  The plastic feels sturdy and the non-slip pad is great.  It really does make it easier to frost a cake!
summary: Makes it easier to frost a cake

reviewText: I got one because my sister got one.  She loves hers too.  It is heavy so the dogs cannot knock it down.  It takes about 20 minutes to heat up. The dogs do not get burned if they bump into it.
It works okay, and does what I wanted, vaccum wood floors, however cord could be longer, and it is so small that it turns over easily when vaccumming.
Nice decanter, plastic is a little tacky, but I like the fact that this is glass, not crystal with lead.

Did my research and went with this due to the review on Consumer Reports.We have a modern home with cement floors and lots of black wooden stairs.  Toss in a long haired white cat and we have a setup for the impossible... Clean stairs.  This vac is the perfect solution for "Oh-no we are having guests" or "It needs cleaning but I'm spent".  The light weight and great suction make for a simple cleaning solution of three flights of black stairs...  All the white cat hair and other things are gone.  It will not replace a damp cloth solution but that's not the point.The added bonus was the beater brush for use in the car!  This thing is gong to save me lots of quarters!  No more quarters needed at the carwash!The only thing that could make this better is if it were not bag-less.  I LOATH bag-less vacs because they are so filthy to empty.  I would never empty this thing inside!  Then comes the environmental impact of bags...  I suppose it's best this thing is bag-less and that's why it gets five-stars.

I purchased this after becoming concerned over the increasing cost of compressed air cans.  I'm very happy with my purchase.  It has a very powerful blast of air that easily cleans out the nooks and crannies of a computer case.  It also has a variety of tools that are useful.  You can also use it for things other than computers.
I was looking for a product that I could see the contents, have a good seal and be space saving. I got all three with this product.

Those chair-pad are beautiful, but they are very thick. I was hesitating between 3 and 4 stars, it s more like a 3.5. Luckely i did nt buy them for chairs but for my entry bench, so it s all-right because it s kind of more for decoration . But even tho...less thick would have been much much better.

I have been wanting one of these forever, but just never got around to buying one.  This one works great and it is so convenient to have soft butter on the counter to spread or whip into a recipe.I like that this is white, it matches my table and my kitchen which are two different color pallets.  Make sure you do not fill the butter past the top and don't add too much water or you would have a mess.  Be aware that there is a bit of water that drips from this because it is sitting in water, I know that sounds silly to note, but just make sure you hold it over the crock when you lift and use it.The crock and top are smooth glazed porceline, but the top ring around the handle is not glazed.  We have had it for just a week and it has already absorbed some color from people's hands, kind of icky -- wish it was all glazed.

What can you say, it covers a tissue box.  Only thing I do not like is that all it does is cover the sides and top, the bottom of the box slides around so I had to put some shelf liner on the bottom so that it would not move around.  What happen to the type the entire box  went into?

Over the years, my mom has owned probably 10 different pasta makers and I've owned 3 additional pasta makers of my own.  There's a couple of things that can really be frustrating:  1) If the handle falls out a lot.  2) If the clamp doesn't clamp the machine onto the table tight enough. and 3) If the noodle cutter doesn't cut well.  Any of those three can make for a really frustrating experience.The problem with this machine is #1: the handle falls out a lot. The machine is very lightweight and doesn't feel as if it's made that well and the thickness adjusting knob feels flimsy.  But, you have to think about the price you're paying and so I understand that.  It's reasonable quality for the price.  BUT, the handle doesn't go in all the way on the roller (as far as it should).  It only went in about half way on the roller part.  And it went in far enough on the angel hair cutter, but not on the fettucine cutter.  So, this pasta maker would be really frustrating--because the majority of your turning is the rolling part--making the dough thinner and thinner.My recommendation is that if you're looking for a good pasta maker that won't frustrate you, then I think you'd be wise to choose a different one.  I do know that sometimes there are quality control issues with things and perhaps mine is just defective.  So, please read the other reviews to see what the general experience with this pasta maker is.
I am very dependent on my salad spinner.  Since it is salad season I use mine everyday and love it.  Cooks Illustrated recommends this spinner and I trust them for any kitchen gadget I ever need.

I just received my Nordicware popper, and popped my first batch of corn.  How good was it?  So good I immediately ordered another one for my daughter and her family!  I used about 1/4 cup of corn, no oil or other additions, and set timer for 2 minutes (I have a 1300 watt oven).  Timing was perfect and so was the popcorn--nice and fluffy, lots of real corn taste, and as low calorie as you can get with a snack.  What's not to love???

Time will tell if the mattress cover remains in good condition after repeated washing.  But, my first impressions are definitely favorable.  Like everyone else says, even though it's waterproof, it doesn't make crinkling sounds when you roll over.
They last a long time too!I used them for mixing ingredients, washing fruit, or eating out of!They're very versatile and they're sturdy!
summary: I've bought a lot of pyrex bowls; they great

reviewerName: david l. poremba "the past in review"
reviewText: My wife is a quilter - that said, she is using an iron practically everyday and is a little particular about her irons.This Rowenta is a bit on the heavy side, which is a good thing as it irons the fabric without much pressure; it has an electronic shut off; the tip is perfect for getting into the tough spots; it gives out the desired amount of steam; the steam is not that adjustable; the power cord stays out of the way.All in all, a tool that does the job - time ill tell for how long...

I've had this fan for 2 years or so and I use it during the summer months. It's not too loud and still works fine after 2 years. It's a tower fan so doesn't generate as much air flow as a box fan so don't expect it to cool a large room. The only other down side is the lack of timer controls, so I just leave it on throughout the night.
I bought this to hold cake pops for a baby shower. I have used it a couple times since then and it works great. I would recommend it for an easy cake pops stand instead of making your own.
I received the scales in a timely manner. I use this product everyday. It's fast and accurate, makes life in the kitchen much easier.
Very pretty! This will be great for buffets to serve rice, couscous or corn. Sturdy, long handle, beautifully polished and definitely a conversation piece.

I spent the extra money to get these 3M bags for storing my queen size mattress. What a waste.-These BARELY fit my queen size mattress. There was only about 1 inch of overlap. I have a 17" deep mattress. These are supposed to even fit a king. Good luck.-Bags are not air tight. I sealed up the bag and sucked out all the air with a vacuum cleaner. I could hear the air seeping back in on the side where it was factory heat sealed...not where I had taped it up.-Despite what other reviews say, these bags DO rip easily. My ring snagged the bag and ripped it wide open. The bag is not sufficient for lifting the mattress, it will also rip open.I just want a nice THICK mattress bag that I can store my mattress in for a few years. Why is that so hard to find?

I was thrilled to find this product, as it both stores and measures long pasta. It is very similar to my old favorite spaghetti measuring containers which were made by Rubbermaid but are no longer sold. The "be careful" part is that the measuring top came off the first time I was trying to pour out a serving. The measuring top came off and all the spaghetti poured out all over my kitchen counter! When initially loading the container, I had pushed the measuring top firmly down into the container until it "clicked" and I don't see how/where it could be further locked into the container. If the seller reads this and can advise me, I would love to be given any tips.The service/delivery time was excellent.
summary: Great for storing spaghetti but be careful

reviewText: I live in Las Vegas, the dust capital of the world, and I hate all the dust. So I thought I'd try this little Hoover Windtunnel Air Bagless Upright.I went over my living room and office carpet with the Bissell and then went over the exact same area with the Hoover Windtunnel and was very surprised at how much more the Hoover picked up.Bill in Las Vegas<><

This has become a staple in our kitchen, used on everything from flank steak to pork chops.Why I love this:1. Works for all ages and levels of cooking expertise. Safe to use.2  Very, very easy to use. Simply press down on the top and the sharp blades cut through the toughest sinews of your particular cut of meat. It takes very little energy to press down on this, so even eldery cooks or those with arthritis could handle this.3. Allows MAXIMUM penetration of tenderizers. No other tenderizer has done as well.4. The best tenderizer I've used.5. Easy to store, wit a protective cover to prevent any accidental cuts or harm from the blade.6. Allows you to save money, making less tender cuts of meat come out as tender as more expensive ones.Now, a personal opinion. If you ARE going to tenderize your meat, please avoid adding salt to your marinade if you can avoid it. I think it draws out the juices and makes for a less flavorful and tender cut of meat. If you want your meat to be salty, just add it after your first bite, adjusting to your taste.Also, please let the meat rest for a good 5 minutes after you take it from the oven. If you cut it before then, you may have one good slice of meat (the first one) but the juices will flow out and the rest of the pieces will be less tender. So let the meat sit and let the juices settle a bit. You'll be glad you did.
summary: So simple to use and the results are incredible

reviewText: This is just one high end, overpriced, ice cream scoop. Although I love it because it looks so much better than a regular ice cream scoop. It has a good weight to it and fits well in the hand. I have a lot of Rösle kitchen utensils and this further adds to the collection. Highly recommended for the professional chef's kitchen! :)

Daily use for months now without a problem.  It works great on apples and pears, cuts them to 8 equal pieces.  The blade side on mine is really sharp, best cleaned with a dish brush (I've cut myself a couple of times on it.)  Can't say I'd recommend letting the kids use it.  The only criticism I have is sometimes it's hard to remove the core at the center, but otherwise it works really well.  In response to one of the other reviews: you should check to see if the stem and the flower end line up to minimize capturing some of the core in your slices.  This is especially true if your fruit is somewhat odd shaped--you may have to line up your stroke.

I purchased a set of these straws for my mom in an attempt to stop her habit of having literally hundreds of plastic straws in draws waiting for her to use and throw away several times a day. Not sure if it worked, but I bought myself a set too and absolutely love them. We use them everyday with our smoothies and clean up is a breeze. I just rinse them in warm soapy water and run a pipe cleaner through them and I'm done. We have used them mostly with cold drinks and have not had any problem with the straw getting too cold. They look great and the detail of the rings around the bend makes these straws fantastic. I looked at glass straws as well but I'm too afraid they could chip or break in a glass cup. I think these stainless straws are great and should be added to everyones silverware collection.

I hate eating big slices of apples for some reason, but I love teh ease of slicing an apple up with these type of slicers.  This one is perfect because it cuts the apple into 16 slices vs the typically 8 you see.  Love it!
This set is excellent for the price. Has every type of scraping, scooping, and serving dimension all in one set. You can even use them for cooking. Does not feel like cheap plastic that will break.

I just gifted this to my husband, we haven't used it yet. Just a note though on the color. I have the teal and it is super kitschy, barbie doll pastel turquoise. Not having seen this in real life I thought it would be metallic. It is beautiful, but considering it is for a man not the color I would have picked off the shelf :)
I love Ateco products, but the largest of these cutters arrived broken at the seam and I can't even use it.  Very disappointing.

I just got this yesterday. It took less than 4 hours to fully charge the battery. This vacuum ROCKS! It made very quick work of my hardwood floors that are constantly covered with dog hair. It was very easy to manuever and deceptively powerful. It gets in the corners fairly well, as well as any vacuum I've seen. Definitely worth the purchase, and I LOVE not having a cord!
summary: Awesome for hardwoods and dog hair

reviewText: We thought we'd give buying furniture a try.  Not a good idea, the chair is made for a person well under 6 feet, is very narrow and the quality is truly sub-par.
summary: Too small, too flimsy poor quality

reviewText: I was completely excited about the arrival of the OGGI Marilyn cocktail shaker, as it had been "temporarily out of stock" for several months preceding its arrival.  If it only worked as good as it looked.  Seemed like a solid design, but the major design flaw is that liquid does escape while shaking it.  If you get nothing else right with the design of a cocktail shaker, the cocktail MUST remain in the shaker until you are ready to pour it.  Had very high hopes.  Gets 1 star for execution.
summary: Looked great but looks are deceiving!

reviewText: A friend had this in their house to cleanup some pet hair on a couch. I was really impressed with the suction power so I picked one up for myself. I am so glad that I did, as this sucker works great. As others have stated, the motor is a bit loud. But it's a trade off I don't mind having when the vacuum works this well.
summary: Powerful, Great Vacuum Even If You Don't Have Pets

reviewText: My mom is working on cooking healthier and using new Mediterranean recipes that requires specific oil and vinegars.  She said these containers help her more easily pour while she's cooking.  I would recommend this purchase to a friend.

These thermoses are great for sending warm food in lunchboxes.  It keeps food warm with no spilling whatsoever.  They are easy to open, which is important for kids.  Also it is easy to open AND close again, so if the kiddos don't finish their food, you don't end up with soup all over the lunch box.  These are on the small side, but not overly tiny.  I use these for elemetary school aged girls.  They would work for kids through middle school, I think.  The only issue I have is that i do not believe this is dishwasher safe, unlike other thermos products.  These are a good buy and very durable.
summary: Good quality, wish this was dishwasher safe

reviewText: I love wrought iron and this looks great on my stove.  It keeps the stove cleaner and easier to take care of.

When I realized I absolutely had to put down liner on some cabinet, visions of pulling backing off self-adhesive liner and then gluing it down without bunching, all while standing on stepladder with my head and shoulders inside a wall cabinet came to mind.  My hands aren't as flexible as they were, and I could see disaster looming in the attempt to use any adhesive liner.  I found (thank you Amazon, for an excellent search function!) and bought the Plast-O-Mat liner.  It took me maybe 1/2 hour to install it on the two shelves most in need, and that includes the measuring, trimming the width and making cut-outs for vertical posts.  The material is absolutely cooperative and very nice to handle.  Now a job I've been dreading is done, and I have lift-out liners I can clean easily!  I think it's great!

I LOVE this thing.  It holds ice for hours and hours, which keeps my water cold and pleasant to drink.  As a bikram yogi, I need something that will stay cold and refreshing while I'm exercising in 103 degrees.  THIS does the trick.  I will be ordering another one soon just so I have two.  :)
These are heavy duty and a great size. They look very nice without feeling cheap. The multi colors are great for gatherings so you don't confuse your drink with everyone elses.

This can opener makes nice clean cuts on some wide cans without any jagged edges. But I have a lot of other cans that it won't open like my stock of Edens Organic Beans. I turn to a cheap model for that.
Great price, regular coffee filters. Shipping was fast and easy. A lot cheaper than the other brand that sells 40 in a pack. I should have enough for a year with this purchase
Much easier than boiling in a pot. Fast and simple to use! Most of all, it works!No egg on your face with this little gadjet, just in your mouth!

I bought the South Shore desk (the one with handles that matches this dresser) and it had a ton of parts, so I knew this would be the same way. Assembly went fine until it tells you to screw the tracks on to the drawers - it says you don't need power tools, but I definitely did. They didn't want to go in. Once everything was put together, the drawers are a very, very tight fit. Not a fan.. after this lease is up I'll probably toss the dresser. Because of the tight fitting drawers, it's very likely to tip over. I can't screw mine to the wall because of the trim on the bottom of my walls.
Otherwise, it's not really made well. One of those impulse buys when I was on a protein drink diet.  Oh well.
summary: If you're on the go....this is good.

reviewText: I've been using these Kuhn Rikon peelers for many years.  I can't find any other brand that peels potato as easy and fast as this.  I also bought extra to share with my mother-in-law and converted her. :-)
I usually use an air popper but the mini popcorn kernels blow right out of that.  I had one of these for years and gave it away and had a hard time finding another.  It works great.  I love it.

I've had this machine for one week and even though I had never used one before found myself making the most delicous cappuccino's and lattes you can imagine. The machine feels solid. The top is stainless steel and is wonderful for warming your cups. The frother does an amazing job. It is low to the counter as some have said, so I found a beautiful ceramic cake stand and set my machine on top of it. Problem solved. It looks nice and I store extra cups under it. It makes it so much easier to froth milk. I think the built in tamper works just fine because I have managed to make the most beautiful and great tasting espresso ever. The removable water container is easy to use. It's true that you don't have to wait long for it to warm up. The instructions say 30 minutes but that's not necessary. I turn it on and in 5 minutes or less I have a great cup of espresso. I do put hot water in my cup first to warm it and then pour it out before I set it under the machine. A friend of mine who had both a steam driven machine and this one told me to get this one hands down. I'm glad I did. The price is amazing and so are the espresso's, cappuccino's and lattes I've already made.
summary: Perfect Espresso and Cappuccino at a budget price

reviewText: This cooker is just the right size for six medium pancakes which cook just right. I have not used for any other meals but based on other reviews I don't believe you will be disappointed. Great price!

I have been looking for a great set of cobalt blue glasses for a while, and finally I found these and couldn't be happier. They perfectly match the cobalt wine glasses and vase that I already had, so it looks great on my Shabbos table.For some reason most cobalt glasses I kept finding were just too tall to fit in the dish washer, which I did not want. These thankfully fit perfectly, which just makes watching them so much easier.They also are very thick so they don't appear to be cheaply made even though the price is pretty cheap.

Very disappointed to find all 6 hooks on the carousel were completely sheared off when it arrived. There was absolutely no cushioning in the product box and not enough bubble packaging to fill the space between it and the outer shipping box, so it seems the product took a pretty good beating on its way to me. The utensils look to be good quality, and the colors are FUN! Trying to decide whether I should re-order because I know my daughter would really love this set, but based on the packaging materials, I doubt it would be worth it.
summary: Would be 5 Stars - Except it Arrived Broken

reviewText: I've bought Tenergy batteries before and, my experience is, they don't hold charge very well after a few months of use. They're great during the first few months but useless after that. Check the All-battery forum and you'll find a ton of users with similar experience. This 12-pack C batteries is no different since it uses the same Tenergy batteries. I don't know why this company keeps churning out this low-quality batteries when it surely must be capable of producing better ones. I wish Eneloop NiMH batteries are available in C size.

We bought this for the playroom in the basement.  The room is about 21 by 13.  This little guy did a pretty decent job warming up most of it.It doesn't feel hot to the touch, but I would obviously never leave it unattended with the kids around.  We also like that you cannot hear it when it's working - a definite plus!
Clean and easy way to make popcorn without all the fuss and mess.  No splattering and self contained.  I think the popcorn tastes better when making it this way.

reviewerName: Gretchen H. "Enjoying life one strange moment...
reviewText: I've gone about as low end with this espresso maker as you can go. I don't use a special tamper, I don't use a special frother cup nor demitasse cups. I load up my coffee ground holder thing, press it up against the tamper and squeeze it together with my hand to get it packed in and then let it trickle into a small bowl which is then poured into my coffee cup. I also use another mug for frothing.I warned you! I did not add embellishments.But it works! The coffee comes out tasty but I'm always sad because I want more but then I have to go through the whole rigamarole of making a new cup. Ah well.Let me start with the cons:• We don't always tap out the grounds right after we make a cup so that means they can get kinda solid. You'd think this would make it easier to empty but some days I am knocking that thing so hard I might as well be trying to smash a hole into my wall. Seriously. I might go in thinking I want an innocent cup of coffee and instead I end up red in the face with my blood pressure rising dangerously close to Krakatoa.• Boy does it vibrate. It sounds like a little motor boat and whatever you have trying to catch the coffee will attempt to creep away from you. I've put a rubber band under my little bowl before to keep it in place.• Milk frother likes to dripPros:• It makes espresso• It's compact•Super easy to clean the drip pan• It makes espresso

We have one set of these already, but love them so much, we got another set. These work really well for muffins and cupcakes. They're sturdy, and can stand up on their own. They can take plenty of heat, but they can also go into the freezer without a problem. Getting even still warm muffins or cupcakes out of these is no problem at all. Clean up is easy...whatever you've put in these comes right off without any scrubbing. They easily go into the dishwasher, even when you don't have a whole lot of room, they're so flexible, they fit just about anywhere. Then, they bounce back to their original shape with no problem. I also like the fact that you're not using up a lot of paper cupcake cups, so, they're environmentally friendly, too!

Bought first one, worked great for about 3 weeks, looked good.  I really liked the soft heat without a fan.  It stopped working properly, thermostat wouldn't go past the minimum setting.  I exchanged it for another.  Second one lasted 3 days and stopped working.  I will not buy anything from this mfr. again.DeLonghi HR715 Retro Convection Heater

It is very easy to use and clean.  However, it does not fit very well into my Frieling Clio.  The filter is too wide, so it sits too high in the Clio, and it wobbles around in there.  That allows the water to flow through too quickly, within seconds.  As a result, I have to use a great deal more coffee in order to get the cup I want, and it still is not the extraction I want.  It fit a little better after I removed the handle, but it still is fairly loose in there.  I may have to look into other filters or a french press.A good deal of "sludge" will get through, as well.  I don't mind that.  I really don't.  In fact, I somewhat like it.  However, if you do not want it, then you probably ought to look into cloth filters.  I do tend to go with a fairly fine grind, so that exacerbates the sludge.The ad claims that the filter is "dishwasher safe."  While the filter is fairly sturdy, I question whether it will survive through many times in the dishwasher, but that is purely my speculation.  Still, I prefer to wash it by hand, which takes only a few seconds.In the end, this filter is worth a good try.  If you like it, you can't beat the price for the quality you get.  If you don't like it, you ain't out but a few bucks (so long as they continue to offer this under $5).

I was specifically looking measuring spoons that had the measurements imprinted and not just painted on. I wanted stainless steel because I knew they would last longer. They were such an amazing value, I am very pleased. I think these will last me a long time.I also love that they are magnetic and all stay together in my drawer!Great buy!!!!

I live in a tiny house with limited counter and cabinet space, so a mug holder saves a lot of space for me.IT works pretty nice and does a good job at holding mugs.  At first I was concerned that it would be flimsy, but once I put it on the wall it felt much sturdier.  I am still debating if I should put a couple of nails right through it and literally nail it to my wall, just in case.  But I don't think it is necessary.
Finally a measuring cup that's large enough for my family of 5. And because it's pyrex I can put in the microwave, didhwasher.  I love it

The clear plastic hip handles can be a space hindrance if you have limited space in a hardsided briefcase.Also, I have trouble remembering which pieces go in the microwave - obviously not the steel sleeve, but how about the cap?  Manufacturer should make things more foolproof by embossing or engraving instructions right on the part.Otherwise, food stays HOT for 6 to 8 hours.
summary: The clear plastic hip handles can be a space hindrance

reviewText: A really nice looking little butter dish for the price. Feels heavy and durable. Looks expensive.  After I bought this, I purchased salt/pepper shakers of the same brand.
This is a great knife sharpener.  Easy to use and does a great job of honing the knife to a perfect edge.

Since there were so many more good reviews than bad, and the worse reviews were a few years old, I took a chance with this kettle. I'm thinking that the problems first mentioned in the bad reviews have been taken care of. I own an inexpensive Aroma brand yogurt maker that has been in constant use every week for several years now and had been marvelous, so I thought I would go for their electric kettle as well. It is my first electric kettle, so I didn't want to spend too much money to figure out what worked best for me. I'm very pleased with this purchase.Of all the things mentioned that were potentially bad about this Aroma Kettle, the only one we have noticed is the noise. It IS loud when heating up, but for me it's a good thing, because I often forget to plug it in and no noise is my indicator that I need to get over there and do it. It's not loud enough to wake up the grand baby, but it makes the dogs perk up from a sleep and I can hear it from two rooms away. Like I said, this is a plus for me because I usually set it up and leave the room.I have some nasty arthritis and this kettle being so light is a real plus and I don't look at it as a sign of cheapness. It is built solid, doesn't drip when pouring. The lid stays attached but opens all the way and has a catch that holds it open instead of flopping closed on you. It can't be filled from the fridge water dispenser, but I never use that anyway, (we keep open water jugs that have out-gassed of chlorine for coffee, tea, plants and doggies). I leave the lid open so it can dry out after use and have seen no rust.The water level indicator is located behind the handle and isn't that easy to see, but really, who cares. If it's that important you can see it or use a measuring cup. The handle is very comfortable for my arthritic hands and wrists, and placed well for balance.I wish it had a longer cord, but it seems that none of them do. The cord length is 29" and can be shortened by wrapping it in the underside of the base to the desired shorter length so you don't have excess cord on your counter.There are some very expensive electric kettles out there and I am sure they are wonderful, but this Aroma Kettle is perfect for our use. It will get a real work out here, as we are a small inn, so I'll report back if I change my mind about this product in the future.

I  am so surprised at the positive ratings for this thing. I was so excited to get this, and immediately put it together, and put some frozen strawberries in. The result: it was extremely loud and obnoxious and I got a small slush residue and then it wouldn't work at all. I guess I have to fork over an extra $30 and get the Yonanas!
This item when expanded all the way is a good height from floor to reach.  You don't have to bend down to grab anything on the top rack.  Bought this for a standing shower and it fits well.
OMG this is GREAT.  OXO is the best - high quality!  And because it is dishwasher safe - just fabulous!!!!  We use it on potatos and veges.  Love it!!!

The machine worked really well for about 2 months, and then it stopped producing forma. Sometimes coffee flew out perfectly, but other times it dripped a drop every couple minutes. Coffee tasted very bitter when it happened. I thought something maybe clogged, so I run diluted vinegar through the machine for a few times. It started working again for 2-3 months, and then it stopped steaming. Steam came on for couple seconds and then nothing. I tried to warm it up longer, run diluted vinegar again, but nothing worked. The steam sometime came on miraculously, so I can get my frosted milk. Otherwise I will have to warm up the milk in the microwave. On top of that, the coffee tasted awful. So I started going to Starbucks again, and only once a while I try the machine again in hope that another miracle would happen. Now the machine is out of warranty. I don't think Delonghi could do anything anyway, and their service response is very slow. I waited 3 months for a water tank replacement. I don't know if I should be happy with the purchase for the perfect 2 months experience of home-made espresso.

Well I certainly have to give this little zester top ratings all the way around.  I own five or six various zesters, some good, some bad and some that I would not even give my sister who we try to keep sharp things away from; she has mastered the toaster and is able to open soda cans, but that is about it.  Just a tip:  just because someone is an MBA, dose not mean they can function in the real world.  Anyway, I digress...  This little thing is by far the best I own and the best I have ever used; and I have used a bunch of different models.This grater is easy on the hand and even after a couple of hours of steady use, I do not seem to get stiff and tired as I do with others.  The handle is perfectly molded and fits my hand perfectly.  I use mine for lemon, oranges and hard cheeses that need grating.  This works perfectly every time.  If you have ever had to spend zesting fruit for a large meal (like as in feeding 30 or 40 people) and spent hours doing so, you will find that this zester will cut your work time to fractions.There are several things to note about this instrument.  First, never every put it in the dishwasher.  It will dull the grating surface.  I use a heavy stream of very hot water and rinse, rinse, rinse. The hot water helps in the drying process.  Never put this thing away wet or damp...you are just asking for trouble.  This item comes with a protective slip cover and you should use it as if you let the zester bang around with other stuff in y our drawers, it will dull it.  And this is important...BE CAREFUL!  This is an extremely sharp instrument and you can take a pound our two of skin off in a blink of the eye.  Slow and easy is best, especially at first until you get very familiar with it.I do wish I could give this zester more than five stars as it certainly deserves it.
summary: Best I have ever owned by far.  I love this thing.

reviewText: This unique high quality Bamboo Tree Forest Painting Art is nothing short of spectacular, looking much more expensive than they are. It has brighten my home. They have used superb quality artist cotton canvas.
Have owned this set of cookware for over a month and love it. My sister had a set and wanted my own so purchased it as soon as I could and have really appreciated it.

I have diabetes and very thick toenails. Before I can clip them, I used to have to soak in the tub for an hour. That's gets harder to do as I get older with arthritis. This dish pan is the remedy! I can fill it with bubble bath and sit and read while I soak my feet before grooming. It's sturdy enough to carry from bath to bedroom and is an inexpensive answer to my dilemma.
summary: Strange what I need it for, but it works!

reviewText: THIS IS AN EXCELLENT GRILL, VERY PRACTICAL FOR INDOOR AND OUTDOOR USE. LIGHT WEIGHT, EASY TO CLEAN AND TEMPERATURE CONTROL REALLY NICE. ONE OF THE BEST THAT I HAVE USED.

This is a pretty large towel, larger than I would use in a kitchen as counter cleaner because as a one handed towel, it is bulky but it is great for so many other things. It is great for drying a car, a dog or a large puddle. I put towels down when I'm doing water changes on my fish tank because I tend to make a mess. This is great for making sure I don't drip dirty fish water through to our carpet.There are also times that I like to hand scrub areas of our kitchen floor to try and get stains out of the grout. This is great for sopping up the water as I scrub and takes a lot of abuse and dirty water before it gets too saturated.The best thing is that it washes up really nicely and is ready to tackle the next job. Make sure NOT to use fabric softener when washing it.I was provided a sample for evaluation and review.
summary: High Quality, Very Large, Great for BIG Messes or Drying Up

reviewText: If I need boiled eggs for a recipe, I dread the boiling, timing, and wondering if they will peel nicely.  Often they don't, even though I follow the usual rules.With my Nordic Ware Egg Cooker, it's easy.  I just do it in my Microwave and leave my burners for other things.  If I want a soft boiled egg, it's all in the timing.  Eggs peel with ease because the eggs actually are steam cooked.  Eggs don't stick to the shell.  No more guessing or messed up eggs.  They cook in less time than the old fashioned boiling way, saving me time.  Making an egg sandwich is no longer the chore, but simple to do.Once you get the timing with your Microwave down, you can count on it for consistency and ease.  I use more eggs now in our healthy diet, sometimes just for garnishment because of my Nordic Ware Egg Cooker.  You will love saving time with it.lajammer
summary: Let the Microwave do the work boiling eggs

reviewText: These brushes a great.  I bought two so my partner could help me clean veggies!  I do a big wash once a week after a trip to the store.  I liked this brush so much I just ordered my second.
This is the best duvet insert I have ever purchased...not too thin and not too thick. Can definitely be used year around. Very soft and well made.

This K-cup coffee pod drawer unit was carefully packed and arrived with no defects.  The rounded corners of the glass were protected by four carefully-applied plastic bands that were removed with ease. The smokey-colored glass is thick and of good quality, and the drawer glides smoothly.The four legs are stainless steel and are about 3-1/2" tall; my single-cup Keurig unit stands roughly 11" tall.  Overall, when the two are stacked the dimensions are (roughly):  14-1/2" tall, 14-3/4" wide, and 16-1/4" deep (measurements are not exact).  There is plenty of extra room on the glass to place cups and saucers, cream and sugar.Our counter top had been cluttered with K-cup boxes so it was nice to do away with those and load the little cups into the drawer, which accommodates 36.  The smart-looking black Keurig unit sets atop this lovely, thick glass coffee drawer which helps keep a tidy kitchen.  Everything I need to make a nice cuppa is in one handy spot, and life is good.I do recommend this coffee drawer.

I have been using this juicer now for about a month and a half with no problems.  Now, I haven't been juicing vegetables, just wheatgrass and spinach.  I use my omega for other veggies.  That said, the healthy juicer is easy to use, easy to setup and clean and and leaves dry waste coming out, so it's juicing to the max.  The DVD is nice in learning how to use it properly and the extra parts are a nice added value feature.  For the price and the value, why not try it!  I suppose an electric one would be nice, but  for a few moments of cranking, I'd rather keep it simple.  Buy this one!
summary: No problems with the little juicer that could

reviewText: This dishpan lives up to Rubbermaid's reputation. It's sturdy. I didn't buy it for dishes. But I'm positive the water won't leak out when I soak my feet in it. That's all I wanted. So, I'm well-satisfied. If I washed dishes, I'd definitely wash them in here. Grea value and fast ship!

This is a pretty simple and cool gadget that works petty well with champagne bottles. Gave several of these as gifts over the holidays and everyone was excited to get one and use it as closing champagne bottles is always a hassle. It's sleek and modern.

A lovely little coffee gizmo which makes pretty good coffee but pressing/plunging IS difficult  esp if you're making more than two espresso cups. I have to use my full body weight which is a bit ridiculous. Today, it exploded all over me...guess I pressed too hard! Also wish it was glass. BPA free or not, plastic still has lots of other harmful chemicals esp. when heated.

This item is perfect for a mom that loves to make cookies or bread in home. I mom is absolutely pleased with this goods, because gave her a help in the kitchen . Its a great purchase and Totally recommended

I hadn't change my filter, EVER in the last couple years I've had my vacuum, so I saw this while ordering the bags...by the way get those too because they are waaaaaay cheaper on here than at Wal-Mart...got this in the mail.  Popped the old one out...yick...all black.  Popped this one in...took 2 seconds.  Suction improved right away.  LOVE it.  Love my awesome vacuum!

We ordered this Immersion Hand Blender after I blew out the motor on my Wolfgang Puck immersion blender while trying to make an almond paste. I'm not sure whether this is the same manufacturer, but we suspected that it might be (though under a different brand name) because the attachments and cups look very, very similar. I discovered that I can't use my WP attachments because the motor part that attaches has a different locking mechanism, but I can interchange the lids on these with the cups and bowls I already have. That alone was worth the price, but even without it, I love this product.I use the immersion blender for soups, gravies, sauces, etc. But I think I use the mini chopper even more because it's the perfect size for small batches of onions, garlic, or whatever else needs to be chopped. The whole thing is easy to use and easy to clean and just pretty darned convenient.The speed of the motor seems just right for what I need; it's not overpowering, but I also don't feel like it's too weak to chop, blend, or mix in a timely fashion. That said, I trust it to chop nuts, but definitely won't be trying it out for almond butter this time around.
summary: Chops, Mixes, Blends, Stirs...It's the Perfect Kitchen Gadget

reviewText: It is a very powerful blender, seems well-built, well-rubberized and frighteningly fast. The motor can run a small scooter or even a drone.
Works very well.  Very sturdy and well crafted.  Probably could use any container of similar style, but this does the job.

I did not want another big item to store, and can make rice just fine on top of the stove!  But, this is perfect for 2 people... we can take it in our tiny Airstream when on the road, and I find we use it a lot at home, because it takes less watching.  I have tried steaming veggies on top of the rice, and that works great.  If I can fit in our suitcases..... it might just have to travel with us on some longer hotel trips, as I am inspired by the airline steward's comments.
I have wanted one of these and found this on Amazon. Comes with a cleaning brush and both work great. The brush makes for easy cleaning the inside of this baster.

We eat a lot of avocados, and using a knife and a spoon I have developed my own technique for cutting, slicing, smooshing, etc.. This little tool replaces 3 tools I previously used. It's very easy to use and easy to clean. It's become my favorite little kitchen tool. I have been looking at other Oxo tools to see what little wonders they have.
summary: Pardon me, i think you have my Avocado slicer?

reviewText: This is more powerful than my last immersion hand blender and I can do a lot more with it. It fine for me.
I love these! Feels fluffy, light, just enough to warm you without getting too hot. I would definitely recommend these to anyone looking for a duvet.
i can't tell that it is working except that it feels like it may be.  i leave it on 24/7 in my car.
summary: no way to measure how well it's working.

reviewText: I perfer the "screw-on" lids like these, but the larger bottoms of the Ziplock styling. Ziplock does not offer a 1-cup size, only 2-cup. So I have to use these.

This stand may have been intended for camp use, but I use cast iron in my kitchen for extra iron in my diet, and this versatile product works just as well for not only holding hot lids, but also as a trivet at home. Shame on our American companies that make cast iron for not offering something comparable that is made in the USA.
I just bought a new Hoover Tempo vacuum cleaner and these bags.  They work great!  The price is right and GoVac had them at my door in a few days. I was amazed and happy with both the bags and GoVac!
Rada Cutlery never disappoints, I have used it in my home for many years. I purchased this as a home warming gift. It's a very nice set and will last a lifetime.

First off this comes with 3 pieces.  The bottom is a beautiful heavy glass tray, the second piece a plastic divider that when placed in the glass tray becomes a 5 section tray for fruit or crudites plus a circular middle that is perfect for dips etc..  The third piece is a plastic deviled egg holder.  It holds 24 deviled eggs. Also you can place the deviled egg holder into the divider and it raises the egg tray higher.  But I don't like it like that.  I always place the plastic egg tray right into the glass tray.  I have used this several times and I love it but my 1 pet peeve is I wish the egg holder was glass and not plastic.  I think it would look nicer.

I have used this for sinus and follow cleaning rules and use only distilled water. It is still going great. I wish I had bought the face cover also, the nose is adequate, but it would be nice to have the face cover too. Wish they would sell it seperately.  This puts out about 5 minutes of steam.  I change and leave to air dry the water, so I  have never had an issue with any infections.  Works great!
summary: Bought a long time ago, still works great

reviewText: I love worthy kitchen gadgets...  This one is tops,  it really works, is a time saver,  and the results are perfect every time.  If you make a lot of pies, this is for you...
THESE TOWELS ARE WORTH THE PRICE.  THEY GET THE JOB DONE NICELY.  VERY ABSORBENT AND PLUSH.  THINK YOU WILL ENJOY THEM.
You will not be disappointed.  It is a perfect size.  It looks very attractive on the table and the cloth washes up nicely.  Very handy and so good for keeping your yummy bread warm.  A winner!

OK folks, this has got to be one of the most satisfying purchases of my life!Yes, perhaps I'm being a bit overly dramatic, but believe me, this Electric Warming Mattress Pad is phenomenal!We actually love the cold weather and purposely keep our home cool.However, the feel of cold sheets against your skin is not pleasurable in any way, shape or form!The first night we used it we were ecstatic!I turned it on "HI" 30 minutes before going to bed (as the directions suggest) and then turn it down to "LO" when we get in bed... I actually turn my side off all together.The bed is toasty warm when we get in, but it's not uncomfortably warm while we sleep -  It works beautifully!BTW, not sure what was wrong with the other reviewer's unit, but ours doesn't make a sound...
summary: Stop thinking about it and order it!

reviewText: I like this bench a lot.  I needed something for my twins to brush their teeth.  It smells HORRIBLE when it comes out of the box but it was super easy to put together.  Sturdy and heavy quality.  If you have a slick floor you might want the pads that go on the bottom but I haven't had a problem on my vinyl floor.

I usually write longer reviews but this one is pretty simple. The pots and pans are a very good deal for the money. Considering that this entire set costs what just one professional pan could cost, it's worth it. The pieces are light and strong, cook evenly, clean easily and are built well. They're about the same as the low-end Calphalon lines you see in the store but about half the price. If you're looking for a good cheap set that's a step above T-Fal, here you go.Update -  It's been a while now and they're still performing perfectly. I feel an obligation to make fun of the people that gave these a one star rating because "a magnet won't stick to them" ... Yes, they're aluminum, Einstein. And, to the other person that was upset because their electric stove discoloured the bottom....Sigh.  I guess some people will never be happy with anything. I wonder if they realize a real set of cookware can cost upwards of $1k. For 100 bucks, these are awesome. Don't expect a bmw when you're buying a toyota, know what I mean?

I bought this steamer to clean carpet and wood floors but after two times it stopped steaming, also the steam comes from the tip of the triangle and that does not help distributing the steam well. Dissapointed. Throwing it away today.
summary: Two times of use and not steaming anymore

reviewText: I've been canning like a fiend since June due to not being able to buy any condiments at a store due to corn allergies and these items have really held up to some really heavy use.
summary: Have put it to hard use

reviewText: We purchased this cooker in November 2013.  In December 2013 the plastic ring that holds the pressure release valve broke.  I phoned GoWise USA and the friendly lady on the phone knew exactly what part I was referring to and sent out a replacement that day.  I received the warrantied part a few days later and was back to cooking with it till March 2014 when the same part broke.  Another phone call to GoWise USA and they are sending out two of the rings, so I will have a spare if this happens again.We clean ours as suggested and do use it 3-4 times a week, so perhaps we are putting more wear than typical.Otherwise this is a fantastic cooker.Overall we are very pleased with the cooker and GoWise USA customer service, but be aware that you might have the same issue with the ring holding the pressure release valve.

I was buying this as a gift for my daughter-in-law and have always been leery of brands I have never heard of, especially when buying a gift, so I went with the famous Rachael Ray. We could not be happier!It is beautiful, the color is bright and shiny. The stoneware makes for even heating and cooking.It not only looks great but the design is very useful. A good solid handle on top to easily lift the lid off. A nice LARGE handle on each end to make it easy to pick up and serve from.Just a quick comment (not at all a negative) is to make sure this is the size you are looking for, it not huge. I will be back to purchase a much larger one soon, and will definitely go with Rachael Ray again.
summary: High Quality, Looks and Works Great!

reviewText: At some point a step stool, unless the base is made very wide, just can't be stable.  This one is just right.  It's the best height you can achieve with a reasonably sized base.  That's important for easy storage.  As a bonus, ours fit in between the trash and recycling bins in a slide-out drawer.
We considered bolting our frame to the wall but it hasn't been necessary, the locking wheels keep this in place very nicely and QUIETLY.
summary: Keeps our Queen sized deep box spring & pillow-top mattress in place, quietly

reviewText: Because, again, I had to move into a place with no closets I felt this was an attractive way to protect my clothing.I've been collecting clothing for over 20 years. Usually I purchase clothing that is not dated that wayI don't have any worries. I believe this product is a attractive way and protective way to keep what youare not wearing at the time, I live in a several season city, from getting dusty and sun damaged. They are attractiveand protective. That is what I was looking for.
Product arrived on time and as described.  Works well.  My Martha Stewart lids fit perfectly.  No complaints - the product met every expectation.

reviewText: The gun and kit works very well, but the spices included are just blah.  I would much rather make my own stuff than use this powdered gunk.  Nesco was even great in replacing the cylinder which cracked on the second use.  Good quality product and company.

I often use scales when cooking and dieting and I especially appreciate this scale which includes its own "slip-free" bowl to use while weighing. You can also use your own box or bowl, but this one fits so nicely (and holds 2 liters) that you will probably end up using it most of the time. It fits nicely over the scale as a cover, so you can keep it right with the scale.This is the smaller of the Smart Weigh scales and will weigh up to 2000 grams (in US terms, that is a little over 4 1/2 pounds). Since a majority of my weighing needs fall into this capacity, it is perfect in my kitchen, whether measuring fruit for canning or measuring the quantity of food I am supposed to be consuming. However, if you need something larger, Smart Weigh does offerSmart Weigh CSB5KG Cuisine Digital Scale with Removable Bowl 11lbs / 5000g x 1g - Blackwhich weighs items up to 11 pounds.It includes clear instructions - and is very simple to use. I love the ease of doing "tare weight" because you simply put the bowl (or other item) on the scale before turning it on. It automatically begins your weight at -0-. The Mode (M) allows you to quickly move between ounces and grams (as wells as ozt and dwt). Since many recipe books include the gram weight of foods, having it available is very handy.Something important is the ability to calibrate the scale if it gets out of calibration.All in all, this is not only an accurate scale but it is also easy to use and works nicely in the kitchen.I received a complimentary sample to test for my review. I am happy to report that it surpassed my expectations.
This cuts ok.. but I was a little surprised at how lightweight it is.. I am not sure how long it will last.  So far it works as advertised though

There were many canning kits I could have purchased but II choose this one because one additional item was in this kit and the price was right.  It has already gone through one canning season with no signs of wear.
Got them yesterday and had a vodka on the rock.  The glasses kept them cold for about an hour, compared to other glasses which only keeps the drink cold for an 30 minutes.  Love them.

reviewText: Yes we love this thing this Rubbermaid container is great although the top of it is a bit flimsy maybe they could make that a little more sturdy, the end broke off and it is very hard to glue and get it to stay as it flips up.

Amazing product, I just love it!!! there are so many different ediable frosted things that you can create with these tips.
Lovely mat. I love the look of it. We have a shower in our basement. The floor is concrete and this mat works perfectly with no slipping. It is much nicer to stand on than the floor.

used to crack giant blue crab claws, works well,duriable, sturdy, well made great design,large handles  are easy leverage good for the squeeze and good with arthristius hands
This is my second Snoozer Pillow; my last one wore out, but I had it for 4 years and it was just time for a new one.  Love the leg support it gives me or use it for propping me up when watching TV.

this is exactly what I needed, no more toothpicks, and guessing.  Easy to hold on to and long enough to check a large cake.  The price was right.

No dragging the device out from under the counter.  This is the main feature that I really like.  I do not like having to move the device around on the counter just to fill it.  Great product.  I wish it was available in more stores.  I had to order it on line.

Having owned "several" electric can openers prior to this purchase; please make a note of that past statement: the one I bought this Hamilton Beach to replace lasted 12 years before it broke. I was immediately disappointed with the performance of this Hamilton Beach 76606Z Smooth Touch Can Opener.  Having known the Hamilton Beach brand as one with a reputation of making great quality products, and also having owned several Hamilton Beach products over the years; my expectation was dashed on seeing how poorly designed and sloppy this can opener was, I must say it looked very cute, and that's the best I will say about it here. I first tested it with a simple can of beans (non microwavable) that I had used the old can opener to open in less than 10 seconds with its magnetic clamp holding the cut away piece cleanly. This new Hamilton Beach notwithstanding it's cuteness when put it to the test to open the "same" can of beans failed to get the job done; instead it kept spinning around and around, leaving a nice pattern on the edge of the can. I am an engineer, but I did not want to waste my time seeing what exactly was the "design" flaws, all I know it could not perform the simple task of opening a can that I bought to do. I made sure I read the manual which was not much, but it validated that I was doing everything exactly right as per the operator's expectation. That was enough to tell me that this can opener obviously was not working. I did notice that it did not have a "can puncture" mechanism that all can openers I previously owned had, but that is not a concern: my concern is that it works properly, and it did not. I re-consulted the manual and noticed where the manufacturer stated that this can opener will not open certain type of cans, such indicated to me it was a much more finicky can opener that I am accustomed to, if technological advances of any kind is made and it does not improve performance it is just a R&D fad to sell something as "new" and latest, "a can opener, is a can opener, is a can opener," it should be able to open "cans" so to speak: whether it is electric, or manually operated, it shouldn't take a rocket science degree to operate, nor should the customer be subjugated to using, chewing gum, rubber bands, and refrigerator magnets, to customized it in order to get it to work: such is totally unacceptable. It's possible that I could have gotten a lemon, but I returned this product immediately to Amazon.
summary: Hamilton Beach 76606Z Smooth Touch Can Opener, Black and Chrome

reviewText: This is a flimsy product that is made in China. The exterior gets extremely hot, and is a fire hazard. There is enough room for a packed lunch, a couple of drink cans (or bottles) and extra snacks. The lining is not terribly think so this really shouldn't be considered to be a cooler. It wont keep beer or soda cold for hours unless you include one or more freezer packs. It will however keep your non-perishable lunch from getting too warm under normal conditions.
