reviewText: I was a bit taken aback to see how lightweight this throw was, but then one of the reasons I had ordered it was the quest for something that would keep me warm without making me feel as if I were enveloped in some kind of protective gear of the kind used by scientists working with the Ebola virus.The bottom line: the light weight is deceptive. This throw is a great way to keep warm without feeling weighed down or constricted -- it's just as effective as a heavyweight faux fur throw (a Pottery Barn purchase) is and much more comfortable. The microsuede side is particularly nice; the other side feels like a light artificial fabric mix designed to imitate silk. It's not nasty, but it's not as pleasant a feel (and if you use this on your bed with this side down, it can slide off more easily.) The filling (not down) doesn't shift in use (the big negative of my down duvet) and doesn't bunch up when it's washed.The only downside for me is that even at 5'2", I would have preferred a slightly longer throw. As it is, if I stretch out for a nap, I have to choose between keeping my shoulders or my toes warm. That's the reason for the 4-star rather than 5-star rating. But right now I'm using it to compensate for the shifting down in my duvet cover; I keep the bedroom below 60 degrees at night, and pulling this up around my shoulders means I wake up comfortably warm however chilly it is outdoors. At the sale price I paid, it's a bargain and I wish I had snapped up a few more.
summary: Keeps me toasty-warm; a bit on the short side

reviewText: Winco makes good products, and this dredge is no exception.  It has a nice weight, unlike the flimsy dredges I have seen at Wal-Mart, K-mart and other local stores.  I think it will stand up to years of regular use.  In the image, the handle looks like it is very thin and could bend easily or snap off.  It isn't.  I can't imagine it bending or breaking without some serious abuse.  If I had to say something negative about this dredge, it would be about the cap.  The screw top doesn't move as easily as I would like, and almost feels as though it will cross-thread at any moment.  I wish it had a better finish on the threads.  Even so, it's not a huge problem for me, since the body is large enough to hold a lot of powdered sugar or flour so it doesn't have to be refilled very often.

This DreamFoam 8-inch memory foam mattress is great so far, it is soft enough to make sleeping on it very comfortable, and firm enough to not give the person sleeping on it any backache or sink with the person laying on it. The mattress was very soft when it was first opened. Therefore it's better to leave the mattress out for an hour or an hour and a half after opening it, in order to give the mattress time to fluff up to its full density and firmness- for best use. The cover on this mattress is also very soft to the touch, which makes me think that this mattress can be used without any additional bed sheets on it, if one so chooses. However I always use bed sheets to protect the fabric of the mattress, and hence preserve it longer. This mattress also comes with two small complementary pillows that have the same cover/design as the mattress.Overall so far this mattress is great

For me there is no downside to this great, single-serving size pan. I live alone and tend to sometimes cook more than I need. This pan is perfect for reining in my penchant for larger portions and eliminating oil and butter from many dishes I prepare.Things I especially love: you can scramble or fry an egg without any oil or butter, and, best of all, the pan is deep enough to poach an egg. And although it's called a 'one egg wonder' you can easily cook two eggs at a time.As an added bonus for me, it heats perfectly on my glass top stove and has not marred the surface in any way. If you have one of these stoves you know how important it is to have compatible cookware.It's a breeze to clean. Either machine wash, or simply dunk it in hot, soapy water, rinse and towel dry.A few things to keep in mind: (1) be careful with the heat. If you go above a medium setting (somewhere around 325 or so) eggs will stick and it does become less easy to clean. (2) Resist the temptation to scramble an egg with a metal fork (and for me it was a temptation until I ruined one of these). The best companion purchase you can make with this pan is aNorpro Nylon Mini Spatula.Finally the price is right. T-Fal is a respected brand and the construction of this pan is evidence of their high quality and standards of craftsmanship. When was the last time you saw any T-Fal product go for the six bucks this was selling for at the time of this review?

A simple jar would have done fine to can my fig preserves but since these were going to be gifted I wanted something a little less ordinary. I was very pleased with the product, both aesthetically and functionally.
Wish Amazon had sold the ten piece set. Easy to clean, doesn't burn, looks pretty. It replaced some of my pots and pans but would like to replace all. Love the white ceramic surface.
Fit great, will last a long time. Highly recommended.

reviewText: The item in the photo shows a lovely shade of purple, and the thing I got was an abrasive magenta pink. reviewText: Do you need "the ring?." These will work fine but I guess I need to pay a little more attention to detail, and ShopVac probably needs to do a better job of marking.  I ordered these filters and the foam insert after I got the part numbers off the machineI was replacing a cartridge filter on an older machine and as well as not having the foam and paper filters, it did not have the plastic mounting ring that you slide down over the paper filter to hold it in place!  The nearly identical filter package at ShopVac *does* include the plastic ring, so I just had to pay a little bit more and wait another 3 days. I could have sent this back but (a) the problem was my own fault and (b) I can use the filters eventually.To be fair, the description says that package does not include mounting ring, but I had no way to know I needed one.
This is very soft and cool on my pillow.  I have washed it and of course, being silk, did not dry it. Still it seems not as soft as before but maybe if I iron it a bit it will come back.

I grew up in a series of funky houses whose kitchens were thieir worst feature. The only visable touch of civility in the kitchens were some quality cookware and the Chemex on the stove.Later, my wife got a Chemex for both use and decoration in our own series of unremarkable kitchens.Actually, we bought one Chemex after another. Despite using those heat ring things and being careful, the allure of functional minimalistic coffee pots decreased as the cracks grew. Buying new Chemex pots every few months was not our biggest expense, but they don't give these things away and it was annoying.I got to think that in this age of advanced glass technology that it would be possible to make them so they would last forever. My take is that they are purposely made to have a limited life. I can't go along with that.I did give three stars for style, probably one too much. If I could be assured that the new Chemexes are made of durable glass, then I would assign all the stars and buy one. We really need one as our Melitta just developed its own little crack after about three years of use. Hmmm.

Outstanding quality.  I have three different brands of dishware/stemware storage collected over the years, and this is by far my favorite.  The quilted fabric is soft as can be, especially good for delicate stemware.  The interior separators are the highest quality yet.  Absolutely love the product
Love this little pan for brownies and cakes, for my family. Sometimes all of us can't be together at once and this little pan works.

Let's not beat around the bush, the InterDesign Forma Lupe Dish Drainer doesn't drain, and it is a perfect example of something that is designed "to look good" but have absolutely practical purpose. It comes in two pieces: a metal rack and hard, breakable clean drain pan.1) While the clean drain pan has indentations for the drainer rack's feet, it has no way to drain water to the sink. No holes, no lip, nothing.  Nada.  The lip is shallow and the pan fills quickly.  You have to stop everything when the water in the pan is close to the edge, manually dry the dishes in the rack, and then tip the pan into the sink. FAIL.2) While this does hold small, light weight plastic dishes, cups and glasses, its sleek low lines are unable to support glass, pottery or china.  That Pyrex baking dish? sure, if its the only thing going in the rack.  So for versatility: FAIL.3) The utensil caddy is, to quote Dorothy Parker, had me thinking "what fresh H*ll is this?"  The caddy is a molded section of the drain board pan (that doesn't drain)  with a couple side holes to allow for water to escape.  This means that your knife points, spoon handles and fork handles are in contact with water collecting from the stuff in the rack.  The idea of a dish drainer is to let the water drip off, not to have things standing in the water.  So from a logic standpoint, FAIL.4) Materials look good, but they are impractical.  The hard drain pan is shiny and clear, and if you keep it washed and dried with a soft cloth, it looks bad.  As for the rack, there is no way I would put a good china in it its hard and unforgiving basket, or on one of the rigid short cup holders. Materials: FAILI want very much to like the products that I am fortunate enough to try, but this went into the trash after trying to use it a couple times.  It is a clean design made by someone without regard for functionality, or the weight of various cooking and eating surfaces.  It comes with no instructions for its care, or an explanation of why it has no drain when it has a DRAIN BOARD as one of its main pieces, much like a washing machine with no hose to empty the washing chamber.So my one star review should be taken to mean that this is an epic fail of a product.
But you lose so much of the yogurt trying to get it out of this that it seems a little counterproductive.
I have not had a problem with these yet!  they have stayed put and no broken YET!  will update if they do end up breaking though

After some research, I ordered this griddle from Amazon. As a cooking instructor, I wanted a griddle that could not only make pancakes and hashbrowns on weekends, but go beyond and make flat breads like roti and paratha (Indian breads).I was concerned with the reviews that mentioned uneven heating etc but took the precaution and preheated the griddle to 400 degrees for about 15 minutes before proceeding. Last night I make stuffed cauliflower parathas which came out great! I was able to cook 4 breads at a time which made it a lot easier and faster than trying to use multiple pans on the cooking range. This morning, I made pancakes for my family and those came out very evenly cooked as well.Cleanup was not difficult. I knew I was going in for a large griddle, so I maneuvered it in my double sink and washed it quite easily. I will be putting this griddle to frequent use at home and in my cooking classes.About the handles popping out as some reviews mentioned, I did not experience that because I placed the griddle on top of my cooking range, so unless you were moving the griddle around, I don't see why the handles would pop loose by themselves.

After over a year of having this couch it has seen some damage. My husband put a hole in one of the boards under the cushions.... our two siberian huskies use it as their bed.... it has seen doggy drool and everything else imaginable but it is a trooper.Our couch is still comfy and looks brand new. We clean it with windex and a towel every other week or so and it cleans it like a magic eraser.We love this couch.

reviewText: The cap that gives access to the battery compartment is poorly designed and difficult to operate. The activation switch located on the same cap is an even worse design than the cap itself. The shaft operates intermitantly out of round and the operation doesn't always stop when you release the switch.Despite all these shortcomings you can get acceptable results but only as long as you use cold non-fat milk. In order to warm it you have to microwave the foam and whip it again. I'm back on the market looking for a replacement.

I have one in each room for my babies. Compact, quiet, easy to clean and keep sanitary.My main concern for the big models was that they were difficult to clean. Especially the water bin. Usually they are all strange shapes depending on the model of humidifier. I had a hello kitty one and a teddy bear one and after a while, I just didn't feel they were clean enough to keep using them. I would rinse with boiling hot water or put bleach in the bins. But how can that be good for babies?This unit is great because you can take it apart (there is only three pieces to it) and scrub the insides. Then you can run it under the faucet to rinse. It comes with a cleaning brush which is handy.Then the bottles are replaceable. I replace mine after 2 weeks of use and I rinse them every time I refill them. I'm using a 1 liter water bottle now and so that I don't have to refill so often. The 16 oz ones sometimes don't last through the night. But I don't have that problem with the 1 liter bottles.
It keeps my food from having to be turned by hand and getting hard in one spot. glad i got it.

For years I've used (and loved the juice quality from) the Omega 8003 which is a horizontal masticating juicer.  I wanted to upgrade after using the 8003 for 6 years and chose the Vert because of the larger loading chute.  There was almost as much foam as with my old Breville juicer, and the pulp content kept getting larger and larger each time I used it.  To have to pour it through a fine sieve each time was simply a nuisance.  Too much money for my needs to not be met.I returned it (thank you Amazon for your 30 guarantee) and bought the Omega 8004 which is the newer and slightly improved version of the 8003.  There is still a smaller loading chute but its worth the extra cutting to get juice that is fabulous, smooth and foam free.
summary: Unless you love pulp and foam, this is not the right juicer for you

reviewText: I was really excited about these pans after reading the reviews.  I must say I was rather dissapointed when they arrived.  They are very thin and light weight.  I have not used them yet. so will wait and see....

I've had two earlier versions of the Floormate.  They seemed to pick up the wet water better.  This model doesn't do quite the job they did on pickup.  This is wider and I do like the attachments (and the nifty storage rack) to get under things.  I have sheet vinyl throughout the house due to a wheelchair bound family member so use it daily.  Being wider has it's pro and con - faster on the big areas, but harder to get into spaces that the older version could manage. Go SLOW if you want a decent job done. Clean up with the new version is much improved and easier!  Like the easy way the dirty water container comes out and apart to empty.  Advantage is that you aren't just slopping dirty mop water around so floors feel and look really nice.  I will ALWAYS have one in my house!  Makes life easier!

This, for me is a GREAT accessory kit.  I have 12 finches and if anyone has ever had birds, they know the mess they create.  I love the birds but hate the mess.  I have a 5 foot cage that is actually attached to an upstairs banister, plus an additional large cage.  But trying to get under the wires to clean out the seeds and such is almost impossible on the attached cages.  Not anymore with these attachments.There are enough wands to make it long enough to get to where I want to get.  Also, my computer sits adjacent to the cages (I sit and watch birds all day long), but that too can be problematic.  This accessory kit has enough attachments that allow me to clean my computer well.I was thinking of getting a small vacuum cleaner with those tiny wands, but this kit was much less expensive and because of the reviews thought I'd take a chance.  Glad I did!!
Works fine. Cleans up easily. Needed it for making holiday cookies and cakes.Happy with this choice as it was priced right.
A great price; they last; they go in the dishwasher and don't break, and don't spot.My kind of idea of convenience and also look great.

This stainless steel griddle is a very good value.  I received it in good condition.  It has an aluminum encapsulated bottom which is clad in magnetic stainless steel.  This allows it to function on an induction cooktop.  The griddle has riveted handles and heats/browns uniformly with no hot spots.  The glass cover allows you to keep food warm or steam cook foods like sausage and hotdogs while simultaneously browning.  The griddle can double as a serving tray if cleaned thorougly after cooking.  It's easy to clean.  It is decently made and has a good appearance without the "arm and a leg" price of more prestigious cookware.

reviewText: We needed a couple of cutting boards and a friend recommend the Jelli boards.  I'm really glad he did.  I bought the 8 1/2 x 11 and the 11 x 14 1/2 in red. They are dishwasher safe of course and just lots more fun to use.  I will probably get one or two more, maybe in another size.

WOW!  This little guy is incredible!  Not only does it suck the yolk right up WITHOUT breaking it, it is actually really fun to use.  I do a lot of baking and i've never really been very good at separating eggs so the Yolk Hero has become my new favorite kitchen gadget.  Try it, you'll like it.

Bought this on Amazon a coup,e of years ago. Nordic Ware is THE name in Bundt pans and this is the granddaddy of Them all. I rarely purchase non-stick bakeware - sharp tools ruin them- but knew that no knives would get near this baby, so I gave it a try. Wonderful! The pan is perfectly heavy to evenly cook your cakes. The nonstick surface allows everything to release with no fuss. And since no one is allowed to use or wash this pan but me, I'm able to protect the nonstick surface to ensure years of scratch-free use. (Remember to use the right type of scrubbie for non-stick pans.) I highly recommend Nordic Ware Original Platinum!

This is a great foundation for anyone who moves a lot or anyone who needs a new foundation / box springs.Well-constructed and sturdy.  Heavy as all heck  -- assembled with ease.Works well with a Hollywood frame and a traditional mattress.I'm actually really impressed with it.  I have it in a basement room that at times can be a bit damp.  I like how it creates good airflow around the mattress.  The way it is made I also know it will not hold odor which is impressive.
summary: where was this when I lived in aparmtents

reviewText: I bought these for the hunter green in the picture. Right out of the package, it was a faded, pea green kind of green, not the rich colored green in the picture. I bought two extra pillow cases and they WERE hunter green and look very nice. So I have this dual colored look when I put them on the bed. I am really disappointed. They really do look like I bought them at GoodWill. As for feel, I've washed them a number of times and they have softened some, but still a bit starchy-hard.

We know own 8 of these glasses. The first 4 held up so well, I bought 4 more. We were gradually breaking all our glass drinking cups and I figured plastic would be the way to go. I was worried that these might get water trapped inside or get cloudy, but that's not the case. Naturally the older ones have some minor scratches from the dishwasher. Since these are everyday glasses for us, I don't care if they look perfect as long as they hold up well in use and in the dishwasher and they do!

I hadn't made homemade yogurt since the early seventies until making my first batch of Greek (and regular) yogurt with this Oster unit. It was easy to prepare and the yogurt came out perfect.I used 2% milk and 2% Fage Yogurt as starter. I boiled the milk as recommended in the manual, then set the pot in a sink half filled with cold water, and used a candy thermometer (a thermometer is NOT included with this unit) to see when the milk's temp was about 110F, at which point I added the starter.There are many, many sites on the web where people discuss homemade yogurt making, and some insist that it's better to use only a few tablespoons of starter yogurt as opposed to a whole cup (the manual recommends using a cup to 9 cups of milk). That may be so, but my first batch with this unit came out perfect even though I used an entire 7 ounce container of Fage. (I found this site particularly helpful to refer to when I was familiarizing myself with the process of making yogurt: makeyourownyogurt dot com.)The only problem I had was due to my impatience at waiting for 9 cups of milk to boil. I set the temp on my stove to medium high as it says to in the instructions, but after a half an hour of watching and occasionally stirring it with a whisk my patience ran out and I turned the heat up full blast. The milk boiled quickly after that, so quickly that it boiled over before I could stop it and I also ended up with scalded milk on the bottom of the pot. (For great ideas on how to remove scalded milk from the bottoms of stainless pots, see this site: thriftyfun dot com backslash tf569266 dot tip - sorry to write out dot and backslash but in my experience Amazon doesn't tend to allow urls.)What you do NOT get with this unit that you will need to use it as recommended in the manual is a thermometer suitable for checking the temp of boiled milk, a pot in which to boil the milk, a whisk, yogurt starter, and of course milk. What you do get is a set of containers, a strainer for converting the yogurt you make into Greek style yogurt, a unit that keeps the yogurt-in-process warm at the right temp, and a built in digital timer (and the timer is the only thing that makes this unit "digital"). One can of course buy all those things separately and many of us own timers and crock pots and other kitchen gadgets useful for making homemade yogurt, and many people of course do make homemade yogurt without using a yogurt maker (and the site I mention above, makeyourownyogurt dot com is all about making yogurt without a yogurt maker), so what this unit gives you is convenience (or not if storing the unit when it's not in use would prove to be inconvenient for you).When in use on a counter, the unit takes up about 9 1/2" x 11 1/2", which is only a little bigger than the footprint of a sheet of printer paper. It's nice looking, and the six included jars are glass with blue plastic lids. The larger container is plastic and any yogurt prepared in it is meant to be transferred to another container. The straining process is very easy and the whey that is strained out can be used in all kinds of ways and thus doesn't have to be discarded and wasted (and there are many, many sites devoted to the topic of how to use leftover whey; you can freeze leftover whey AND you can freeze the yogurt you make with the Oster Mykonos Greek Digital Yogurt Maker).Would make a great gift for someone who might not be inclined to start making their own yogurt without the help of a yogurt maker. And making your own yogurt is certainly a heck of a lot cheaper than buying yogurt in a store, especially Greek yogurt. Many people complain that most store-bought flavored yogurt contains sugar or too much sugar. I flavored some of my first batch from this unit with nothing more than stevia and cinnamon and it tasted great! Plain it was great in a smoothie and I used some of the portion I strained to make it Greek in place of sour cream to prepare guacamole.
summary: Works great; a few things you should know

reviewText: We've been using a humidifier every night for our baby since she was born in the fall.  I had a 10 year old Vicks Cool Mist Humidifier that is still reliable but I got tired of replacing the filters every month since we used it every night.My sister registered for this humidifier and we used it when we visited her.  Its very cute and I love how the mist comes out the nose.  I also like how you can see the mist unlike in our Vicks one.  So we ordered it for our baby's room.I decided to pack it up and return it after the 2nd night.  I followed all the recommendations in the manual and used filtered water. I would also empty it in the morning.  When I would put it on at night, I'd see the mist and it seemed to be working in adding moisture to the air.  But when my husband or I would check on our daughter in the middle of the night or in the morning, there was no longer any mist coming out.  I put my hand on the mister to see if it moist air was still coming out and would feel nothing, hardly even feeling air.  The manual says that it can last up to 10 hours and we never had it running that long.  Plus the tank would still have most of the water in it when it would stop misting.Maybe we just got a defective one.  We weren't paying attention to my sister's humidifier to see if it was having the same issues.  We have decided to try the Crane Drop Shape Cool Mist Humidifier based on its reviews.
summary: Returned it after using it for 2 nights

reviewText: I was a little concerned when ordering this Dutch oven because the price seem to be a little low. I was pleasantly surprised to discover that this is a well-made all in and attractive as well.  I have used this southern several times since I purchased it and each time it has performed exactly as a Dutch oven should. The enameling is is even and smooth which allows me to cook all of the dishes I have made while providing easy cleanup.  The lid fits snugly and rests on little ridges to provide in-depth space to allow steam to escape.  The knob on the lid is steel which allows  cooker to be used in the oven at high temperatures without damage to the Dutch oven. Overall, this is a great addition to the kitchen and I would recommend  it to anyone. A

These sheets get the job done. I bought these when I was just moving into my new apartment with my fiance and I had already spent so much money on moving and other new furniture, that I knew I just needed something inexpensive to get me by for a while until I could register for better sheets on my wedding registry. They are not the greatest sheets ever, and they pill up a little bit after a few washes, but if you need something cheap and quickly then these are the sheets for you.

This is a general household timer and clock. It does a nice job timing cooking and other household tasks. The alarm is loud and pleasant. I really  like how this timer performs. However, there are a couple of problems:The biggest is that it is very difficult to install the two AAA batteries. The battery door has four tiny phillips head screws holding it closed. All four have to be removed to get into the battery compartment. I had to try several small screwdrivers to find one that worked. The screws are so small, they are difficult to handle. It was an annoying task just to be able to use the timer.The second problem is that the magnets attached to the back are too weak to hold the timer on my refrigerator door. The door works fine with regular magnets, but the timer is too heavy to stick. It slides down the door.The product itself is water resistant and can be dropped without damage. It works well and the controls are large and easy to use. Now that the batteries are in, I really like this product. It would have gotten 5 stars if I didn't have to suffer so much getting the batteries in.
summary: Great timer, major problems with installing the batteries

reviewText: I bought this 'spice rack' to use for all of my nail polishes. It arrived on time without any defects and included the screws needed to mount it to the wall. It was very easy to hang and seems very sturdy! It's adorable and practical.
I bought this for the color. I have vintage Jade-ite dishes and green Depression glass in my Art Deco themed kitchen.
Bought this to add to the space theme in my son's bed room.  He loves it.  Nice picture.  Good quality.

We had used the large capacity "big box store" rice cooker for years and didn't realize what a difference technology can play in cooking rice. We eat mostly brown rice, barley and basmatti. Although this unit is compact and "only" makes three cooked cups of rice it's certainly more than ample for 4 people. NO more burning on the bottom and you can set it to cook and be ready when you get home from work at the end of the day. We have used our Zojirushi bead maker weekly for three years and know that this brand is the very best! It goes without saying that ordering from Amazon get's you the best product at a great price in lightning fast time!
summary: Rice is a whole new experience at home now

reviewerName: Amazon Customer "Gluten Free and Allergy Frie...
reviewText: Doughs: YesFondant, gunpaste: NOFor cookies and pies this is great.  The disks store with the pin so no lost rings.  The pin isn't very wide but is sturdy and well made.  I like it for cookies, pies and tarts.  As a Private Chef I often have to travel with my tools/  The lack of a handle makes this easier to pack/store.Cake decorating:  I thought it would be great for smaller fondant projects but the marking etched in the wood show up on fondant and gumpaste.

For the price it's not bad, a little on the heavy side though and took pretty long to install it alone, it seems like it will be hard to disassemble to carry out of a room. The lack of a headboard is a minus and the price of headboards is disgusting. I'll stick to the wall as my headboard for quite a while. Otherwise it's stable enough for my foam mattress.
I love this bed.  At first I though it wouldn't be so durable, but so far (3 months) it's been going strong.  It's not so bad to setup, took me about an hour.

Same as other bad reviews: Pricey yet cheaply made.  One foot snapped off at end, so couldn't even use the regular feet.  I have a brick propping it up.  Read the reviews on Target.com of this piece of carp: Target stopped carrying it because of all the complaints.  Do not kid yourself: the picture looks nice but it's cheap and won't last, assuming it even arrives intact.  There's no quality control here.
summary: Wow. Amazon really sells this junk?

reviewText: OMG! I love this garlic press. It is by far the best garlic press I've owned, except for one fatal flaw. The bottom handle is round, which is good. The top lever is a hollowed out c-curve with edges. When I pressed the garlic, on my very first use, I got my finger pinched between the two handles. The sharp edge of the top handle left a nasty mark on my finger. It hurt like hell. This product is perfect in every way, except for the handles, which is its achilles heel. Make the top handle round and blunted like the bottom and this would be a non-issue. I am impressed but frustrated.
summary: Perfect, except for one fatal flaw.

reviewText: I love the softness of it and it is easy to turn on and nice size.I haven't had a throw before and really like this one.

The product arrived on time.  The sheets are a true Olympic queen size and do fit my hard to fit mattress.  They are soft.  I washed them in cold water and the fitted sheet shrunk quite a bit so it is a very tight fit on my mattress.  They were very thin until I washed them.  The thread count is true and I ended up really liking these sheets.  I will buy them again and I will buy from this seller again.
summary: Very thin sheets...shrunk when washed in cold water

reviewText: This spatula features a metal core surrounded by silicone so it gives you the control of steel with the non-scratch of the silicone. It is a little small, but that does give you more control, especially for flipping. It's the best pancake spatula I've ever seen.
summary: A little small, but perfect for pancakes

reviewText: I've been using my 19 year old Carico juicer all this time and kick myself for not upgrading. It still worked and did its job but this juicer just takes the hassle out of it. Yes, you still have to clean it. Yes, it does take up counter space. But, it juices easier, has low and high settings, is easier to clean, is quieter, and has a larger opening to pop the food in.This juicer runs quieter than my old one and is much easier to put together. I love the suction cups at the bottom which hold it in place while juicing. My old juicer hopped around on the counter when I would juice leafy greens!Just be sure you have everything put on correctly. The first time I tried it, the cover wasn't on right and it spit pear pulp all over me. LOL!I love this appliance!
This is a great little timer at a great price - fits our needs perfectly!

I purchased a "used", I.e. repackaged version of this scale. It looks fantastic. It's nice and slim but still has enough surface area to weigh larger items.Unfortunately it wouldn't register a weight for any items lighter than about 8oz, so I had to return it.

I bought this to use in my 4-year old's pirate chest.  It was supposed to come rolled up, but it had been smooshed and bent in the middle a little bit.  I tried flattening it, but it didn't work very well.  It's not severely creased, just wrinkled a bit.  But that's ok, because it allows my kids to follow the wrinkles to roll it back up and bend it in have to fit it in the pirate chest.  Just a warning though, that it doens't flatten very well.  It has stood up very well.  We've only had it for a month but it sees play almost daily.  No fraying or tearing, and no new wrinkles.  My 2 year old has wadded it up into a ball a few times but doens't have the strength to really crease it, so it doesn't take much to smooth it back out.  The kids really have fun with it, and it's worth the money to include this in their pirate chest.

There are some good points to this timer. It has an adjustable volume that does make it loud enough to be heard, or soft enough that it is not scary.One of the selling points seems to be the splash `n' drop feature. It would have better protection if the rubber surround was a bit thicker and stuck out from the sides more to protect it when it was dropped. Frankly as for the splash, with the thin plastic coating and seams that do not seem to be sealed very well, that factor doesn't seem too promising.You need a very small Philipp's screwdriver to open the back. Unless you have one of these very small sets, you have a problem.It has a pull out stand of very flimsy plastic, which does not bode well for its longevity. You can always leave it standing vertically. The magnets that are supposed to hold it, for example to a refrigerator, slip and pretty soon my timer was near the floor.It does time from 1 second to 24 hours, so it is good for those long slow cooking items or whatever else you might want to time.My biggest complaint is that it doesn't have a clear function. If you make a mistake you have to go up or down to the number you wanted in the first place
These are cute. Not real big but gets the job done. Looks wider in the picture! I like that it matches my color theme and NOT at a huge price! Worth the $ spent!
summary: A little smaller than I expected!

reviewText: I didn't want to like it because of price, but I DO love its performance. Doesn't just stir everything up and re-dust the room like a regular fan. It's just really calm but effective at circulation cooling. I can sleep with it on - which I never could with other fans. Four stars because the controls at bottom make it harder to use the remote. I usually use my toe to push the power button on and off. VERY easy to adjust trajectory/angles.

I won't deny in saying I was excited when I first saw the product.WHAT'S INCLUDED:1. Main square container2. Glass-like Lid with a silicon gasket to snap tight on the main container to create a spill-proof lunch box3. Sauce container4. Dish container5. Fork with a thick edge on one side that acts like a pseudo-knifeConcept-wise it makes sense. Apart from the main container, they provide two more containers. A small one to house your sauce so foods don't end up getting soggy. You also have a bigger container that fits inside that acts as a separator from hot and cold foods in the same box by simply removing the container that houses the cold food before you microwave the rest.All of these in an attractively designed, BPA-free product.WHAT'S WRONG?1. You can't microwave longer than 2 minutes to prevent any part of the product from warping. Shorter times are even required for oily foods. The main container even has this 2-minute warning. Depending on the food, my lunch comes out partly hot and partly cold due to the short duration that I need to go past 2 minutes each and every time.2. The glass-like LID looks great when new. After a few uses there are scratches from normal handling. It also gets warped easily when handling warm foods that are dumped in the container then sealed. Despite the small silicon vent, a vacuum is still created and you'll have to force the lid to separate from the container at times and then find the lid in a slightly concave shape that impedes on getting a tight fit.3. Handles on the lid break easily due to a pathetic thin plastic part that holds the hinges. As you can read from the other reviews, it is a problem. The company is aware of the defect and has quietly launched a replacement lid program. You will have to take the initiative to contact Black + Blum's customer support so they provide you with the link to register for the replacement lid. This is poor customer service rather than an announcement from their home page. As of this writing at least no open announcement has been done on their website or found on their FAQ section at least.4. The plastic fork that acts like a pseudo-knife, just like the poorly designed lid, can't handle any cutting work other than already easy to separate foods like salads, fruits, vegetables and sushi. Any plastic fork can do that job. What I need is a tougher manufactured fork as mine is pretty scratched up as well with just less than 2 months of daily use.5. The two containers when used at the same time pretty much occupies the whole main container and nothing else can pretty much fit. So when I need to use a container, I only use one of these so I can fit more of my main food item. Otherwise, I don't use the containers at all.CONCLUSION:Although customer response is quick to provide an answer by simply giving me the link to register, I'm not impressed with the overall performance of the product. It looks good on paper, but not really impressive for daily use. The original hinges have snapped which brought me back to my trusty old Ziplock containers that have taken abuse and is still going strong.I'm still waiting for the replacement lid which they confirmed to have processed and will be shipping soon. The hinges are now soft so they don't break and snap apart.After this experience with the product, I'm staying away from Black + Blum products. Sure they can create wonderfully designed products, but until they can build quality into it as well their just turning customers away in the process.This review will be updated once I receive the replacement lid.
summary: Good Concept, Poor Execution and Build Quality

reviewText: I think it's aluminum, so it bends a little.  But it works great and creates the classic bundt shape.  I use it often because it makes a pretty presentation of a cake (or whatever you want to make) without having to cover it with frosting.  It also works well as a jello-mold, by immersing the outside in warm water for a couple of minutes after the jello sets and then turning it out.  The paint on the outside scrapes off with moderate wear against the oven racks.
summary: Works great, could be more durable.

reviewerName: Jillybean "Are you a good witch or a bad witch?"
reviewText: Bought two of these: one for a Christmas present and one for me. I have to say that I love it, which is why I got one for me, too. Would be great birthday or Mother's Day gift. Very colorful.
This mat is not worth the few dollars that it is sold for. The suction cups do not work well and it came with a really strong odor and some odd paste on it. Skip it.
summary: This safety mat does not seem very safe.

reviewText: Well that title pretty much says it all doesnt it.Now lets explain what you are getting into if you dont already have a dyson or have experience with them.Dyson designs are very elegant. They are works of art and design genius that have been manufactured with crappy materials and workmanship second to absolutely anyone.1. You can not vacuum with this unit like you have with your other vacs. You cant bang them into stuff and jerk and throw it around and expect it not to break. Youve got to treat her like a lady, a work of art and respect her or she wont do her job for you anymore. And if you treat her like every other vac why should she.2. She is independent with no cord to tie her down. Dont expect her to be as powerful as the tied down corded ones, Just appreciate the freedom.3. She is always ready when you are. She wont go all day like the tied down corded ones of the past, but for quick, fast, and easy she's the one. 15 minutes tops and she's spent.4. She likes it on the bare floor better than carpet thats for sure. Yes you can talk her into doing the carpet for a little while but she doesnt like it.Respect her and she will be with you for a good long time. Treat her badly and she will be gone in no time.I for one am glad we met.Seriously though the run time is aproximately 15 minutes on a full charge and to recharge from zero takes me around two to three hours I have found, your milage may vary depending on the condition of your battery. The vac has good suction so if you dont goof around you can do 1500 sq ft easily on one charge. Pet hair animal and human tends to wrap around the revolving brush slowing it down at times. I use a coin to remove the large screw on the side of the head attachment to remove the brush and pull all the hair of when it gets noticably bogged down. Pretty painless process and you are up and running again.Update: 4/7/14 Still going strong. Battery still holding charges well with no noticable loss in run time
summary: Awesome Fragile Piece Of Garbage Greatness

reviewText: I've used them a couple of times and they work fine and clean up fine, but a little small for my liking.  Still a good value for the money.  Probably perfect size for a lot of people.  Maybe I'll like the size better when I use them more.

I hadn't used a pressure cooker in over twenty five years and missed using one for cooking corned beef & cabbage so I decided to finally break down and buy one.  After reading the great reviews for this model, I decided to purchase it.  I was a little nervous trying it out but it was a breeze.  I cooked a chuck roast in it and followed the directions that came with the pressure cooker.  It came out tasty and tender.  My husband wants me to use it for all our meats now.  lol!!!  You won't be disappointed if you buy this model.

If you've decided it is time for a full-fledged big fryer, the DeLonghi is a good solid choice. The construction is almost commercial grade and yet it is light enough to easily clean and move.The first big question is if you really need a big fryer. This fryer uses roughly one gallon of oil. The minimum level is slightly less - I feel like, if you're pouring oil, why not just add that extra quart and fill the thing all the way up? It will cook French fries for a family of four, easily. Aside from disposing of all that oil, the other big downside is the smell of fryer oil in the house. There is no carbon filter on this fryer, so it gives off a good strong fry smell. Of course you could place it near a range hood to exhaust the smell. I've used a small one-quart fryer that cooks roughly one serving of food for a long time. That fryer has a charcoal filter and avoids a lot of the nasty fryer oil smell. The downside, you have to keep fried foods warm if you are cooking for more than one person.If you are sold on a big fryer, this one is super sweet. The metal bowl is extruded stainless steel that is super easy to clean and built like commercial kitchen utensils (not necessarily pretty, but rugged). There is a valve at the front of the bowl to drain the cool oil. That valve is covered with a fine mesh stainless steel screen that prevents particulate from draining. The heating unit is a standard well built metal loop, exactly the style used in commercial fryers. DeLonghi did a nice job with the control unit and heating element in one assembly that is easy to place inside the fryer bowl. The stainless steel base is well designed. There are handles in the front and side to allow easy lifting of the hot fryer. There is a front door covering the drain.The lid looks pretty, I'm not sure I'm a major fan of the design though. The front window is large and it is easy to see inside the fryer. There is a plastic handle that makes it easy to open the lid. The problem with the design, the vent holes are just behind the handle. When you remove the top, there is an opportunity for you hands to get a little hot from the rising steam. If they put the handle in front of the viewing glass, the problem would be solved. There isn't anyplace to hang the lid when you remove it. You have to put the lid on the counter or someplace else while adding or removing food. Given all the though put into everything else, I would like some kind of hook.The basket is outstanding. The handle snaps in solidly and has no play. The stainless steel mesh is fine with good clean welds. The whole thing has a good solid feel to it.Oil heated very quickly, this is a high wattage fryer. The controls are a little quirky. The temperature increases in 9 Fahrenheit degree increments - the design is really meant for degrees centigrade. The timer is limited to whole minutes. Once the fryer reaches the preset temperature, you start the timer by pressing the power button. You turn off the unit by unplugging it. It didn't take long to get used to the controls, they're odd but not too odd.There is a lard mode that heats the oil slowly to allow the lard to melt. Lard mode also resets the oil timer (a ten hour timer to tell you when to change the oil).The dual zone concept is mostly all marketing. In theory the bottom of the fryer is supposed to be cool and not burn flakes of food that have settled to the bottom of the tank. Food burns just like any other fryer. That cold zone is actually just a small standoff for the heating element. Oil is slightly cooler at the bottom, but not dramatically cooler.A few minor quirks aside, this is an outstanding fryer. I've used a lot of commercial fryers, and this one is almost at that level. I like the details they added to this fryer.

Great little slowcooker for one-three people but doesn't get as hot and cook as fast as larger ones. The interior cleans very nice in dishwasher! The one I received didn't match the picture on Amazon, didn't have a light on it and there was no cookbook! I could've got the same one for alot less in the stores. Save your money!
summary: Slow cooker doesn't match picture on Amazon!

reviewText: I was looking to buy a half sheet because I wanted to make focaccia bread and my 2 Good Cook cookie sheets are very shallow and narrow.  I was hesitant on buying this one because my single wall oven is quite small.  But I thought, what the heck, I'll just return it if it doesn't fit.  I ordered one and was amazed when I got it.  The pan is very thick and quite heavy... and made in the USA!  Very rare, nowadays.  Best of all, it fits perfectly in my oven!!!  I've made chocolate sheet cake beautifully with no sticking (I sprayed the pan with PAM then sprinkled flour).  The pan is very shiny and pretty so I use nonstick baking mats everytime I bake scones, cookies and messy stuff like cinnamon rolls.  I ordered one more so I have 2 of these pans now!For those with single wall ovens, the base of this pan measures 11.5 x 16.5.  It is 13x8 with the tapered sides included.  Love these pans!  I will order the smaller ones too.
For a Brooklyn apartment with minimal closet space, this is a life saver. Easy to put together, 100% stable - even loaded down with clothes and shoes!

The Waring Pro does not perform as adverised, either in the Waring ads or in the customer reviews online.  The container on top does not "seat" itself firmly on the base; it does not lock into place for safety; and it does not pulverize a tray of ice cubes at all, much less in 3 seconds, as was one person's experience.  Thinking I had gotten a defective machine, I called Waring only to be told that none of their blenders lock into place and one is supposed to hold the top down on the base while blending!  The tray of ice cubes stuck in the blender without blending, and the personal chef I had in my kitchen at the time and who was watching my personal demonstration said, "No, no, that's not ok.  Send it back!"  And so I will.
Everything about this says Cuisinart. Well made and protects the blades and the safety latch keeps the little ones from getting in it easily. So glad I ordered this with my food processor.

I received this coffee maker for christmas and am extremely thrilled to own it. I drink coffee about three times a day so this machine is constantly working and has been spot on since day one. the single carafe brew function is brilliant and so convenient for my mid day nodding off. The travel mug that comes with the machine doesn't have the best lid but I'm really not going to complain about it; just be careful if you do use it. You can use any coffee cup and a variety of travel mugs that you probably already own for that side any way. The coffee on the single side can seem a little less flavorful but I've found that using the "bold" brew option helps this matter. Coffee brews super fast on both sides and especially on the single side. I really don't like to wait for my coffee and this pot does not keep me in a panic of whether or not I'll ever get my frist cup in the mornings. It programs to be ready in the morning, has a bold brew option and is super simple to operate. The most important part...the pot does not do the usual coffee spillage when you pour. This is terribly important to me as my ex-coffee maker poured coffee all over my counters and didn't clean up after itself. The new pot doesn't clean up after itself either but he doesn't make a mess to begin with.
Make sure you read the instructions.  It foams a lot.  Easy to use.  Leaves a nice fresh scent after using.

Great item for the summer corn season, and so easy to use.  One ear takes about 4-5 minutes, two take about 7-10 minutes.  You put 1/4 cup of water in each chamber, and it steams perfectly.The lid does NOT snap on, as some expect, but fits on the top of the chamber. The corn will be hot, and perfectly cooked.  Kind of fun to have this at the office too- very handy.Of course, you could steam anything in this, but it is designed for corn.  As for size, it has worked well so far.  If one were to have extra large ears of corn, I think it would still work, though you might adjust the cooking time up a bit. Best for medium-large ears, I think.Perfect for singles, college age, and seniors  -  who wants to fool with a pot, boiling water, salt, draining and clean-up, when THIS is an option?One of the best.
summary: Quick and PERFECT results in home and office.

reviewText: This is so convenient for my tarts and pies! I love the easy lift of as I sts forget to grease before I use the pie crust but I guess it's not necessary.... Would definitely recommend! Great for a large size tart or pie!
I love these pillow cases very soft after you wash them and they feel good to your body as you sleep. I purchased for my mom and I'm the one that is picky about the sheets. Very happy with them
Progressive International Microwavable Four Egg Poacher is a great product and I would buy it again.  Makes a great gift too.
summary: Progressive International Microwavable Four Egg Poacher

reviewText: You just can't  go wrong with the classic mason jar! Arrived on time, no broken parts and exactly as described. We use them for everything.

I read all the other reviews have had absolutely none of the problems that were mentioned. I've owned them for at least three years.  I even bought another set, as a matter of fact.  I don't use the second caddy.  I stacked both sets on the original caddy.  Yes, it's kind of cheaply made, but has held up excellently.  I love the fact that I never have to look for lids to match, that there is a good variety of sizes, and best of all, they are NOT disposable.  I admit I do not use them in the microwave.  (I don't use any plastic in the microwave.)  They hold up very well in the dishwasher, and none have stained at all.  I put hot and cold food in them.  Every lid fits fine.  I'm very pleased with the price, the convenience, the entire idea of space saving.
I am very happy with the set.  It was just as the picture showed.  Adds a lot of class to my bedroom.  Love the color and feel.
summary: It's as nice as it loooks

reviewText: I use this all the time. Food just turns out better. Thick bottom, great heat conduction, the pressure part of the pot really makes meats tender. I would absolutely get another and if someone was getting married soon, that would be the present to give them!

What I really love about this grill is that it sears and cooks burgers, chicken cutlets, steaks, etc. evenly and within a short period of time. The lid automatically allows for thicker cuts of meat (I think up to 1" thickness) and is variable in its height adjustment, which is an excellent and useful feature.The lid prevents any spattering of liquids or fats which are directed to empty into the plastic fat rendering container provided. Since there is a small output of smoke during grilling, I just place the grill on a thick wooden cutting board, on the stovetop (obviously with the burners in the off position) and with the stovetop hood on to remove smoke and odors; it's pretty effective.Cleanup is relatively simple due to the grill's nonstick surface and takes just a few minutes. This model is quite small, compact and lightweight, making it easy to store. The surface area is large enough to grill two burgers at a time. I use it often and highly recommend it.

I never ever thought I would pay this much money for a vacuum cleaner, but that being said..I'm sooo glad I did. We already had the DC41 Animal upright and that is excellent. The DC39 Animal is also amazing. I have a yellow lab and two cats that seem to shed nonstop. This gets everything, especially with the extras that came with it. I also got the Dyson groom kit for dogs, and that works perfectly with this. The Dyson videos that show how to use the groom tool,  always show them grooming in the direction of head to tail.. but you can also get alot of hair going from toe to head..just don't push in to your pet too hard. My lab loves it. I also bought the hose extension that works great for this. The vacuum cleaner doesn't have to be so close as I'm brushing, and same with cleaning out the car. This is perfect for car cleaning, especially with the hose extension.The DC39 is pricey, and that turns alot of people off. I know it did for me..for a long time. But I finally broke down and bought one, then finally bought this one also, after my other non Dyson vacuum cleaners broke down, belts broke, or who knows what went wrong. You can go to QVC or HSN and the 4 or 5 monthly payments to make it easier on you. I have had this for about 2 months now, and just works like charm. And I love that it has the retractable cord
summary: Works flawlessly.. and great for cleaning car interiors

reviewText: I bought this popper in order to make a healthier popcorn, one that doesn't require oil to pop.  It pops the popcorn quickly and does a good job of popping all of the corn in the chamber.  However, it does tend to shoot unpopped kernels out of the maker at the beginning of the popping process.  Perhaps the chamber could be somewhat deeper.  For the price though, it is a good alternative to popping corn in oil.

My lunch routine works for me, I make a pot of soup a week and pre-portion it into 16 oz containers for weekday school lunches.  I heat up one container in the morning in the microwave before putting it in the Thermos. No more running out to find something within walking distance and having to settle for whatever unhealthy thing that may be and unnecessarily spending money. Fast, easy, economical, and healthy.I love this Thermos. The 16 oz size is perfect for a generous meal portion. The wide mouth is perfect for eating out of and not making a mess, it also helps to clean up thoroughly inside later on. It's almost indestructible and looks great, the cranberry color is lovely. You can't beat stainless steel construction- IT DOES NOT LEAK. It actually does keep your food warm or cold for 9-12 hours. When I get it ready in the morning around 6 am, I put hot water in the Thermos, set the lid over it and come back in about 10 min, dump out the water, and put the warmed food inside till lunchtime. When I sit down to eat at noon, the food is piping hot - sometimes i even have to let it cool off before I can eat it.You can use this Thermos exactly as advertised for a hot lunch, clean it by hand or in the dishwasher, drop it on the floor, and trust that it won't leak all over your car. My last few semesters in school would have been a lot more of a trial had I not been able to depend on having these products to deliver my lunch daily to keep me going for a full day at school. I love having something that does what it is supposed to do and does it well. I would buy this product ten times over, funny thing is it's such a great quality I probably won't ever have to replace it. I do heartily recommend this Thermos food jar.
summary: Trustworthy brand to rely on for meals

reviewText: I purchased this coffee mug based on the reviews here at Amazon, and so far have been pleased.  I grew disillusioned with my Oxo Liqui-Seal mug, and saw recommendations for this cup on those reviews.This Thermos Nissan keeps my drinks much hotter than the plastic-lined Oxo cup ever did, and does not retain flavors in the liner, so I can use it for hot tea and other drinks after drinking coffee from it.The lid is a much simpler design, basically a circular insert that screws down to shut, and screws 1/2 turn to open.  The best part about the lid is that there are no crevices or little openings to harbor residue from coffee with milk or cream.  The Oxo cup quickly developed on off-flavor, since there was no way to thoroughly clean it, but this Nissan cup has a very straightforward design, and is totally cleanable!  That was my #1 criteria for a cup.  It is also totally spill-proof, another criteria for this busy mom and teacher.  It has been knocked over several times on my desk at school, without spilling a drop.  It is not as easy to open one-handed (ie while driving) as some other cups, but that is not my primary use for it, so that hasn't been a big deal.The rubber grips on the cup and the rubberized handle are both easy to hold onto, even with gloves on.  It fits easily in my car cup-holder, and is not overly top-heavy or wobbly on a desk.It is easy to clean; they recommend washing by hand, but I confess that I've put in the dishwasher a couple of times on particularly busy days, with no ill effects.The one and only thing I don't like is that you cannot tell by looking at the lid whether it is open or closed.  The only way to know is to either try screwing it open or shut, or to attempt to take a drink.  I quickly developed the habit of screwing it shut immediately after every drink, however, so I know it is always closed.Overall, this is the best insulated travel cup I've ever owned (and I have a cupboard full!).  It was pricey, but for my purposes, it was worth it to have a mug that I could throw in my bag, and know it would not leak.

This coffee maker makes excellent tasting coffee no matter what kind of coffee I use.  I did purchase the  optional filter that inserts in the water tank and use filtered water (Pur faucet mount).  The coffee maker is very stylish and I really like the way it is designed including the red stripe.  I do agree the coffee could be a little hotter and I wish it had an audible on completion of brewing coffee.  The price definitely helps to make a 5-star rating too!
Very nice mat. Would buy again. After a month the smell dissipated. There are worse smells in most bathrooms. Probably not recommended for the severely asthmatic.
summary: Yes, it stinks for a while

reviewText: I've abused this fridge. I keep it on 24/7 (its been about a year.)I will say it keeps things very cool not ice cold but it does work well. It works in the car and in your house.I really thought it wouldn't work for every day wear. The picture is actually changed since I bought mine. The picture that was shown before had a huge coca cola logo on it but the logo is a tiny circle at the top.Kinda closes funny, you just have to make sure you press hard enough to close it.Is small, only holds I guess 9 coke cans. I use it for a water bottle and it holds two quart bottles.

I have been looking for something like this to make quick salads. As I work full time I don't have much time on my hand to cut and dice food for hours just to make a salad. I did a lot of research on Amazon and on other sites and finally decided to give this one a shot.I have to say I have had for some time  now and I am pleasantly surprised by how easy this SaladShooter is to use. I like that it came with 4 different dicers and slicers and I can use them for variety of items : grating cheese, cabbage, carrots etc. Please keep in mind that this saladshooter likes raw items - if you cook something and try to stuff it in there then, it will get all mushy and most likely will ruin. Also because of the white color veggies like carrot, beats and other pigmented foods will leave a color residue which does not come off under hot water with a soap. I usually use baking soda or sea salt to scrub off the coloring. I have used this item at least twice a week for past few months and blades are still sharp and in excellent shape.I would definitely recommend this product if you are not into forking tons of money on other brands.
summary: A nice essential in the kitchen

reviewText: I'm so glad I purchased this! Great for making small amounts of sauces, soups, drinks etc. The chopping blade made chopping things for dinner so much faster! Also made guac with it..came out super smooth and creamy in <2 minutes.Highly recommend if you don't want to bust out your 11 cup food processor for a 2 cup job.

Bought my first set of these for my children's lunches 3 years ago!  It took that long for half of them to break, but then again, I do have three within 1.5 years each of each other...accidents happen.  I just ordered my second set, and even though the price and demand has gone up, they are still the best little things I can find for my kids' lunch boxes!  Pure glass - no plastic of any kind in them - that's what's safe.
This is better than the same in wooden style, but still not that stable and both can be swept over in a good breeze.
Wife loves it and is always using itShe loves all the settings it hasAnd the prob she says is handy.
Grabs and holds barbecue sauce as well as melted butter.  Great all-around basting brush.  I am going to look for a longer handled to use while cooking on the grill.

First off, I have never paid $24 for a towel. In fact my wife gave me an -$$ chewing. We bought several cheaper towels at another local store and within a week they started fraying and they also did a poor job of drying. Well I am here to say that this towel is huge, it drys you good and so far no fraying.

This is for my SEARS reverse osmosis water filter.  These are labeled "Whirlpool" but are the same as the Sears part which had gotten ridiculously expensive.  They come sealed in clear wrap so they seem clean and fresh. I have been happy with them.
I like the floral pattern and colors in this sham.  The quality of manufacture could be better and the fabric needs to have more body to hold up the corners.

I purchased these for our full size travel trailer mattress.  I was disappointed at how thin they were, but they are soft and they do not scratch.  I would not purchase these for my home, but they will serve the purpose for our travel trailer mattress.
They work perfectly at a good price, and I didn't have to drive around town trying to find a store that stocks the RR size.
summary: They fit and function as well as the Eureka bags that came with the vacuum cleaner

reviewText: It does cook, but cooks faster than normally a slow cooker supposed to do.After I finished cooking, I set it at "warm",the result showed that it was still too hot at "warm".(Food in the slow cooker was still slowly cooked at "warm". )So we need to buy a good timer for it.(which made the purchase not a good deal.)BTW, I agree with other people said that,the size is very useful for a small family, also looks nice.
summary: It cooks faster than other slow cookers I had before.

reviewText: This is like a bath towel cut to mat size--no backing; at least the color works for me.  I bought the towel set too; both towels and mat have strong chemical/dye odor which hopefully will go away when washed; quality is ok but not my idea of 'luxury spa' . . .
Just like in the picture. They could come in a display box of some kind but really, they're fine for such a low price.

I put this on the inside of my closet, as it's not very attractive and has that nasty vinyl smell. But it's very good for storing my "seasonal" sneakers when they're not needed. Takes up very little room. Recommend.

it is not a white ceramic it is similar to a real fine diamond hone and is a grey color hence the word alumina in the description,regular steel does not really sharpen per say it is magnetic and basically realigns the metal or steel to help keep the knife sharp.This is not magnetic,this is good for refining a knifes edge as say the final stage sharpening or touching up then maybe a last touch on a regular steel for magnetic and molecular realignment.
The toasting slots are too shallow.  When I use normal, presliced bread, the top half-inch of my toast doesn't get toasted at all.
I ended up thowing it out as it didn't work, just leaked water every where.  It wasn not worth returning.

I looked at many different models of humidifiers before settling on this one and purchasing it and it has definitely exceeded expectations in regard to what I want and need in a humidifier. Its large capacity water tanks make for less times per week of filling it up. The two reservoir tanks make it very convenient when filling because since you can leave one in place on the humidifier you do not have to turn it off when refilling it. I have found that it does not empty the tanks evenly as it runs but empties one tank and them moves on to the other one after the first is empty. So this makes it to where when you check on how empty it is by just gently lifting the handle of each tank to see if they are very light indicating that they are empty or very close to it. Then you just grab the empty one and refill is while there is one tank absent and the other is still making the machine run without interruption. This feature makes it much easier to gauge how much water is in it at any given time. Also, this unit automatically powers down when both tanks become empty so that it does not just run and run with no water in it and damage itself. The last two humidifiers I have had that were Vick's brand did not have this automatic feature and it made it to where you had to watch it on a regular basis to make sure it was not running with no water in the reservoir. The controls on this unit are very accessible, straightforward, and are marked very clearly for quick adjustments to the settings. The two control knobs and all indicators are on the top of the unit so you can easily see them and adjust them.This Honeywell unit is large and that makes for bigger and better venting of the discharged humidified air so that it does its job much more effectively. And even with it being a bigger and heavier unit, the fact that it has casters on it makes moving it around as easy as can be. This also allows for moving it to a workable are easily when it is time to clean it. The filter is very effective and since it can be rinsed out once and reused it makes it to where you do not have to buy a new filter every time it gets a bit dirty. So, given that, you only have to replace it every other time of cleaning the unit. I am the type that is very meticulous about keeping machinery, appliances, and other devices very clean because it makes them last longer and work more efficiently. This unit is a snap to clean because the entire top comes off along with the two reservoir tanks so that you can put the base in the dishwasher lying flat on the bottom rack and let the dishwasher disinfect and really clean it well. Then when you put it back together it is so easy because there are no screws or fasteners that have to be taken out or disengaged to take it apart for cleaning. The device housing and two reservoir tanks just lift off for easy access to the base tray for cleaning. The design and style of this unit makes it to where it is not unsightly but actually is very graceful and attractive when in any room. It is not like some of the other humidifiers that are on the market that are so ugly and unattractive that you would rather keep it hidden to where it is out of sight.The machine does have a level of operating sound coming from it when running, but it actually is a pleasant and even sound that is not a nuisance to the ears and is not so loud that you have to turn the TV up in the room with the humidifier to be able to hear it. My overall view of this unit is that it is the best humidifier that I have ever owned and I am very happy to have taken the time to really check out a lot of different humidifiers online before purchasing this one. The time and effort spent researching and comparing really paid off. I would recommend this humidifier to anyone that needs one for office or household use.
My old dough hook lasted nearly 10 years (the last 5 with heavy use) before the paint started to chip.  The coated version is dishwasher safe.

so many uses! we use when hotel stays, camping, vacationing ,on cruises, etc, to hang over bathroom door & organizer everything from toothbrushes/toothpaste, deodorant, makeup, sunblock, bug spray, flashlights, batteries, meds, makeup. anything that could create clutter on countertops or that you might spend a few minutes looking for. Maids love us since the can quickly clean counters! Highly recommend!
summary: Don't forget on your next trip

reviewText: I used this to line my kitchen cabinets, pantry, linen closets, bathroom cabinets and so on.  It is easy to cut and fit.  Can be wiped off, is durable and long lasting.

I have been wanting a kitchen scale for a while now. I find this one to be a an interesting mix of cheap and expensive make, but with excellent features that work well.Design:The scale is made of plastic except for the glass platter upon which one places the item to be weighed. The plastic feels cheap but the glass seems high quality; however it appears to be sturdy enough. There is a space in the bottom for two AA batteries, and a switch for changing between Lbs and Metric measurements. It has a 6 pound weight limit. The front has a large LCD and a button for ON and OFF.Pro:The glass provides a good surface and can be cleaned  under water. It removes easily.The scale allows one to first put the container on the scale, then hold the ON button until the scale zeros out. This enables the user to weigh the ingredients easily. And of one is combining ingredients, then it is simple - just hit the ON button again for each added ingredient. Nice and simple.The instructions are graphical, but were fairly easy for me to figure out. There are warnings about keeping it level and making sure it is on a steady surface. The sequence of pictures to show how to zero out the scale after placing a container on the scale were well done.Con:I would be a bit worried about the glass breaking, but then again one just needs to take care of it. I'm keeping the nice box with inserts to store it.Summary: Great design, great features. This one is a good choice. Highly recommended.
I really enjoyed this skillet for cooking small meals, but was very disappointed when the handle fell off soon after I received the skillet.

I really like the size of this and the quality of the material it is made of.  It stores and cleans up well.  Great product for the price!  Definately would recommend this to anyone interested in purchasing something like this in the future.
summary: Mario Batali The Italian Kitchen Collection Silicone Work Mat

reviewText: I'm a meat and potatos kind of guy.  Therefore my diet tends to consist of a lot of hearty soups, stews and meat dishes with gravy.  Unfortunately, many of these meals can contain rather high fat content.  Of course this isn't exactly healthy on a regular basis so anything I can do to cut down on fat consumption is a good thing.  Enter the "Cuisipro 4-Cup BPA Free Fat Separator."  Here are my thoughts;Pros+ Large 4 cup capacity.+ 25 year warranty (with product registration).+ BPA free.+ Dishwasher safe.+ Sturdy construction.Cons- A bit pricey.- Can leak at the bottom from time to time depending the consistency of the fluid inside.- Not microwave safe (has a metal upper band).The "Cuisipro 4-Cup BPA Free Fat Separator" is an extremely useful and well designed fat separator.  Invaluable for skimming fat from your favorite gravies, stews and soups which in turn helps you watch your waistline while still being able to enjoy the foods you love.  Another welcome addition to our kitchen, especially this Thanksgiving for our gravy.  Thumbs up.
summary: A fat separator that's simple to use and easy to clean

reviewText: I wish I never purchased this.  It does not take the place of my dear old Mouli which sliced and shred.  This just takes up space in my cabinets.
summary: I wish I never purchased this.

reviewText: We have had this for about a week now and have used it almost daily. It is truly non-stick. Great for sandwiches and grilled cheese, we absolutely love it!!

Yeah, it's another thing to clean and stow however cleanup is fast and easy, not much more than a paper towel wipe down, I use almost daily and quite frankly it's been a real time saver for me, don't know how I got along without it.I've grilled pastrami, corned beef and tilapia fillets on it, put it right on the bread of choice plus the appropriate vegi, cheese and condiments, top it off with bread and press it on the spot, delicious, nothing left the panini press til the devouring stage, wipe down while hot and detail with a damp micro fiber towel when cool...12-16 min start to finish, it just doesn't get any easier unless somebody else waits on you. A luxury I've never been prepared to accept the consequences of.
summary: I questioned how much I needed this until I used it regularly.

reviewText: Very easy to use and a great price. Simplifies the process greatly. You only need a knife to remove the top and to slice up the "meat" you get out of the pineapple.

I did a lot of research before I bought this particular steam mop and I 'm glad I did.PROS:  Extra wide and thick pads with flip side for easy, continued mopping.  (Sturdy velcro closure too.)  Long handle and light-wht. mean no back ache.  Long cord.  Barely uses half of the water in the reservoir to clean my living room, kitchen and bedroom!CONS:  NONE YET!

I ordered the cabinet to hold/hide cleaning products in my utility/laundry room.  Cons: I agree the packing left much to be desired. All the pieces were scraping against each other inside the carton for their entire journey to my front porch. Fortunately the only major damage did not show after assembly. As others mentioned, it does have a bit of a smell but it did not give me a headache and I did not need to air it out for 3 weeks; smells like fresh paint to me. Assembly was moderately easy (I'm not good at such things). I was suprised at how few pieces there were.  The whole front panel (the door and hinges) was pre-assembled except for the knobs (which I will change out).  The bottom panel was supposed to slide into a groove but due to poor craftsmanship it did not meet up with the groove. End result was that the entire cabinet is slightly wobbly because it affected slightly the rest of the assembly. One of the pre-attached doors hangs a bit off-kilter, but it does not affect opening or closing and is not unsightly. The bottom and side panels are kind of thin and different from the rest of the unit, but not nearly as bad as I was expecting from some of the lower reviews.  They look fine, they just sound a little rattly if you tap on them.  Biggest con for me was that the clearance between shelves was a bit shorter than I wanted. Some standard cleaning products will not fit the way I'd hoped. By the time I'd figured that out, I was done with assembly.  But I made it work.  Pros:  Very inexpensive, and despite some of the cons,  I knew I wasn't buying an heirloom quality piece of furniture at that low price, but it was far better than I expected for such an inexpensive piece. Looks decent enough for a laundry room.  With a little patience and creativity and haphazardness, I was able to fit the cleaning products in, so it is doing what it was supposed to do, if only by a hair.  Delivery was lightning quick. It arrived 5 days earlier than the shipping/tracking estimate.
summary: Better than I expected, good but not great.

reviewText: I have a small kitchen. Not "Recreational Vehicle" small but still relatively small. I don't have a lot of space for storage and when I actually need to use the counter...that's about an hour of moving stuff onto the kitchen table just to clear the space. So needless to say: easy to use, functional, space saving gadgets and kitchen equipment are very important to me.I used to have separate electric salt and pepper grinder's that were pretty fancy. The downside was that they were big (each one took up about as much space as a 20 oz bottle of soda) and heavy (6 AAA batteries and an electric motor will do that). And they didn't hold all that much before they needed to be refilled.Fortunately, Ozeri's Duo Ultra Salt and Pepper Mill and Grinder came to me at the perfect time after the motor on one of my grinders finally died and I needed a replacement. I have to say I love this thing. As the name suggests it holds salt and pepper, in separate chambers. You hold the base and turn the top in one direction for salt and the other for pepper. It comes with a removable base cap on the bottom for storage (so the area where the salt and pepper actually come out doesn't get gross). The base cap also doubles as a handy funnel when it's time to refill. It's super easy to adjust the grinding size on the salt and pepper.In the grand scheme of things it may not come to much, but sometimes it's nice to have a simple, functional tool that does everything it's supposed to and does it well.
summary: A simple, functional tool that does everything it's supposed to and does it well.
