reviewText: I have now replaced almost all my sheets from 400tc to the microfiber ones. The feel like silk and they are dry-ish right out of the washer. I needed green. I would have acceptedsage, spring, apple, emerald or that mold that grows on various vegetables that get lost in the refrigerator crisper drawer. What I got was a color so far off the scale of visible detection that I have named it "IT". IT has more to teach us than that the human eye cannot figure out what a color so lacking in character that if you were in a sea of it you could only report that you were in a sea of "IT". IT also shows us that a thing as simple as a flat sheet can be made poorly and the much touted embroidery is a pain unless you intend to iron it. I would have given it a minus one star, but the system won't permit. "IT" might make a nice winding sheet for a dead person you didn't like, but if you have no impending candidates don't buy these and wait, let me know and you can have mine.

my wife uses lots and lots of garlic in our food and has managed to jam up every garlic press i've ever bought her. this one is pretty amazing. Its easy to rock back and forth for pressing, then cleanup is a breeze.totally worth the premium over cheaper presses/crushers.

This grill pan is solid cast iron, long enough to cover completely the two burners on one side of my electric stove, and does what I want it to do--cook meats, fish and vegetables indoors with less fat. Does it really "grill" them? No, but it's not the fault of this particular pan. If you want real grilling, use a barbeque.  Obviously you don't get that smokey flavor from this. But if you want to cook a steak or some onions and peppers for a fajita and you can't or don't want to fire up the barbeque,  this will do a good job, searing the food where it touches it but not sauteing or frying it. It also uses a lot less energy than an oven, and takes less time.I've found two downsides of grill pans. First, since it's not designed to be used with much, if any, fat, some foods will stick. I've had some problems cooking fish; when it comes time to flip or remove a salmon fillet, you may find yourself scraping vigorously with a spatula to avoid leaving that nice crust behind, stuck to the pan, even though you've brushed the fish with oil first. This may change eventually, if the pan gets thoroughly seasoned from use. (Of course, the alternative is a non-stick version,  but no, thank you.)Second, be sure you have a hood fan that works well, or a very well ventilated kitchen,  or your house will likely fill with smoke. Putting a cover (or upside-down pot) over it may help.But these issues are inherent with grill pans. This particular model is well designed and well made and reasonably priced. It's solid without weighing a ton, and I've had no problem with warping or cracking.  It has a flat griddle on the other side, useful for pancakes or, for those who like them fried, burgers. Being cast iron, it should be washed without soap (so it maintains seasoning) and dried thoroughly before storage (or it will rust).
summary: Just What I Was Looking For

reviewText: This is exactly what I was looking for!  Fits the burners perfectly.  We did 10 bratwurst on it the first use and they turned out great!  Cuts the tortilla making time in half.  Cleans up easily.  I use a lot of cast iron so is never a problem to season - I expect to do that routinely.  Very heavy and sturdy.

I'm a bit of a packrat when it comes to my kitchen, and I'm very protective of my knives.  With my new kitchen space, I didn't have room for my under-counter knife blocks, and putting them in a drawer certainly wasn't an option.  Hanging them was the best solution.  This bar magnet met my needs exactly.The magnets are sufficiently strong to hold everything from my 10" chef's knives to my 3 1/2" paring knives and everything in between.  The only blade that is near insecure is my one leftover from my first set of knives; an ancient boning knife that is a little iffy on the magnet, but is safely between two other knives so the chances of knocking it are slim.  Plus, there's some incentive to be able to replace that soon...Mounting is easy - 1 screw on each side and drywall anchors are included (though I recommend upgrading those with better ones available at your favorite hardware store).  Overall good value, and good quality for the money.

I've been using this set since January 2013. I have regularly run this set in the dishwasher and the set doesn't look like it has dulled down or tarnished. This set has a good weight and feel. I just think that the soup spoon is a bit oversize, so avoid using them, which makes me run my dishwasher a little more often. I guess the fix here is if I weren't so lazy and just hand wash my small spoons, it would extend the time between my dishwasher cycles.
summary: Still looks good after a couple of months

reviewText: This is a great gift for teens, college-bound youths, or anyone with limited kitchen space. So far, the only downside reported by the ever-hungry boys around here is that it only makes one sandwich at a time. A quick workaround was discovered, however, when impatience won out in the fight for breakfast. They simply filled our four-slice toaster with their bread of choice and used the maker to cook two eggs at the same time, one on top, one on the bottom. The lower one will cook slightly faster, but no one here seemed to care when it meant faster eats. When using the sandwich maker as designed, our only recommendation is to take care with cheese, as it seems to make up 90% of any mess made. Cleanup is still pretty quick and easy, but why make it harder than it needs to be? We use a biscuit cutter to trim cheese slices. Because it is slightly smaller than the 4" cooker rings, it helps keeps melting cheese from getting out of hand. We have tried all kinds of creative stuff with this thing and the more creative we get, the more we think of trying. Mostly, though, we use it as designed. It's just plain simple and it is nice to be able to do other things while breakfast is cooking. The boys agree that this plus the Keurig is better than any drive thru.

They are a cute design, with a nice weight, good quality, solid feel, balanced design, and reasonable durability. I really like these and think that you will too.  The only thing that I don't like about them is the price, considering what they are and that they are made in China.  The finish scratches kind of easily, especially considering the price.I have nothing against Rachael Ray, but am not so enamored with her (or any other celebrity) that I would be willing to pay a premium for her name to be on my flatware. There are better flatware sets out there for the same price, and sets of similar quality at a lower price, but this is by no means bad if you don't mind paying a premium for the owl or the Rachael Ray name.
summary: Overpriced for what they are, but they are not bad especially if you like the owl or the Rachael Ray name.

reviewText: Bought this to replace an off-brand from another source. Was looking for a turner with a very flexible tip. This one is stiffer at the tip than I wanted - later bought a different silicone turner from Trudeau which exactly fits the bill.

I have a seasonal wreath that I have hanging on my apartment door, I use to use the Christmas wreath hangers, however ever since I moved into my new apartment the hook is too long and I can't see out my peep hole. This is great, I can place it wherever I want and it hangs securely. I also can reuse this with it being refillable, great buy! I am an avid Command Strips fan!

What can one say about a shower curtain that hasn't already been said...The fabric has a nice, heavy and luxe look to it, and is perfect for a simple and understated look when decorating the bath.  A liner is needed to help keep it clean and being white, it may not be the most practical color choice.  Otherwise, it is a good value for the size and heft of material.

I just got my Cuisinart DLC-8SBK yesterday. So far I have mixed a cake, shredded coconut, sliced pototoes, made cole slaw, chopped onion; green pepper; tomato, and tonight I made the BEST Guacamole I have ever tasted! It is a heavy-duty, powerful, get-the-job-done machine.You should have seen the pretty,fluffy shredded coconut! I do not know how I have survived without it. The feed-tube assembly took me a little while (an hour!) to get used to. And I wouldn't suggest mixing a cake as your first project. Would be better to get used to it before doing anything liquid. So easy to clean. This machine is mine now. We are partners! Tomorrow I will try to make some bread.

This is an interesting design but I found it hard to fill, difficult to clean, and the twelve cups are really more like six.  The final problem was that it went dead in less than a year.  I recommend that you avoid this one.  I have a Cuisinart that has been in use more than eight years and works fine.
summary: A great concept but awkward to use.

reviewText: This is a great way to store your K cups especially if you have a variety of flavors.The sturdy top also makes is easy to set your Keurig or other items on top so it doesnot waste any valuable counter space.

This did everything and more for me. I have been using a wet rock to sharpen my knives but no longer. I saw this item while shopping on Amazon and thought I should take a chance and I'm so glad I did.

I am impressed with the design of the pressure control dial and the solid feel.  Although T-fal doesn't say what type of stainless steel this is made from (some types are tougher than others preventing long term rust).  I have to admit, I prefer the German made WMF and the Swiss made Kuhn Rikon pressure cookers over this T-fal which is made in China.  I would decide based on how long you intend to keep the pressure cooker.  Is this for occasional use or for something that just works?  Then the T-fal is an excellent choice.  If you are looking for a pressure cooker that will stay in your cabinets as classic cookware for many years, then check out the WMF and Kuhn Rikon models.
summary: Best affordable pressure cooker for beginners

reviewText: I bought a bunch of these to move with. This Extra Large size was useful for packing bedding in, but the zippers can be very contrary (falling off, or not zipping smoothly), the valves leak, and the bags tear fairly easily. All of these problems were worst on the XL bags.
summary: OK storage, but leak and tear easily

reviewText: These bags wreak of polyurethene or whatever there are made of. So strong it will stink up your garments. Don't waste your money.

Item arrived very quickly and is just as pictured.  I love the easy press on off button, and that it has the option for Fahrenheit and Celsius.  The large read out, it is great to not have to squint to see tiny numbers.  It is very fast at reading the temperature. I love the sleeve to put it away, no more broken thermometers in my utensil drawer.  Overall a great product that I would definitely recommend.

Ok the good first - this thing is awesome on dog hair! We have 6 big dogs in the house and I am fanatical about keeping a clean house, so daily sweeping or vaccuming is a rule here. (Having dogs is no excuse for dog odor or dirt.) The only vaccum I've ever found that really does get the dog hair reliably from carpet, hard wood, tile and furniture is the Dyson Animal and let's be honest... who can afford to spend $500 on a vaccum cleaner in real life? This Dirt Devil Swerve did an admirable job on the short pile wool carpet in the formal living room and an area rug in the foyer. It transitioned easily to the hard wood floors from carpet and then to tile with no loss of suction in either direction. The can is easy to pop off and empty and the hose clean out is just one step as well. Overall, this is a pretty simple machine to use and take care of and holy cow does it get the daily grime off the floors!The reason for the one star deduction - the swivel design is nice in some ways, but the vaccum is bottom heavy and feels unbalanced in the hand. It wobbles and becomes unruly as you maneuver around furniture. This is not a deal breaker, but it is obnoxious and takes some getting used to. For the price point though, I can live with the wobble - the suction power is worth it!
summary: Badly Balanced, Amazing on dog hair!

reviewText: and it's a little bit translucent, kind of like hankie material.  To me, it is more of a $4 bag rather than a $7 bag.  I was a little disappointed.  Maybe it's more durable than it looks....
summary: the cotton is kind of thin-ish

reviewText: This is a quality product that is so comfortable. I love to use this in my bath. It makes so easy to completely relax.

Have been using this knife for 3 years. Great value. Good balance and sharpens well. Thick tang and I like the curve of the blade a lot. Use this knife every day. Have purchased one for my mother and sister, they both use them all the time. Keep out of the dishwasher though, as with any good knife some times they will develop tiny rust spots if put in the dishwasher or left wet overnight. Use, wash and dry always. The rust spots can always be removed with some ultra fine steel wool if you ever get any. Many more expensive rust even easier, this one is much more resistant.

The space from the opening to your mouth is too long so that its easier to spill liquids when you are drinking on the go. Also, really hard to sip hot drinks. I don't know why they designed it like that. The top is really hard to get off when you need to clean it. It does keep drinks cold or hot, but that means your tea/coffee already needs to be at a drinkable temperature before you put it in the thermos or else you'll be waiting 4+ hours before it even cools off enough to drink. I had high hopes for this thermos, and I've been using it for 4 months now trying to make it work but I might just throw it away since I can't return it anymore.

I had gotten a cheap pair of shears from a son's girlfriend and found them to be very practical.  When they broke, I  ordered these and they are very good quality and handy to have in the kitchen drawer.

This Norpro 682 Anti-Freeze Ice Cream Spade plows through ice cream like it's butter. Very sturdy and easy to grip. For those of you with dishwashers, in no fewer than four different places on the packaging and the spade itself, it warns you DO NOT PUT IN A DISHWASHER or immerse in water hotter than 140 degrees. If that's too hard for you to follow, then I suggest you don't buy this product. You will ruin the spade if you put it in a dishwasher, as several others have shown in their comments. I mean, come on, you're only scooping ice cream with this thing. All you need to do when you're finished using it is rinse it clean with warm water, towel dry, and put it away. How hard or complicated is that? If you do that, you will have a great ice cream spade to use for a very long time.

If it wasn't for this product i accidently  found on amazon, i would be buying a new microwave now. For some reason my sharp microwave was acting funny, sparking when warming even water, these sheets came to my rescue. Just cut them to size accordingly.

I didn't like this iron first time I used it, but thought I should give it more of a chance. I absolutely hated it the whole time I've owned it. First problem, I couldn't get it to stay on steam. I finally taped the lever to the on steam position. Second, it automatically turns off right before you will use it again if you are doing a sewing project... pain in the butt! I found it to be unstable on my ironing board... fell off a number of times, partly because of the base of the cord and possibly my board's problem. It just fell off the board for the LAST TIME! Going out to buy a PANASONIC Iron and a new board!!! The only good thing about the iron is the stainless steel plate, glides over the fabric wonderfully.

My spouse is in culinary school, so we go through a lot of different kitchen implements.  When it comes to spatulas, this is our mutual favorite.  Due to the placement of the spine of the spatula, it is very sturdy - much studier than spatulas which place the spine at the edge of the spatula.  Although we've since bought extras, our first one -  purchased back in 2006 - is still going strong.  It's not stained or warped or otherwise damaged.

I absolutely LOVE this food processor.It makes chopping vegetables, meat, nuts, etc. super easy. I also use it to make certain sauces. You have to remember though, if you fill it too full, it will leak and or spill. This is easy enough to remedy by pouring some out into a bowl and continuing on.Highly recommended!

I do love parachment paper, rather than tin foil, you don't get the tinny taste and it doesn't stick.  I would buy from this seller again and I will keep using parchment paper.  Some people re-use their parchment paper, I don't.
Very ample capacity, without hogging too much counter space.  Well made. Why did I waste 50 years digging through my utensil drawer?

reviewerName: D. Deutsch "Chance favors the prepared mind."
reviewText: Have been using two of these bags for the past 6 months. They have held up nicely despite the kids filling them with clothes and throwing them down the stairs at each other.  Use them for laundry or Kamikaze-bomber-stairway-sneak-attack. Your choice.

I have tried tons of travel mugs. The Oxo were hard to clean and did not keep beverages cold/warm. The Starbucks ones work pretty well, but also were hard to clean. This mug kept my coffee warm all day! I was so surprised. Plus, you can take it apart and it is very easy to clean.. I am exclusively using these mugs now and am throwing out all my old ones!

As everyone has said, it's expensive, but it makes perfect rice every time.  What I like most is that, compared to the steamer I used to use, I no longer have to time the other parts of the meal to the cooking of the rice since this cooker will keep it warm and ready to serve whenever it's needed.  It has very good moisture control, a fact I learned when I accidentally left a half-cup worth of rice in the cooker overnight.  After 11 hours on "warm" it was still moist and good to eat.I don't think the (non-user replaceable) clock battery is an issue if you leave the unit plugged in most of the time like I do.  It's only used when the AC power fails or it is unplugged.  If you leave the cooker on the shelf for months at a time, it might be an issue.
I got this for sifting flours when baking.  It's well-made and was reasonably priced.  I'm happy with my purchase and recommend it to others.
I am using this on my table and I like it for everyday. It does not tip over and is easy to fill.
I use this as a towel rack. It works well and looks very nice.  4 stars because it was a bit crooked and I had to straighten it out a bit.

Perhaps I'm doing something wrong because I've had to watch this machine the entire 5 minutes it takes to cook.  One thing I did learn is not to put the cheese on in the cooking cycle; it burns and leaves a mess to clean up.  It doesn't work on bagels, they're too big and get stuck. So after adding the egg, then I waited a couple minutes to add the muffin and then the cheese at the end I might as well as cooked it from scratch in a skillet on the stove. Perhaps the benefit is not having to get a toaster out but that's about it.  I would probably recommend for an apartment dweller that is tight on space because you could make fried bologna, ham and swiss, etc sandwiches with this machine.  You'd just have to have them on english muffins. Good if you don't have a stove.  My big concern is the english muffin sitting on top of the raw egg; is that safe because some of the time it seems like the egg didn't fully cook. Hummmm...just make me leery.
summary: Hummm...english muffin actually sits on raw egg?

reviewText: This set of baking mats are very nice.  There are 3 mats of different sizes. You don't have to use any oil to keep things from sticking.  These mats can be used in the over, microwave, and can even be put in the freezer.  I love the idea that food doesn't stick to the mat.  Just use some warm water and soap to clean them. They can be used on the counter to roll dough out .  One thing to remember, don't use a sharp object on the mat.  It will cut the mat. I couldn't believe how easy this is to clean and store. I recommend you try this product.
After tons of research I chose this breadmaker and I love it.  It seems that all breadmakers brown the bread too much for me, but "light" setting is acceptable.

reviewerName: H. Chen "Black Rice - Born To Dye"
reviewText: Pros:1. Portable2. Easy to use3. Powerful enough to suck in small debris, in my case mostly scattered cat litter.4. Washable filter cup, saving quite some bucksCons:1. Battery doesn't last long between charges. After a few minutes it would start to weaken and lose a lot of sucking power.2. If you or your family ever happens to forget assemble the filter cup in before use, it'd be discovered the hard way, debris would be sucked into the enclosure and require a manual disassemble to clean the accident out, which could damage the unit, especially the wires connecting to the connector supplying power to the motorized brush, and void warranty.3. Smaller debris are easily trapped between the plastic that protects wires running inside the vacuum tube. Debris get stuck so easily but are impossible to get out, causing odor in the long run.4. Motorized brush doesn't work well on thick carpet and loosed cat fur, which would wind itself on the brush, causing it to loose cleaning capability.Other thoughts:I ended up taking out the plastic wire-cover to prevent long-lasting trapped debris. It has no evident effect of functionality, except the wires are no longer protected. Usually there is no such sharp debris to cut wires, nevertheless.
summary: Pretty Powerful, But Short Battery Life And Some Flaws

reviewText: It will crush whatever food you try to crush.  aluminum, so it's light.  crushing nuts is the best way to use it.
The item arrive with good deliver and service. The electric barbeque is good that started cooking meat there and taste delicious i don't know why but when i start using this the food taste better.
It has been working well for three months. No problems. Quick cook. Rice done in 25 minutes. But the heat may be too strong that the rice may get hard at the bottom.
Great k cup storage that fits well under my keurig, would recommend for all keurig owners. Looks decent as well.

When I first saw this item I was excited. My wife and I use plastic containers for food all the time, but the tops break pathetically quickly, leaving the heavier-duty bottoms like sad little orphans. So as I said, this was highly anticipated. Unfortunately, it's an awkward size -- too big to take with someone for lunch or snack, yet too small to store any significant quantity of leftovers at home. The one really good thing is the small container -- that is perfect for taking salad dressing.  Other than the size issue it seems to be a well make product -- I just wish it was more practical.

reviewerName: Jeri Zerr "formerly a Road Warrior of the Nth...
reviewText: After too many years of getting frustrated when our so-called HEPA filtration bagless vacuums ended up spewing dust everywhere and they needed frequent thorough cleaning and washing of sponges, tanks and parts that then needed to be left out to air dry lest they mold in the closet, we returned to the convenience and sanity of a bagged vacuum that happened to come with a canister vac - theHoover Platinum Lightweight Upright Vacuum with Canister, Bagged, UH30010COM. After a year I am still in love with our Hoover Platinum system, but that's a story for the review of the vacuum.These Hoover Platinum HEPA bags are very durable and made of very good quality. They are a breeze to change and do not require any cleaning of filters or other nonsense, ever. SO HAPPY! They also are great at cutting down odor from having an indoor dog - if the bag starts to smell when the vacuum is running it's time to replace. That simple!Even with a German Shepherd Dog indoors full-time (senior) and a younger GSD indoors part time, we've only used 8 Q bags and 4 I bags in the past 12 months as calculated based upon my purchase history since I bought the Hoover set 12 months ago.Watch for the 4 for 3 promotion on this 2 pack, or look at the multi-paks that come with both the I bags (Canister) and the Q bags (upright) such asHoover Platinum HEPA Bags: 4 Q bags & 4 I Bags. I will definitely buy again!
summary: Ok value, exceptional quality! Very thick and durable

reviewText: I bought this specifically for the carpeted stairs in my home. After a few uses, the battery stopped working. Called Shark and they sent me new battery free of charge. That battery also stopped working after a few uses. When it does work, the suction is so poor that the accessory tool (stuck to back of unit to get into crevices) can't even suck up a grain of rice. Most cordless vacuums are not great, I'll grant you that much, but this is by far the worst cordless stick vac I have ever had. I have given up on all cordless vacs until the technology improves. I really didn't even buy this because it was cordless, I bought it because it is lightweight and I thought it would make vacuuming the stairs easier; lightweight or not, it doesn't even work. Stay away from this product!!!

It was okay but needed to be heated prior to use to make the crust crispy. That means you have to transfer the pizza to a hot stone after it's made up, which is not always so easy to do. Hard to clean, I finally bought a different stone that was more expensive but cleans better and does not need pre-heating.
summary: Did not have great luck with this.

reviewerName: Mom of an ultimate frisbee geek
reviewText: I bought this for my elderly mom who is always cold.  She loves it and sleeps much better at night.Most definitely would buy this again.

Good thick material, but top sheet was cut and sewn bad. Was 6 inch difference from the top to bottom. You will not be able to fold 4 corners together. Do have pictures to show the problem. Didn't like the stitching on pillow cases. Hope you like ironing.

It is not as soft as I expected. I buy the same thread count from Ikea for $10 more and it is much nicer. I cannot use the pillow case because it is a bit scratchy on my face.Also it did shrink just a little but now it is a struggle to get them on my mattress, which is 12 inches deep. So no, i do not recommend this. Pay the extra $10 and get it from Ikea.
summary: Not a good product for the money

reviewText: Took 2 weeks to arrive and in addition isn't dishwasher safe. It becomes black and leaves marks on the food. Am buying the old plastic one and binning this one.
I have had many food processors.  This one kind of smallish compared to my others and this limits what you can put into it.  Very good price but this one harder to use than my Cusinart.
bought these for a fun addition to our bar collection but didn't want to spend a lot. These are perfect, nice weight, look more expensive than they are, very versatile.

This is a really nice Duvet Cover Set and it was a gift for a family member who really loved it!  I can't say enough good about this ....however...it was shipped by FedEx and the package it was delivered in was in shreds and taped with duck tape!  The Duvet was hanging out of the box even!  I am just glad it arrived in one piece but as far as FedEx goes...they stink...I have had many problems with them before and I try not to deal with them but had no choice in this matter!  I am so surprised at the condition of this box and I do have photos of it.  There was no excuse for this to happen especially with the prices of shipping that they charge!

Great Cooker!!!! I got mine for $15 at Walmart though!!!! I almost bought a 6 qt digital one but I'm really glad i got a 4qt for two people... it's perfect + extra for leftovers. Cooks great... reliable...not the latest technology but it gets it done well!!!
I always knew that wilton has the best stuff out there for baking.. I am very pleased with the product and expect it to last long.

The French press has been around for decades in Europe, an easy alternative to pricier espresso machines and Italian stovetop Moka pots. Bodum is the foremost name in quality French press pots (styles include the Chambord, Brazil, Kenya, and Eileen), and the Chambord is the flagship line, available in 3, 4, 8, and 12 cups.*NOTE*: the "cups" listed on the box refers to the *European* 4-oz. espresso cup, not a 6- or 8-oz. U.S. cup, so the U.S. measurements are: 3 cup = 1.5 U.S. (12 oz.), 4 cup = 2 U.S. (16 oz.), 8 cup = 4 U.S. (32 oz.) and 12 cup = 6 U.S. (48 oz.).The Chambord press is simple, efficient, and stylish, and most importantly, solidly constructed. Made of a borosilicate beaker and chromed brass with a molded handle, with proper care, it will last for years. Parts are dishwasher safe, but I prefer to hand wash. There are a number of cheap, made-in-China imposters to be found in discount kitchen stores, but these do not compare to the Portuguese-made originals.Because the French press takes a coarser grind and doesn't use a paper filter, this allows the coffee's oils and essences to be extracted 100% for a full-bodied, intense brew reminiscent of espresso. Unflavoured dark roasts yield the best results.To make the perfect cup of French press coffee, use one Bodum scoop (2 Tbsp, included) per 4-oz. cup of coffee (coarse grind ONLY). Add hot, not boiling water, stir with a chopstick or plastic spoon, and put the lid on (with the filter pulled to the top in the closed position). Do not press down. Allow grounds to steep for four minutes. Leaving the spout in the closed position, grasp the handle firmly with the spout pointed away from you. Using the flat of your hand, push the handle down *slowly and evenly* (if you shove the handle down, there is a chance that scalding coffee may shoot out!) until the filter is at the bottom of the carafe. Pour and enjoy. Be sure to thoroughly clean the filter after each use. Replacement carafes and filter parts are available from Bodum's website, [...] Say goodbye to stale, bland coffee; take the plunge (bad French press pun intended!) with Bodum's Chambord and see what you've been missing!
summary: Avoid cheap imitations...Bodum Chambord is the *original* French press. As the Bodum box says, "Give up bad coffee for good!"

reviewText: Having been through a variety of teakettles over a 40 year period, I'm definite about preferring function to form at this point. I love good-looking, but not if it means dreading actually using the item. I read a lot of reviews before deciding on this kettle. I figured at this price, if my husband and I did not like it, at least we wouldn't have spent a lot on it. We like it! It is not of great quality. The first one arrived with the whistle lid broken off, but Amazon sent out another the same day I reported it. The metal and workmanship remind me of a child's toy cookware set, but if it holds up well, it's acceptable because it works well (and to me, it's more handsome than many more expensive kettles). My husband uses it most often, making French press coffee several time a day. He told me just yesterday that it is easy to pour out of and the water boils so much faster than in our previous tall narrow kettle that he often can't get the grounds ready before the water is ready. I recall that another reviewer said her 8 year old son can use it with ease to make himself cocoa, so we concur that it's easy to manage. The whistle lid is almost silent, however, so I'd say if that's really important to you, don't count on the whistle. For us, it boils water so quickly that we don't have to rely on the whistle. After a couple months' use, we are satisfied customers.
I have these decorative towels hanging and I love them so much I go in just to look at my restroom lol

Great coffeemaker. This works so much better than our old Mr. Coffee. The thermal carafe truly hold the coffee hot for quite some time after brewing. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone looking for a new coffeemaker.

Thank you to those who noted a problem with wood splitting and those who advised to avoid setting the mills down on a damp surface. We had gone through a number of poorly made pepper grinders before finding that the Peugeot grinding mechanism is simply "the best" for quality and durability.  I have owned one for ten years that works as wonderfully today as when brand new. Passed it on to my Daughter, so bought the 9in pepper and salt grinders in natural finish.  I noted that the bottom edge and tooled wooden surfaces below the plastic components of the grind adjustment dial were unfinished wood; which could "wick up" water and swell, thereby causing joinery seams to crack.  To provide additional insurance against this possibility, I took a couple of minutes to seal this bare wood by using a cotton tipped applicator to apply a modest coating of olive oil. Now look forward to many years of service.Update 2/12:  The coating applied to the bare wood seems to have sealed the surface nicely, without affecting function.  Now if i just don't drop it as someone mentioned it should last a long time.  Caution: This item qualifies for super saver shipping.  Be sure to change from the default setting before finalizing your transaction!  Join me in encouraging Amazon to set super saver shipping as the default choice, to avoid the appearance of a deceptive practice of inserting undesired shipping charges for what should be an "upgrade" option.  Peace Out
summary: AVOID POTENTIAL PROBLEMS WITH A GREAT GRINDER

reviewText: I absolutely LOVE this product. Was very surprised how wonderful it is, because the price was so low. My only negative is that instead of a regular measuring cup, they've included one, and if you lose it, you might be out of luck for perfect measurements. Super little appliance!

I have not used a crock pot in a long time.  But, with my schedule, I decided to purchase another and start using it.  I am so glad I did.  I love it.  I have many more options for cooking on this than my others.  It being digital was a plus for me, and I love the handles that clamp down for ease in carrying.  I have used it many times over the last month and loving it so far.
I ordered this item in February. It is now the end of April. Don't believe the "usually ships in 8 to 10 days" line they have up there, this item takes forever to get shipped, at least it did for me

First off, no manual but a quick start card, so you'll want to go to the fitbit web site and read the manual first.  It'll simplify things.Setup was a pain in the butt.  If you don't have a smart phone or a wireless laptop, you cant configure the device.  Both methods require going to a site on the phone/laptop, running some software, changing your wireless access point from your regular one to the scale, configuring the scale, then switching back to your regular access point.  Clearly a product designed by 20-somethings that grew up with facebook and smart phones, and are comfortable with jiggling wifi settings.  NOT a high touch install and setup.For whatever reason, our one wireless laptop would connect to but not allow configuration.  I never tried to figure out why, just used the smart phone.  This induces a situation where the phone wants to look for the scale to configure it, and the scale must be in setup mode, but the phone process was cumbersome enough that the scale would sometimes time out of setup mode before I got to the part of the setup where the phone would look for it.  Then you have to remove a battery, wait ten seconds, go back to the phone and restart the setup and try to get it done before it times out again.It was completely non obvious to me how to add other users.  But in reading the manual you set up the primary person, and then they go to their devices on the fitbit dashboard and from there they can invite up to 7 more people by sending them an email.  When they click on 'accept' in the email they're added to the scales users.  I didnt go far enough to determine how you would tell it specifically who was who if you had a lot of people on it.  It can tell the difference between people if there is a large weight discrepancy, say my wife being 120lbs and I'm 180.  So it knows which of us is which when we step on.  But if we had a teenager that was close to my wifes weight, you'd have to have a way to tell it.  Whatever that is!Only other thing I noted from removing and replacing the batteries 57 times is that the springs that hold the battery at each end seem like they aren't the strongest or best made.  Hopefully it wont require battery changes that often.Once set up, it worked fine.  The scale takes your weight and then extrapolates the fat % and BMI based on your sex, height, weight and so forth.  There is a 'lean' or 'athletic' option because this type of calculation doesnt work for people with low body fat content.  Each time you step on the scale it weighs and calculates the bmi and fat % and uploads it immediately to your fitbit dashboard.  The integration is nice, as I can weigh myself repeatedly throughout the day and have it pop up automatically.I noted that like the fitbit ultra, the dashboard doesn't report the battery status of the unit correctly.  The laptop said the scale was down to 1/4 battery but they were brand new, and my other computer says it has nearly a full charge.So a large amount of improvement on the setup polishing (this would have been a lot easier with a usb port on it and some software) and I expect they'll have some frustrated returns of the product until that area becomes push button simple.  Also looks like there needs to be a little more polishing around the user interface on the computer end as well, but I've already found a number of bugs in the fitbit web site.  Hopefully they'll get there.My limited experience with fitbit support wasn't pleasing.  They're only open m-f during extended business hours, they do not do phone or chat, and they take a day or two to respond to an email.  Mine specifically noted that my fitbit ultra wasn't working at all and that I'd tried upgrading the firmware and resetting it, but it was dead.  Two days later I got the most unhelpful suggestion to upgrade the firmware, which I'd already said I'd tried.  So instead of trying to process a return with this 24-48 hour turnaround email support, I just returned the fitbit to amazon and got a replacement from them.Very cool technology.  We have two ultras and the aria.  I've lost 60lbs so far, but most of it without these tools.  With them I have much better recording of my efforts and intakes and with most of it being automatic, its a huge facilitator in the effort to work out, lose weight and feel better.  Its just that my immediate reliability and ease of installing the fitbit products aren't quite where they need to be.Lastly, I sure would appreciate it if fitbit would package their products more simply and reduce the price a bit.  The packaging is lovely, very well done and quite high end.  But since I'm a retired marketing guy, I know its expensive to package this way.Edit: The scale has been working fine for us, but I think I found another problem.  I liked weighing myself 3-4 times a day with my old scale, just to see how different things affected my weight like hydration, workouts, etc.  But I'm hesitant to step on this scale aside from my first thing morning weigh-in because its going to transmit that data to the fitbit web site.  I'll have to look but I didnt see anything about a 'weigh only and dont report' option.The other annoying thing is that I started this odyssey at 247 and I'm at 189 now, but the fitbit web site says I've only lost 51.5 pounds.  I actually didnt catch that, but my 7 year old was looking over my shoulder and commented that the math was wrong. I did have some problems with the fitbit web site taking weight input for dates in the future when I typed in the wrong info.  No limit checking apparently.  So there were some 'future weights' that kept messing up my charts.  Maybe thats still a problem.These products really have enormous potential and I've used them extensively in the short time I've had them...but the setup and the web site polish needs a lot of work.
summary: The setup needed more work before releasing this

reviewText: I ordered these when I broke one that I had.  I love these little minis much more than larger s/p shakers, the size is nice and they appear whimsical.  And because I received so many of them, I have given a couple of sets away.
A lot of bang for the buck. The different colors are very handy and they wash in the dishwasher well.
Item arrived ahead of schedule.  Easy to put together and is a big help in organizing my closet.  Highly recommend.

I love these scissors!  The are by far the best kitchen shears I've ever used.  The cutting is so smooth and effortless.  The large handles are a nice feature.  Makes them very comfortable to use.  The blades are not very long but are extremely sharp.  They are great for snipping.  The two handles come apart for easy cleaning.  That's a great feature.  They measure about 8 3/4" inches.  The handles are made of a soft material and the blades are stainless steel.

These toothpicks are the cats meow. We stumbled across this style of toothpicks in a restaurant and immediately feel in love with them. I was unable to find them in any local store. So I bought them from Amazon.
This oven is very large and well made.The only thing I've found negative is warm up time, seems to take longer than my old one but that's an easy adjustment:-)
The material seems to be soft but it does the job and holds okay. You should not have a problem with this.
summary: soft, but it does its job.

reviewText: The sieve is not as deep as i expected (i don't know why i expected a very deep basket..) however, the mesh is SUPER HEAVY DUTY.  This is not a cheap-o single weave mesh.  there are several layers of mesh and the mesh is very sturdy.  It does nto flex easily.  Fantastic for light use for dusting large surfaces with sugar (or flour) as well as straining heavy vegetables (broccoli) or pasta

I bought this blender to use for making frozen drinks... margaritas, daquiris, etc.  I looked at the machines specifically for making "frozen concoctions", but settled on this one because of the price difference and also because the other machines were too large for my kitchen counter.  I'm very happy with it.  I used ice straight from the refrigerator ice-maker, along with either liquid or frozen mixers.  The end result was smooth and creamy, just like the ones from commercial machines - no little ice chunks to clog your straw! This blender has an ice-crushing feature that automatically pulses while in use to prevent overheating the motor. I did find that adding a little extra liquid (juice or even water) helped to keep it running smoothly.  Great buy.
This blanket will be around for years. The blanket is a quality construction and good materials we will have this for years to come.

This is a great microwave, but the stainless steel outside is very difficult to keep clean and free of smudges and fingerprints. I would buy a different one if I had it to do all over again.  I would prefer plastic exterior that cleans up easily.  Otherwise, it is a very good microwave.  Thanks again.
summary: 4 stars only because of how hard it is to keep outside free of fingerprints.

reviewText: Bought this to organize hats and other things inside our coat closet.  Worked out very well and hold a lot.
summary: Great for things other than shoes

reviewText: I have used this to cook everything from pizza and fries to texas toast and chicken breasts.Everything I use it on cooks really evenly and bread and crust crisps right up.Great non-stick surface, I just wipe it off with a paper towel after I am done each time.Nice heavy, durable pan.
Its big, its heavy, it has a nice marble pattern to it and it holds an entire stick of butter - just make sure the butter is pliable before you put it in

I love this soap dish because i can choose where to apply it and the suction cup is very strong.  Just be sure when you apply it to have it open all the way, wet the suction cup, apply pressure to get a good suction and then fold down and it holds tight!  Just do not apply so much pressure that you break it.

My experience with electric can openers is not the best.  Most of them are flimsy and don't work very well.  This one does a very nice job so far, even compared to expensive openers I have owned.  Of course, the true test is to see how long it lasts.  More later.

I have had one of these since 1981.  It is the best ever. When I saw this product at $30, I wanted to buy all of them, but just bought one.My original will last another 30 years. I have a back up just in case.  I don't know why I'll ever need it.Seriously, if you can buy this monster for $30, buy a bunch and give them away.  This is the best pan ever for searing, sauces and whatever you want to do.
summary: Absolutely the best Steak Frying Pan of All Time

reviewText: I run a fan at night as white noise but also to keep cool.This fan does both jobs well! I would highly recommend this fan.On setting 1, it's fast enough to cool my room.

This was a gift for my son, but he likes it and uses it every day. It's a little smaller than I had envisioned, but it's good quality and just the color of red he wanted. He's a Liverpool Soccer fan. It holds the heat and is easy to clean.

After several months of use, I can't find anything that I don't like about this amazing tool !! It's handy and quick for measuring the temperature of just about anything you can think of !!Bought another one for daughter !!I check the auto A/C output, set the refrigerator and freezer temperatures, set the water heater temperature, and check my computer and peripherals for hot spots -- Indoors and outside, the Mastercool Infra-red gun gets the job done !!The wife uses it for cooking and baking. Daughter uses hers to take her horse's temperature and keep track of ovulation (hers AND the horse's! ).This tool is amazingly accurate  -- much more-so than I expected for the low price!!The carry-case is sturdy and protects the tool very well.Highly recommended !!Both of my units were shipped (separately) quickly and arrived in perfect conditionThanks, Amazon !!
I love this pan I have been using now for about a month and had no problems. Nothing stickes to it, Works great. I highly reccomend this one.

I was searching for a comforter for the guest bedroom and didn't want anything too expensive but wanted something to be able to keep my guests warm (my husband and I like it super super cold in the house at night). After reading some of the other reviews, I decided to go ahead and make the purchase (the price was nice too). I like it so far. I will say it is thinner than what I imagined a down comforter would be, however it's still thick enough and provides enough warmth without being too thick that you would be hot and sweaty (we live in Houston). I like that each individual box is stitched so there is no shifting in the filler. There is nothing more annoying than having flat spots and puffy spots on your comforter. Would definitely buy again!

These knives are so sharp--almost dangerously sharp if you're not used to using sharp knives.  They hold their edge through a lot of use, are easy to sharpen, and are priced right so you can keep several in your collection.  I loved the first one I bought so much that I got two more.  I also highly recommend the 6 piece Steak Knife setVictorinox 48792 Cutlery 6 Piece Steak
This rolling pin works very well.  It rolls pastry and pizza dough easily and evenly.  When well-floured, the dough does not stick.  It is easy to clean.,

This juicer came to me as "remanufactured" but it looks like it is brand new.  I have had other juicers that I gladly passed of to other members of the family.  Not this one.  It is much easier to use and I believe you can put larger pcs of veggies/fruit in it.  The pulp really comes out pretty "dry".  Great, good looking unit.

This is not an ideal design. A few vices really undercut its virtues. I think the flaws should be mentioned first because they are potential deal breakers.The outside surface is smooth metal, the shape is basically an inverted pear making it top heavy, there is no rubber on the base and the base is narrower than any other cup of this type that I have tried. All of this amounts to an unstable design prone to tipping over and not securely seating in a cup holder. Every time I use this I have to tape something to the base bulking it up and countering the smooth metal surface so it fits snugly in a cup holder.Also, the parts to the lid which are designed to make it leak proof require disassembling to clean. If you are not very very careful reassembling the pieces it will leak. The key is to have the lid in the "closed" position so the gasket/seal does not shift when attaching the lid to the base. Other people have mentioned a need to release the pressure so I initially screwed the lid on in the open position then closed it once it was tight. This allows the gasket potential room to to move resulting in a compromised seal. In the closed position there is a disk that holds the gasket in place thus preventing it from moving if it hits one of the sides of the base.Other people have mentioned the paint eventually chipping or peeling. I just received this but it appears to be painted very well, almost like auto paint. I have doubts this will develop the problems that some people have experienced. At this stage I'd say Thermos has addressed the chipping/peeling problem.The coffee does stay hot for as long as it takes to finish every drop, generally several hours. That is something I appreciate.Overall, the proclivity towards tipping over and even falling out of a cup holder due to the slick surface and top heavy design outweighs its ability to keep coffee hot for an extended period.
summary: Sorry to say the bad outweighs the good

reviewText: If you are looking for incredibly soft pillows, go with these.  They were incredibly fluffy when I first got them, and your head just sinks right into them.  I sleep with one of these and a firmer pillow underneath, which seems to be a great combination.  They are starting to collapse a little after a couple of weeks, so they aren't quite filling out the pillow case as fully as they once did.  I will probably need to wash them soon; hopefully they fluff back up.

This was my first Calphalon purchase, and my first ever commercial anodized aluminum pan.  I am extremely pleased with  the quality of this pan's construction - this pan is HEAVY duty.  The first night I had it I tried the chicken recipe that came with the pan and it blew my family away!  If there is a downside to this pan it is its size.  At 2 1/2 quarts, its small size would not hold 3 raw split chicken breasts, so I had to brown 2, set them aside, brown the third, and then add the first two back in.  On the upside, this cooking surface has unbelievable abilities to brown meat at a fairly low burner setting, it deglazes beautifully, goes right into the oven without worry, and as long as you follow the "rules" for cooking with this type of surface (which are included), it cleans fairly easily.  I highly recommend this pan and predict that I will be buying many more pans in this product line in the future.
summary: It changes the way you cook!

reviewText: I bought this for my daughter for her college dorm room recently.  Last time I saw her she commented that this little vacuum was "awesomely powerful!".  She has linoleum floors with an area rug next to her bed and she found that the settings for hard floor and carpet worked great.  If she is willing to actually clean I am happy!
I purchased one of these years ago.  The new one looks great.  Perfect for my q-tips and cotton pads.  Very clean look on bathroom counter
This really helps to showcase your best muffins and cupcakes.  It is similar to having wrapping paper and a ribbon for your prize baked goods.
summary: Get fancy with your muffins and cupcakes

reviewText: I bought this right after I was diagnosed with Celiac Disease. I had made some gluten free cupcakes and I was not real impressed with the taste/texture of them. Well I solved that real quick with my Cuisipro Cupcake Corer, I used it on each of my cupcakes and filled them with jams and jellies. YUM!!! I have since become a better gluten free baker as I've learned to use the gluten free flours now, but I still use my Cupcake Corer!!  A must have for those that must be gluten free.
Cute addition to the set. Price was a little high. But to have everything match was worth it. Easy to clean.

Bought this for my hubs - it does exactly what it says it will do!  We weigh the meat on a digital scale and use this bad boy to press out our burgers between wax paper squares that we also bought from amazon - it's super easy and definitely speeds up the process!  My only complaint is it can be hard to press down and sometimes the burgers come out a little flatter on one side than another depending on the pressure applied, but we can live with that - handmade they were certainly NOT even!

The Braun PowerMax MX2050 was top-rated and listed as a CR Best Buy in the December 2004 issue of Consumer Reports. According to the text, the current model passed the severe durability test: 50 minute-long ice-crushing cycles. Evidently, durability improvements have been made in the model. The negative comments may have been made by buyers of the "old" model.

I bought 2 sets of these for general purpose family use and so far they are a big hit.  They made it through the dishwasher well, a little spotty, but I think that was mainly due to my kids doing a poor job loading the dishwasher.  Other dishwasher loads have gone through without problems (and I'm using just the generic costco dish detergent.The tumblers are thick and strong and fit well stacked together.  I'm hope and expect these to last a long time.

Alright, let me start off by saying that I bought both soft and firm high-loft pillows so I can compare.  Both pillows are fantastic.  But I'll tell you this, don't bother with low loft.  The high-lot pillows are only about as tall as the length of your hand, and they compress a lot from there.  In fact, the soft high-loft pillow compress to about 1" when you lay on it, which is great for stomach sleepers.  But given the compression, low loft is completely unnecessary.The soft pillow will give you a true floating in clouds feeling which is hard to describe yet extremely comfortable.  The firm pillow still has that effect, with less sinking in.But to be honest, I could quite easily mistake one for the other.  I tend to like softer pillows but have found the firm pillow to still be very soft and comfortable.My only caution is that side sleepers will likely not like the soft pillow.  It just compresses too much.  Go for the firmer pillow.  In fact, if you aren't sure or like to sleep in different positions, go for the firm pillow.There is a rubber like smell for the first couple of days (I didn't leave them outside to air out, the stench didn't bother me that much).  It's permanently gone in both pillows now so in the long run it doesn't matter.Bottom line is these are the best pillows I've ever bought and they compliment my latex mattress nicely.  They really are extremely comfortable.
summary: I bought both soft and firm

reviewText: Apparently I concur with almost everybody else!  We did lots of research to find a blender to make smoothies and frozen drinks.  We were careful to use small chunks of ice and followed the directions that came with the blender, but after a few uses the plastic teeth at the base of the pitcher broke off.  The teeth probably should be made of metal.  Otherwise, it's a great blender and works as advertised. Strange to find this type of problem in a Braun.

At first I thought it would be too soft the way my hand easily pushed all the way down when I first tested it.  But after the first night and all others until now I think this pillow is just right.  Not to soft, not to firm.  But as the saying goes," time will tell" Lets see how it feels a year from now.
Despite not being a fan of Sears, this product came to my house quickly and was exactly the right one.
It is perfect for travel as we use this thermos for ready tea only. Only the problem is, sometimes open activity is complicated for thermos.
I like these because the bigger handles are nice for my arthritic fingers.  Easier to hold on to.  Arrived right on time.

I haven't quite figured out yet which way to put the slicing disk to get the desired slice.  I have sliced ginger, tomatoes and onions.  The tomato and onions have come out perfect slice for sandwiches.  It's a good product.

AFTER 2 1/2 YEARS, THIS MATTRESS TOPPER IS COLLAPSING AND NO LONGER SUPPORTS. IT HURTS TO SLEEP ON MY SIDE. WE ARE SIDE SLEEPERS THUS THE REASON WE CHOSE THIS BRAND. I NOW AM WAKING UP WITH THE SAME SORENESS THAT I HAD BEFORE PURCHASING THIS ITEM. I HAVE NEVER HEARD OF MEMORY FOAM WEARING OUT. WELL WITH THE "LIMITED" 2 YEAR WARRANTY, LETS SEE HOW THE SELLER DOES….I'LL UPDATE MY REVIEW ONCE I CONTACT THE SELLER.
I get good circulation from this fan for its size.  I've used it in the bedroom and living room.  I really like the vintage styling.  I find it a bit loud for the bedroom, but acceptable.

This thing is great.  I don't care if it only lasts a year since it's so cheap.  The last aluminum slicer I had fell to pieces within a couple of months.  The plastic one cracked apart within a few months.  This one goes in the dishwasher and right back into service.

The concept is great. However, these small blenders don't pack the necessary power for my type of use. I need something heavy duty. I have a Vitamix and am used to the power of this type of blender. I like to mix frozen berries into smoothies and this wasn't very good at doing this for me. So, this was a huge step down for me in terms of power. Since I purchased this item at Costco I was glad to not have to receive this item in the mail, only to have to pay for return shipping.I guess it's fine for very small jobs but it will not give you the power to do everything. I'll stick with a Vitamix.
summary: Bought this at Costco and returned it the next day.

reviewText: I continue to love this purchase!  They bake the best stuffed bell peppers every time I cook them.  I leave this out on my counter just to admire every day.  Very happy with purchase and highly recommend!

Skeptical at first, we quickly took a liking to the avocado slicer.  As avocado enthusiasts, we eat a lot of them.  This tool does indeed split the avocado easily.  It separates (and at the same time slices) the avocado core effortlessly and neatly from its outer skin.  We’re less excited about the pit-removing feature.  We have yet to use it successfully.  Nevertheless, this is a kitchen gadget that cleans easily, is lightweight yet sturdy, and is unquestionably worthwhile.
summary: Skeptical at first ... not for long!

reviewText: This is the best cordless vacuum cleaner yet.  If you find that the battery wears down too soon, let it run until it quits on its own, and then recharge.  That works for me.  Clean the inner filter by washing every once in awhile, and shake it out every time.  The vacuum cleans dog hair, dirt, and whatever else is on the floor- carpet and hardwood.
summary: I'm getting another one for my vacation home

reviewText: I have always had a problem of my knives not being sharp enough.  I took a chance and bought this product.  Within ten minutes of opening I had sharpened all of my knives, even my serrated steak knives (cheap ones) and my serrated bread knife.  My knives are so sharp and I can cut through everything with ease.  Once I used the course side of the sharpener and then honed them I only have to run the ones I use the most through the honing side and they sharpen easily.  Highly recommended by me.

This tool makes it much easier to vacuum hard floors with my Dyson upright.  The hard floor tool that came with the machine didn't have the bristles that most such tools have. This new one has bristles and it is better for getting up dust and dirt.  It's true that pet hair gets stuck in the bristles and has to be removed by hand but the old attachment would allow the suction of the machine to hold it too tightly to the floor and not slide properly.  We have a collie and I need all the vacuuming help I can get and this does the trick.

On the first bottle that I tried, it worked fine.  The second bottle, the screw went in 1/2 way and refused to move any farther.  I had thrown out my old wine opener so I only had this one.  I had to keep reversing the screw and tried and tried again.  Finally after many tries, it removed the cork.  All I can say is, be sure you have a manual corkscrew as a backup in case it acts up.

I had a non-stick rolling pin that worked very well for me until little pieces started flaking off into my dough.  I wanted a better quality rolling pin - but i wanted it to actually roll.  I'm not a fan of the one piece designs.  I was amazed at how well this works.  Flour sticks to it perfectly and dough does not.  It is a little heavier than I'm used to but that makes it easy to roll the dough.
summary: Flour sticks to it perfectly and dough does not.

reviewText: I drink a LOT of water each day, but I bought this specifically to do flavor-infused water (adding thin slices of cucumber, lemons, and some mint).  One gallon is too small for my needs since I drink it all day long.  No fault of the product's for not meeting my needs, but make sure one gallon is enough for your needs.  It's not a lot of water.
summary: Too Small to be Really Useful

reviewText: These are great..  I hung some cups with these and they look so nice.. a good way to store them on the wall... There are many uses for these, and I like the clear ones the best ... the smaller ones I used to pull back wires that were too visable and in the way... I anticipate that I will find even more uses for them.. and will want more...  Again, getting them Amazon made it easy to purchase...
Just purchased these place mats for the Holidays. The quality of the workmanship is excellent, and the mats are beautiful.
summary: Park B Smith Wine Classic  6 piece placemat

reviewText: I recently purchased the 11-inch and after just a week I've ordered the 8-inch also. It's just a great pan. It holds the heat well, easy to handle -much easier than regular cast iron - browns food beautifully and is easy to clean up. My only complaint  is that the 11-inch in terms of the cooking area is really more or less the same  as a 10-inch since the sides slope quite a bit. A minor issue, however, and I like the somewhat deeper sides than my other skillets. I've tried all kinds of non-stick as well as regular  anodized Calphalon and  so far I like  this better than any of them.

I have some Cuisinart pans that are over twenty years old, and yet (properly cleaned) they shine like they did when brand new.  If you are in need for your own kitchen,  or (especially) for something like a wedding gift or other special occasion, you'll never go wrong with this set.  People love getting them!  And, kudos to Amazon for always getting them delivered on time!

I did a lot of research prior to buying this juicer.  I found a lot of information on this juicer that was helpful in making the decision.  There are plenty of folks with tips on how to quickly clean, juice, etc..The juicer works very well.  You can make continuous juice and the pulp can be easily used for other recipes.  It is very easy to clean and store.Just wanted to add to the list of satisfied customers.  Definitely check out other reviews and information to ensure that this type of juicer is what you want, as each juicer will produce different types of juice and have different health benefits.
summary: Great juicer, easy to clean and juices very well

reviewText: I bought these because I'm always baking and cooking.  I also purchased the matching spoons.  I really like them, they're not cheaply made and I like that the measurement won't wear off.  It's imprinted in the plastic.

As a chef, I use these kinds of graters or rasps frequently. Zest, cheese, nutmeg, garlic, whatever it might be. We have always used Microplane and nothing else. But this Cuisipro grater is really just as good. It is shorter than the Microplane, but I'm not certain that that is necessarily a drawback. It does have a protective cover, but unlike the Microplane cover, this one can double as a "catcher" for whatever you are grating. At first I thought this was superfluous and unnecessary, but more and more I find it pretty useful. I'm not sure how much the volume measurements would really be used, though.It is comfortable and works great. It has a rubber grip at the far end to keep it from sliding (though I think Microplane is starting to do this also). The price is pretty comparable too. I would say either are great. Go with what you know, or grab both in a store and see which one is more comfortable. Great product!
Very good quality.  This is designed as advertised and well made.  I highly recommend this product and am very pleased with the manufacturer.

There are two parts here, the gasket and the blades.  So far I can tell no difference in quality between the Oster orginal and this Knock-off blade.  I am so far pleased with the blade part.The gasket is made of a lesser quality material and is slightly smaller.  It is already crumbling.

If you are looking for the quality of All-Clad or Calphalon but not necessarily willing to fork over the dough, then this is a great set for the money. Fast, even heating; good looks; versatility (stove to oven to even freezer, if need be...); and a decent combination of pieces in the set made it the perfect choice for me, after nearly a year of research.I don't find it as difficult to clean as other reviewers have commented. I will say that the mirror finish does show wear after just a few uses. It's not bad, by any means, but just know they won't stay perfect if you plan to use them. A few notes...*They heat up fast! Don't ever leave the pan to heat up and do something else while waiting. You'll be at the temp you need lickety split.*It's a good idea to soak them a bit after cooking something sticky--then cleanup is a breeze.*Lid handles do get hot when covering to allow something to simmer or boil, but I've found my handles stay cool enough to take off the stove with no problem.*I have yet to stick them in the dishwasher, but I know you can, so that's a plus. I have a tendency to soak them, wash them, and dry them right away so as not to get the water spots on the pretty finish that others have commented on.All in all, I'm very happy with this set. After years of hand-me-downs with handles falling off, dented sides, and nonstick coating that wears off in no time, I feel safe and healthy cooking with my new Cuisinart.

I love the fact that this cutter has NO MOVING PARTS that can break. So many other styles have broken--the wheel falls off or the handle loosens and eventually breaks. This style works well, isn't hard on the hand, and chop/cuts lots of other stuff!
Holds up to the heat of my stove's highest burner, and seems to concentrate heat to the wok as well as hold the wok securely on the stovetop burner.
summary: wok ring concentrates heat to wok

reviewText: This fan is great. It was a breeze to put together, it has 3 speeds (low is the quietest and totally sufficient) to move air around and to cool. I am pleased that I made this purchase and would recommend.
I love that I can fold it up for storage or moving. Seems study and feels solid, great match with my new mattress!

Cuisinart 77-7 Chef's Classic Stainless 7-Piece Cookware SetPurchased several pieces of this cookware in addition to a set. Initially, everything was beautiful. However, after a few uses, the skillets (a 10 inch and a 12 inch) both began to stick very badly with every use. I mean every fried egg turned into scrambled egg every time. I cook with a lot of butter and oil, so whatever is fried in them should slip out easily as they did the first few uses. The skillets have not even been used that much (and now you know why) and still look new even though they are pretty useless at this point.I've tried everything from scrubbing them with bar keeper's friend (in case there was some sort of build-up) to leaving them in the cabinet with a oiled paper towel (also known as seasoning) to make them non-stick again. Nothing has worked. When I called the company, I was told that this is typical for these frying pans after a while (a very short while in this case) and there is nothing that can be done to remedy this since it is stainless steel and has no non-stick coating. The company offered to "let" me send them in for an evaluation (my expense and no offer to replace) and that's the extent of their guarantee. Otherwise, I was told "sorry, that's just the way this cookware is."I gave two stars because the pots are good, but stay away from the skillets unless you just feel like wasting your money. I wish someone would have gotten past the good looks of the cookware in their reviews and warned me about the non-practicality of buying the frying pans that you can't fry in.
summary: Give it time and you'll see

reviewText: This mandolin works GREAT, so great that it took off the top of my finger!!!  I guess there is a reason that it comes with a guard, which I now use.  I make the dogs sweet potato treats in our dehydrator and this does a great job of making even chips and fast!
Use this on a regular basis.  Purchased this to replace a similar one that disappeared.Love this one as much as I loved the other!  Thanks for having a great products.
summary: Bought this about a year ago!

reviewText: Streamlined, classic, simple, and an excellent price.  What more can you ask for in a bread box? It fits several loaves at once, and blends seamlessly into any decor.
The DrinkMaster is simple to use and to clean up.  I was disappointed with the size.  I thought it was larger.  Overall I am satisfied with the item.

This unit is very small.  In fact it's about 60% the size of a regular coffee table, and probably about 70% the height.  Don't let the picture fool you.  The picture makes it look like a regular coffee table.  It's not.  It's tiny.  Almost like a toy that you'd give to a little girl to play house.  You'd need to buy 2 of them and line them up side by side to get a regular sized coffee table and then it would still be too low.  Makes for a decent, yet hard, ottoman.  I think if I had guests over they'd laugh at this unit.  It's really quite embarrassing to have in my living room.  I'm tempted to put it in the garbage tomorrow.Then there's the assembly.  It requires allot of glue but they don't give you enough.  One instruction in particular requires guesswork.  I guessed wrong and had to go to the hardware store for additional and larger screws.Bottom line:  If you're a Munchkin or a Hobbit this coffee table might be for you.  Otherwise, do yourself a favor and forget it.I know you're going to say, well what do you expect for $34, right.  Well, forgive me, I was trying to get a bargain, and trying to bypass the obligatory $225 you'd pay for a sheet of plywood and four legs.  If this little coffee table was offered to me in a store for free, I wouldn't take it.  In fact if they gave me $20 to take it, I'd leave it there.  I already realize it was my own stupidity and gullibility that caused this, thank you very much.

This skillet is well made and is very attractive. We use it frequently. After years of using non-stick, coated skillets we are having to learn how to properly use oils, fats, water, etc. to prevent sticking. We have found that this skillet does not seem to require as high a heat setting to cook with it as compared to others we have used.
summary: Well made, but has a learning curve

reviewText: I had a 4-slice toaster (Rival) that was very basic.  This one is much better: the darkness knobs are well marked (4.5 seems to give average toasting); the controls to defrost/bagel/cancel work well.  The sliders are a little tricky as you have to really push them down with some force ALL THE WAY to engage the toasting which I think will break either the knobs or the toaster sooner rather than later (hence the 4, not 5 stars).  The toasting slots are nicely wide enough although I would have liked them to be a bit longer to handle oval-sized bread slices.  Overall, it is surely an upgrade from the basic model I had before.

Works pretty good.  Using 2 scoops to fill this for a perfect cup of coffee.  Saves me tons of money by using my own ground coffee.Only issue is the sealing.  If you pack this too full and don't allow the coffee grounds room to expand you will have water by-pass the coffee and go straight into your cup.  boo!The screen mesh is filtering fine enough for me I don't use a paper filter at all.  The tiny bit of grounds that do make it past are not an issue for me. (very few and very tiny, like dust)
Just bought this to use with my new cast iron wok and I love it!  Really a good quality spatula for a reasonable price.
This works really well with our coffee maker.  We are able to use all kinds of other coffee with it in our machine.

I got this trash can for my kitchen.  It is sleek and clean looking.  I like that it has a lock for the trash bag, so it doesn't fall inside the trash can.  I like the foot pedal for the lid.  Here's the downfall, the sticker (which is huge) on the front of the can is so hard to remove.  I even used adhesive remover and that didn't even help much.  It probably took me 20 minutes to remove the sticker, and I mostly used my finger nails.  All in all, this is a really nice trash can.  OXO might want to consider using different glue for their sticker.
summary: Nice can, but the label is impossible to remove!

reviewText: These glasses bring fluid to my lips and make me very happy.  When alcohol is involved, I'm even happier.  I've yet to actually break one.  Booyah.  Bonus - me!

Usually for regular thickness cuts of meat, I've got it down by regular clock and feel on how long to grill my steaks.  But sometimes I'll get one of those packages from Costco, thick cut steaks, and this thermometer was really helpful to allow me to leave the steak long enough to develop that yummy grill coating on the steak without getting past medium rare.  Got a reading quick enough with an easy to read display.  I'm very much a fan of the red readout on this model!

I purchased this because I have hard wood floor, I thought because it is 19.2V it will be strong but It is not, it is good for very light work . If you have carpet forget about it. They should have make brush part motorized, then it would be stronger. It is very easy to work with it handle beautifully, charging station very nice and easy. But the main thing picking up trash is not there. Is not a good buy.

I was under the impression that this was fully automatic, meaning you didn't need to find a huge spot in an already over crowded freezer to pre-freeze the bowl.  Also, the freezer needs to be zero degrees.  The average refrigerator freezer is NOT zero degrees.  I opened this and expected to have ice cream in 20 minutes, not 13 hours later.  I am disappointed.  It is expensive, especially when the Tastee Freeze down the street has cones for 99 cents!  I am going to pack it up and give it as a gift rather than buy a new deep freezer to accomodate the bowl.
summary: Hope you have a big, VERY COLD freezer

reviewText: Well, apparently, I must.  Seriously though, the clips work like a charm - they do exactly what I purchased them for:  they clip (not too loose; not too tight), and keep my dry foods fresh. Woohoo!  Four stars only because I loathe trendy s***.  (Honestly, what's with the mustache? Who has to decorate their chip-clips with mustaches??  I just don't get it...)
summary: Must I have a mustache to keep my dry foods fresh???

reviewText: I can't believe that I reached the age of 60 and had never owned "real" cooling (baking) racks before and still managed to become a fairly accomplished cook. But I did. Now that I've been using these racks, I don't know how I managed. I DO know that I created way too much work for myself and my kitchen helpers (the rest of the family) by not using the right equipment for specific tasks.PROS: Sturdy and well made, large - but fit perfectly in theLincoln Wear-Ever Standard Duty Half-Size Sheet Pan 18 GUAGE. Not only can you use the racks to cool, but to dry fruit, bake pork chops, cookies and chicken and, you can even put them in the freezer with fresh fruit slices to freeze slices individually. What a versatile kitchen utensil! No warping or rust at joints after six months of use. Like other reviewers noted, I like the smallness of the mesh - I was even able to dry blueberries after washing without having them fall through (see customer photo).CONS: NoneBon appétit!
summary: Wonderful - Love Them - Don't Know How I Cooked Before They Came Into My Life :-) !

reviewText: I bought this last week and used it for the first time yesterday. On the plus side, this peeler is comfortable in my arthritic hand, just like the regular OXO peelers with the soft grip that I've had for years.  Also, this peeler is really sharp.  And that was my problem with it.  It is actually too sharp and seems to slip off of the foods you're peeling too easily onto one's fingers.  I was peeling rhubarb and it was a little slippery.  The serrated peeler took off a very thin layer of the skin very, very easily.  It's that sharp.  But unlike my older, straight-edge peeler, it seemed to slip every few minutes and collide with my index and third fingers, which I was using to hold onto the stalks, much too easily. This happened a few times and I was left with several nasty abrasive cuts.  I tried the peeler again later to make thin strips of a hard cheese.  Again, it was difficult to control without slipping.  So, as much as I admire the ultra-sharpness of the blade, that very sharpness is a problem.  Hence, only 3 stars.

There's no better value in cast iron cookware than these Lodge skillets. They'll last a lifetime if you take care of them properly.This one is tiny but perfect for melting butter, warming a little bit of a sauce, or frying a single egg into a perfect circle. For general cooking, I'd recommend the 10 or 12 inch.
The rubber rings on the tops keep coming off. They're very nice looking and the perfect sizes for all my baking supplies, just don't like constantly having to put those rubber rings back on.
Bought this for my allergies to Dust Mites. I have had it for over a year and it is holding up well. Great product for the price.

I am so in love with these!!! I put grapeseed oil and olive oil in these. They're so perfect for cooking, I can drizzle oil where I want it and it wont spill. Nice to handle and the little trigger thingy snaps shut when you close it! Super easy to use! I am going to buy another set! I highly recommend this to anyone, the price and quality together make a perfect product!!!!
summary: Fantastic to store and cook with!!
