reviewText: Six months and not even a sign of rust! This is the first caddy that hasn't rusted after a few months. It's great over our shower glass wall which gives access to hanging towels on the flip side, hanging over part of the caddy. Not perfect if you use tall over-sized hair products (Aveda budget sized shampoo fits on the top but is too tall for me to use the plunger, I have to take it down to use the shampoo). Hold more than I thought it would and we use the "soap" holder on the bottom for girl razors and sponges--can't imagine using it for a bar of soap. Recommendation: measure and check where you want it to take full advantage of the towel hanger.UPDATE April 2014: Still NO RUST! Very happy.

I bought this on a whim and I totally loved it.It easily cuts potatoes and it easily sets up and breaks down for cleaning. I am not very strong in the arms and yet I find I am able to cut the 'taters' with this very easily. My mother in law, who is in her 70's is still able to use hers to cut potatos.As with other reviewers I would say that this cutter could be bigger. If you have large potato you will have to cut it into smaller sizes in order to fit into this cutter. That is the only con that I can share with you.If you make french fries or sweet potato fries, this is the tool to use. We do parboil our sweet potatos before cutting them.This is one item I would buy again if we were to lose this one.Enjoy.

Yes, you are using it wrong if food sticks to it. If you read the Cuisinart instructions included with the pan, it tells you to heat the pan before adding food to it, and then it won't stick. Try it, it works. Multiclad is pricey, but it works and will last a lifetime if cared for.
summary: Read the manual — food does not stick

reviewText: I am still using some of the same spatulas purchased as a newlywed 33 years ago.  I have added some, given away those that haven't worked out, and still have my favorite vintage "go-to" workhorses that I use day in and day out.  Yet I still search the shelves, bins, and brackets of retail stores, and tirelessly peruse internet sites in the hope of finding that one special spatula to someday replace my "vintage pieces" should fate intervene.This STAINLESS STEEL AMCO FISH TURNER, my friends is NOT THE ONE.  This spatula IS perfectly sized but extremely lightweight, resulting in a slightly awkward feel in the hand.  I find the slanted angle of the working end also a bit cumbersome, despite my having been raised using a similarly angled spatula.  Additionally, the end is not as "sharp" as it could be, meaning I have a somewhat difficult time separating foods (i.e. pancakes, fried eggs) with it.  Another caveat is that foods tend to stick to the working end of this utensil, requiring soaking and scrubbing both before and sometimes after manual and machine wash cycles.  (The finish is a matte finish; very dull which likely plays a distinct role in adherence of food.)To reiterate, I "like" this spatula, but just don't "love it".  The concept is there but needs "fine tuning".  I will still use it, but it is not my "go to" utensil nor will it supersede any of my vintage pieces.SUGGESTION TO MANUFACTURER:  Increase the weight of the handle just a tad more to make it more substantial.  "Sharpen" the edge of the tool and slightly decrease the angle of the working end.  Also, add a little "shine and resiliency" to the metal which should not only enhance the look of the tool but may also keep foods from sticking to it.
summary: HAD HIGH HOPES... but just DOESN'T COMPARE TO MY VINTAGE PIECES

reviewText: Now I like this little chopper knife! So much better and easier than a wheel. Cuts quick and smooth and cleans like a breeze. Glad I took the leap on this it was worth it.

These are great towels: very absorbent and thick and sturdy. No skimpy towels here. I wish they came with hand towels of the same quality. But no matter, this is a great deal and if you are looking for basic towels that are of good quality and that really soak up water, go with these. I have had so many other towels that don't seem to absorb water. It is very odd. It's a towel. I've read reviews that say you have to soak them for 4 hours in vinegar and baking soda before you wash and dry them the first time, in order to get out protective chemicals. Who has time for that? These are wonderful towels that don't require any fussing and the price for the quality is fabulous.

This mattress pad was purchased for use in converting two twins to a king....because there is a foam piece that goes between the twin mattresses I needed a nice, thick pad.  This one did the trick...it is well made and did the trick for the conversion!

Overall it's a decent product. My only complaints are that I wish the baskets could have taller sides and were a little thinner/less bulky (so that the baskets themselves would take up less space and leave more space for storage). I also wish that the bottom could be secured somehow so that it doesn't bang around every time I open the door (I ended up using some 3M velcro strips)
summary: Overall it's a decent product. My only complaints are ...

reviewText: I will be ordering another one of these. I have two and they hold my spices great. I cook and bake a lot, so it is great to be able to see them and know exactly where they are.

Easy to install in a couple of minutes. I bought two - ones holds jumbo boxes of quart and gallon sized ziplock bags with just a bit of room to spare and the other one holds Saran Wrap, aluminum foil, and wax paper with enough room to fit two more items that size if I wanted. Got these things out of a drawer and hung up under my sink.
summary: What you see is what you get

reviewText: When it comes to cooking utensils nothing is more important than a reliable knife. By that I mean one that is sharp and resharpens quickly and easily. For my money the OXO GoodGrips Knife Block set is superior and is a great value. We give this set as gifts for weddings, birthdays, and housewarming. Buy it you'll like it.

I have tried everything- I am not kidding. I've bought every stainless steel cleaner I could find- even the ones that are wipes. My kitchen windows all seem to bring in the sunlight at the absolute worst angle for showing even a fingerprint or drip on stainless. Frankly, I have hated having stainless steel appliances. I don't get it. But now I have a sense of peace when I look at my frig door.  This product was my last chance- and I am AMAZED at the beautiful surface it leaves behind. Not one streak. No rubbing, etc. I will throw out all the other SS cleaners I have in cabinets and drawers and use this until this stainless obsession goes out of style. A word of warning- don't use other things (even water) to wipe up spots after you've used this cleaner- it won't work. Just use this product every time. Water drips show up on this - but then again, they always did anyway!
summary: Finally I can clean my refrigerator and dishwasher doors!

reviewText: Great sized kettle (1.8L) and does exactly what it's suppose to do, boil water for your hot beverages!  Well priced or one can spend over $40+ to get a nice, fancy design, which I've purchased before, but this kettle is a lot more quieter when boiling.  The cord is a tad short, but I'll live.
Feels good to the touch, warm to sleep under and easy to clean. I recommend this comforter set. Color hasn't faded yet, (i'm sure it will eventually but so far 2 washes down and no color change).
This is our favorite pan and yes its non stick and stays that way, it gets lot of uses. Only sad part it doesn't work on my nuwave 2 induction portable cook top.
summary: Ceramic marble coated cast aluminium pan

reviewText: I received the 20 inch by 36 inch GelPro mat in Antique Redwood with Flora pattern.  It arrived wrapped in plastic film, around a cardboard tube and quickly flattened out when placed on the floor.  The color is a very attractive dark reddish brown and the Flora pattern is a subtle rose detail which is not obvious unless looking at the mat close up.I often have back pain and tired feet at times, so I opted to place the mat close to the kitchen sink and countertop, where I am usually standing for long periods of time to do dishes or often time-consuming preparation for cooking.  As soon as I stepped onto the mat with bare feet, I can feel a real difference, especially on days when I'm experiencing lower back pain.  There seems to be less pressure on my lower back and my feet are much more comfortable when placed on this mat versus tile floor.  I am looking forward to using it on a daily basis while in the kitchen and may move the mat to the bathroom for making tasks such as cleaning the tub a little more comfortable.Update: Take care when cleaning the mat, especially with a vacuum.  A member of the family had roughly vacuumed over the mat and left two spots where the deep red cover has come off and you can now see a black material underneath.  While this doesn't affect the functionality of the mat, it's not as attractive as it used to be!

Ateco makes great products. There are 6 pieces of these square cutters used for baking. I use them mostly for cookies and assorted pastries. One edge is a straight edge and the other side is another design. These are not flimsy materials and does what it needs to do. Perfect!

I find most, but not all, OXO products to be of very high quality and usability.  This grater is no exception.  Cheese grates easily.  The container is what I really like.  It is a bit small for larger "projects", but that is easily handled by simply emptying it and continuing.  High quality; I haven't had it long but I expect it to hold it's sharp edges for quite a while.  I will update this review if that proves not to be so.  Glad I added this to my kitchen utensils.

I wrote an email to Rubbermaid this morning citing the unhappy mood of potential customers as well as myself due to the discontinued manufacture of the large drain board that drained on the narrow end.  This is the reply I received this evening.powerbroker@rubbermaid.com (powerbroker@rubbermaid.com)Add to contacts4:50 PMPicture of powerbroker@rubbermaid.comThank you for your interest in Rubbermaid and for taking the time tocontact us.We are pleased to inform you we have a new Universal Drain Board whichdrains from the short side. It is 17.6" x 13.2" and is available inClear, Bronze, Black and White. The product is currently available atT*@*@*.Thank you for using Rubbermaid products and for giving us theopportunity to address your concern.(Ms.) Chris FirstRubbermaid Consumer Service1-888-895-2110From: powerbroker@rubbermaid.com [mailto:powerbroker@rubbermaid.com]Sent: Friday, August 09, 2013 9:19 AMSubject: Rubbermaid Re: Issue #I on the other hand found some New Old Stock and purchased it this morning after I sent the email.  I have not seen this new drain board (hence the 3 stars) that drains from the narrow end but not to worry it is once again available.  I hope this helps all that have been searching for this style drain board.
Great pan. Just fried eggs and the pan heated up quickly. When the eggs were done I just wiped clean with scott towel. Buy it now, not the cheap stuff.

I'm afraid I'm something of a coffee snob  I grind my own beans, am picky about the beans I grind, and on weekends and when I have a hankering for the real deal, only French press will do.  On busy mornings you can't beat the convenience of the automatic drip, but when you have a friend over for coffee, or are having a festive weekend breakfast, the French press ritual is charming, and the flavor is coffee perfection! I've had many French press pots over the years, from the standard Bodum, to the solid Francois et Mimi, to a Sterling Pro to the Kona French Press. Since a French press pot is essentially low tech, what I've found is that the quality of the coffee produced is as dependent on the user as it is on the pot, although I've produced the most awful sludge from the most expensive of pots--and that's how I know!The criteria I use to evaluate a pot are as follows:Is it intuitive and easy to use?Is it easy to disassemble to clean?Does the screen filter out grounds sufficiently?Is the pot sturdy and attractive?Could a novice produce a fine pot of coffee?Does the pot keep the coffee hot for a reasonable amount of time?The Kona French Press performs well in every area.  Although it's advertised as three pieces, you don't disassemble the lid.  The pot is actually two pieces.  It's very easy to use.  I grind a third of a cup of beans to a count of twelve, dump the grounds in the pot and boil water.  I pour a little boiling water in the pot and stir with a wooden spoon, then add water to the top band, replace the top, and set the kitchen timer for five minutes.  The directions on the box call for four minutes and using a tablespoon (helpfully provided) per six ounce cup.  A four miinute brew is not sstrong enough for my taste, and all my coffee cups are huge, so I'll use the measurer for something else.  A third of a cup of beans is perfect for this size pot., IMO.When the timer ding, slowly press the screen to the bottom of the pot, make sure the lid is positioned correctly to pour, and enjoy two very large cups of perfect coffee. There's a little sludge left in the bottom of the cup, but the screen performs brilliantly to filter out the grounds.  There's also a strainer on the lid in case any large bits get by.The Kona is very easy to clean.  Not finding any instructions to the contrary, I've been sticking it in the dishwasher, and it's come through with flying colors. I've never had another French press pot I could do that with.  YAY!!  The glass is thick, and well protected by the black bands around the pot.  I'm careful to bloom the coffee with a wooden spoon, but I also don't worry about the pot getting sideswiped by a skillet in the sink.  It's solid.The Kona is also attractive.  It's a bit sculptural and I like the black accents.  I keep it on the kitchen counter, and it looks very European and businesslike.  This pot would be the perfect wedding gift or present for someone you'd like to introduce to great coffee.  A novice could use it right out of the box, with Maxwell House or a designer blend and be just fine.  I love using this pot when I'm by myself, it's the perfect size for me, and the pot keeps the cofffee hot for as long as I need it too.  I have a cup at hand while I'm writing this review!  I received a sample for review purposes, but I'm looking seriously at purchasing a couple for upcoming wedding gifts.
summary: Elegant and efficient--makes a great cup of joe!

reviewText: I needed a strainer and wanted a decanter.  Buying the items separately would have been a lot more money.  I've used it a few times, and it works well.  I am not sure I am an aerating convert yet, but so far so good.  I would have given this 5 stars, but there is a bubble in the glass that I am a bit concerned about.  It's a nice little set, there are no leaks, no holes, but...  That bubble is in there...
summary: I needed a strainer and wanted a decanter

reviewText: Fit the pillows good , love this fabric , and I was just going to use these for me , but my Daughter swiped one from me so now I share !!!

Works OK but would benefit from having a lid. Sifting nut flour, turning the crank at a brisk speed, nut particles would occasionally get caught and cause some of the sifter's contents to come flying out the top, getting flour on the counter. That might not be a problem if not sifting flour with unground nut particles in it.See comments below.
All the fine details are done with great care the print is lovely in a black frame. it makes for a perfect addition in a movie room or just for any Westeros nerd.
This is my 3rd saucepan & I really like the quality & ease of clean up.  I put them in my dishwasher (top shelf).

Following the Doctors advice I needed to increase my veggies in my diet, I bring a salad which is a full head of lettuce plus toppings.  That means a large plastic tub plus my water thermos (doesn't everyone want cool water... ;-).  This tote has not let me down.  Was the right size.
So far, no spills or problems. So I can't tell you how it saved the mattress from red wine. When you wash it, line dry it. (No dryer, no heat) It took several hours to dry, so plan ahead.

I like these laundry baskets because you can hold it against your hip with one hand while using the railing to go up and down stairs. They are sturdy and deep, and there is a hand grip on both sides as well as on the outer edge. Once you own one of these you will want more, so just order a few and save on shipping costs.
These pillows were a great purchase! Super comfy and still have their fluffiness a year later. Stop looking and purchase these.

Nothing negative at all to say about this bottle opener. It is sturdy, probably indestructible, opens all of my bottles on the first try (when I am sober), and looks great with our vintage  cast iron drawer and cabinet pulls.Go ahead and spend the extra $2 or $3 on this bottle opener--it's worth far more than the value fries and value cheeseburger you were going to eat this week anyway.

This Contigo Shake and Go Tumbler is perfect for me! I drinkAriZona Green Tea with Ginseng Sugar Free Iced Tea Stix, 0.7-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)andAriZona Arnold Palmer Half and Half (Iced Tea/Lemonade Stix), 1.2-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)all day long. (I love the taste and love the no/low calorie count.) Because I need to mix the powder in a container, I usually start my day with a 16.9-ounce bottle of water. Then I refill the water bottle with water from my Brita pitcher, add the drink mix, shake it up, and drink it. That refill/mix process is repeated several times a day.With the Contigo tumbler, I don't think I'll need to use bottled water to start my day anymore. I'll just fill up the tumbler with my Brita pitcher water, add my tea mix, shake, insert the straw, and I'm in business. By the way, while some people may not like the straw, I actually prefer it. In fact, because I drink so much tea my dental hygienist has told me on several occasions that I should be drinking it through a straw. (Doing so helps cut down on staining of the teeth.) But I've always found sticking a straw in a flimsy plastic water bottle kind of awkward. Now that's no longer an issue!This BPA-free tumbler is very well made. It's very durable, has a tight seal, and is easy to clean (by hand or in the dishwasher). It also fits perfectly in my cars' cup holders. I really couldn't ask for anything more. Highly recommended!UPDATE: I've been using this tumbler for a few days now, and I have *not* used any bottled water during that time. I've started out my mornings with my AriZona Iced Tea mixed with water from my Brita pitcher in my Contiga Shake and Go Tumbler. No more bottled water necessary!
summary: The perfect tumbler for me and my AriZona iced tea mixes!

reviewText: We really needed a good immersion blender to puree soups simply and easily.  In under a minute this blender will puree a soup right in the pot.  Cleanup is a breeze.  The shaft detaches and goes right in the dishwasher.
summary: Exactly what we were looking for

reviewText: I recently switched to a vegan diet and therefore use vanilla soy milk with my coffee instead of 1/2 & 1/2 cream.  This duplicates what is made at Starbucks and adds a richness to my coffee.  Now I prefer it over the cream...that amazes me.
Lemon zest is very expensive, so I purchased Ergo lemon zester.  I works very well, and fresh lemon zest is very good.  I would recommend this zester

So happy to get this for my son's room.  His other heater is against the wall and he wanted to put his bed/futon there and we were concerned about fire issues so I bought this to ease my mine which it did.  Keeps it very warm so he can adjust or turn if off with the remote control.
summary: The remote control is a nice feature

reviewText: Stays sharp for a while. Nice balance and feel. Although this is a really nice knife, remember it's pretty small and may not do those big jobs very well.
I am sure that these will last me for a good long time.  They look and feel superior.  I was tired of buying those dollar store brands that rust and come apart at the rim.

Please don't shoot me for my pun, but this item just wasn't my cup of tea.  It will do exactly what it says it will do.  But for me it was just too much trouble.  I guess I'm a child of the hurry up and microwave it and get done generation.

I was gifted a nice older stainless steel U.S. made Presto pressure cooker from a buddy who was moving. I was very happy to find a new ring and vent in one convenient pack here on Amazon.  Great product at a reasonable price! The old used 4 quart cooker works GREAT!This may be "irrelevant" to this review, but this older Presto is "built like a battleship" when compared to my 6 quart stainless steel Chinese made Presto pressure cooker which I bought a year ago.  Both do the job, but it seems to me that it really makes very good sense to refurbish the older U.S. made Presto's because the stainless steel is of a heavier gauge and higher quality. The Chinese one works but it just feels "cheap" all around in comparison. Fix the old ones!!
Really comfortable type of desk, Love this type of desk idea.  This is so far the best style of desk i have ever had.

My old cooker used to leave the rice hard and brown on the bottom of the pan. I cannot believe how good the rice tastes with this one. I love trying the different types of rice. Amazes me that there are so many settings to use. My husband just loves it.

I had been using the carafe part of an old coffee pot that after being dropped, would no longer keep coffee hot for any time at all.  This Copco while highly rated, was not a name I knew and needless to say, I was leery of the product.  Upon arriving I rinsed it out and filled with hot water to wait for the following mornings use.  The next morning while waiting for the coffee to brew, I preheated this carafe, with just hot water out of the tap.  After about 10 minutes, I dumped the water and then filled with the freshly brewed coffee.  The last cup that day came out of the pot 3 hours after being brewed and it was still -hot-.  Today I awakened at 0300hrs and followed the above steps.  The final cup came out of the pot at 1545 and while not hot, it was still warm enough to be considered a good cup of coffee.  The pot kept coffee warm for 12.45 hours.  Not only that it was still fresh enough to both smell fresh and have fresh coffee bubbles when poured.  I highly recommend this carafe to either friend or enemy. ;-)Here it is over a year latter and the pot still keeps my coffee hot.  I am amazed at how durable it has been also, I have managed to accidentally bounce it around my metal sink and I have not broken the glass liner.  I have been well pleased with this item and feel like that it is worth every penny I paid for it.
The web photo is better than the real thing, I'm sorry to say. Utilitarian, but not pretty. Will keep shopping!
summary: It holds stuff, but it's not terribly attractive :(

reviewText: I saved up to buy this, and I use it about once a week.  It is amazing how nice it is to have home made bread without all the fuss of letting it rise etc.  It's a great addition to any family, and It is perfect for two people.  I love the bread it makes; it is fabulous.

These glasses are very beautiful and elegant.  No imperfections at all.  The glasses are thick and are quite tall.  Be sure to take advantage of the 4 for 3 promotion.  Product is made in USA.  Also check outCircleware Twilight 6-1/4-Ounce Flute Set, 4-Piece.  It is cheaper and just as sturdy.

When I received this, I couldn't believe how small this thing was.  It really doesn't look like it has any power, but I was completely wrong.  It is so powerful and made my room warm so quick.  I am using it in master bedroom (14' X 23') and has plenty power.Temperature setting comes from 60 to 85 degrees in 5 degree increments plus "MAX" setting. "Max" is the default setting, so whenever you turn on, it starts on max which is so much better than my old heater where I had to press the button for 5 times to get to the highest temperature.Having a remote control is very handy especially in the morning that I don't have to get out the bed to turn on.  It has all the functions on it too (although the display is hard to see from the bed).  Oscillation function is nice to have also. Timer is kinda interesting.  Display only shows 1 hour, 2 hour and 4 hour, but combining these, you can set it up to 7 hours.I also purchased a smaller heater made by the same company for my bathroom and this is also a great product (Lasko 754200).
summary: Can't Believe How Much Power This Little Guy Has!  Won't Take Much Space But Making The Room So Warm!!!!

reviewText: I love this brush. I used to use the older one before, - wooden with bristles. But the negative part was, sometimes it was hard for me to wash the older brush (to clean all the hairs on the brush thoroughly), and sometimes the hairs would come out of it. With this brush, - it's much easier to clean, and I don't worry about hairs getting on to products that I use the brush on!
summary: Love it, and using it all the time!

reviewText: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my parents. They had a cheaper insultated carafe that had performed well over the years but was on its last legs. We looked in the stores at different ones but they were all made in China or someplace and none of them had very good reviews when I looked them up on-line. I saw this one on Amazon, read all the reviews and figured I would give it a try. My mom didn't want me to spend any more than $30 or $35 ("that's plenty to spend"). My response to her was "if you spend $35.00 on a carafe and it works - great! But - if you spend $35 and it doesn't work - what's the point?".Obviously NOT having to spend a lot of money would have been great but I figured that if this worked as the reviewers have been commenting then I'll gladly pay this much for it. My parents unwrapped the gift and the first thing they said was "it looks expensive" :-(. I'm like "it's a gift - if it doesn't work - I'll send it back. If it does work just say thank-you!". The day after Xmas my mom followed the instructions and rinsed it with warm water before filling it with steaming hot coffee at 7am. A full 12 hours later the coffee was STILL hot at 7pmt! Not steaming hot obviously but hot enough to enjoy without having to heat it up. They really only need the coffee to stay warm for 5-6 hours so knowing that it works much longer than that is fantastic. She was astounded (not to mention extremely happy).Funny - I haven't heard them mention the price since then? Quality remains long after the price is forgotten. It's definitely worth it in my book - it works very well and is elegant at the same time. I may have to buy myself one!!!

This is the neatest can opener you will ever own. I have had mine for six months and absolutely love it. I love the feature where you can remove it and let it run around the top of large cans. It holds the charge for a long time. It says it will hold the charge for a month of can openings, but I don't usually keep it off the holder long enough to find out. Where else can you can a can opener that is also fun to watch.

This blender is much more difficult to use than the old one-speed version, at least for me with my arthritic hands. My husband, who doesn't have arthritis, has no problems with it. I find the on buttons very difficult to push and hold. If you have arthritis or weak hands, don't buy this one.

My brother has one of these and thinks it's great.  After reading the reviews, I was concerned about the battery life, but bought one anyway.The device is a little difficult to get started on a can.  My wife, a technophobe, gave up and went back to a manual opener after one try.That would have been bad enough, but the battery, which I tried to keep charged, refused to take a charge after about six months.  That was the last straw.  The opener and mount went in the trash.Even if it were the best can opener ever (which it's not), the short battery life makes this a non-starter.  Save your money.

Household Essentials Doorknob Hanging Cotton Canvas Laundry BagThis laundry bag is a great idea.  Rather than hang it on the doorknob I put a hook on the lower center of my bathroom door and hung the laundry bag there for towels.  Gone is the big clunky plastic hamper!!  Gone are towels all over the bathroom floor!!The laundry bag holds a generous load of towels that come out of the bag easily due to the zipper on the back.  Just unzip and let the towels empty into the washing machine. Then zip back up and toss the bag into the washer too!What a great invention - especially for smaller bathrooms.

I only bought the one set of four, so I made a small regular cake in an 8 inch pan and then I made four of the mini cakes which will equal 2 cakes after I put the filling and place the layers together.  So it looks like the cakes use about half of a box of cake mix.According to the recipe, one box of cake mix makes 5 cakes.  I believe that means that you will have 10 halves to make 5 cakes.  Unfortunately, the container has 4 containers, so even if I bought another set, I would have just a little too much cake mix for 8 pans.  You will need to cook some cakes, remove them, and cook another batch.  I live in Arizona and bake and cook year round not worrying about heating up the house too much, but that seems like a waste of energy to me considering that the oven will be on 20 minutes longer for another batch.  If these came with 5 pans, that would make more sense.The cakes came out no problem.  I have only used them once so far and am pretty pleased so far.

I bought these funnels to help in my vanilla making.  I have small 4oz round boston bottles that I needed to pour into and these (all three) fit the bill.  They held up in the dishwasher (top rack) and I am sure I will find lots of uses for them around the house.

While I do like the grip and size of this wisk, it is flimsy.  I tried to whip up some potatoes.... that was not going to happen, had to grab old the metal one. It will be good for dressings and such, just wish I had done some more looking before this purchase.

This works perfectly for me - no grounds in my cup, no water everywhere, no mess at all and I'm using a plain pre-ground coffee.  Reading some of the reviews and comments actually made me wonder if some people were taking the filter cup out of the gray outer housing and trying to use that in the machine's existing cup housing, just because mine works so well (knock on wood) that I can't imagine /understand the issues with "water spraying everywhere" that some are having.On top of the ease of use, it brews a GREAT cup of coffee which is noticeably smoother and less bitter than in my previous Cuisinart coffee pot.At any rate, try it yourself if you're curious, maybe you'll be as lucky as I've been!

I really wondered whether I would notice a difference between my old blade grinder and this (much more) expensive grinder. Well, I did. It really is a quiet machine (compared to my Hamilton Beach blade grinder). It produces a very consistent grind.I have only one con in regards to this machine:There's a flexible plastic cap that swivels over the hole in the lid for sealing the grinds into the container. Two comments about this: a) if you're paying this much money for a grinder, you're probably not grinding your coffee only to store it for a few days--you might as well buy pre-ground coffee at that point and save yourself some money; b) It gets in the way of putting the grinds container into the machine so that grounds fall freely into the container. And pushing in the container far enough can sometimes make it difficult to then get it out.All in all, I love the machine. This machine is priced right in the middle between too cheap to be that good and too expensive for someone who's not a world-renowned coffee taster.
summary: Better than the average without going overboard in price

reviewText: This Wusthof model is the best Knife and Scissor Sharpener we've ever owned, bar none!
summary: Wusthof Ikon Knife and Scissor Sharpener

reviewText: I was impressed with this product from the very moment I pulled it out of the box. The other waffle iron I was considering was a Cuisinart and I wondered if it was really worth the extra money to buy the Chef's Choice. It is. I own more Cuisinart products than any other brand but I am glad I chose this one. It is a very good quality appliance and I whole heartedly recommend it for the one or two person household.

Used this last night for bar-b-qued pork ribs.  The size is just a bit smaller than I'd expected, but that's on me...I never could picture a measurement in my head. I lined the pan itself with foil, so can't say how well the non-stick worked, but the rack itself worked perfectly. It's nice to be able to cook greasy items up out of their own fat.  The baked on sauce washed off quite easily, even though I'd let it sit overnight without soaking.All the pan edges are rolled and it seems well constructed...heavier than you'd expect for its size. The lifting handles are a nice benefit too.It did receive a couple of minor scratches from being packed in the box with some other items and nothing being placed between them, but it takes nothing away from the quality of the pan itself.

I was using this cup to fill a bird feeder.  Upon finishing, I tapped the cup on a chair to get the remaining seed out.  The cup split all the way down the side.  I hit the cup mildly hard - like a calm judge rapping his gavel.  It was now way hard enough to break a well-made plastic cup.  The ambient temperature was 34 degrees F, so I wouldn't have expected the plastic to be very brittle.
summary: Cup Broke A Few Weeks After Purchase

reviewText: I made 2 experiments using my brand new Taylor Digital Instant-Read Pocket Thermometer which I bought at Target.First, I found out that H2O boils at 207F which is close to what I was told in school.Second, I found out that H20 freezes at 0F [sic, Fahrenheit] which means that everything we know about nature needs to be re-evaluated.I am awaiting to hear from the Nobel prize committee...
summary: I discovered new laws of nature...

reviewText: To me, when I think of a beach towel, I think of a larger towel than your run of the mill bath towel. The description says beach towel, but in actuality, it is the size of a bath towel. In this case, size matters. In addition to its size, it is very thin. I guess that is what you get when you only pay $9. For $13 I got a much nicer Tommy Hilfiger true "Beach Towel". The Tommy Hilfiger towel has some mixed reviews, but it is night and day over this. Here is the link if you wanted to take a look:Tommy Hilfiger Anchors Red Beach TowelFor an extra $4, it wasnt a hard decision.
summary: Pretty cheap, and not a beach towel

reviewText: I used a granite ware canner for years and years.....until I wore it out. I decided to 'upgrade' to a nice stainless steel canner and was sure the Ball would be good quality. I was wrong! I have used it once and am very very disappointed. The rack is very poor quality and already has rust spots in the canner. If I could return it I would. Unfortunately I purchased it the end of last season so I'm sure returning would be out of the question. I will probably end up purchasing a plain 'old' granite ware. Water , continually, sputters out from under the lid all the way around no mater how I adjust the heat under it. And I was only doing half pint jars, I can't imagine how poorly it will perform doing pint jars. I do not recommend it.

Nothing fancy here. Holds two sponges. The outside bars are turned outward but very slightly but the middle bar is short. It does not do a good job of keeping the sponges from touching. It's okay but could be designed better.

This is the most wonderful tea accessory I have owned to date.  It is one tough little mug and never leaks.  It keeps my drinks hot and makes the perfect cup of tea.  I use mine at work and could not ask for a better way to make my beloved tea.
summary: Zojirushi Stainless Steel Mug w/Tea Infuser

reviewText: This is a must product for anyone who has a Keurig coffee maker. The K Cups are pretty expensive and for someone like me who drinks 3 or 4 cups a day that can be kind of expensive.The my K-cup allows you to use your own coffee in our Keurig. It is easy to use and you can easily switch between the My K-Cup and regular K-Cups.The instructions are easy to understand. You'll be using your own coffee minutes after taking this out of the box.The downsize is that this is a tad messy. After making a cup of coffee you will want to clean it, and loading 2 tablespoons of coffee at a time can be tedious at times.Also the instructions suggest using coarser ground coffee. I used finer ground coffee and found the results were more suited to my taste. So I would definitely suggest this more for someone who has control over how finely their coffee is ground.

I bought these for my parents who have electric beds and were always complaining about the sheets slipping off their mattresses.  My mother said these bands work well but are difficult for her to take off and on when washing the sheets. It helps to have two people.  This may not be an issue for younger users of this product

This little Bissel is just a glorified "dust buster". And a small one, at that. It has enough power to pick up some crumbs, but it's not going to do a great job. I guess if you want more power you'll have to pull out your "real" vacuum.The way that the long handle attaches is neat, easy, and secure. The way that the floor attachment goes on is also easy, but unfortunately it is CONSTANTLY falling off! Also, there's a nice little "crevice" attachment, but there is now way to store it on the vacuum, so i know that in my house it will eventually be lost. Kind of annoying.
It arrived just as advertised and really moves a lot of air.  I especially like that it tilts up and down so well.

I love this product!  It is very unique and makes my wine drinking FUN!  I was surprised that the bottom is sealed so you can put it in the dishwasher.  It is on the fragile side so you do have to handle it with care.
Item arrived well packaged, and on time. Looks and feels like silk, but heavier. Doesn't wrinkle like silk and washes well.

It really looks great. But its not very high quality. Some would argue you get what you paid for but I think the $130 paid was too much for the low quality. For example one of the legs is crooked on mine so I have to slide some folded up paper under it. It is also very light weight.
Works great.  I use this to weigh packages of meat that I have purchased on sale prior to freezing them .  It works great for other uses like cokking and baking.

I owned a previous model that did not have the pull down screen.  Luckily, I was still in the "return" window and exchanged the first valet steamer for this model.  The pull down screen is a great improvement.  The water capacity is more than enough.  I've steamed for up to 40 mins and did not have to refill--plenty of water left.  However...the fabric brush needs a design change.  I am on my second fabric brush and this one clips on the steam head...but pops off with the slightest contact with clothing.  This did not happen with the previous model. I find that the steamer is still very effective even without this brush so I will keep it.  But Rowenta--if you are reviewing these, I will be stalking you to see if you come out with an improved brush and will request it!
summary: Great Improvement over the previous model--but the fabric brush needs modification to stay on the steam head.

reviewText: I am very happy with this kitchen scale, works great and now when I freeze or prepare food I can make equal portions. Quality made, definitely recommend this scale, Great buy $$$$.

Arrived and did not work at all.I had a good look at the base which seemed cheap to me so instead of exchanging it for another one I exchaned for the Oster BVCB07-Z Counterforms 6-Cup Glass Jar 7-Speed Blender, Brushed Stainless/Black, which works great so far and looks better made.
summary: Did not work and seemed cheaply made

reviewText: This heater works very effeciently putting out a lot of heat for it's size and is blessedly quiet making it ideal for over night use.
it was ok then it just died ,a few weeks after I can't return it .I really liked it,  why do things all way died when you can't do anything about it .

Thing does a pretty good job. It isn't the same as grilling. The flavor isn't the same at all but it does a pretty decent job at cooking chops, burgers, brats, shrimp etc. It is a quick and easy alternative to firing up the grill and it cleans up very nicely. Seems that maybe it could be a little warmer but it still gets the job done.
summary: It's not grilling but I like it

reviewText: I woke up to the loud banging sound. Apparently, my glutenous shopping sprees over the past year have resulted in accumulation of clothes that my poor closet could no longer  handle. I started looking for replacement options. I went to the container store where the clerk was nice enough to price out an Elfa system for me. It sounded so nice and convenient until I got the actual quote. The system would cost me over $500. I decided that's way too much money to spend on a closet. I went online and purchased 2 of the classic custom kits for my 10 foot closet. It took awhile to get this installed, but once the top rail was down, the guide rails were a breathe to install and then the rest of the system was highly configurable. The quality is good, the installation time is reasonable. I don't see why you would spend more money on a closet than you have to.
summary: Elfa who? Why pay more for closets when you can get this?

reviewText: The knives cuts really well and different ones for different cutting jobs. They are designed well. I love them.  Great product to have.

I have a bad habit of breaking the Carafe for my MR Coffee maker.This is the exact replacement. It costs about 1/2 the price of a new Mr Coffee, and since the maker seems to last many years, I order a new carafe when I break my spare one.I wait until I have enough to get the free shipping. It seems that there is always something I want from Amazon.I have never had a problem with the carafe dribbling, in fact this is a great machine. I use my coffee maker every day. Nothing fancy, in fact very basic.
Made Ricotta right away. Took no time at ll and was simple. Never realized how much ,ilk it takes to make cheese!! Delicious!Highly recommend!

My wife wanted something she could use for all the vegetable leftovers we have from cooking.  This compost bin is perfect.  It has a nice heavy weight to it (the white bin is ceramic like) so theres little chance of it moving accidentally.  The black bin inside the white ceramic is also quite sturdy, and with a handle cleanup is a breeze - just take off the lid, grab the handle, dump out the black bin, rinse, and put back into the white ceramic.Additionally, the odor;  there is none!  The bin does come with an air filter you slide under the lid, however, I havent put mine back in after taking it out when I cleaned the lid, and there has been no negative side effects.  The odors remained trapped even without the filter, though it may have to do with what you throw away (ours is mostly leftover vegetables, tomatoes, eggplant, etc).  Other items may emit a stronger odor requiring the filter, but for that I am not sure.

This is truly a nice little gadget!  I am a kitchen gadget freak that collects a lot of such things.  This is not only handy to pick up and transfer cake layers to plates or decorating turn table.  I smack a skillet of corn bread out on the butcher block, then pick it up, turning it over onto the serving plate.
Purchased these and 4 spreaders.  Very, very nice.  And sturdy.  Where are the little spoons available to fill out the collection?

This grapefruit/citrus knife is great. The dual blades make cutting a grapefruit quick and easy. I was so impressed with it that I bought 4 more to give as gifts for family and friend who like grapefruits. I have one at home and one at the office. The best grapefruit knife I've ever used or owned. I highly recommend it to everyone. It was also shipped to me very promptly. Great product...

I used to avoid baking cupcakes since they always seemed to be hit or miss in terms of doneness -- either a bit too done, or a bit underdone regardless of the level of care taken. After using this pan for a few batches I have the answer - it was the cheap pans I was using!This is a sturdy, heavy pan that heats uniformly. Every batch so far has been spot-on. Cupcakes release easily even though this is not a non-stick pan (which I greatly prefer since the regular pans last so much longer). Easy to clean as well since you don't have to worry about scratches.I have several other Chicago Metallic pans in their commercial line, and every one has been an excellent performer. Highly recommend!

This whipper is easy to use. The hardest part about it is in loading it; the instructions state to not overfill, so you must be careful to remove the same amount of cream that you will be using in liquid sweetener if you are using one of the coffee syrups. Probably won't matter if you're using Stevia powder or liquid. Our only difficulty is the size, it only lasts a couple days for desserts; we've already ordered the 1 pint. Since both use exactly one gas cartridge, the larger size will be more economical.The only other item to note is that you need to know the percent of fat in the cream you are using in order to shake it the necessary times. This can vary from brand to brand.
My apartment has an ongoing problem with pantry moths, so I bought this to store cat food in.  No surprises - great Lock & Lock quality, tight seal.

All through childhood, I lived with my grandma. There were two things she always had to have: a cup of hot tea and an electric blanket. Needless to say, she purchased multiple electric blankets through the years so I do know a little bit about them.This is by far the best electric blanket ever. I love the material of it because it's extremely soft and high quality. Most electric blankets skimp on the material and it ends up feeling like canvas because the emphasis is on the fact that it stays heated not the material itself.The last electric blanket I had (which was also a Sunbeam so they have obviously made improvements) had a terrible problem with shedding and getting lint everywhere. Lintballs would come off of the blanket and get all over everything: the sheets, the pillows, the carpet, my clothes, etc. It was terrible. This one does not have that problem.Now I have to warn everyone about washing it: do not wash it like a normal blanket. If you do, it will destroy it. I washed this one in the regular wash and then in the dryer, and it destroyed the heating mechanism. So follow the instructions on how to wash it or it will ruin it.I'll be honest, I have rarely turned the heat in my house on this winter because the bills are so high that I can't afford it so having this electric blanket helps a lot. Even if the rest of the house as freezing at least it's warm in my bed.
summary: Best electric blanket I've ever used

reviewText: this thing is great for camp coffee.  easy to use and clean and keeps coffee hot long time.  gets me jacked in the morning to start a hike.
of course the bowl is going to be perfect for the wonderful cuisinart.  No contest, best food processor I've ever used.
summary: great part for a great product

reviewText: It works fine but a pint canning jar would do just as well. You unscrew the bottom to get the butter out. The top has holes to strain out the liquid.

I LOVE these pots and pans!  I purchased them for my cottage because the stove uses propane and the regular Calphalon from my main home were burning the food (even on low), plus the propane was leaving a residue that was difficult to scrub off.I took those back to my house and bought this non-stick set for the cottage.  They are very attractive and I really like the glass covers. I've cooked with them over the past several weekends and find that they cook very evenly.  The handles stay cool and the propane residue washes right off.  With the propane it's hard to regulate the heat, so I wouldn't stay that nothing sticks, but they do clean up easily.  They hang beautifully on the hooks above the windows also.With Calphalon you never want to put them in the dishwasher and that may be the source of some of the poor reviews I've seen.  These are great pans and now I'm considering selling my regular Calphalon and buying this non-stick set for my home!
summary: Pots cook evenly and handles stay cool

reviewText: The measuring cup are no different than any other set except OXO has added some features to make them better.  First thing you will notice is the are not ROUND they are oval; and have rubber on the handle of each cup, and brightly colored raised markings, and they easily remove from the ring to use one at a time, and then securely fasten back onto the ring.This means no more opening a ring to remove a cup, or washing all the cups because you need to use one and got another dirty; and you won't loose them because they fasten securely back to the ring.  These are also dishwasher safe.  The price of these are a little more than the plastic ones you get in the store, but you are getting a lifetime warranty on the product.

I expected a thermometer that went to -40F. I specifically bought this one because of that, since I'm going to be monitoring a freezer temp that might be below the normal -20F. The one I received only goes to -30F..... Anyway, my freezer isn't even below 0F, so I'm not going to return it. Still a bit annoyed, though.
summary: Well, I expected the thermometer in the photo...

reviewText: For the price, they are sharp, durable, and fit my average male hand well.  Would buy again.

For the first time in my life I have carpet and I never realized how annoying it is. Between unpacking boxes and walking with shoes on and such there was small rocks, pieces of styrofoam, all sorts of things in my carpet. My apartment is tiny so I didn't really want a full sized vacuum so I got this one. It picked up all the things that were in my carpet and it worked in my kitchen too, making quick work of spilled uncooked rice. It's not that loud either so I don't dread having to turn it on.
summary: Lightweight, quiet, and still gets the job done

reviewText: I didn't think they made them like this anymore.  Thick, strong, uncoated aluminum, rolled edges reinforced with steel rods.  No bending, warping - this thing will last forever. Nonstick surfaces have their place, but for cooking a roast on one of those metal racks uncoated is better - no scratches.  No matter what sticks you just soak it awhile and scrub it with an SOS pad or something similar. Old-style pans like this can take a ton of abuse. Bake a single layer cake or brownies, frost them in the pan and no need to worry about cutting into the nonstick finish with a knife or spatula. There's a reason Grandma used pans like this (aside from the fact that they didn't make Teflon then!) and still does. Pure functionality, no special tools and minimal fuss.
summary: Chicago Metallic has become my go-to brand

reviewText: These pans have excellent heavy bottoms. I don't have too many gripes, except it would have been nice if the handles were welded to the outside instead of being bolted in. Stuff will stick to the bolts.I just cook neater and avoid the bolts, and I'm fine.We use these pans for literally EVERYTHING that can be cooked on a stovetop!SHIPPING was SUPER FAST!!!*** UPDATE *** September 10, 2008Excellent product UNTIL we had guests who "helped us" clean up and put them in our super heavy duty dishwasher... After that, the finish was never the same. I have ALWAYS hand washed my non stick pans. I'm afraid the trip through the dishwasher killed them. Now, our dishwasher is brutal, much more harsh than the average dishwasher, i have to admit.We still use them, I'm a fan of the heavy bottoms and even distribution of heat. But now, I have to use cooking spray to keep food particles from sticking :(
Cheap and works well. Not much else to say other than its a soap holder, it's cheap, and it works.

Contrary to how myKitchenAid Khm7twh 7 speed Hand Mixer khm7t khm7 white + Dough hookswas described, it arrived sans kneading hooks.  Thank heavens Kitchenaid accessories are widely avialable and fit virtually all of of their hand mixers.  I'd already purchased aKitchenAid Hand Mixer Stainless Steel Pro Whiskwhich was a delight to use and now I have these kneading hooks.  I'd attempted using a Sunbeam stand mixer to whip up pasta dough and quickly realized its limitations.  I know now that myKitchenAid Khm7twh 7 speed Hand Mixer khm7t khm7 white + Dough hookswould have been the way to go as it has the ability to work the dough in a way the Sunbeam just can't.  These are nice and strong, well constructed, and worthy of the Kitchenaid name.  In some respects I don't know why I relied on a lesser stand mixer and didn't opt for the tried and true Kitchenaid.  If you have any qualms lay them to rest as these are the real deal!
summary: A great option that fits all Kitchenaid hand mixers

reviewText: Not bad it holds the bar of soap .. plus for the price you cant go wrong with this.. i just needed something to hold the bar up .
summary: Great For holding the bar up so it wont get stuck on the tiles..

reviewText: I purchased this storage drawer so that I could better organize my mass of K-Cups. It currently sits underneath my Keurig. It looks very nice and does what it is supposed to. It is a simple design and while it doesn't save a lot of room, it doesn't take up much room either.
It's been hard to find a steamer that the metal pieces don't break.  This one seems more sturdy.  Also, it is a little more curved and seems to fit my pots better.  Very happy with it.

My wife and I have owned many mugs, cups, containers, Thermoses, "to-go" coffee containers, thermal, non-thermal, plastic, metal, you name it.This Thermos is hands down the best Thermos I have ever owned. My wife makes smoothies every morning with fresh ingredients that I HATE wasting. This Thermos keeps my smoothies as cold as the moment I poured them for hours! The locking cap is heavy duty and I can assure you it won't pop open unless you intend to open it.The metal is solid and I don't have to worry about whether the container is BPA free or not because it isn't plastic (which also won't crack). I will be buying another, highly recommend.
summary: The one Thermos to rule them all (The Lord of the Thermoses)

reviewText: My husband generally rolls his eyes at any fancy attachments, but he loves this one for getting the pet hair off the furniture.

I have purchased two sets of these and they had all worked great.  I particularly like the smaller wastebasket for our bathrooms.  I do wish that the smaller one were available singly as I would consider buying more of those.

FInally I saw these sold by amazon and not a third party seller which would charge so much on shipping you could get two more sets.  SO i jumped to get these from amazon, good deal esp. with free shipping.  I give this four stars because when this fragile set ships it is extremely vulnerable to breakage.  I don't think it's amazon's fault, they're probably not meant to be shipped.  And that is what happened to my set.  Went and got this set from the store to go with my existing set of Sango Black dishes, bowls, mugs.
summary: Great deal but shipping is too risky...

reviewText: I ordered these, and then promptly ruined the pure-as-snow exterior by very stupidly allowing my hand to be on the glass top of stove burner. While it was on. Fortunately, my idiocy didn't result in it going up in flames, but it did leave a nice sear mark which I would consider to be medium-rare. Other than that, I use it for case-iron cookware with no issues. Terry cloth generally seems like its used for its absorbency, like for towels and robes, so I'm not sure why it was used for these, or why I bought them. It would seem like there are so many other better fabrics to use.
summary: I am a moron and burned one of mine.

reviewText: I use my non-stick 10" skillet everyday but found I was coming up short with the number of pierogis I could cook at a time.  I have also learned not to invest megabucks in non-stick cookware.  I settled on this pan after reading reviews in Cook's Illustrated and have been very pleased.  It's become a staple in making and serving spaghetti sauce, egg dishes, and yes, pierogis.  It is giving my 10" a run for the money.  The light weight, the glass lid, the easy-clean surface just make for a great all round pan.  One word of caution, it is not at all deep sided.  Think of it as a  big omlette pan.  UPDATE: After using this pan for about 2 years now, I have downgraded it from 5 stars to 4 simply because I realize that I find the side handles not so user-friendly.  They are a little small to grab hold of when you are trying to transfer contents of the pan to a bowl or whatever, and if your hand goes from the cushioned part to the metal part, it's hot.  It's still a great looking pan, and the non-stick surface is holding up well.  But I find that I will often choose to use other pans because of the handles.

this bento box is a little on the expensive side when compared to the more plain ones out there, but the overall quality of this is great. It holds a decent amount too, I tend to eat somewhat large meals and it will fit enough to be considered a light dinner for me. I take this thing to class when I dont have any time to get back and make myself a meal and it does its job admirably.the box closes very loosely and comes with an elastic band to keep it closed. the top compartment is great for rice or some yakisoba since it comes with a cover that has what appears to be a microwave steam vent, the bottom compartment is slightly larger and you can stuff a bunch of other food in it.Ive used this for months and the only thing wrong is the fact that the top decoration starts to get scuffed off after a while, given that its shiny and all, its not a big surprise, just try not to pack it in a bag if its going to roll around or rub against a bunch of other stuff, considering that I stuff it in my backpack, its to be expected that it gets somewhat abused.Id give it 4.5/5 given that the price was a little high. its a nice sturdy, simplistic and awesome looking bento box.

Pros: Cheaper than Dyson, not too heavyCons: Stopped working after half a year, feels cheapThis vacuum cleaner is great when it works, but unfortunately it stopped working half a year later. I don't use it that much, maybe once a month, so I didn't expect it to break so soon. I expected something more from a brand like Eureka, but unfortunately it looks like I have to go with premium brands like Dyson to get a working product.When it was working, it picked up dirt just fine, but it felt cheap compared to other vacuum cleaners. The overall design feels flimsy. I don't expect much out of a vacuum cleaner, but for a company that only sells them, I would expect more.
summary: It sucks (not in a good way)

reviewText: This is exactly what we needed.  I just put in a search for window shades and found this one that I could customize  to fit a particular window.  And was very reasonably price.  Love it!!!!
THIS IS A WELL MADE DEEP DISH PIZZA PAN THAT PRODUCES AN EVENLY COOKED CRUST.  I USE IT ALL OF THE TIME FOR PIZZA AND OTHER COOKING NEEDS.

Bought for my apartment. It is extremely light weight, very easy to move from room to room. Its small, compact so it doesn't take up much space to store it. Works great. It naturally takes a little longer to vacuum a room but its just due to the size of it. Its perfect for small areas...my 2 bedroom apartment I have no complaints!

I just got back from visiting family in Australia and noticed that "airfryers" are in nearly every household. From what I've observed over the years, Australians seem to be more health conscious than we are here in the US (smaller portion sizes, eat seasonally, no growth hormones in dairy and meat, fewer preservatives in packaged foods, etc) anyway, they still love to eat, drink and celebrate with food like everyone else on the planet. So they find work-arounds ... enter air fryers. You can give your kids home made chicken nuggets and fries that taste as good as what you would purchase at any fast food chain (even better actually) and do it all at home and eliminate the deep fryer.This is an EXCELLENT unit that is well made, looks great, and really lasts (my in-laws and several friends have had theirs for a couple of years with no problems.) It sells for a lot less in Australia (go figure, virtually everything else retails for more) but this tells you it's a great seller over there. I've done the research, you can buy this item directly from Philips USA and pay $249, free shipping OR you can go online to HSN and buy it for $200, free shipping, and if you sign up for email advertisements HSN will send you a 15% off coupon brining the unit price to $170 ... how great is that???So while I normally do most of my home and personal shopping on Amazon, this time around I'll be visiting the HSN web site and ordering this product from them for a lot less.
summary: Used everywhere but USA ... buy for less online.

reviewText: my mother love love it made very welli don't have 12 other words sorry it just a useful tool.
Sorry I didn't buy it to hold banana but if you want a head phone stand that's not ugly and cheap. this is IT!!! :D

You can imagine my chagrin when I accidentally hit my old carafe on my sink and cracked it! I was afraid I'd have to get a whole new coffee maker! But I was able to order this one and it works just like the old one. It did take a bit long to come, around 6 days - and cost a little less than half the price of a new coffee maker - which seemed a bit high to me. But it was worth it! Over all I am very happy with it!
This is the perfect size for my sink. I use this for small amounts of dishes and flatwear so I don't have to run the dishwasher.
This timer unit works very well and is very easy to program. We use it for our UV filters in our pond and it works flawlessly.
I love the piece. Is just not pottery barn LOL. Once put together is beautiful and it looks great on my daughters room. I personally think it should be cheaper but other than that I like it.
Pretty sturdy. Looks nice (aka doesn't look so cheap like a plastic one would). It's metal so it holds up nicely.
Easy to set up program and use. keeps time and is trustworthy. Have had unreliable timers that failed miserably after a few weeks the time kept drifting. This is spot on daily.

Chef'n VeggiChop Hand-Powered Food Chopper,is a one, two, three and you're home free chopper.My wife loves this little chopper because, it does the job of chopping with excellence andease.My wife told me with just a few simple pulls of the stringed handle,it chops all herveggies with ease.She is very pleased with this chopper because,it chops faster than her oldhand crank chopper and does it with a breeze and chops with unity in size as well.Amazon.comgave me and my wife a great price and prize with this little time saver.We highly recommendthis little chopper for it's time save stopper.
summary: Chef'n VeggiChop, chops and never stops

reviewText: The new "Safety Features" on the DFP-7BC model make it awkward to use.  The motor works well once you get the items into the processor.  The problem is that the "pusher" part doesn't come all the way out of the "feed tube".  You have to take the lid completely off any time you want to add more food.  I was disappointed at the poor design of this product.  This is not what I expected from Cuisanart.  I took it back and got the DLC5BC which still holds 7 cups but doesn't have the dorky inconvenience features.
summary: new safety features are a hassle

reviewerName: K. Gardner "Think occasionally of the sufferi...
reviewText: I've been using fabric curtains for some time in my guest bath and have always had trouble keeping them closed or having the holes at the top rip or tear.  Have had this one for over a month, and with daily use I've had:1. No messes to clean up on the floor from the curtain pulling away from the wall during showering. It stays where you put it.2. No mold on the hem3. No tears or rips at top. Top holes are metal-reinforced.4. No water leaking through the fabric. It stays inside the shower even with direct spray from the shower nozzle on it.Plus, it is absolutely beautiful to look at.. do not even need the outer curtain that is up. It is a stand alone product. I've kept this brand and model number so I can order this same brand/model when I remodel my other bathroom. Won't use anything else. Get rid of the plastic.. You'll be glad you tried this one !
This brews the coffee directly into a good sized mug, and automatically turns itself off when done.  I use a paper filter in the basket to make cleanup easy.  Works great.
summary: Perfect for one cup of coffee

reviewText: Pros:Solid weightExtremely non stickEasy to cleanHeats wellCons:No LidThis is as good if not better to pans twice the price.  Save the money and get this one.
I purchased this after researching many hand blenders.I was very confused with different reviews. but finally i bought this.This is my second blender and i am very happy with it.

We purchased this set over four years ago because we wanted "real" knives for the first time.  They have been great and keep an edge for a long time.  When they do get dull I recommend taking them to a professional to sharpen.  I maintained ours for a long time using a diamond board sharpener but these knives will require more when they dull out but it is years down the road.  They have a great balance and feel.  Your hands will no longer get tired.

We have off white trim in our house and we have off-white wainscotting in our guest room with blue walls. A wooden bedroom set would have looked terrible. I needed something off-white to match the trim and looked locally, but couldn't find anything. When I saw this, I knew it was a perfect match for our trim, and am very pleased with the quality. We also purchased the matching headboard. There are small, but noticeable streaks of beige/brown through this, so keep that in mind that it isn't a solid, pure off-white colour. This side table is quite LARGE, so measure to make sure it will fit where you want it. It took my husband one to two hours to assemble this side table and the headboard, but we are both very happy with this set.

I really love this Roomba...I'll spare the long narrative and sum it up with pros and cons:PROS:- Battery life is MUCH better than prior Roomba models -- you don't have to worry about the battery dying if you neglect to use Roomba for several weeks, like the old models- Finds his own charger when he is done cleaning (yes, mine's a boy)  ;-)- Schedule allows you to have Roomba clean when you're at work- Cleans well, even in corners and edges- Comes with two "Lighthouse/Virtual Wall" units, which can be set to either block off an area or serve as a 'beacon' to help Roomba navigate your house -- awesome!!- Cleans UNDER the couches and chairs -- this is a seriously awesome feature, if you hate trying to clean the floors under your furniture as much as I do- Very easy to sift-through clear dustbin, so if you think you left jewelry or Legos on the floor, you can easily look through the lint before you dump it out (this was a BIG concern of mine)- Does not ding or dent furniture- Does not tangle in cords or tassels on rugs -- this is also a big improvement over prior Roomba models.CONS:- Cannot clean a shag rug (in Roomba's defense, the directions do state this limitation clearly -- I tested it, and indeed, Roomba got lost and confused on my shag rug) :-(- Tends to get lost -- not a big deal for me, I am happy to help my poor lost Roomba find his Home Base from time to time... :-)- Can't get into areas smaller than about 16" wideOverall, I am very pleased with Roomba...especially the cleaning under the couch part.  Just that alone would be worth it!  This unit it great quality, gets into cramped areas well, and generally is just a well-made, well-thought-out product.  5 stars all the way!
summary: Where have you been all my life??

reviewText: I love this grill pan. Nothing sticks to it! And the food comes out with wonderful grill marks.It's so easy to clean, too. Everything wipes right off; cooked on cheese, bits of meat, everything.I wont cook burgers indoors on any other pan. They come out so juicy and tasty and they are so easy to cook on this pan.Oh! And fish cooks great! We cook salmon and it comes out with a delicious crust on the outside and juicy and tender on the inside.I've used it dozens of times and it's still cooking and cleaning perfectly and looks just like new.My sister has the same pan. She got hers first and I just had to get one after I cooked on hers. I almost got a similar pan that I saw at Target, but I'm glad I got this one. It's perfect, perfect, perfect.

InterDesign's Una Bin will work well in any bathroom, kitchen, pantry, or elsewhere. It's made of a durable plastic. It measures 10 x 6 x 6 inches. It's clear so you can see the contents of your bin. It also features integrated handles for easy handling and takes up less space. Also works great as a college catch-all bin for carrying your goods to the bathroom.
summary: Durable, Clear Bin for Any Decor

reviewText: I bought 2 of those mugs , i am very pleased with them . I take them to work and heat up my soups i have for lunch . If you looking for a great product , thats the one !
I wanted this for my wine making.  Not only will it work for crushing campden tablets, but for other herbs and spicies.
summary: Perfect tool for my wine making.

reviewText: i had to return this because the product dimensions online were slightly less than the actual dimensions of the container therefore it did not fit under my kitchen cabinets, although it does seem like a nice product

After reviewing lots of electric can openers we decided to buy a manual one. We figured it would do the job at least as well if not better and also would save money. So I reviewed the manual ones and went to Bed Bath & Beyond and picked the Zyllis Lock-n-lift. With the 20% coupon we paid only $12 plus tax. We are very pleased with this can opener. It cuts easily and cleanly and the magnet helps to lift the lid when cutting is complete.

I received this as a gift and couldn't be happier with it!  I love the ability to custom heat the water to the perfect temperature for the type of tea I'm brewing. It's incredibly sturdy and beautiful to keep out on my stove.

We looked at a lot of reviews before we settled on this model. Stainless steel is a key. This pot is easy to fill, either from the top or the spout. It pours well without dripping and the handle is good, it never feels too hot. The whistle is good but I would rather have a spout cover that I can lock open when I don't want to make any noise. Other than that small complaint, I am completely happy with this product. It looks good, seems sturdy, and works well.Product update, 2013. It has been a year since we put this unit into service. It's a tank! The stainless steel stays clean (our old kettle got rusty inside). It's part of the family now!
summary: Good tea kettle, stylish and functional

reviewText: Just knowing the duvet cover set was 1200 threads made the gift!  Nice color of Ivory, on the very light beige side .vs. white and Egyptian cotton fabric  felt very rich.  Price was excellent for the quality so I'd call the purchase a hit.

I've wanted one of these for awhile and this is a nice one. My garlic is definitely staying fresh. It's not super big and I do pull apart some of the larger bulbs before I put them in here. It's a little bit larger than my butter bell. In fact I keep them beside each other and they look nice together. I haven't used it in the oven yet, but that is a definite bonus.

The fact that this mat is made of silicone is why I purchase it because I love silicone products and its benefit.  However silicone just doesn't work for this purpose other than it's non-stick and easy to clean but for practical purposes, it just doesn't roll the sushi tight enough like a bamboo sushi mat does. And when the roll is not tight, it falls apart when I cut it down to bite size pieces. I had to bring out my good old bamboo mat to finish the job that this couldn't do.
summary: Didn't work so well. Too Soft

reviewText: Works great.  Color goes with my kitchen and there is NO NEED to purchase simplehuman's "special" liners. Just put a regular kitchen garbage bag in and go!

We like this whisk for making dough but it is a bit hard to use.  We find that we use it sometimes but then other times just use our hands.  It is hard to clean so that is the main purpose.  The hand is untreated wood we think but it does wash off without cracking.  We would suggest this for any baker that doesn't like to get his/her hands dirty.

No, it's not "real wood", but I didn't expect real wood given the price.  Assembly was a bit frustrating in that nothing is marked - although there aren't a zillion parts, it would have been a quicker assembly had "this side front, this side back" or similar been included as I found myself unassembling and reassembling a few times.  Also, the "backer" (back panels) are to be overlapped, something that's not clear on the instructions and I learned only after realizing there was no other way it would work.  Excellent packaging, no chips or nicks, nothing broken (although I was missing one "confirmat screw", not a big deal (the instructions include a date code, telephone number and an email address, the latter of which I used to secure the missing screw).  Screws to attach the unit to the wall are not included and the part that attaches to the wall (the unit sort of "hangs" from the "bar" you attach to the wall) does not include predrilled holes - this wasn't a problem for me as I have drill and had spare wood screws on hand, but may be helpful for some to know ahead of time when deciding to whether or not to make this purchase.The shelves use metal dowels, a bonus over the "cheapie/flimsy" plastic dowels one often sees in bookcases and such.  Overall, to have DVDs, CDs, and so on all in one location and NOT strewn about the floor or tables or here and there, 5 stars unto itself.  No regrets.
summary: Off the floor, nice and tidy

reviewText: We use these for toy storage for our son. It works very well for that. The boxes seem to be decently sturdy.

I got this pillow thinking that even if I only get 6 hours of sleep a night I spend a significant amount of time on my pillow so it should be a good pillow. Therefore, I was ready to pay the high price for something great. But I cannot say that it was worth it. The pillow felt great in the store and it is comfy while I am reading in bed but then it gets to be too hard (even after trying to "break it in" for a while). Also, it is weird because it is thick in the middle but on the outside too flat. And it is too large for every normal pillow case. You can try to force it into your pillow case but that will only make it feel worse. It feels much better without any pillow case at all.Don't get me wrong, it is a good pillow but it is a lot harder than you would expect. The quality is ok. The pillow cover seems really nice but as I mentioned I am not happy with the large difference in thickness between the middle and the edge of the pillow itself.Also, if Tempur-Pedic was confident about the quality of their pillows they would have a satisfaction guaranteed warranty but they don't and interestingly, I tried to post a review on the Tempur-Pedic website but that never got posted.I have another memory foam pillow, a Beautyrest Truenergy Plush, and I use that one a lot more often than this one.Overall, it is not a bad pillow, but I cannot say that it is any more comfortable than the down pillow I had before.

In a closed room this will make the air noticably moister but only after 8+ hours.  No high/low options just on and off.  I'm not sure why, but I simply don't like it much though I would if it had been half the price.  Going to return and get something better.

This wine cork holder has become much more popular since I first made my purchase. I bought this for my parents as a christmas gift since they are really big into wine and especially collecting corks. It looks great and is made strong than I thought. The top opens nicely to retrieve the corks, but will look really nice if you just leaves the corks in the container. The style is very rustic/country and looks great in my parents country themed house.I would recommend this for anyone who enjoys wine and wine decor or for anyone who collects corks and wants a nice decorative piece to put them in.
This is the perfect size to make sauces or heat up leftovers and I love the non-stick interior.

This is a pretty small basket (which if I'd bothered to read the measurements I would have known before it appeared in the mail).  Still, it's great for neatly storing small things like spice bottles and small packages of baking supplies.  I like the fact that if I have it out for baking, and I manage to get crumbs or flour in it, they fall right through the basket and back on the counter instead of piling up in the bottom and corners of the storage cube.
This is my second food saver and I have used it a lot and really like it. It has been very good with meats, dried fruits, and herbs.

reviewText: Easy to use and does the job at a lower price than other packets. Expensive for what it is but who wants to deal with the chemical storage to save a few cents.

Keeps brown sugar moist, just keep wetting stone every now and then and you will have no problems. If I have not used the sugar within 2 weeks of last use I shake the container to distribute the sugar because it starts to turn white on the surface.

Like others, mine smells. And, after one year, the impeller leaks, rendering it worthless. First I thought it was the gasket, but quickly realized that it was leaking through the shaft. Checked out Cuisinart site, and new one only costs $10....oops, did I mention that they also want $5.95 in shipping. Almost 17% of the cost of a new one. Time to find a decent blender.
