Using the highest heat profile and roasting time, 8 ounces has been the most I have been able to get to second crack at any one time. Obviously roasting times will vary with size and type of bean but 8 ounces is about the limit.

This was purchased for our guest room so we didn't wasn't to spend a lot of money on it. The headboard arrived within just a few days. Assembly was easy and clear and the headboard looks great. I couldn't be more pleased.

I just got this and have used it twice. I got it to cook eggs and it is great. I also used it to steam veggies and that also worked great. Just make sure you use it in the open, because it creates a lot of steam.

I thought maybe other reviewers just got unlucky. Nope. I've test 3 out of 6, so far all leaked. Also, the cap-holding mechanism is so poorly constructed that it often looses the cap.Within 5 seconds of inspecting the flask you can tell it's bottom-barrel cheap. You're getting what you pay for. If you enjoy having whiskey leaking into your pocket, then you will love these flasks.
I think the Bowl Covers are going to be useful.  I don't feel like I have to wash the Bowl before every use.  Prompt delivery.  Thank you,  Bobbie S.

This is a very plush mattress cover and I love the velour like material on top.  I don't have a very deep mattress so it fit very well however it would fit a deep mattress also as the sides wrap under the mattress a lot.  I plan to buy a 3" thick memory foam topper and I am sure this mattress pad will fit well on top of it.  Have not washed it yet so not sure how it will hold up after washing.
They're kind of hard to clean for some reason. I got flour stuck to one of them and really had to scrub. When it was dry, I could still see traces of the flour.

reviewerName: K. G. Schneider "Librarian, Writer, and Booka...
reviewText: I have now used it twice to clean carpets that hadn't been cleaned in over three years, both times with excellent results. The machine is cheaply made, so I'm guessing this won't be my heirloom carpet cleaner, but with every successful cleaning venture it gets closer to paying for itself, and the convenience factor of not dealing with Rug Doctor rentals is huge for me. All that plastic makes it easier to carry up and down stairs. The attachments kept flopping around and falling off, so I put them in a closet where I am sure we'll find them someday when we move -- I don't care about the attachments, as I wanted this cleaner for carpets that have borne the brunt of elderly cats with an instinct for vomiting on light-colored carpet. I appreciate the reviews that commented on the flimsiness of the tabs that release the dirty-water tank as I've been careful to be gentle with them. I'm just sorry I didn't get this cleaner earlier, so we didn't have to live with grubby carpets all this time.

This skillet was okay until it stopped heating up! I have only had this for a few months then one day when I went to make pancakes, it just wouldn't heat properly. I thought maybe it was my outlets, so I change where it was plugged-in, nope, it just stopped heating! What a shame too because I really needed and wanted a larger electric skillet, but I guess you get what you pay for. This is a true piece of junk and I would not recommend to anyone! Oh Presto what happened to your quality products?! Unfortunately for me, this turned out to be a big piece of junk!

I bought this to use with myHario VDC-02W Dripper V60 Size 02 White Ceramic FunnelandHario Paper Filter Misarashi for 02 Dripper 100sheetsin brewing those scarce expensive beans that we often invest in.  The ability to stabilize the temperature at 87C, 93C, or 95C (dependent on bean and grind) are essential for a good cup, and the slender curved spout allow good technique in pouring from the center while the coffee drips.  An essential tool for the coffee enthusiast. One reviewer noted that they had encountered rust. I haven't had mine long enough, but I plan to clean it regularly with citric acid, e.g.,Spicy World Citric Acid, 10-Poundwhich should keep scale and anything else at bay
summary: Well worth the expense if you are a perfectionist

reviewText: I was interested in the Filtrete pitcher because I wanted to see how it worked next to my infamous Brita filter, which I love. This is a great looking pitcher- much more attractive looking than my Brita. It is sleek and light, so my seven year old brother has no trouble picking it up or pouring it.The water tastes great after being filtered, and it is filtered quickly. Another wonderful thing about this pitcher is that it is slim, it fits easily in the door of my fridge. I need all the fridge space I can get because I have three boys living with me- we always have a packed fridge.Just remember that pitchers such as this one are for water that is already deemed safe to drink!

A little more than a month into this, and now it's time to leave feedback.  I love it!  At first I was a bit skeptical about the claims of weight loss, but wanted to believe them.  Now I do.I only use it once a day, to replace my usual Ramen soup with potato chips lunch.  Here's what is happening...my big fat stomach, which quite honestly was the first part of me to hit any wall I walked into is shrinking.  My rings are getting a little large, AND, most amazing, IMO, is that the swelling in my knuckles has subsided by at least 75%.Favorite lunch is tomato soup with a whole bunch of vegies added:  Kale, cabbage, celery, tomato, onion, carrot, beet, maybe a bit of red bell pepper, and some raw chia seeds.  Depending on the proportions of each, it can taste a bit different from one day to the next.I've also ground up vegies and added them to spaghetti sauce.Apple, raw cranberries, frozen strawberries, and frozen raspberries make a tasty fruit smoothie.I've used the milling blade to grind up cashews and almonds.  Does a great job!Only experienced one leaking episode, and that was my fault when I didn't tighten the blade part enough.One issue I've seen others speak of, and which happened a few times to me was having the inner (rubber?  silicone?) seal loosen.  Well, it hasn't happened since I figured out that maybe it was because it, and the lip of the plastic grinding cup, were dry, which would cause enough friction to loosen the seal.  So now before grinding, I run a damp finger around the top rim of the grinding cup and then attach the blade part.  No more problems with the seal coming out.Hubby's doctor told him he needed to eat more vegetables.  This is the perfect way to get them, especially for older people who may have chewing issues.  Raw vegies are great, but let's face it...when you have dentures, it's not easy to chew them, and cooking them to the point where they're chewable often turns them into a disgusting, tasteless, discolored mush.Anyway, like others have said, cleanup is a breeze.  A quick rinse in soapy water, and you're done.Would highly recommend!

It works wonderfully holding my cast iron pans without any visible strain and has the right amount of hooks to place what you need on it. The instructions are incredibly detailed which is necessary because this is a notch above ikea furniture since you need to drill with a 1/2" bit. It includes all the necessary hardware for both studs and drywall installation.
summary: The instructions were perfect and the product works.

reviewText: I'm giving this five star review not for the garlic press, but for the outstanding customer service.Garlic press didn't work out for me. Too hard to squeeze.

Wish I had bought this years ago! Keeps the sponge out of the sink where it stays wet and gets stinky. Now I drop the sponge in this basket and it air dries between uses. Sticks to the sink well and was easy to put up.

It is getting harder and harder to find stainless steel bakeware, so when I found this pan I purchased it. Unfortunately it is not as heavy duty as I would like. It has the weight and feel of the cheap bakeware you would find at target or walmart but in stainless steel instead of the usual non-stick junk.Also, when I opened the box I found that the corner of the rim had been bent. That tells you right there how cheap this pan is. I recently bought a stainless steel tray for my toaster oven and there is no way I could ever bend it's rim and it was only 6.99.I sent mine back for a refund.My search continues.
The seats are some type of artificial vinyl and are flimsy.  Not sure an adult would be comfortable on these for any length of time.

Not much to say about this product:  you know what kind of quality to expect from Le Creuset and they deliver (and they better, considering the price).One thing that I didn't realize before is that they recommend emptying the pot after every use to avoid scale build-up, which is slightly less convenient than leaving the water in the pot.Also, I've turned the stove on without closing the spout on more than one occasion, which could potentially burn the house down.  Not sure if there are self closing pots out there...You can find some older models on Amazon that I'm not sure you could find in stores if you like how they look better.

I bought one of these six years ago from a local merchant. I wanted another for my spouse but couldn't find one locally. Should have checked Amazon - they seem to always have what I want.Operation is simple and construction is very good. After six years my first one works as well as the day I first got it.
Please buy this product if you want your dish cloths to last longer and not get a stale smell.  Works beautifully.

These work great for measuring small amounts. It is easy to store, dishwasher safe and kind of fun to pinch and pour. My mom used them when she came for a visit last week and now wants a set of her own!

This thing is great. I have a 400 dollar collection of pans that I rarely use anymore because this thing is so awesome. It cleans up easily with a damp cloth. I actually leave this on top of my black smooth top stove. It looks good In matches all the other applIances. It doesn't heat completely evenly but you learn to adjust. For example when I cook eggs some are a little harder than the others. So now I just move them around a bit. I've made steaks, casseroles,  hash browns, eggs, turkey burgers and eggs of all sorts.You would be considered odd if you did not buy this product.

Great quality stools. We love them and they look great in our kitchen. Do not use any cleaners on them though. We made the mistake to wipe them down and the leather faded on one spot. It was our fault though.

* I will preface this by saying watch the price. It seems to change daily. I have seen it from $20-$40. Get it when it is on sale, cause it always seems to be at some ptAssembly is easy, it looks like it does in pictures. We use it for shoes and clothes in the closet to help declutter.

It may not be as durable as the kind you find in hotels, but it is just about as easy to use.There is no beeping timer, so it's best to time it yourself. About 5 minutes on each side at the level 2 setting seems to be ideal. We make waffles only every few months.When I cook I always use a non-stick spray, and I recommend it for this waffle maker also.  The first time or two it was ok, and the batter didn't stick too much, but after a couple times, it started sticking around the edges, especially toward the back.The great part is being able to throw the plates from the iron in the dishwasher!  If it can't get washed in the dishwasher, it will not last in my house. I simply don't have time to stand around hand washing, especially something as complicated as a waffle iron.  Clean up is definitely a plus for this one!

I just received it this morning. It looks really black and shiny so beautiful! After washing it with hot water only, patting it dry thoroughly, oiling it all over with vegetable oil I gave it a first try by frying an egg. It works better than my Teflon skillet!! Nothing stick on it!!! Excellent skillet!!

I really like the heavy feel of this reamer in hand  verses the wooden kinds I have had in the past.  It works well and cleanup is easier because the slickness of the reamer allows the lemon particles to rinse off easily compared to wooden,  especially if you forget to rinse off right away and the lemon particles get dry on the reamer.

I find these almost a waste of time.  Thought they would give a precise pour but they don't.  They mostly over pour.  The hinged tops don't always close the way they should after use.  Sure they look professional but functionally, they don't work for me.I use mostly wine bottles for olive oils and vinegars.  Replaced the corks with hinged flip top pourers only to find I have less control of the pours.  I'm slowly replacing the hinged tops back to corks.  Corks work best and give more control of what comes out of the bottle.I personally wouldn't recommend these gadgets.

I frequently need to apply direct heat and open flame in a variety of kitchen and workshop applications.  I've used this to loosen stuck metal pipes joints, put a little extra browning on something or even to lightly cook fragile items like scallops.  The trick to this torch and any other is to use good gas thats been filtered at least 4-5 times.  I tried it with a major brand name gas from the supermarket and it sputtered and didnt keep a regular flame.  When I purged it and replaced it with vector quintuple filtered gas, it worked beautifully.Good little recipe from Alton Brown...get some fudge covered marshmallow cookies, torch the tops until the chocolate starts to melt and then sprinkle with a little kosher salt.  Fastest quick dessert to bring to a party and it'll be the first one gone.The base comes off a little too easily for me, I've accidentally knocked it off a few times.  To use, you push down on a tab, it locks and then you push a button on the back.  This ignites the flame and it'll run as long as you hold the button in.  Besides the hold-and-shoot method, it also has adjustments to the flame and a lock that lets you keep the flame on without pushing the trigger.  Thats a bad combination with the easy to knock off base, so I dont use that.  Its not hard to hold the button down in the back.You wont be soldering with this, but for the 1-5 times a day when I think "I wish I had something that'd throw a little flame...", this comes in handy.
This is a nice, well made grill. It cleans easily, just wipe while still hot w/ a wet paper towel, & the size is large enough for 2 portions of food.
My feather pillow wasn't supporting my neck enough so I purchased this pillow for more support. It is well made and has both a firm side and a firmer side. Nice pillow, well made, good for the price
Great quality.  Great price.  Can bake as well as mix in them.  Super design.

Vacuum was easy to put together and rolls great on hard floors. Doesn't shoot the bigger dirt item out the front like other vacs on a hard floor. I have not tried it on carpet but it seems to have enough suction power to do carpets also. The dirt receptacle was easy to dump and replace. Overall well worth the $50.00 bucks.The only downside to the vac is it could use about 10 more feet of electrical cord.

I had left a positive review. We are in May and I had bought this item as a stocking stuffer for my husband. We make a lot of homemade pizza, and this while absolutely cute, starts to come apart after a while. The pieces are removable which ,Akers it great for cleaning, but all of the taking it apart takes its toll and soon it doesn't keep together as we'll making cutting a pizza very annoying.Still a cute item, but not very durable or practical.

We are most impressed with this model of the Dyson Animal.  It had great suction, even through ALL of the attachments.  We accidentally burned our last one up (somewhat, still works but not as well) when our daughter sucked up something large into the hose and partially blocking the airway.  This Dyson has greater suction than previous models, has a great range of power options for different carpet pile types AND can be more easily adjusted for which floor type you are using with the new button technology.  Easy to assemble and take apart for cleaning, as with the previous models, this is a great replacement product.  We are MOST pleased.  We have 4 dogs and clean the floors most every day.  We can keep track of when the canister needs to be emptied because it is clear (which is very important as when you are cleaning up after four shedding large dogs, you need to empty the canister more often than you might think or you will kill your vacuum quickly).  Great product at a great price.  We are Dyson for lifers.
Great product, good variety of sizes, you can stack one on top of the other, easy to store, dishwasher safe
The compressor is louder than i expected, its bearable sometimes, but sometimes it becomes unbearable when you just want peace and quiet!!!
great lids! I recommend using these for storing things in your jars. I hate the canning lids when I want to put things away in a jar. This is much better.

I phoned Nespresso before purchasing my Nespresso machine because the small print of the $50 Holiday Offer credit stated that the machine must cost a minimum of $299. The Nespresso representative assured me that so long as the suggested retail price of the product was $299 or greater, and it was shown on the receipt or attached advertisement,the $50 credit would be honored. Well, now that it has been declined for that very reason, the Nespresso Club representative informs me that "Amazon is not considered to be a reputable dealer" so, it is not possible to give the credit. Places like William Sonoma are the "reputable dealers". To the Amazon powers that be, I ask why you would want to continue doing business with a manufacturer that doesn't consider you to be "reputable"? The Holiday Offer was clearly deceptive and unethical, and their response to the problem was very disappointing.
summary: Beware any Nespresso Club credits offered when purchasing through Amazon......

reviewText: What a great product!  I had no idea that we could have such perfect rice in such a short time.  Clean up is a piece of cake.  I've read some of the negative reviews and the only advice I have for them is READ THE FRIGGIN INSTRUCTIONS!!!Great product!!
Great clip for chips, frig for notes, bread etc.  Easy to clamp with just the right amount of force to keep the chip bag closed.  If you have arthritis this one is for you.

Compare features and price of this KitchenAid roaster (CHINA) to the 17" non stick OvenStuff for $19.99! (which is made the USA!).OvenStuff Non-Stick 17.2 Inch x 12.7 Inch x 2.7 Inch Large Roasting Pan with Rack!!  The whole OvenStuff line of cookware is fabulous - be sure to check it out!
summary: Knockoff made in China! NOT real KitchenAid! Do not buy!

reviewText: As other commenters have noted, it is a flimsy product. I will give a good review because it is what I expected and I need it only to sift the yoke of an egg, to take any residual skin out, so it is fine. It is also great it comes in 3 sizes and the price is good. If you need something sturdier this one is not for you.

reviewText: While the concept sounds interesting, in reality, this "thermo glass" is completely frivolous.  An espresso is served cool enough to drink right away so you don't need double walled glass to protect your fingers.  These glasses don't keep the contents warm any longer than a standard espresso cup.  They are more fragile than a porcelain cup, which works just as well and costs much less.  Don't waste your money on this product.

These are really well made measuring cups that, true to the branding, have good grips. However, they are missing two things we would like to see in a measuring cup. These are personal preference, and may not matter to many people. The details are below:Pros:1. Stylish looking but still functional in use.2. The handles are sturdy, have nice rubber grips and clear labeling.3. The cups all pour well, even though there is not a discrete spout on the rim.Cons:1. The one cup and half cup measures do not have intermediate markings for partial measures (e.g. 1/2 and 2/3 on the one cup measure). Also, they are missing any metric references. Many of our previous measuring sets have this handy feature that helps prevent using more measuring cups (and therefore cleaning more cups) than necessary.2. The brushed stainless steel finish is just rough enough that flour will leave a thin film of dust on it and sugar will also partially coat the inside even though it is thoroughly cleaned and dried. This isn't enough that it is messing up the measurement, but it just bugs us because our other cups don't do this.Conclusion:Not a bad set of cups. If the issues above don't bother you, they are great.

I purchased this item because... Well, first of all, I needed more space. Secondly because the reviews were so good. The shoe pockets fit my flip flips two at a time, but some of my other shoes would only fit one per pocket, and these shoes aren't very big. Overall, this organizer saved me a lot of closet space. The only negative part is that I had to put up screws to hold this organizer in place. The hooks fit over my door, but the DOOR WOULD NOT SHUT. Not that big of a deal, but definitely lost a star in my book!
summary: Hooks over door DO NOT allow door to shut...

reviewText: got this because my great grandkids had a cold and the Dr said cool mist found this one got it it was cheaper than the ones in the stores and I got it in 2 days

I eat imported long grain white rice everyday.  I used basic models with unsealed lids, and high end Japanese brands with fuzzy logic.  I gave this product 4 star for the unbeatable price and performance.The cheaper basic models without sealed lids are pretty good too, for cooking rice.  To prevent messy steam, the trick is to use an oversize cooker.  If you only use half of the capacity, you shouldn't need to clean up the table after cooking.  A non-stick coating saves you time cleaning and saves rice.  The rice is usually on the soft and moist side of things, but that's most people prefer anyway.  It's harder to do drier and crispier rice.This model is almost perfect for cooking white rice.  For the price I don't suppose you eat premium rice everyday from true Asian specialty shops, right?  There's little difference for this model and high end models if your rice isn't that premium.This cooker is primarily designed to prepare rice the way the Asians eat, particularly the Japanese and Chinese.  This is not to make microwave multi-grain paste.  You have to make the engineers and designers willing to eat your paste so they can understand how to cook it.  No amount of high end fuzzy logic can make your paste the way you like it all by itself if the engineers haven't thought of it.For cooking white rice, this one is as good as any, unless you have exquisite taste in premium rice.  For steaming vegetable and other things, it's quite handy steaming alone or cooking rice at the same time.  When steaming alone, it stops automatically when the water is all gone.Everything is best eaten fresh.  And with a delay timer, there's no reason to keep the rice in warm mode for long after cooking.  The warm mode tend to dry out the rice a bit for long periods.There's a bit of inconsistency in the manual.  The steam vent of my model can only be pulled out from the outside, not from the inside.  Lucky that I didn't damage the lid.  You actually do not need to disconnect the electric cord when in the off state.  But I'm sure it's not recommended for legal liability reasons, and to save some energy.  In my opinion it's as safe as not unplugging the TV after watching.  Also there's a flat little plastic cup below the lid hinge, for collecting condensed water from the lid, which the manual didn't mention.  The little ring at the opposite side of the plastic cup is the temporary holder for the rice spatula.For higher end models there is an extra electric plug at the bottom of the cookers, secured in position by magnetic force.  Unplugging and plugging are as easy as pushing a button.For more expensive models, basically there are two lids.  The inner lid is easily detachable for you to rinse it in water together with the inner pot.  The outer lid, fixed to the cooker, hardly ever needs cleaning or attention.  For this model, even though the lid is directly exposed to the steam, the lid looked clean after cooking.  I doubt very much if you need to clean it every time if you only cook rice in the normal way.  If you steam vegetable or just put the steam tray in, you shouldn't be cleaning the lid at all.With the single lid design, the steam condensed to water at the lid and soft plastic seal.  When you open the lid, some of the condensed water will drain through the little plastic cup below the lid hinge.  A small amount of water will be collected at the seals.  It's not likely to happen, but if you close the lid again a few drop of water may drip down to the cooking surface, when you have taken the inner pot out.  But then a few drops probably will not hurt the cooking surface or the inner pot.I do not like that it beeps too loud, too high pitch, louder than my microwave.  I do not like the - - sign shown when the delay timer is not in use.  It's also too brightly red when in the off state.  I prefer a green or yellow little dot, not too bright in the dark but easy to spot in day light.As with all rice cookers, if you put it under anything, the wood above will be damaged because of the steam.  I attach a thin plate of clear acrylic at the bottom of the wooden cabinet to protect it.  Or you can just pull it out in the open while cooking, and push it back after.If you are careful, the non-stick surface should last enough for your $40.  I don't know about the plastic seal though.  My experience with over the top kettles is that the seal is the first thing to go.  But they sell replacement parts and the cost of the seal is still a small fraction of the kettle.The cooker is on the slow side, taking about 30 min to cook.  Higher end cookers don't cook a lot faster because you cannot boil away the water too fast.  Big simple unsealed cookers can cook some 10 or more minutes faster.  But the quality of the cook rice cannot be compared.  I'm sure microwave can cook a lot faster.Update: 2011/8Everything works like new, even better.  I don't wipe clean the lid every use, because it won't get dirty and messy that much.  I don't empty the cup to hold condensed water, because it normally will not overflow for my normal volume of rice.  I don't dry the inner pot completely before starting cooking because it's pretty tough.The plastic seal at the rim is still in perfect condition.  The inner pot did not have any dent on it.  The all important non-stick surface is still intact.  Nothing came off or scratched.  Looks the same as other higher priced models that I used.  There are minor signs of wear and tear at the rim but expected.
summary: Decent cooker for the Japanese/Chinese way to prepare rice

reviewText: I use them when I want to store some dry goods in the cupboard and liquids in the refrigerator. They fit nicely.
Great for any outside activity - or inside.  The little indention makes them so easy to handle.  It takes away the one drawback from stemless wine glasses.  I love them!

Used these to elevate a chair for use by a 6'4" 200lb man after bilateral knee replacement.  The chair is half on wood floor and half on an area rug and the chair does not move when sitting or standing.

I bought this despite some of the negative reviews, and I find that it works well and fits my king size mattress with no problems. I also washed it with warm water (in a front loader) and dryed it in the dryer on medium heat and it seemed to come out fine-- no pilling or snagging or anything.I think that the other reviewers must have been trying to fit this on a really thick mattress, or tugged too hard. In my eyes, it works well, fits well, and it was a great price. As a reference, my mattress is an eastern king,  memory foam mattress, 12" thick.
summary: Good bargain, fits an Eastern King very well

reviewText: These are my go to sticks when cake poppin.  No others compare. They are just the right size and strong and durable! Have tried others and there is no comparing. Wilton cake pop sticks are the only choice.

Along with the Govino decanter, the stemless glasses are an essential part of summer entertaining.  They are light, easy to hold and attractive.  No more worries about broken glass on the deck or the patio if there is a drop.  Perfect for entertaining.

I don't understand the desire to store bobbins seperately from the thread that said bobbins match, so this product works great for me.  I store my thread out of any type of box, but instead a peg-type spool holder commonly sold in Jo-Anns, etc.  These work GREAT!
I purchased the Miracle Blade set in a store and used a block I already had. This block is the best for the set. I love it.
Love all of the different measurements marked on this.  Very handy.  I only hand wash this as I am concerned that the dishwasher will fade the ink, but that's not a big deal.

There's really nothing like a great mattress pad, especially if it's heated. Put two controllers in the mix and you have probably made a lot of couples very happy. Add all known bed sizes as an option and you've reached perfection.Sunbeam has yet to reach perfection. They only go up to King, not California King. I tried it on the guest bed anyway to make sure it worked and it does, very well. And one thing that I really like is how the feet area gets warm first, something my current Soft Heat MicroPlush pad does not do.However, there are some negative issues that my Soft Heat MicroPlush does not have, so I'd have to say the Soft Heat MicroPlush is a better buy.Here's why:* You can definitely feel the cords in this pad* The controllers and the hook-up are not situated so they can easily be arranged near the top/head of the bed.* The sides of this pad are way too wide, almost like they want you to wrap the box springs as well.* The controller color is unattractiveOn the plus side:* The foot area heats up first* Looks sturdy and with a pad on top might be more comfortableIf Sunbeam were to put a more plush cover and run the wires so that the controllers were better positioned, they'd have a perfect product. As it stands now, 2 stars taken away for the above mentioned issues.  3 stars as is.

When it first came in I was worried how hard it would be putting it together. As I began to open it I realized it was packing that protected it. It was not hard at all. It was so easy  to put together I did not even need the instructions. Once I had it together and in my living room it was as beautiful as the picture. And I really like the fact that it's very light and easy to put my meal on it and slide it closed. It has these little sliders on the bottom that makes it easy to slide.
summary: Very awesome deal at such a low price

reviewText: This is a very nice looking rug and is very soft to touch. We have had it about a month and seems to be holding up well. We have not had to wash it yet.
I love this bamboo turntable and the outer edge is great for keeping contents on the board. Very easy to turn. Crafted well. The perfect size for inside my cabinet!
this kettle reliably boils water and auto-shutoff is great.  it has saved me many trips to the company cafeteria for hot water (for tea)

I have delayed this review until now, trying to determine the holding strength of the hangers.  So far, they have not allowed anything to fall off of the wall, so I guess they work.  Since I have not yet removed them, I cannot speculate whether or not they remove cleanly.  I guess the problem is mine, since I cannot get rid of the idea that a brad or a nail is a more secure hanger.  Also, I am not concerned with repairing the hole that may be left.  If a renter or other person is concerned about holes in the wall, they are probably a good alternative.
an absolutely outstanding product - just as described by all the rest...extremely well made and easy to use...super fast ... i would get one if had not just done it...

I really like this flour keeper.  I may purchase more in the near future since i use all types of flour in my kitchen.  I only wish it came in a smaller size for the other flours that i do not need to keep too much of.  Overall a great buy.

I love this product. I was going to buy a manual grinder because my mother used to have one, but I decide to get the attachment instead. I have a Vita Mix and I grinded meat once and the cleaning process was so painful. With The Kitchen Aid it is so easy, just get all parts apart and wash it. and it is so fast. Very happy with my purchase.update 06/23/13I have not using this so much because as other buyers notice, it will release a black grease with the meat when you are using it. I reduce from 5 to 4 stars because of that, It is not a pretty picture.
Bought this night stand with matching bed. Super easy to put together. Classy. Great service and excellent packing from seller.

This popper is a fantastic alternative to the Whirley Pop (which is 100% aluminum) and the ubiquitous VOC-emitting microwave bags.  I received a Whirley Pop over the holidays and immediately returned it to get this Back to Basics model, as it is stainless steel and has metal gears instead of cheap plastic ones.This device is easy to use, and it pops nearly all the kernels (only 5-10 unpopped per batch).  The popcorn's crispness and flavor are unbeatable.  I put 1-2 Tbsp oil in the popper and then add the popcorn and start stirring.  It always turns out perfectly.  Lately I've been adding 1-2 Tbsp sugar to make kettle corn, and it's just like the real thing you buy at the fair!What the other reviewers say about the somewhat ill-fitting lid and the difficulty in reattaching it is correct, for which I'm taking one star off my rating.  One side of my lid stays open about 5 mm -- not enough for anything to come flying out, luckily.  After detaching the lid for washing, you need a determined hand and a little finagling to get it back on; but rest assured, it does reattach.  If Back to Basics could design a better-fitting lid, this popper would get 5 stars.
I bought this for it's small size and color (matches).  It's pretty sturdy for the price.  I'm very happy with the purchase overall.

I love this so much I have two, and a friend who was helping me cook saw it and bought herself one too! Cleans up beautifully, large enough to handle many items or large pieces of meat for cutting. I like the idea of the measuring marks, but haven't had the need to use them. The non-skid marks are perfect for countertop workstations.

While this one works like others I have purchased like this one.  I have not yet tried to clean.  I don't normally have high temp's in my oven so don't seem to have the melting that others have complained about.  I go to able 425 degrees with no problem.
summary: Quite happy with it so far.

Not what i expect from OXO or any other simple device which costs $20. Do they no read major sites like amazon and take our reviews back to the engineers??????? First, I love the material which is much easier to clean than my old bacon tray. Bacon grease is not fun to clean but it IS easier to clean off of this bacon tray than the older ones. The fact that this tray is dishwasher safe makes it very easy to clean. I love the slight ramp in this design which allows the grease to collect in a pool in one area rather than go all over the tray. Very well designed tray, I will be cooking a lot of bacon with it!

reviewText: Some of the pans burn food too easily but everything else has been a complete joy! I really like it
the perfect dish towel holder when you do not have space to put towel holders on the wall. it makes things so much easier to hang them over the cabinet doors

I have used both this standard formula and the Bissell Pro Formula in the last month on our carpets, and I have to say I love them both. I think the Pro works a little bit better at the dirt extraction and smells a little less "chemically", but this is still a great formula. It also costs a little bit less for an extra 12 ounces, so if you are going for economy, this product is still a great solution to use. I would choose the Pro over this if I had to, but wouldn't ever turn this stuff down.The Febreeze scent is not overwhelming, but rather a delicate touch to the solution. As I stated earlier, this solution has a little bit more of a chemical smell than the Pro verison, but it is still far less intense than some of the other solutions I have tried.In terms of cleaning, this did not protect as well as the Pro for future stains, but it did still offer some added protection for future messes. I was impressed with just HOW clean the carpet came, and more importantly, that it took less solution and pass-overs to truly clean the carpet. With cheaper solutions I use two tanks to truly clean the carpet, but with this solution and the Pro, I only needed one.I think there is an even match between this and the Pro when you weigh their effectiveness with the amount/price ratio. I would recommend either product to anyone with a carpet cleaner looking for effective solution.
summary: Not as Good as Pro, but Still Great

reviewText: Don't know how I ever got along without one of these gadgets...perfect roast beef, chicken and pork are a sure ting.

In October, I came home to a shattered lid and ruined dinner.  just what you want in the middle of the week after work, right?This is not a repeat for me. it's the vitamix tamper. If you're stupid like me and absent mindedly tamped without the lid on this will solve the problem

reviewText: I think the product description and reviews are accurate. It is a nice item that does what it is suppose to. It truly is for the most part non stick, although a little non stick spray for the waffle section is something I would recommend.While easy to clean, in terms of the mess and grime comes right off even the non stick portions, just stuff gets all over the maker and a little on the counter. Not that any of these makers are different. It though would be nice and for the price that this item had a drip to attach to the bottom to help with this.I love the omelet section. Omelets come out very nice and for my taste senses significantly better then the pan on the stove method. I have also made a grilled cheese sandwiches which were easier to do and less mess then when done on the stove.I am very happy I made this purchase and splurged on the second compartment not being a waffle one.
