I bought this pan for somewhere around $20 from Amazon, and feel like I got a fair deal -- a solid pan which meets my need for a fair price. The pan itself is nothing to brag about - it's just a regular, 12 inch pan, large enough for most people's needs. The price is fair for what your receive.If you're expecting Le Creuset quality, look elsewhere (Le Creuset, perhaps?). If you're looking for a solid pan that'll last 10 years, and not feel cheap, this is likely the one for you.
summary: Functional, and a fair price -- just not the 'best' pan ever.

reviewText: It was too small for what I intend to store confectioner's sugar.  Not practical as one uses confectioner's sugar either one box or a few spoonfuls.

Teflon/Nonstick Cookware coatings scare me, and I wanted to make mashed potatoes, but was afraid to use my metal masher in my nice nonstick cookware. I now love this nylon masher, as with other OXO Good Grips products, the handles are very comfortable, and  reduce the amount of fatigue that I experience. I have purchased more Nylon products to protect my nonstick cookware and my health.
A bit of work to put together, but nothing unexpected. Solid materials. Looks nice in my kitchen. Can't really complain here.

I've owned this item for about a month, and have used it several times.  The first time, I strained tomatoes for sauce, and it did such a good job that I ended up with tomato juice instead of pasta sauce.  I ended up pureeing the skins & seeds, and adding them back to the juice.The second use was for apples.  I boiled chopped apples (core and skin included) and then strained them.  It did an excellent job of removing seeds, stems, and spices from the mix, while leaving liquid and the pulp.I was originally looking at more traditional strainers, but then discovered this attachment.  I was hesitant to purchase it, but I'm glad that I did, especially when I realized that I already owned the grinder attachment.The food tray is a nice addition, but does leak if you're not careful.  It really just provides a bigger target to place food, rather than extending the capacity of the grinder / strainer attachment.  The seal where the tray & food chute attaches is not tight, so it can leak.
Love! easy to use, easy to clean

Pros- pops corn just fine- handle is long enough for campfire use- popcorn around the campfire has quickly become a tradition when we go campingCons- it wants to fall apart when you shake it and dump everything into the fire- handle wants to come loose from the lid (and has)- lid wants to come loose from the popper (and almost always does)- at best it feels loose and rattly, you have to develop a technique to shake it gentlyI found that if you over-bend the clips that hold the lid to the popper, it helps keep it from just dropping out of the clip.  And, there's a curled retaining clip on the side of one lid (the one that is not supposed to open) that fell off, but I riveted it back on and now it holds firm.When you shake it front to back, the big clips want to come loose, and side to side the small clip wants to come loose.  It's kind of a hassle, but it works, but I don't know of a better way to make popcorn over a campfire.The inside of the bowl is impossible to clean out, so you get black stuff burned to it pretty quickly.  At first this bothered me and I spent a lot of time trying to clean it, before giving up and now it's just seasoning as far as I'm concerned.
summary: It works, but I hoped for better

reviewText: I purchased two of these to replace some very low quality pans. I'm very pleased with them. Work just as they should and perfect size for my side oven.

We bought this fan to replace a really old Lasko tower fan with a broken base. Luckily we held onto the old one, because when we got this one we were a little bit annoyed to find out that it didn't come with screws! We just took the screws out of the old Lasko fan because we were going to throw it out anyway.The fan is nice and puts out lots of air, even on the low setting. It creates a good amount of noise - I like the white noise of a fan while I'm sleeping and this one is about perfect. But, we can set it right beside the TV and it doesn't block the volume. I like the way the fan looks, and it doesn't take up a lot of space which is nice.The oscillation function is nice, and works smoothly. Having a remote is very handy.Main gripes with this fan:- Lack of screws as mentioned above- The cord is VERY short! We have to use an extension cord, because the cord is barely longer than the fan is tall.- The base is plastic, and not a whole lot wider than the fan. I think it could be tipped over fairly easily, and the base seems like the flimsiest part of the fan so that's probably where it will break (just like our old Lasko fan).
summary: Great fan but didn't come with screws!

reviewText: This small whisk is perfect for making gravy either from scratch or a mix. It replaced one my husband had for a long time that had started to rust.

I have the MIU France regular peeler and it's fantastic, this one not so much. They placed the julienne blade first, then the peeling blade second. Every time you make a slice, it has the top attached. You have to separate each slice in order to have the single julienne cuts. It slices very easy and smooth, with this one drawback.
These boxes are HUGE. I wasn't prepared for how big they were. These boxes will hold eight or nine large shoeboxes, which is great, if you are planning on using that kind of space.

Generally I've been satisfied with all Kitchen Aid attachments, but this one is a little different.  For the price I could buy myself a stand alone grain mill with more features and save the load on my beloved workhorse.

In the interest of honesty, let me say that I was supplied with one of these by the vendor, in return for an honest evaluation.The scale is excellent.  I use scales for weighing food, and for weighing fiber and chemicals for dyeing.  This one does a great job for both!  There is a hole at the top for convenient hanging from a hook anywhere you want to put one.  The scale arrived already calibrated but there are instructions for manually calibrating it (without the need to use a calibration weight).  I did check its accuracy using a 50g weight, and the reported weight was absolutely correct.There is also a timer which is a nifty second additional function that helps me time fiber soak times (or food soaking/seasoning times).This scale is perfectly utilitarian but at the same time it looks nice enough to leave out in plain sight (mine is hanging from a hook in the kitchen).  It isn't terribly heavy, so I didn't need to worry about it being too much for the small cup hook I used.It weighs in both kg/grams and pounds/ounces and is easy to switch between the two.  It also has a nice 'tare' function so you can automatically allow for the container weight in whatever you a checking.I can't think of a single complaint.  It's a scale, a timer, and it works great!
Great price and worked better than I thought it would.  I dry pineapple and it really speed-ed up the process to get the raw fruit into the dryer.

I use to use pie crusts savers that were in sections but they never stayed in place when I moved things in and out of oven and I was always having to readjust.  This occasionally resulted in burnt fingers.  This crust shield stays in place, saving my fingers
summary: No more burned crusts or fingers

reviewText: we were replacing our old coffee makers cause they just quit working on us. So when i found this one on amazon i bought 2 of them cause me & my husband drink 2 different types of coffee & we both drink awhole pot & no one likes to wait for thier coffee. This maker is really nice it's features are as followed. It has a big water reservoir with the cup numbers on both sides which makes it easy to read. the spout turns into the reservoir so that you can empty the basket. The led light on the clock is really bright at night. It's easy to read in any light. with the delay brew you can set it to have your coffee ready for you when you wake up. It takes 10 minutes from start to finish & you have hot & ready coffee waiting. It will shut off by it's self after 2 full hours of being on which is great. It does have pause & serve which lets you get a cup while it's still brewing. The pot is light weight easy to fill with water & easy to pour into the big reservoir. the lid which is the whole top is easy to open & close. The buttons to set the clock are so easy to use. it has on & off buttons as well as the delay button. So if you wait more coffee just turn it on or if you are done just turn it off. The set delay button & minute & hour buttons are easy to read & easy to push. You can't go wrong with this coffee maker. It uses the 8-12 cup filters or the filter basket. we use both in ours(my husband uses the filters & i use the basket.) It has a great price as well.

This is a great basic egg poacher.  It's much easier to use than some of the fancier units out there, both traditional or electric.  The cooked eggs release well, especially if a little drop of canola oil is rubbed into the depressions before adding the eggs.  It's very straight forward to get the eggs cooked to just the correct firmness.  Hard to beat at this price!

Wonderful!  I bought this for our camper and it fits perfectly over the top cabinet door.  I hang it on the outside so that I can just reach up and grab a paper towel.  No mounting and you could even take it off and find a place for it outside if needed. Definitely recommend

These are nice, durable, and Made In The USA, glasses (thank goodness; we need more items made here).  Anyway, they weren't, originally, what I was looking for (which was something similar, but smooth, not fluted, or whatever one might call it. They have "grown" on me, as it were, because the design does make them easier to hold.  Only problem, I really only needed two, not six, but oh well. Clear design is nice to see what one is drinking, also works for any beverage (I bought these for "Iced Latte" mix (I buy at the store: cheaper than "Starbucks"). They come in a variety of sizes, but these are about right.
summary: Nice, not quite what I was originally looking for but it "grew" on me.

reviewText: Great value and quality. We used these for a baby shower and are sure to use again for future events.

In my humble opinion, Glasslock by Snapware is simply the best glass storage option for my purposes.  I removed all my BPA plastic storage pieces and replaced them with Glasslock.  I did a lot of comparison research and finally went with Glasslock.  The seal is rock solid.  The glass is a little heavy, but I think it is minimal due to its sturdiness.  I do not microwave in it with the lid on either, but I do wash the lids on the top rack of the dishwasher.  I  use the 8 cup piece to store all the lids in.  A lot of Glasslock pieces do not nestle for storage, and therefore, takes up more space, but again, I think these are all minimal compared to the health benefits.  I pack my lunch for work everyday, and this set has a ton of pieces that fit perfectly into my lunch bag.  Compared to plastic storage, the glass also keeps the food colder when it's in the fridge, and it heats the food quicker in the microwave and keeps the food hotter longer after being heated up.Update:  10/19/10:  One slight complaint.  I dropped one of these containers the other day.  The good news is the glass did not break, shatter, or chip.  The bad news is one of the locks snapped off.  So now I only have 3 locks instead of 4 on one container.
Daughter uses this in her food truck and it has been used at home,  works well in each place. Would order again
I bought for my 15 year old granddaughter.  She loves to bake.  She loves this pan especially because of the lid.

I was hoping this would be a great product, but was left rather underwhelmed. On first look, theNesco American Harvest JB-50 2-in-1 Juicer/Blender, White with Green Trimis attractive but doesn't appear to be made from top notch materials, except, perhaps for the nice, heavy glass pitcher. The plastics of the juicer are fine, so I have no big problem with them. However, the plastic, green latches that hold the juicer and blender onto the base are very cheap looking and feeling. I can only hope they're made out of some space-age technology and they're more durable than they seem.While the blender looks great, unfortunately with only two speeds and pulse, it doesn't work very well at all. I even tried one of the recipes included in the instruction booklet and was left with a chunky drink that needed to be more pulverized. In my application, the blender could only be used with softer foods and liquids, and though it says it can crush ice, I seriously doubt it'd do a good job. The juicer ended up working better, with a decent amount of juice, and left less excess waste than I thought it would. Although the pulp ends up more around the filter sieve than in the bin. One other bad thing is the shoot is pretty small, so fruits and veggies have to be cut smaller than other juicers, which means more preparation. There is some good: suction cups that keep the machine from moving around while in use and the latches must be locked for the product to work, so mishaps aren't likely to happen. Switching out from the blender to the juicer and vice versa is a smooth operation and takes no time at all. The recipes are actually quite good and I will try others out eventually. I didn't find it too hard to clean, but it would have been nice had they included a cleaning brush for the filter sieve.This isn't tops in either juicing or blending departments, but it might be a decent starter for those who haven't juiced before or casual users who would like both appliances in one product. As for me, I might break out the juicer for small jobs, but I'll likely stick with the big guns in the future.
summary: (2.5 stars) Decent starter for beginners, intermediate to advanced, look elsewhere

reviewText: No complaints.  These are bags fit my vacuum and I didn't have to scour the ends of the earth to find them.
so far not used this could not figure it out not great bought a food processor for shredding much easier to use than these attachment Pack

Although I appreciate the 100% PTFE and PFOA Free aspect of the Ozeri G.E.F.P.--as well as its thickness and ceramic coating which provides a very even, nice and thorough cooking--when it comes down to making an omelette, it does not beat a teflon skillet. Price-wise, it is well-worth it. I will buy another for general cooking, but I will hold on to my teflon pan for the eggs.

I didn't get a utensil drying rack at Ikea, and I needed a metal one that would easily hang on the drying rack that I did remember to buy at Ikea. This metal one fit the bill perfectly.Pros:-large enough to hold several days worth of utensils-large enough also to hold cooking utensils like spatulas and ladles-great price-pretty nice quality, doesn't feel cheap or cheaply paintedCons:-some smaller items tend to slip through the cracks in between the little compartments-if you put the utensil handle side down, it comes out through the bottom of the compartment if the handle is small enoughOverall, I'm really happy with the purchase as it was exactly what I needed for my drying rack. I hang it off the edge of the drying rack, so it doesn't take up any additional counter space, and I kind of use it as more of a utensil drawer than my actual utensil drawer since it can hold so much.
summary: Perfect complement to that metal IKEA drying rack

reviewText: I mistakenly purchased a queen size instead of king size.  The company (I paid postage since it was my fault) took the queen size back and promptly shipped the king size.  It looks great on the bed in our guest room.  The color is a nice muted sage and the shams fit king size pillows easily.

A nice looking kitchen scale from SmartWeigh.Fast and accurate, it's more compact than many scales. That saves space on the kitchen counter, but means larger bowls may obscure the readout (but that was a problem with only the very largest bowls I own). The display is large and easy to read (but not backlit).I compared some sample weights (both to other scales and to their labels) and accuracy is right-on. Weight is displayed in english or metric measure. It auto-shuts-off to save battery. The button-style CR2032 battery is included. Construction seems robust. The smooth tempered glass weighing platform should both resist scratching and wipes clean easily. The 11lb weight limit is sufficient to allow weighing parcels or other non-food items.If you haven't yet made the transition from old-school volume measurements in cooking (ie, 2 1/2 cups of flour) to measuring by weight, you're missing out. It's easier, much more accurate, and gives you less dishes to wash (since you can tare the scale to include the weight of the container the ingredient goes in). When I finally made the transition, it made every penny spent on the kitchen scale well worth it. And in the case of Smart Weigh, it's not that many pennies.[ A sample was provided to me for review. ]I also have a couple of other SmartWeigh products, and they are all similar in being well-designed, competent, solid products with a clean aesthetic. And pricing trends below their competition. This one is no exception. Recommended.

I have been using this pillow for several weeks.  I use the Sleep Tite by Malouf Hypoallergenic Pillow Protector with it.  I bought it because I know that memory foam tends to sleep a bit warm.  The zoning in this pillow has now converted me to using memory foam.  My first couple of memory foam pillows were given away to nephews etc.  This pillow is great.  It is firm, yet plush allowing your head to experience a soft cradling effect while not turning into a board or smushing all the way flat.  My neck feels great after sleeping on this pillow.  As a side sleeper, the ends of the pillows are the perfect combination of firmness and plushness.  When propped up to read in bed, the center offers the support you need.Some spoke about the smell.  I removed this from the box, then the zippered container, and let it set for an hour or so.  Fresh out of the box there was no smell.  An hour later there was no smell.  Despite that, I figured that the people complaining about a smell could not be completely wrong, so I followed the advice of several others by rolling the pillow like you would roll a sleeping bag and then let it fluff up again.  Still there is not a smell.I have just one question:  Can someone tell me how to get my dog to understand that the pillow is for me and not for her?  :)

I have owned a Hoover brand carpet cleaner, rented Rug Doctor carpet cleaners and had my carpets professionally cleaned. I own 3 dogs who occasionally have `accidents' inside, a pre-teen daughter prone to spills, and a husband who thinks the house is self-cleaning.  Berber carpets in the living, hall and dining areas, as well as a home gym.  The bedrooms have an older shag carpet.  I've never used a machine spot cleaner before, and love the idea of a machine that gives you two cleaners for the price of one.Enter Bissell's Lift-Off Deep Cleaner...The Machine:It's a heavy one - 30+ pounds. Moves remarkably well though, despite its heft. The Lift-Off portable section is about 15 pounds by itself.  The directions are somewhat sparse but by looking at the labeled diagrams and reading the short `how to's' you can figure it out.No diagram for the Lift-Off specifically is in either guide and the directions for portable spot cleaning mode are somewhat poor.  I could get the Lift-Off portion off, but found reseating it to be a bit of a struggle, with the directions offering no help.  Eventually I ended up at the Bissell site watching videos for guidance.  That did help, and I'd recommend checking it out prior to using this Bissell product.A Quick Start Guide and a Bissell User's Guide are included in the package, along with the deep cleaner and a starter 8 ounce bottle of Bissell's 2x Professional Deep Cleaning Formula.The portable Lift-Off is where the dirty water container and the water/solution tank is housed.  It sits on top of the rolling base with the brushes. A foot pedal on the left (as you face the machine) releases the Lift-Off for use. The cord containment is wrapped around the Lift-Off portion, and the hose for the Lift-Off is wrapped around the opposite side of the Lift-Off from the cord.  The place where you attach one of two attachments to the Lift-Off hose is upright towards the right back (facing machine) of the Bissell.  Overall, it is a very efficient design.The on/off switch is on the Lift-Off and operates the entire Bissell Deep Cleaner. You need to depress it and let the machine sit running for one minute prior to using it after you add the water/solution tank when it's filled and ready to go.  NOTE: The Bissell is noisy - sort of like a small jet engine, so you may want to wear ear protection if using this machine for a long time.The `trigger' is on the handle.  You have to install the handle prior to using the Bissell.  This takes 4 Phillips head screws (included) and a long-handled Phillips head screwdriver (not included).  Patience is key when doing this one.  The screw holes are not visible, but the holes are marked with arrows on the black plastic handle. You have to feel your way until the screws seat and start to work their way in.  A mildly frustrating endeavor, but it worked eventually and the handle is securely fastened to the unit once these screws are in place.The Bissell Formula:Bissell recommends you use only their formulas in this machine. The current Bissell formulas are 2x's as concentrated as before - leaving you to believe you'd need less to do the same job. Honestly, I'm not sure if that's the case, but the formulas are 2x's the price of non-concentrated formulas!I managed to find a 64 ounce bottle for the 50 ounce price at my local store.  I had planned on buying the solution from Amazon with the buy 3 get one free (4 for 3) promotion, but even with that promotion, it was cheaper to buy it locally. So check solution prices before you buy. I also got a Bissell Pretreat spray for over 50% less than it was on Amazon - at a local store.Several Bissell formula choices are available:Bissell 2X Professional Deep Cleaning Formula, 48 ounces, 78H63,Bissell 2X Fiber Cleansing Advanced Formula, 24 Ounces, 62E5,Bissell 2X Pet Stain and Odor Advanced Formula, 24 Ounces, 99K5,Bissell 2X Multi-Allergen Advanced Formula, 24 Ounces, 89Q5,Bissell 2X Natural Orange Extract Advanced Formula, 24 Ounces, 83P3, andBissell 2X Lavender Essence Advanced Formula, 24 Ounces, 34B5.  I suggest if you plan on cleaning a larger than 500 sq' area, you pick up more solution than the starter 8 ounce that came with the Bissell Lift-Off Deep Cleaner.The Bissell 2x Professional Deep Cleaning Formula smells very fresh.  Strong while cleaning your carpets, but that softens as the carpets dry.  By the time it dried completely, it was barely there for me, but a faint clean scent remained.  If you are highly sensitive to scents, you may want to avoid it though, and try the Allergen formula.Warning: regarding Professional Deep Cleaning Formula strength -  if you don't want your hands to get chaffed, don't let your skin touch the solution or solution/water mixture.  I'd suggest wearing rubber gloves while emptying and filling tanks - I didn't and my hands paid the price.Carpet Deep Cleaning:I chose to test drive this model in our home gym. Daily use in this room,  but not heavy traffic. I vacuumed well with aDyson DC28 Animalvacuum first.  Some spots and high traffic areas were visible on the carpet, and were sprayed withBissell Tough Stain PreCleaner, 22 ounces, 40015 minutes prior to deep cleaning.To begin you  use 2 ounces (1/4 cup) per tank full of Bissell Formula solution (your choice) into hot tap water to the line on the water/solution tank.  I suggest using a funnel  not included) for this task, and  putting the water in first, as if you put the solution first you will get a lot of foam. Swirl to mix. Place tank into spot on machine. Turn on the machine to pre-heat for one minute prior to deep cleaning or spot cleaning.Solution will be dispensed quickly if you follow the directions of pulling the trigger and holding it  as you move the Bissell forward and back, and then releasing the trigger and going back and forth to extract the solution.Some carpets may only need you to hold the trigger down going one way, as on the Berber it was easy to see the carpet got a good dose of water and solution  the first time - this would have saved on solution and multiple tank refills too.  Bottom line: this thing really sucks down the juice so be prepared to fill the water/solution tanks many times for a large area!For approximately every two water/solution refills, you need to empty the dirty water tank. At least that was the case for me. There is an audible change that indicates the unit is sucking air - the dirty water tank may or may not be to the `full' line (mine wasn't there yet), but it's full and time to dump the dirty water.  Grit may also be visible on the red filter as you lift off the tank, and you would want to wipe it off as it affects suction and performance of the machine.Grit and carpet fibers tended to collect on the bottom of the machine behind the rollers as it cleaned - even after a thorough Dyson vacuuming.  I took this to mean that the `deep cleaning' was doing its job and pulling out the deeply embedded gunk.Deep Cleaning Results:Almost immediately the room you're cleaning smells better.  Amazing how much odors are picked up in carpets even with daily vacuumingMost pre-treated spots (dog vomit - old stains) seemed to disappear after cleaning the spot 2x's with 5-6 slow passes over the stain in several directions.  Larger traffic areas that were pre-treated and received the same treatment still showed a slight discoloration, but were much lighter right after cleaning.  The water was black with dirt, so I wasn't surprised.As the spots dried, they were lighter, but still visible. Bissell suggests on their website that if this occurs, you use the Pretreat spray again and let it sit overnight before trying the Lift-Off spot cleaner.  I will update my review after trying that one, but for now suffice to say that older spots may or may not come off the carpet, even with a pretreatment. You should see a positive difference if not elimination of new spots however.Spot Cleaning with Lift-Off:I tried the Lift-Off spot cleaner on heavily stained spots on Berber inside my home, inside my car, and on my couch's upholstery.  I must say I was more impressed with this part of the unit, than the deep cleaner.Carpet spots in house: These were all dog vomit (mainly bile, some with blood - old Lab is sweet, but at 12 she's got a fussy tummy) spots, which have previously been cleaned with both OxyClean and Spot Shot.  Neither worked well.Carpet and Upholstery in car: coffee spills, chocolate stains, general dirt. About 8 years worth of general grime.Couch Upholstery: general dirt and home odors - no visible spots or stains.I pre-treated all spots on the carpets for 20 hours with Bissell's Pet Stain and Odor pre-treater (found locally, but not on Amazon). Vacuumed the area to be cleaned and then mixed the Bissell Professional Deep Cleaning Formula with hot water.  I pre-heated the machine for 1 minute and then spot cleaned three spots on the carpet.Because the brush on the attachment head seemed a bit wimpy for the stains (it's good, but these are 'ugh' stains...), I used a cleaning brush I have at home to scrub the area after putting the water/solution mix on to the area, then extracted the water via the Bissell portable. The power of extraction was GREAT - you have to tip the head of the attachment down, but it's easy to get the feel for it.  Several passes in several directions left the area dry in 3 hours.One tip while using the Lift-Off - tilt the head down and over the area to be cleaned and hover about 2" over the area as you pull the trigger to dispense the solution.  This covers a pretty wide path, and then you simply release the trigger, drag the attachment head securely over the stain to extract it. You do have to apply medium pressure to the head of the attachment and angle the head to get the maximum extraction of water and solution.The stains in the carpet?  Well, they are still there, but like the stains in the gym that were cleaned with the upright - they are more faint.  A huge improvement and I would have to credit the pretreatment, the Bissell Professional solution and the pull of the portable for this result. I intend to be more vigilant about immediate accident clean-ups now that I have this portable unit, and would imagine that if found in quickly and pre-treated with Bissell's Pet products, new stains will be eliminated.The car upholstery and carpet looked great.  Brightened up my light gray interior on my 4Runner and smells nice too. Very quick and easy to use in the car. No more worries about muddy feet mucking up the carpet!The hands-down winner in the portable testing was the couch.  I didn't think it was really dirty, but it had a cooking and pets smell to it.  That's completely gone and the navy blue fabric with threads of lighter colors, is now brighter and fresh looking. The muddy gunk I got out of it was amazing, and the Bissell was so easy to use, I'm actually looking forward to using it on all my furniture before and after the holidays.Overall Rating for the Bissell Lift-Off Deep Cleaner: 4 out of 5The deep cleaned carpet looked fresher, brighter and smelled great.  I think it did `deep clean' by comparison to the Hoover branded home cleaner and the Rug Doctor machines which just swirled things around on the top of the carpet and left a lot more water behind, for longer drying times.The heat, the  Bissell solution and great water extraction from Berber carpets, all left behind a good result.  As good as a professional cleaning?  No, but better than most home cleaning units and rentals I've tried, and you have the convenience of two machines for a lot of different jobs, and it all works well.Really loved the Lift-Off portable though.  It's a 5 out of 5 in my opinion and a surprise. I will use it a lot and because it doesn't suck down the solution and water quickly at all, it will save me a ton money in spray-on carpet and upholstery cleaners that never worked well anyway.If this Bissell had been able to eliminate old stains on my carpets, had better directions and a bigger water/solution tank - it would have been a 5 star machine overall.  Can any machine do that?  I'm not sure, but I'll continue to look for it!The Bissell Lift-Off Deep Cleaner is a great home unit for people with new carpets and furniture that they want to keep clean with semi-annual cleansing and spot clean-ups.For those of us with older homes, less time for carpet cleaning, messy families, pets and old stains, it's good, but not great in terms of a carpet cleaner. A solid, quality product with much to offer, it's  not a magic elixir to what is ailing your old carpets. While I had high hopes that stains would disappear with just a bit of extra effort - as seen in the Bissell promo video, I've not found that to be true.As for upholstery and fast clean ups of new messes, and cleaning your car...the portable Lift-Off cleaner is fantastic. A bit heavy, but you don't have to hold it while it does its job.Suggestions for Bissell:1. Bigger Water/Solution Tank: the small tank of water/solution mix is quickly depleted while deep cleaning. I could only get a strip of carpet about 4'x6' completed and then I'd have to refill the tank.  That seemed far too frequently to be running to the sink, but probably not all that unusual for most home cleaning units.2. Incorporate Videos:  include a DVD of the helpful videos from the Bissell website, or improve the Lift-Off Deep Cleaner User's Guide.3. Easier Handle Attachment: figure out how to have the handle attached before it ships to the consumer.  A tricky assembly, even with only 4 screws.Is it worth the price?  That depends upon the consumer.  If you want an awesome spot cleaner and a good deep cleaner - for sure it's a deal.  Particularly if you have a newer home with kids and pets.If you only really see yourself using a deep cleaner, you may want to consider other Bissell Deep Cleaners which also have heat, but are less expensive. Like this one:Bissell ProHeat Upright Deep Cleaner, 25A3.Take a look at the photos I've posted to see product photos, and before and after shots of carpet deep cleaning.UPDATE: 10/8/13Still using this cleaner and loving it!  Durable, powerful, and well made.
summary: Good deep cleaner - Great portable cleaner, but not a Miracle Worker

reviewText: Love the container that holds all the blades, bowl clips, etc. in one place.  It keeps it all together, so I'm not constantly looking and rummaging through drawers to find the parts.  However, I was not aware that I needed the grinder to be able to use these blades.  I thought they were add ons for my pasta rollers (duh! right?)  Anyway, I had to order the grinder before using these blades.  I just received the grinder, so have not had a chance to use the blades yet.  I am, however, looking forward to using this set, especially with the price of pasta going sky high along with all the rest of the groceries.  (THANK YOU OIL COMPANIES!!!)
I bought this for my bedroom.  Seems to work quite well on odors, dust, smoke, etc.  Sometimes too loud on turbo, but once air is cleaned, returns to normal speed.
This will cut into hard ice cream like butter. The two sides are also good for cutting as well. Very pleased with this purchase.
summary: One of my favorite ice cream scoops of all time.

reviewText: There are so many different sizes, ones that I didn't even know were made, and they seem like very durable plastic as well.  I love them, and for someone on a budget or just starting out I do not see why these wouldnt work for you.

We have a small farm in central Illinois and raise a flock of  approx 100 free range chickens, and turkeys, for eggs/profit/personal use.We needed a much larger cutting board for butchering our  turkeys that can range in size from 15-28 lbs.  This board is perfect for that use.Would also come in handy for processing deer or Canada geese, I would imagine.  But I'm not a water fowl hunter.Very pleased.  To me, the price was reasonable.  It fits nicely between our refrigerator and adjacent wall (for storage). Wont fit in any cabinets that we have.  Just something to keep in mind.Also, it has a slight contour on the board surface (not a smooth polished smooth surface like our smaller board).  helps prevent items from slipping around, but also takes a little more elbow grease to clean.Love it, overall.Good luck
summary: We butcher home grown turkeys, excellent for this purpose

reviewText: This is a great mug. It's not cheesy like some mugs I've seen. I bought it for a friend for Christmas and he loved it.
cheap good item does its job wellcant complain since i never had to leave the house to get it

There is a flexible part just around the edge that I like but other people did not like so well. If something is really stuck onto the pan and you need the equivalent of steel to pry it off the pan, this is not for you. By flexible, it is something like the edge of a rubber spatula about 1/4 inch wide all around the edge. Had another fat turner but I have a family that burnt its edges off. The same family can't manage a regular size spatula. This is nice and big so my all thumbs family can actually get the turner under the pancake and turn it over.
summary: OXO Good grips Silicone Flexible Pancake Turner

reviewText: My dad gave me this rotisserie for Christmas, because he knows I like to cook. I had never thought of having my own rotisserie, but given the number of rotisserie chickens I buy in a month, this made perfect sense. First, the rotisserie looks much nicer in person than the Amazon picture. It is stainless steel and black, very sharp and contemporary looking. It's easy to assemble and use, but you do have to be careful handling the hot spit. I make my small children stay out of the kitchen when I'm handling it. Also, I'm still working on perfecting my rotisserie chicken, as the outside gets very done before the inside is *quite* completely done, and I don't see a temperature adjustment on it. But it's still really good - tonight I used the basket to cook bratwurst in it.

With the three-color order of these stacking cups, I can pick out the sizes I use most often, just by recognizing the location of the cup by it's color. It is also easy to find where a cup goes after washing. You just look for the missing cup by the missing color. Also appreciate the 10 sizes, as opposed to the usual four. No more need to figure out how many tablespoons equal 1/8 cup!
Yet another recommended/mandatory cleaning tablets for our Jura Impressa machine. Again, a bit expensive but needed to extend the life of this awesome machine!

This is the second Presto pressure canner I've owned.  The first one is in storage, not a thing wrong with it.  I bought this one to share with a friend, to reduce cost, and both of us used it all summer and fall.  The interior has darkened with the water, but it works perfectly and I can highly recommend it.  We've had NO problems with it, as I never did with my earlier one, same model, so I highly recommend it.  I also recommend taking the pressure thing to the Ag Extension Service and having it checked before you ever use the canner.  It's a safety precaution in the better-safe-than-sorry category.  Not a thing needed adjusting on either of mine.
I love this cake topper so much, it is unique and beautifully crafted!  We haven't used it yet for our wedding but I know everyone will love it
This measuring set is more complete than any other set I've ever owned, and while I will probably never use all the pieces, it's great to know they are there. So highly recommended.
summary: Everything you could want and more!

reviewText: My wife ordered these for a tea party.  She is happy with how they look and the quality of them.

We have very little counter space so a drying rack was impractical... found this guy and we love it.  We bring it out when we need to use it and hang it by it's little hanging tab when not in use.  Washes fine on the gentle cycle and for the most part keeps its shape (sometimes have to flatten it out but that's expected).  Much better than using just a dish towel for air drying.

Come on lets be real this is just a strainer but for the price and getting three sizes was the selling point for me.Nice finish and not cheap looking. The mesh strainer itself is on the soft side and bends but goes back into place easily. Can be put on hooks and hung saving on drawer storage.

First of all this product does work.  I was using it correctly after three times. The first time I too like another reviewer had the plastic wrap under the bar, once I had it over the bar no problem at all.I find it ODD that no one reads the TV commercial, it clearly states which size of rolls to use for it.  It is NOT for the large rolls at all.Someone asked where to buy rolls that fit this nifty gadget, I suggest a Dollar Store of some kind they sell smaller rolls of these items.The reason I give it 4 out of 5 stars is because the directions are a little vague and also difficult to read or see due to the size of the font and size of the paper used for them.I did not read any of reviews before purchasing this product.  I got it from a mail order company, not through the TV commercial.I would buy 3 more of these to use with Foil, Parchment paper, and wax paper.

I have new wood floors and an outdoor cat who invites an occasional wild racoon to his dinner via the cat door. They both are adorable. However I was worried about fleas, dust mites, germs and viruses. So I purchased the HAAN SI-70.  On my first try: I swept all floors with a duster, then mopped all floors, then used the steamer; the steam pad even picked up more dirt. I'm so impressed and happy with this product. It's just me and the cat (and his friend) I do clean my floors once a week and spot clean cat area twice a week. I did notice the noise some complained about but it was only after the water tank was empty. This is clearly noted in the manual. The noise let's you know you need more water to steam with.

Surprisingly nice! This folding/roll away bed comes as a complete package and includes:- Light weight but sturdy bed frame. Uses springs with a solid "canopy" or trampoline type mesh to support the mattress. No straps or uncomfortable springs.- 4 inch mattress - comfortable. Much more so than those old fashioned foam ones!- Mattress cover - big plus for including a zipped mattress cover that is easy to remove and easy to put back on.- Cover - Zips up to provide extra protection for the entire bed.Pro'sComfortable, rolls away for easy storage, removable cover for cleanliness, store in its own case. Supports up to 300 lbs. Good for camping due to rounded floor/footing.Con'sUnlike many folding beds, this one folds in half almost upside down. This requires a little bit of wrangling with the mattress. The mattress is light weight and the bed frame itself will hold in a true position so this shouldn't be an issue for the majority of people but it is worth mentioning for the elderly or those with some mobility related concerns.OriginThis is made in China. Comes with a 1 yr warranty. Does NOT include a strong odor or harsh chemical smell like many other related products.
summary: 4.5 stars - great bed with one small consideration!

reviewText: One set that came in was supposed to work with my $200.00 vacuum machine. Doesn't work. No place to hook it up, these boxes you squeeze once. That all the vacuum you get.
summary: I order two sets of these. One set that plugs up to vacuum

reviewText: I would recommend this product.  It is good for multiple surfaces.  I have used it for months.  Good quality product.

There's probably a billion ways to design this better, especially concerning the placement/removal of the filter and plug, but that 'ol fashion moonshine quality of making your cold brew (without actually making your own system) is part of the appeal, I suppose.It works. And, you'll be hard pressed to ever drink non-cold brewed coffee ever again. The distinct difference in "smoothness" is just impossible for me to overlook. I've lamented to the friend of mine who introduced me to cold brewed coffee how she's destroyed my food budget for life. Yes, unless you're a hippy and re-use the grinds/super dilute the coffee, you're going to go through a lot more coffee grinds. On the flip side, even "cheap" coffees can end up tasting fabulous, cold brewed (admittedly, I've never tried something like...Folgers in it).I generally dilute with whole milk and a dash of Torani.
summary: There's probably a billion ways to design this better, especially concerning the placement/removal of the filter and ...

reviewText: This works very well for small, quick jobs like dust bunnies, a small pile of sand, or a small spill of cereal, etc. My only complaint so far is that it doesn't fold or come apart... that makes it quick to grab, but you need to hang it or have other adequate storage on a shelf.
summary: Quick cleaning work for small messes

reviewText: OK, so I have to say, this gadget did not at first glance seem worthy of taking up any of my precious kitchen space.  I mean, I have a HUSBAND, so who needs an electric jar opener?Well poor Husband had a little accident whereby he detached his biceps tendon in his left arm (OUCH!) and subsequently had surgery.  Needless to say, he became instantly useless to me for jar-opening purposes!My Dad had been given one of these for Christmas and the instant my Husband saw it - he NEEDED one!  So I ordered it up here at Amazon.I must say, it works as advertised, is lightweight, takes up very little space (I keep it on the kickplate under my kitchen countertop and only put it ON the countertop when using it) and is a great conversation piece!Now, whenever I need a jar opened, I STILL call Husband, but only because he has proclaimed the jar opener HIS DOMAIN and not to be used by wimmin!  LOL!  Fine by me - but I HAVE used it when he's not home and trust me, it IS easy!
summary: Lids off - quick and easy too!

reviewText: I got this for my nightstand so I could get a drink in the middle of the night without having to get out of bed or turn on a light. The problem is that if I knock it over while groping for it in the dark, water spills out because the top is not water tight so it fails for my primary use.  I do like the fact that the straw does not come out but adding a little twist lock with the top would make it more useful for my purposes.

Havent had any issues with this.  Use it almost daily.  Cord being nicely reeled back into the base is a plus.  Not much more to say here except it irons my clothes just fine, no issues, don't need to spend $100-200 for an iron when this one does the same job and have a nice tucked away cord when its not in use.
summary: Good decent iron for a great price

reviewText: Got this for an office set-up.  It works, and works well.  The grind is consistent and easy to adjust.  Buy

The first set I received has a wooden box broken, so I returned it.  Amazon shipped a new set to me the next day, super fast, and I appreciated it.  The new set is perfect.  The knifes, kitchen shear and wooden box are well-made quality.  I have no problem with their sharpness or their weight.  I normally use the santoku and 8-inch chef knife.  The kitchen shears is also very useful and sharp.  It's easy to clean.  I clean it right away after use.  Highly recommended.
It's a great substitute when one does not want to add lemon to their canned products.  I have not noticed a change in flavor with it.
summary: When you do not want to add lemon.

reviewText: I ordered this for my twin size bed and it is way too large.  I decided to save it for when I get a full size bed in the future.  It is nice looking though and will go good with any color bedspread.
summary: Way too large for a Twin Size

reviewText: Again, same is true as I said about the toilet brush. Nice design and fits into a small space, but is expensive.

I've been having issues with my hand since a riding accident a little while back, so I got this in order to open cans easier. I tend to prefer a manual can opener, but this invention is GREAT!  You just pop the can in, lower the top and push a button.  It does the rest of the work for you!  Highly recommend!

I LOVE THIS THING!!! I was just going to buy a generic Mandoline. But then I read "Practical Paleo" checked out more blogs and found out about this one. It is so AMAZING. Super easy to use and its great quality. You can do soooooooooo much with it. I love it. I would only love a little more if it was Stainless Steel. But this is an amazing easy to use product. I am obssesed with it! :)
summary: Paderno World Cuisine Tri-Blade Plastic Spiral Vegetable slicer

reviewText: Not a bad product for holding our 60" TV. It's functional and for the price (got it on sale) not a bad purchase.
Super value.  These towels are a generous loft and function fabulously.  There is no reason not to make the purchase if ou are looking for a set of dark towels.

I am shocked at how much my boyfriend spent on this pot!  This pressure cooker is beautiful and really REALLY heavily built yet the user's manual says this cooker is not dishwasher safe!  Not even any part of it!  I find it hard to trust this Kuhn Rikon pot with steam under pressure when it can't be washed in the dishwasher!  My mothers old Presto pressure cooker was always washed in the dishwasher, and my daughter, who is still using it to cook for her family, is dishwashing it nearly daily to this day.  I'm going to ask my boyfriend to send this Kuhn Rikon back and buy a Presto pressure cooker.  He'll spend a fraction of the money and get a multi-generational classic.  Maybe the Kuhn Rikon is just a level of "fancy" above my interest.
summary: Trust it with steam under pressure but not in the dishwasher?

reviewText: We bought this pitcher as a cheaper alternative to the Dr  Brown's formula mixing pitcher and the Pampered Chef mixing pitcher.  Perfect solution. I can't believe I almost spent 2 to 4 times the price for essentially the same thing... except the Dr Brown's is smaller and the Pampered Chef one can't go in the dishwasher(reviewers posted that it melted). Simple to mix and simple to clean.  Now we can mix up the day's worth of formula in the morning, simplifying our routine, which is essential when you have triplets!  The simple up-and-down motion re-mixes the formula easily.  We'll probably get a 2nd one as they grow and are drinking more than 2 Qts a day.  We love it!
This is so much better thqn the pampered chef one we have had forever.  The lid is much lower profile and seems to be made better.
summary: This is so much better thqn the pampered chef one we have had forever

reviewText: I always reuse grocery bags so I LOVE the handles on this. I was looking at thesimplehuman Grocery Bag Can, Brushed Stainless Steel, 12.5 Liters/ 3.2 gallons, but $30 for a trash can that's just going under my bathroom sink is ridiculous. This was perfect for us.

I'm not going to say anything here that other's haven't said over and over, but I just love this mixer!Although I bake a decent amount, I never thought a mixer was that necessary.  I live in a small NYC apartment with a galley kitchen and NO counter space.After cleaning out some cabinets and realizing that I could store a mixer, I finally broke down and got this one.I can't believe how much better my cookie dough is!  It is just so more consistent that I was ever able to get it.  Making royal icing is a piece of cake as well.  I wish I had bought this ages ago.I love that it comes with the powder cover so that you don't get a cloud of flour or sugar if you dump too much in at once.It is heavy and I have to store it in a cabinet but as long as I remember to lock the tilt head, it isn't that big a deal to pick it up.The color is great.  I basically just wanted a fun color since I wasn't going to keep it out, it didn't need to match anything.  I decided to buy whatever color I could find for the least amount of money.  The "ice" color is a little more green than I expected, but still great.
summary: How did I live without this?

reviewText: I had originally planned to buy a more upscale tea kettle, but after reading the reviews that indicate even the high-end kettles have problems, I went the less expensive route.There is nothing sensational about this pot ... it does what it's supposed to, and it does it well.  When I'm using organic green tea, I remove the kettle before it hits the boiling point.  The shut-off feature works beautifully when I wander off, as I am wont to do on occasion. :)One serious design flaw, pointed out by other reviewers, is the placement of the water level indicator.  It's under the handle and darn difficult to read.  Also, the lid drips when the kettle is being emptied completely into the cup or teapot ... I wish the lid would go back further to allow for upside down drainage overnight.One reviewer mentioned removing the mesh screen:  I don't recommend this.  First, even filtered water can have particulate matter that you don't want to drink.  Second, the automatic shut-off feature doesn't work if the screen isn't in place, according to the manufacturer.  All in all, a nice basic kettle.  I honestly don't know why anyone needs anything more.

My pan cabinet was a nightmare to tend with because of the lids. I've purchased two other lid organizers that were more trouble than they were worth. This one has literally transformed my most dreaded to use cabinet into a spacious one used with ease as it was intended to be.This installs firmly and is not too deep of a fit (as others like it are where they extend over 6" into the cabinet when closed.) Mind you, we have to keep an inch or two in front of it clear so the door can close all the way, but not very much. If I had a really large cabinet, it could easily install on a side wall too. My husband had to change out the screws for shorter ones so they wouldn't go through the door of our cabinet, but that is a cabinet design. They'd have to ship this lid rack with at least 3-4 varying lengths of screws to cover all possible cabinet walls and doors. We don't find it a problem finding different screws as most things we buy require that any way.Six lids from small to very large fit in this. My lids are stainless steel and I have on glass dome lid. I do have to push down rather firmly for the lid handle to snap into it's proper position for one style of lid I have. For my other pan style (with a 1/2" inner rim that extends deeper past the edge of the lid) I have to adjust the angle to get it past the curves and seated right, but then it's unmovable until I want it to be. Almost every lid of mine fits in one of these slots and most fit in at least two of them, some three. The only lid that doesn't fit is my large, every day skillet's glass lid. It's handle is the wide, upside-down, oblong U (see next paragraph on tips for these kinds of lids.) I have one just like it for my stockpot that is smaller and if fits in the lowest slot just fine with my tip below.TIP FOR LIDS WITH THESE CABINET-TYPE HANDLES: I found with my one stockpot lid that if I try to set it in the slot with the handle vertical, it leans too far forward and is not stable. When I turn it so the handle is horizontal and then slide the lid a bit to the right or left so that it sits with one side of the handle down in the handle groove, it has a snug fit all the way down and does not lean forward. With this kind of lid, there will only be one slot with a perfect fit for each lid (which is o.k. if you have a complete set from small to large.)It's made of a very sturdy, thick steel. While it states chrome and not stainless steel, I don't see the difference between my more expensive stainless steel items. Not all chrome is equal and there is a higher quality out there with better performance. I believe that is the quality this has been made with. With it's special scratch-resistant coating, I'm hoping it lasts a very long time.
summary: Wonderful addition to my pan cabinet.

reviewText: I like this pan and use it quite a bit. It keeps an even heat, and can be used as a sort of dutch oven. The one drawback I should have anticipated is that it can be hard to tilt and serve out of because of the short handles ... no leverage.

I ordered two of these to go in my bedroom. They are perfect. Super sturdy, EASY to put together, and hold a LOT. I am going to put a little basket on either one of the shelves to up the decor a little, but seriously-- these are great. Don't overlook them. Great for the price and I am definitely happy.

I read all the reviews and complaints decided to give them a try anyways, I washed them before first use and did use low heat to dry, yes they shrank, but I expected that since they are cotton. They are not "thick" towels but I can not see through them as one reviewer stated. Actually I like the thickness.  I have used them in the kitchen and they dry the dishes like a dream, no lint and I don't have to wipe and wipe til they are dry. Very happy with my experience so far and would purchase again

The ultimate glasses for espresso coffee. The double glass wall protects for heat and adds a class to coffee drinking. I use them every day and so is my family. It is a daily routine and we can not use different glasses
summary: Bodum Pavina 2-1/2-Ounce Double Wall Espresso/Shot Glass, Set of 6

reviewText: Love that there is no glass carafe, as I have inadvertently broken several of these in my stainless steel sink in the last few years. Con is the cleaning is a little more involved than a carafe.
summary: love the no glass to break feature

reviewText: I have owned several electric blankets, this is by far the best blanket i have ever owned. Heat is distributed evenly, no heavy cords, feels like a regular blanket.

So happy with this purchase.  I've had this pan for a few months and it has quickly become my favorite pan.  Very quick and even heat distribution.  No problem with cleaning in the dishwasher.  LOVE IT!
This pillow cover is nice, well made, soft, the zipper is sturdy, and it is roomy, not too tight on the pillow.  I recommend this pillow cover!

so awesome. i love the idea behind these.  super cute, super functional.  the markings for measurements are clear (so you don't have to memorize which is which, or refer to the box or something silly like that), and the plastic seems durable.

I bought this primarily to use to dehydrate sweet potatoes for my blue brindle Cane Corso(Italian Mastiff). Dehydrated sweet potatoes are one of the few foods he is not allergic to, but they retail for about $15.00 per pound. After doing the math it was easy to justify the purchase of this unit. Purchasing one bag a week of the dehydrated potatoes works out to about $780.00 per year. Purchasing this unit for $50.00 and buying 52 pounds of raw sweet potatoes only costs a total of about $76.00 for the year--plus the effort and the cost of electricity.So I purchased the unit and the sweet potatoes, sliced and blanched the potatoes as described, and cooked them for about six hours. They came out chewy and a little moist, so I put them in plastic bags in the freezer to draw out the rest of the moisture. Next time I'll increase the heat a bit, and the time after that I'll just lengthen the time. Obviously this is just cooking in its basic form so trial and error is a basic part of it. I'll also cut the potatoes lengthwise next time and a little thicker than specified in the instructions.UPDATE: June 8, 2013Now we're cooking!  Bought two more trays and figured out the time and heat combination that works best. Unfortunately my wife and daughter are hooked on the sweet potato treats and are competing with the dog for them.
summary: The Big Easy: Easy to Set Up, Easy To Use, Easy To Clean

reviewText: These spatulas became an immediate essential in my kitchen.  The handles are uber-comfortable and they're solidly made. They don't feel like they'll snap or bend when stirring stiffer batters.As I don't have a dishwasher, I'm not sure how the spatula itself (not the handle) will hold up.  I ordered an expensive spatula from that home-party cookware company, and am highly disapponted that the scoop itself started to deteriorate.  But with these, I don't feel that will happen.  Excellent purchase!

I had one of these that lasted for 15 years. This one is definitely on the cheaper side - they don't make them like they used to. I don't expect it will last that long, but it does the job. After the timer rings, it keeps ticking for several seconds (10 maybe) longer before it completely ends it's cycle.

This portable coffee press is wonderful.  If you use the right (large) grind, the filter works extremely well.  Also, I'm amazed at how hot it keeps my coffee, especially if I preheat the mug.I still have to take slow sips about an hour after it is brewed and it is still drinkable a couple of hours later.
summary: Makes great coffee and keeps it hot

reviewText: These would work fine for home use in which they are always upright, but they are not suitable for travel, camping or other situations in which one needs portability.  The lids do not snap tightly, and they certainly will not seal out moisture/humidity.  I purchased them to keep with my camping kitchen gear, but they easily pop open and spill.

I normally use the hammer type of meat tenderizer/pounder and have my favorites among that type BUT my hands are developing some issues and so I was looking for something that wouldn't require too much hand or wrist force to flatten chicken breasts and thinner cuts of meats. This is the answer to my hand problems. The rolling action does not require as much force as my usual methods do and so on days when my hands are not in the best shape this will come to the rescue of our meal. I do wish that the textured part was a little wider though, it would be even easier to do a whole chicken breast without having to move to the sides and use more strokes to get the job done. All in all I would rec it for those who have any kind of hand or stregnth issues but have a need to pound cutlets, the rolling action will help alleviate the pain of swinging the little hammer type mallets.
This works great for grating garlic or nutmeg and zesting fruits... it produces very fine shavings. It would not be great for cheese.

I started out frothing with a lightweight 12-ounce Krups pitcher but decided to trade up, so to speak, as I became more proficient.  For one person,  the 20-ounce seemed like overkill, so I opted for this 16-ounce spouted version in case I graduate to "latte art" at some point.  This proved to be a very good decision.  I don't know if it's the shape or the heavier gauge, or both, but I'm definitely getting much more volume with this pitcher.  And it fits nicely under the short wand on my Mr. Coffee ECM160.  So, if you're looking for something larger than a 12-ounce but smaller than a 20-ounce pitcher, this is a good choice.  I'm very pleased with the performance and quality of this pitcher.

I own the Dyson DC07 Animal and though it is a fabulous vacuum, for the quickie jobs it is lacking.  I have always had a hand vac for the quick cleanups under the table and around the house.  My daughter bought the DC44 and raved about it.  Then I saw the refurbished DC44 being offered by Amazon.  My product came to me, in absolutely pristine condition.  I would not have known that it was reconditioned if the packaging wasn't marked as such.  I am 77 years old and am happy that I don't have to bend over and crawl around to clean up crumbs anymore.  The suction seems comparable to the DC07, and is as easy to operate.  I use it everywhere and for those quick clean-ups between major vacuuming.  I am extremely pleased with my purchase.
These can tolerate heat, so you can stir hot items with them as well as scrape and scoop.  Nice color too.  These arrived quickly
My wife uses this for a long tubular pillow. This is a good product that was as described in the Amazon description. It arrived on time, was well packaged, and had no damage.

I have been burning through Eureka vacuums every other year and have always been discontent with their performance even when they were brand new. Determined to find my dream vacuum I of course went straight to the Dyson. I know they are great but I can not justify spending that much for a vacuum.  After reading tons of excellent reviews on the Shark Lift-Away Navigator I was sold!  The minute it arrived I unboxed it, quickly and easily assembled it and went to work.  My first impression was WOW this thing is light and so quiet!  I proceeded to vacuum the area rug in my living room, of which had just been vacuumed with my Eureka a few days before. I was shocked and amazed and a little disgusted with all the dirt/hair/nasties that the Shark vacuumed up! I am in love!  Where has this vacuum been all my life? My only complaints are this, the extension hose is hard to extend, it springs right back, (could be because it is new)I am hoping in time it will extend easier, also there is no on board clip for the pet hair tool and I feel the power cord could be longer. For these reasons I am giving this 4 stars rather then 5. Even with the minor complaints I have I would certainly buy this vacuum again and recommend it to anyone looking for an excellent vacuum!
summary: Is it wrong to love a piece of machinery so much?

reviewText: It was smaller than I expected but that was my fault, not theirs.  It clearly stated the size.  It was what it claimed to be.
summary: It was what it claimed to be.

reviewText: Fits both of my 8-inch pans (with different edge shapes) equally well.  Looks great.  Like the see through glass that reduces the need to lift lid to check the cooking process.

I had a pasta machine that you crank yourself and it wore out.  I decided to try these and well they so much easier.  I make  fresh pasta a couple times a week at the very least.  I made ravioli's last night and I just rolled the dough and then laid it out and put the filling in  row  on the bottom half then folded over the other half and cut.  I then use a fork to press around each one.  I also make lasagna noodled by just cutting strips after I rolled it out.  You want wide noodles just roll it out and then roll up length about 12 inches into a roll and cut the noodles as wide as you want them.  The other two cutting blades work well for Spaghetti and Fettucini  and the best thing is they give you a recipe book and even a great recipe for whole wheat pasta.  I make mine in a food processor and so that is easy peasy.  Homemade pasta is so much better and fun to make.  It only takes a few minutes and is so worth the time.  Kids love to help with making pasta and well if you let them help a little the will eat better as they helped make it.

I leave this hooked on the rack. I have noticed if this new Termometer is right that our stove is 25 dgs lower then what the stoves sieze it is. So I just turn it up 25 dgs more. I really havent noticed any thing different in the cooking.

I got a tall (72") chrome shelving unit to help extend my small one bedroom apartment's kitchen storage.  I also wanted to add some of the pots and pans to hang on it.  These were on the list and, although I knew the S hooks at the home improvement store were too short, I did worry about the 5" drop and the slight twist.I was very happy to see they are quite thick, I have theCuisinart CRUH-6 Chef's Classic Cookware Universal Pot Rack Hooks, Brushed Stainless, Set of 6.  My shelving unit is shiny chrome, and it does not mar the look at all.  The 5" drop is perfect for me to easily reach them to take down or put up.  The pot hook end is perfect for any pot I hung on them.You can look at the other reviewers to see detailed measurements.
Not much else to say...  simple tech, tidy, smart execution.For dish soap, far nicer looking and easier to use than the standard container.
summary: Does what it should, looks great - we're using it for dish soap

reviewText: In addition to the "tippiness" observed by the other reviewer, part of which is just a side effect of the otherwise-desirable saucier shape, the problem with this pan is that the aluminum disk is simply too small to make this a good pan for sauces, particularly if you are cooking with gas. No matter how small your flame, you get hot spots on the thin lower walls of the pan. Had I thought more about the design before purchasing I would definitely have bought the anodized aluminum version.It is an attractive pan and pours well, so my initial thought after discovering the poor cooking performance was to use it on the table for serving gravies and sauces. Unfortunately, the tippiness makes that kind of an unwise idea.

Great all around wine glasses for the wine enthusiast to use on a daily basis. Mine go in the dish washer most of the time - but they do require a hand wash now and again to keep them free of residue.

I like this  combination of a portable hand vac and lightweight stick vac.  We have found that if works well on our wood and tile floors in the kitchen and adjoining breakfast nook.  We can also quickly pull out the hand vac to clean up the coffee roasting chaff I spill on the kitchen counter around the sink.  The filter is a bit finnicky to clean and the brushes and suction are not strong enough to do any sort of deep cleaning on carpeting.  However,  it is very convenient for quick cleanups.

Missing from the information is which end of the stopper is 1.25".  Is it the top or the bottom?  That made a difference.  I needed a larger stopper and this one was the correct size for a bathroom sink but not an outdoor/garage sink.  So my garage sink is still without a stopper.  But now I have an abundance of bathroom sink stoppers.  Each of these works better than the ones supplied with the sink.  So that is positive.  It is seldom that we use the bathroom sink in a stopped mode.  The bottom line is that it does what is is supposed to do and even though I am an idiot it works.
summary: Wrong One Ordered but works with Sink

reviewText: When assembling and first using the Samsung MotionSynce Vacuuum, it is evident that a lot of engineering went into this lightweight product. Some may even find it a bit over-engineered. It offers many options like built-in accessories (brush nozzel), the dust sensor section and even the 3 primary vaccum heads for use on various surfaces. I feel that Samsung could have refined and simplified the MotionSync a little, dropped the price a bit, and had a better final product for it. A single head that can handle and adjust to both flat surfaces and carpet like certain Dyson models stands out as a good example. For a corded vacuum, it has great reach and is fairly versatile. The innovative swivel base handles well and the large capacity canister is easy to remove and empty. It has such good suction, we're using it in our garage right now in place of our old shop-vac. It doesn't have quite that level of suction, but it is sure a heck of a lot quieter!My abode is home to a number of vacuums and steam cleaners, and the two other recent acquisitions that I'm comparing this Samsung model to are theHoover Air Cordless Series 3.0 Bagless Uprightand theDyson DC59 Animal Cordless. They are both coordless, so have a lot more range and are easier to use since you don't have to worry about being connected to a power outlet. They both run out of juice eventually though, so the MotionSync is your model if you need to use your vacuum for long periods of time. The 3 different heads are made for different surfaces, and the snaking suction tube lets you reach areas that standard uprights won't be able to manage. I like the dust sensor attachment, but don't really feel it is something that you have to have. It also requires extra batteries.Overall, this is an excellent cutting-edge-technology vacuum. If you don't need all of its bells and whistles, want to save some money, and prefer to have a (limitied battery life) cordless that nearly matches the MotionSync's capabilities, then I would recommend Hoover's Air Cordless Series 3.0 over the Samsung. Otherwise, no major complaints and a lot of kudos to the designers!~ Kort
I BOUGHT THESE FOR MY NEW DOWN PILLOWS, AND THEY'RE GREAT. NICE QUALITY AND APPEARANCE! HAVE ONLY HAD FOR ABOUT 6 MONTHS, BUT FULLY EXPECT THEY'LL STAND UP TO LONG TIME USE!
