(This review is posted for both the Aprilaire 600M and 600A units in order to contrast them and to describe their similar functions.)The Aprilaire folks say the “important considerations in the evaluation of a humidifier are precise control, sufficient capacity, trouble-free performance and minimum maintenance.” I would add cost, ease of operation, and ease of installation.  My sense is that this unit gets high marks in all of these areas.The Aprilaire 600 humidifier operates in conjunction with your heating system to add moisture to your air. It is called a bypass humidifier because some air leaving your furnace is rerouted to bypass your ventilation system and instead run through the humidifier, absorbing moisture through evaporation, before returning to your furnace and on into your home. (The bypass is accomplished as a function of the higher air pressure in the supply leaving your furnace than in the return air going into your furnace.)Generally, a hole is cut into your supply plenum (through which heated air leaves your furnace and goes into your home) and a bypass duct is run into the humidifier, which is mounted on the return plenum (which feeds air from your home into the furnace). Within the humidifier is a pad, which holds water like a sponge. As the heated air from the supply is bypassed through the humidifier, it picks up evaporated moisture and is run back into the furnace for distribution into your home.A hygrostat (humidifier control – set manually on the 600M and automatically on the 600A) monitors the humidity in the air and controls a valve to release (or shut off) water running through the humidifier. It is generally mounted on the return plenum from which it measures the relative humidity (RH) in your air.Water running through is a key point here, since when the valve is open, water not only soaks the evaporating pad, but excess water runs through a hose into your drain. I don’t know how much water is simply – literally – poured down the drain, but it doesn't feel good to watch it go. This leads to your first decision – hooking your humidifier to the hot water or the cold water supply. The hot water humidifies your house more quickly, as it is easier to evaporate, but of course the waste is much more expensive (and it’s not good for the environment to heat water only to run it down the drain).When the hygrostat determines it is time to run the humidifier, it generally waits for the furnace to come on and send it a signal from the control board (in most modern units). However, you can also install the humidifier to run when the fan is on without the heat (you’ll need to use the hot water for this). Finally, you can install it so the hygrostat signals the fan to run so that it can humidify your dry house automatically.Automatic v. manual control?It is highly recommended by the manufacturer to keep the humidity low enough in your house to prevent moisture from condensing (or frosting) on your windows, which could cause rot and mildew. The condensation point is a function of the humidity in your house and the temperature of the inside surface of your windows. This is a function of the thickness of your window glass and the temperature outside.The automatic hygrostat (600A) measures the temperature outside your home to drop the humidity when the temperature falls. However, it takes up to three days to make a significant change in your home’s humidity, and the hygrostat can’t know what the temperature is going to be over the next three days. The automatic control of the 600A is a bit more expensive, is harder to install, offers more possibilities for malfunctions, and doesn't fully do what you want it to - know the temperature in the future. Still, you’d have to have more discipline than I have to keep up with the weather forecast and run to the basement every day to manually adjust the unit. Although I chose the manual version based on the recommendations of two plumbers – one on YouTube and the one who installed my unit – I believe I would now select the automatic one.Installation was done quickly by a professional for $240 plus $30 in supplies. I was quoted prices up to $500, so be sure to shop around. The work is simple, if you know how to do it, and most plumbers have installed many of these.The maintenance seems simple – replace the pad annually (about $15), shut off the air bypass valve and the water valve in the spring. I suppose you should also check the water flow through the little orifices and stuff, but I imagine I’ll forget that until the system doesn't seem to work properly.Overall, I am very happy with this unit.
perfect misc cleaning around your house, car, anywhere on your property. easy to clean and reuse.

I've been starting to use these hanging organizers and really like the 80-pocket one we bought recently. So I thought this one might be useful. But the pockets really are so small that they really can't hold anything but pantyhose. I thought it might be nice to keep some panties in there too but the pockets are too small even for smallish, thin panties. So this isn't that useful because how many pairs of pantyhose can you really have? Three rows on each side with larger pockets would be better than four rows and small pockets.

It's just a basic piece of plastic, but it works well for cutting dough, scraping countertops clean, and scooping out bowls. It's pretty stiff and unless I accidentally melt it, it will last a long time.
This kettle looks great, heats water up relatively quickly, and manages to do it without leaving the water tasting funny. Exactly what I needed.

Well, first of all, I am not a regular cigar smoker. I'm one of those rare-special-occasion-only people. I got this just for transportation purposes.  I don't think it's a perfect solution, but for under $10, I think it's worth the money. Especially for how infrequently I use the thing.The main shaft of the tube is a pretty sturdy metal, as is the bottom screw cap.  Unfortunately (and for reasons unknown) the entire top portion is plastic, including the flip cap and the section that elongates. The only metal part in the top section is the pocket clip. It boggles the mind, frankly -- had the entire tube been metal, this would have gone from "worth the money" to a 5-star "Fanstastic Deal of Incredible Awesomeness" (or similar variant).Now, I haven't used the thing to actually snuff a lit cigar.  I'm pretty sure it would be fine, but the fact that the top section is plastic (which could melt) bothers me.  Now, the description states:"Inside this attractive tube there is a cigar snuffer that extinguishes your cigars immediately and keeps it safe until you are ready to finish it."Cigar snuffer inside the tube? I'm not sure what they're referring to, but it's a hollow tube. There's nothing in it. I guess "cigar snuffer" is media-speak for "a lit cigar in an enclosed tube will eventually go out due to lack of oxygen"?But at any rate, as a single-stick case, it works great. The cap is the weak point here though, because when closed it merely sits on top, and since the hinge is plastic, it has some side-to-side movement that makes it feel like it could break off.But for its few bad points, it hasn't failed yet. It's likely that it is actually stronger than it feels when you hold it.All in all, it does what I wanted it to, and it does it for a reasonable price. I think as long as you know you're not getting something that's metal all the way through, you won't be disappointed.
These worked just liked I hoped. I try to research everything I buy and I decided on these and have not been disappointed so far.

I knew I should have  purchased another Cuisinart oven but decided to try a supposedly " better" one. Don't even try that. Just do yourself a favor and just buy this Cuisinart. I'ts a perfect oven but most important, it's EASY to use, Works GREAT and is a lovely addition to my kitchen. I also bought the Cuisinart Stainless Electric skillet that I love also. Handsome appliances that work!

My husband works outside in the summer heat and it is always a struggle to keep his water cold for the day. I had these large ice cubes to his water cooler and it last through out the day. The ice is easy to remove from the tray and I love that I can pop it in the dishwasher. This product is essential in our home.

My elite died 13 days in and I have descended into their customer nightmare. How I wish I had purchased from Amazon, how I wish I had purchsed something different. By all means get a juicer, it will change your life, but not this one...no, not this one.

It does the job with keeping the cold at bay. Only reason it is not 5 stars is because i had to tape the foam around the air conditioner which took a while to do. Even though it is possible to do the job by oneself it would be better with 4 hands.I did not have the trouble with the quilted cover to stretch to fit the AC unit as some of the other reviewers. I would recommend and i would purchase again if needed another one.

I wanted the larger size(6QT) and the higher wattage 525. My other Kitchen Aid Mixer is over 20 years old and at the time was considered the home professional model. It is the Pro line 325 watt. I love it.I am not sure how this new one will measure up to the older unit. The first thing I noticed with the New Unit is the spindle that you attach your mixing blades to and etc. It does have a significant amount of play. The old one is tight as a Drum. Not sure if this will matter in the future and I can not speak of the New Units durability.I did use it to make a large amount of stiff bread dough and did not notice any significant increase in temperature of the motor housing as mentioned in other reviewsMy old pro line is built more solid. What I mean is it is smaller but weights about the same and the metal does seem to be a heavier type. Only time will tell if I made the right decision but for the moment it is a five star Kitchen Appliance.
summary: Just can't Think Of Any Other Appliance That Does it All!

reviewText: Love this ...Taymor Chrome Large Vanity Tray....It works great for my perfumes and lotions. Keeps things tidy and organized really well.

These towels are very well constructed but are a bit thin.  If you are looking for a thick, rich and full wash cloth then these will be disappointing.  I tend to like a thinner wash cloth that is a tiny bit rough to help exfoliate the skin.  These were soft, yet a bit abrasive giving me exactly what I was looking for.  I have washed them a few times and had no odor when I received them.They are holding both their stitch and color very well and are of ample,size to wash and lather you body with, yet delicate enough to use on your face.  Now they are described as "luxury" towels and as being "thick" so because of that, I knocked off two stars.  But as far as an everyday use wash cloth that gets the job done, this towel is well suited for that job.They were dense, but more in a cheap microfiber kind of way.  I have six of the gray so I will be using them again and have no problem stocking my guest bathroom with them when friends come over.  I will most likely try them out a few times more in the wash and if they hold their weave, buy some more for our other bathrooms.I recommend them for everyday and common use.

reviewerName: The Skies Are Not Cloudy All Day
reviewText: Got a blackish stain on the bottom interior of my 3qt. braiser and was so disappointed when it wouldn't come out.  I was afraid to try Soft Scrub, Bon Ami, or Barkeepers Friend, etc., because I thought that would cancel the warranty on my cookware.Since my cookware is still pretty new I thought I'd best get this cleaner (initially I never thought I'd need it).Anyway, I purchased this cleaner and put a small amount on my pan, as directed, and rubbed with a sponge and out it came!!  It didn't "melt" the stain out but with minimal rubbing it absolutely disappeared and left my pan looking like new!A little goes a long way and I will NOT be without this cleaner as long as I own Le Creuset cast iron enameled cookware!

reviewText: I like this container, it was a little odd to use at first but after you understand you fold the wrapper back down outside of the container and then pull that down to raise the bread it is really simple.  The idea is to keep out as much air headspace as possible.

Wow, who knew there were so many honey jars out there.  Wanted glass or ceramic and not plastic when I started, but learned from other customers that some of the ceramic ones were from china with LEAD used in making them.  Next eye opener was that most do not list country of origin, a dead giveaway as to where they are from.  Did find some that were made here in the USA with no lead used in making them, but could not find one I liked.  So I bought this US acrylic jar, and love it.  Is just the right size for one or two, but would require  frequent filling for a larger family.  The stick that picks up the honey is easy to learn how to use to keep the honey on it until you place in your tea or over your cereal, and like the way the lid slides off to allow ease of use.
This is a nice size bowl for soup and cereal as well as for a small salad. It's nothing fancy but I've had it for awhile and it's gotten a lot of use, particularly in the microwave! I recommend it!

I purchased Hamilton Beach 42-Cup Coffee Urn for our Cub Scout pack.  I purchased one for coffee then bought another for hot water used in hot chocolate and tea.Our needs were for coffee at fundraisers and to take on camping trips where we have electricity.It takes about 30 minutes to fully brew a pot of coffee and get the ready light.The coffee/water is very hot when it is done brewing.It is very lightweight and easy to pack.The coffee basket is plastic but it holds the grinds and keeps them out of the coffee.For the price we paid on Amazon, this is a no brainer purchase.
I've made 3 batches of italian bread with this bread pan and it came out perfect everytime.  The perforations make the bread bake nicely.
easy to put together, sturdy and has plenty of space. Great for a small bathroom. only issue I had was one of my cabinet doors was cut larger then the other by about 1/8 an inch.

My first impressions were that the Pancake & Tortilla Keeper is much too big and kind of ugly.However...IT WORKSI made pancakes this morning, and it was really convenient to toss them into the Keeper as I flipped flapjacks, instead of firing up the oven to keep the hotcakes hot.The entire batch was steaming when we sat down to breakfast.  And, when we were ready for seconds, the pancakes were still an acceptable butter-melting temperature. At this point, I did have to wipe dry the inside of the lid (not a big deal) -- the rising steam had created a good deal of moisture that was about to start dripping.By the time my husband was ready for another helping, I just put the Keeper into the microwave for less than a minute to heat up the last of the pancakes.IT'S HUGEThe size (inside measurements: 9" x 3-1/4") no longer bothers me.  I can see where it will be a plus when I'm making waffles or bigger batches of pancakes, and for holding dinner rolls or large tortillas.SAY IT LOUD, I'M PLASTIC AND I'M PROUDI still feel that the Keeper is pretty darn ugly.  It's plastic, pretending to be clay.  The texture and color suggest to me that it was designed to resemble terra cotta.  (It does not.) For this, I deducted one star from my rating.I say, "Be proud of what you are, Plastic! Go crazy in glossy candy-apple red, eyeball-piercing neon green, or cool matte black."EAT MORE PANCAKESThanks to my very convenient Pancake & Tortilla Keeper, I will be making pancakes much more often.  And, if someone should decide to manufacture it in a fun color, I will happily buy another one.

I ordered this for our home we just moved to & another table in same collection for a tv table. Great table for the price.

reviewText: I bought this item along with the following:RSVP Terry's Tamper&New 20 oz Espresso Coffee Milk Frothing Pitcher, Stainless Steel.  The cappuccino's I get out of it are on par w/ Starbucks.  At $4+ per drink this item pays for itself in about a week.  I don't think you need a tamper for it as I've not noticed difference in taste between the tamped vs. untamped other than espresso shot strength.  The frother's arm is quite short and discovered the arm's length to equivalent to that of a Pyrex 1-cup container (if I'm making a single cappuccino); for more beverages the above mentioned frothing pitcher is perfect.  I found the small size and appearance of the machine to not go well in a large, high-end kitchen.  It looks out of place.  The water chamber does get a bit difficult to open if you don't do so immediately after using due to the cap design and the vacuum effect once the water vapor cools down.  The machine is light, easy to move and clean.  I would recommend this item for anyone that is looking for an inexpensive alternative coffee shops for their morning fix.  The machine has more than paid for itself in savings since I purchased it.12/28/2011 -  To release the vacuum in the water chamber and make opening it easier move the knob to the steam setting.  This will suck air into the chamber through the frothing wand and make opening the cap easier.
summary: A decent machine and excellent value.

reviewText: Would I buy this coffee maker for the full price of the new model? Probably not. But the reconditioned one is a great value.It looks great, as is apparent from the photo. Keep in mind, though, that as a reconditioned unit, it may have some minor blemishes to its appearance. Mine, for example, has a very small dent in the stainless steel on its left side. It's not noticable unless you're looking for it, and that alone wouldn't keep me from recommending this coffee maker. (Also, as previous reviewers have noted, this model does NOT come with a permanent filter like the new model does.)What's a little iffier about it, though, are a couple strange design issues that affect usability.Every coffee maker I've ever owned has had a flip-top carafe--but not this one. You have to physically remove the lid to pour water into the carafe--a minor inconvenience, but an inconvenience nonetheless.You need the carafe to measure water, because there's no water-level indicator on the coffee maker itself. Additionally, the water filter takes up a lot of the space under the lid, meaning that there's a relatively small space to pour the water into from the carafe. It's enough room that someone without any mobility problems shouldn't have any issues getting the water in, but it takes a little getting used to.Overall, I'd recommend the reconditioned model of the Brew Central. It's not so great that I'd replace it with another one of the same model if it became unusable, but good enough that I'm glad to have it on the counter.
summary: Minor design flaws keep this good coffeemaker from greatness

reviewText: This is replacing an OLISO that we have had for a few years.  We hope that this one lasts much longer.

This makes it very practical for my non-food straining applications.Only four stars because the holes on the side are a little larger than those on the bottom and they're large enough that I have to be a bit careful sometimes.  I can only imagine this was for looks since it isn't necessary for functionality.

UPS dropped off the package and I was mopping my white, vinyl floor in 10 minutes.  I am short on time with special needs children who can really track in on a floor.  I could not keep up with it using a sponge mop and pail, and always needed a scrub brush.  This steam mop works really great and it is quick, non messy, and easy to use.  It is a little effort to push, but this helps clean the floor, you adjust to it very quickly.  I definitely pushed and scrubbed harder with a normal mop.  My son had scotch tape stuck on the floor and the steam loosened and removed it.  The cotton head scrubs just like a towel in your hand and the swivel head makes it easy to get in anywhere.  It is not that big and stores away easily.  Virtually no clean up after it other than removing the cotton mop cover and throwing it in the washer.The instructions say not to add any cleaner to the water and I didn't, but for a walkway where the finish is even getting worn, and it gets dirtier, I put a little bit of Bissell Hard Floor Cleaner on the floor and just let the mop push it around like you would with a normal mop.My floor was clean and shiny and sanitized in much less time.  The floor also dried faster since it doesn't get that wet.

Works beautifully- Can't smell the chopped onions, and even two days later, no gross film on them.  Fits into the butter compartment of my fridge too!  Screws on and off easily, and I love that you can see into it to know how much you have left.  I even stuck the remains of a package of mushrooms in there, and two days later, they were still fresh.  Highly recommend.
Attractive and durable, this knife holding tray fits in my impossibly narrow drawer and finally helped me organize my knives. Very nice.
summary: Great little item for small space

reviewText: I really enjoy this easy basket rack.  I'm using it in my pantry to put sandwich bags, foil, and parchment paper in.  It is sturdy and does its job perfectly.  I'm considering getting another one!

So far so good!  I'm enjoying making salads more and really like how I can separate ingredients, especially nuts/seeds which can get soggy if you add to the lettuce.  I love the three little wells and it sure saves the environment from all those snack bags that use to pack to keep my salad ingredients separate.Definitely a good buy.

Cute,gimmicky,and simple to use( as an ice tray). I've not been able to get the knack on how to bake in this. The batter comes out in clumps after being baked. I do like it though. Just using it for other things!

Overall, I'm very happy that I was able to audition these knifes and I do recommend them for consideration.  Without a lot of experience with various knives, I'm not sure if they are a good value at the current asking price of $300 - but they seem reasonable based on the following.  I have a set ofAnolon Advancedknifes that cost about $150 and came with more knifes (some of which I'll likely never use, though), and these knifes are clearly at least one step up in quality.  They are sharper, feel more balanced, and have a nicer fit and finish on the blades.  After getting these, I bought two Shun Premier knifes.  An equivalent set of those might cost around $500-$600, and I think that the Shuns are better than these Felix knifes in the same categories that the Felix are better than the Anolons.  So, in my limited experience and personal opinions, this set is middle ground in quality, function, aesthetics, and price.I've listed below the aspects that I like and those that I would change.  In general, I think that the whole set is high quality, the knifes are very nice, but the block, while sturdy and aesthetically pleasing, isn't a great functional design.Pros:- Knifes arrived very sharp.  This should be expected, but it's a pro to me because my Anolon knife set had a number of dull knifes when it arrived.  Cutting fruits, vegetables, and meat has been easy with these knifes.- The fit and finish of the knifes.  From what I can tell from researching, the steel is the same as that used in my Anolon knifes, but the overall quality of these knifes is at least one step up.  The have a consistent surface finish and exhibit an attention to detail.- The handles.  I was leary of plastic handles, as I thought that they would feel cheap and uncomfortables.  To my surprise, I really like them!  One of the nicest things to me is that they do not get slippery when I'm hand washing them with soap and water.- The aesthetics and build quality of the knife block.  Not the most functional (see below), but it does showcase the knifes very well.Cons:- The functional aspect of the knife block.  To its credit, the base is heavy and the block will need to be angled fairly far before it will tip over.  There are two things that I don't like about it, though.  First, while it fits under my cabinets just fine, I can't pull any of the knifes out without pulling the block out or angling it.  Sometimes I want to grab a knife when my hands are already wet or messy from handling food, so that isn't nearly as convenient as a knife block that has the handles angled out for grabbing.  Second, the knifes can rattle inside the glass if the set is vibrated.  For example, if you have them on a table and bump the end of the table like I did at first, or possibly if you have them on your counter and run an appliance like a food processor.As a note: the knife block that I received is not quite the same as the one pictured (at least at the time of my review), but instead is identical to the block that comes with thisMercer knife set.  They are very similar, so it's a note and not a criticism.  However, I think that you might be viewing this set based on the aesthetics of the block, so it might be important.  The differences are that the included block contains a metal piece with separators that help with placing the knifes, and two circular ends that screw onto the top of the metal posts to secure that metal piece in place.  That separator isn't installed when the block arrives, so you can use it or not according to your preference.  Without that piece, the block looks nearly identical to that pictured here with the minor exception of two circular end caps (which are the same metal) on the top of the posts.  You can also remove those end caps, but then you'll expose the threaded holes that they screw into.There is nothing about this set that I think is low quality.  The knife block, which I thought looked great in the photo, isn't my preference after being able to try it in person - but it is very well made.  The knifes themselves should last for many years.  Like I mentioned above, I'm happy overall with this set and really like the knifes.UPDATE March 4, 2012:  I like these so much that I bought a set (minus the glass block) for my mom.  She is also quite happy with them and specifically pointed out that she likes the handles on these.
summary: High quality knifes, not my favorite block

reviewText: After purchasing the board it had arrived cracked, and the company reached out to me, and not only offered a replacement, but gave me the damaged board as a gift. I am so impressed with Mountain Woods, as they not only stand by their product, but they make every attempt to keep their customers satisified. I would recommend highly!
summary: Excellent Board and Exceptional Customer Service

reviewText: This works just like a thermos bottle should.  Follow the directions for use and it works every time.  Can't believe how my coffee stays hot for long periods.  Also, cold things stay cold for a very long time.  I put ice and water in it when we went to Key West and it stayed cold for a 24 hour period in a hot van.  Unbelievable!!

This order was placed based on the excellent service obtained from the previous model which I used for many years. The prior model was still functioning in excellent fashion and was donated to my niece - my reason for purchase was to upgrade to the lithium battery power supply now available.

I purchased this mainly because I was tired of looking at compost scraps sitting in a tupperware bowl on my counter. I bought it more for form than function I guess. It is kind of small, think kid's beach pail size.  When cooking dinner involving salad, veggies, etc. I almost fill it up in one day.  I prefer to empty it in my outside compost pile every evening, so that's no big deal for me.  The lid does stay up nicely, and it looks good, clean, so if that's what you're after you will like this one.
summary: nice looking pail for compost scraps

reviewText: No big deal here. It works. I expect it will keep moths out of my expensive wool clothes. It was easy to set up.

This duvet cover was a gift for my son and although he's only had it a couple on months so far, we are very pleased. It's a beautiful mocha color and the construction seems to be of good quality. Time will tell about it's durability but so far we are very happy with it.

I was worried this wouldn't fit but the handles extend above the back splash of the stove. I use it over two burners on one side. This leaves me with two burners free. Other than that this is your standard non-stick pan. It heats fairly evenly. I've had no problems with burning anything. I've fried egg plant and crab cakes  on it with each of the burners on low.It is of course difficult to clean due to the size.WARNING: The handles get HOT. I took off one star for that.

I love these molds. I think the tortilla shell is easier to shape and bake if you put the tortilla on the outside of the upside down mold, although the picture shows it on the inside, like a pie crust, ready for filling. I dampened the tortilla first. For crispier crusty tortilla, brush a little oil on the tortilla, or the mold.
summary: TORTILLA SHELL MAKER - JUST THE RIGHT SIZE

reviewText: I love these glasses!The case had the perfect amount of glasses for what I need.They are not the sturdiest glasses that I have ever owned, however, they are designed wonderfully--they are bottom-heavy, so, they don't tip over.  I had one glass that cracked, but, that was my fault (packed it wrong in the dishwasher).The design is really great--the four divots in each glass makes each one really easy to grasp and it adds to the design.As I mentioned, the bottom is thick, however, the sides are thin.  So, be careful how you load them in the dishwasher.Anyhow, I really like this set...so much better than what I had.Enjoy!
My wife and I love this knife.  It's a perfect utility knife, sharp, handy size, durable.This knife is the second of a pair of these we own,  love them !

Great pan.  Very heavy.  Cooks evenly.  Can serve in dish and stays warm for the entire meal.  Make sure you put in on a pot holder.  Full of Lasagna the pan probably weighs 15ibs.  Be carefully placing in on glass top stove.

The dust ruffle on this item is terrible.  It has splits in the corners for custom fitting however somehow they managed to stitch it together in such a way that the split is worthless.  The fabric is overlapping at the top so that the ruffle is bunched up and therefore does not hang at the same height as the rest of the ruffle.  Not a deal killer, I'll take it apart and fix it.  The spread is true to color and the texture is nice. I expected something a little bit heavier but this will do until I can afford a better quality daybed set.

This is a terrific value. I love nearly everything cobalt and had purchased some of these individually, over the years, for a lot more. The amount that came is more than plenty. I won't be upset if a couple break. None has broken yet--it's been more than a month. I like both sizes and we use them every day. They go right into the dishwasher.Update: It's now 1 1/2 years later and I have two tall and two short glasses left.

Little by little, I am learning to make our food from scratch. It's challenging, fun and the results are usually terrific.This is the second Kitchen Aid attachment I've purchased (the first was the ice cream maker which is great also) and we're very happy with it.I have made pasta from scratch without a pasta maker.  Mixed the dough, kneaded the dough, rolled out the dough and cut the dough. That was a big job!  The noodles tasted good but it was very hard work - I don't know how our grannies did it. :-)Making it in your Kitchen Aid mixer is a snap. You mix and knead the pasta dough in your KA, wrap in plastic or cover with a damp towel for 15-20 minutes then roll and cut. If you go to the KA website they have a forum and I found a bunch of great recipe on there and there's a video on YouTube that shows you just how to do it.(search 'pasta Kitchen Aid' and you should find it) Other then the resting time it took less then 10 minutes and the pasta was SO good. Next we're going to try part whole wheat pasta and then fresh basil pasta.I did make a test batch first (one cup flour with water to make a dough) in case there was any flaking/oil as some other reviewers have mentioned. There was one drop of oil but no flaking so it's a good idea just in case. It'll also give you a good idea of how to work everything. It was easy to clean with the included brush.Wonderful and highly recommended!
summary: It's so easy, and delicious too!

reviewText: The rack itself is nice - decently made and has a good shape/design. My star rating is based on that.But just a heads up: the dimensions listed are wrong - it measures just under 14" long (maybe 13 3/4) and just shy of 12" wide (as listed).I am returning mine, but if the dimensions work for you, it should serve well, good value.

I had my ties on a drawer, taking a lot of valuable space on a small apartment.This solved my problems and allowed me to have all my ties ready to be used, and presented in a way that allows me to chose them fast.I have a natural tendency to making of my apartment a disaster area. This has solved one important issue, and works a lot better than other tie hangers that makes you mount one tie over the others. It's easy to put the ties onto this hanger, and to take them from it.Great purchase!
summary: Why didn't anyone thought of this before?

reviewText: These are really cute, and are fairly durable considering they are collapsible.  The are "accessory" organizers, so they are fairly small.  I think the price is a little high for how small they are, but beyond that, and if you need this size, I would recommend them.  The only thing I haven't liked about these type of boxes is that you can't really wipe them down for cleanliness.  These are cute, but I wouldn't use them in a bathroom or kitchen.  These are closet or laundry room only.
summary: These are great, but very small. Check the size before ordering

reviewText: The Eureka AirSpeed does a good job as a quick touch-up vacuum. It offers a number of advantages, chief among them that it's extremely light. It's also corded and so is pretty powerful, and it's easy to assemble and use. All very good. Against this are a few disadvantages. At 16 feet, the cord is rather short. Looking at other stick vacuums on Amazon, this doesn't seem to be an unusual length for this type of product, but it is inconvenient. Plug the vacuum in a few feet from the base of your stairs, and you may have trouble doing the entire stairway without moving the cord to a different outlet. The vacuum comes with a crevice tool. The tool has a ring that attaches to the stick of the vacuum, but the connection is not very strong and the thing falls off constantly. Finally, the handle does not feel very strong where it attaches to the vacuum unit. I feel like it would snap if too much pressure were put on it. None of these complaints are a big deal, but they do detract a bit from the user experience. To sum up, here are my pros and cons:PROS-- VERY light weight-- Easy to assemble-- Easy to use (emptying, for example, and putting back together again)-- Corded/powerfulCONS-- 16-foot cord is too short for some tasks-- Crevice tool falls off routinely when in storage position-- Handle doesn't feel solid
summary: Lightweight vacuum does a decent job

reviewText: I got this especially for upstairs where we have no carpets, only hardwood floors. I am amazed how well the head handles corners, baseboards and underneath all kinds of furniture. Time will tell, but I think the filters might last a lifetime as these are made of plastic - even the accordion style one. Filters are very easy to wash and no issues with putting everything together. I am pleased with this purchase.As an added bonus, our 2 month old son falls asleep every time I vacuum the house. The noise is soothing and definitely can be used at night unlike our upright Eureka which wakes up the whole neighborhood! I wouldn't use it for carpet cleaning as already noted in prior reviews. The only concern I have is with the little felt pads on the head, I don't think they will last too long. Still, highly recommended for under one hundred bucks!
summary: Quiet little beast, finally great Euro vac in US

reviewText: Short of spending 3 times as much I challenge you to find a better one.  Mine has lasted 6 years and I use it 6-7 times a day.  I work it hard.  I have to use a feeding tube to feed myself and so everything has to be a liquid.  Any little specks or the tube will clog it and I have to take it apart and run a special tool down it to clear it.  So I depend on it being liquefied.  It does an amazing job.  Lesser blenders would have burned up.  It's not fancy no 10 speeds but it works and is very tough.  I have gone though 2 blades and seals 3 locking rings and one shock coupling.  Those were easy to find and didn't cost much.  I beat the hell out of it doing what I do.  It may have to run under a heavy load for more than a 2 min..  It gets warm to the touch but it keeps working.  I have another one that is 3 times that old that needs a few parts but it still works.  It is so old that the rubber feet disintegrated.  I don't use it because it has been knocked around and looks bad.  I keep it for emergencies.
summary: The best blender I ever used.

reviewText: LOVE this vacuum cleaner! It came fully assembled. I connected the hose and lifted up the handle and was off. I do agree that there didn't appear to be any difference in the "Hush" mode compared to the regular mode which I really didn't find to be a problem. I ran my old vacuum first, then I ran this one right after. This one lifted the pile up on the carpet with the beater brushes and actually made it look like new; the gross dirt in the cup confirmed that I bought the right product. If you're hesitating, look no further...this one's a keeper.

The design for this is very nice and it does fold almost completely flat.  The top has a metal ring inside the fabric so it stands up nicely in addition to folding flat.  The inside is plastic coated, so if you wanted to use this outdoors the interior would stay dry and clean from the elements.  The plastic interior also allows it to be wiped/washed out.  The exterior is a nice brown/brindle look.  The handles are very sturdy and attached well for hauling whatever you could put in here.  My only complaint is that the bottom does not have the same metal ring sewn into it, so it's a little top heavy when it's empty.  Also, b/c of that, if you put heavy stuff in the top, but not in the bottom it will tip over.  Overall, it's a nice bin and would be great for light/portable storage.
I use fat free eggs. I pour in both sides 2 1/2 MIN microwave AND PUT ON LOW CHEESE, ANOTHER 1 1/2 MIN  A GOOD OMELET... VERY EASY TO CLEAN ..THE OMELET TASTE GOOD TO ME.

This is the best pot I've ever bought!  I have 6 kids and this pot holds enough to feed the family.  I love how it can go from the stove to the oven.  I love how it cleans up so nicely.  I've had the pot for 6 months now and I'm ready to buy another one.It's now 3 years later.  This is still my favorite pot.  It has held up really well.  The nonstick coating is holding up great!

I've heard it said that if you only buy one pressure cooker you should get a 6 quart.  Well, I have a 6 quart Fagor, which is great, but I must say that I am really happy with my 3.3 quart Magefesa Practika Plus Super Fast Pressure Cooker.  I debated with myself which size to get, after equipping my boat with the 6 quart Fagor to handle cooking on a propane stove.  But for just the two of us at home, I decided my everyday use would call for a smaller model. Afterall, I have a 5 quart Dutch Oven for braising for company.And I am so pleased with the Magefesa.  It cleans up easier than the Fagor, and comes up to pressure faster than my 6 quart model.  It is perfect for our rice (and incredible stir-free risotta) - I dislike plastic microwave rice cookers and don't make rice enough to warrant an electric one.  This Magefesa made lunchtime soup and stews from scratch a breeze.  Its size is really the way to go for just two people.  For comparison, it's the same shape as my All-Clad 4 Quart soup pot, not counting the handle.
summary: The best for cooking for two

reviewerName: Joe Bruno Sr. "Fiction and Non Fiction author"
reviewText: I bought this as a present for my son-in-law for Christmas. This is really a stylish item, and I tried the knives out and they cut great.Great value for the price.[...]

This purifier is just what I needed for my basement room in my apartment. It needs to be place away from a wall, as it's a round purifier, but it's just what I need. It helps keep my 16x13 foot room feeling fresh all day long. I run it all day, usually at the lowest setting, but turn it on high when I leave. It can be very noisy above the lowest setting, so keep it on low when you're in the room.If you're looking to clean the air in a pretty large room, this is the purifier for you.
I wanted something that was specific on weighing grams and this little scale fit the bill nicely.  The readout is easy to see and it is very sensitive.  I like having tenths of grams.

I chose this pan based on the Cooks Illustrated review, and boy do they know what they are talking about. This pan is awesome! I've used it to grill fajita strips and steaks and it works perfectly.  Beautiful grill marks just like on a real grill, great conduction so it heats up evenly all the way across the pan, and the nonstick surface makes it clean up super quick and easy. One of my favorite pans! Highly recommended.

I got this set on a deal some time back, and these are still my go to kitchen utensiles.  I have never found another set I like as much, and when mine eventually wear out, I will replace with the same.
summary: Matches my set, and the utensiles are great.

reviewText: These were almost perfect, the best I have found in many long searches to replace my worn out seals for my glass jars. Very fast service.
summary: Hard to find replacement rings worked great

reviewText: This machine is a lightweight with heavyweight cleaning capabilities.With six cats, a carpet cleaning machine is a must. The big machine is too much hassle to drag around for smaller jobs, so a few years ago I bought a smaller spot-cleaning machine. That one was virtually worthless, and I finally gave it away.Then I bought this one. Wow! It's terrific - light years better than the old spot-cleaning machine. I first tried it on a stain on the carpet in the basement, a stain that had been there since we bought the house years ago. The stain had not budged using my big cleaner along with a pre-spot solution. Using the "set-in stain" button on the new SpotBot, I was astonished that this machine took the stain out in only one pass. I've had the machine for nearly a year now, and I haven't run across a spill it couldn't handle, including a recent incident with about a pint of freshly spilled house paint. That one took six or seven passes to rinse all the paint out - but I finished painting the room while the machine did all the work for me.This one is a keeper.

I want to offer a different perspective on this product than most other reviewers.To be clear, the product itself is inexpensive and frankly nothing special. A gas burner with a convection chimney and some propane gas lines. It lights easily and runs more or less as advertised, although as some have pointed out, it does tend to generate yellowish flames instead of solid blue sometimes. I get about 12-15 hours out of a single propane tank, and in my area, this works out to a cost of less than a dollar an hour for operating cost.Still, my experience is different, as I lived through the blizzard of 2013 in the Northeast - over two feet of snow, no power for five days and trapped in my home thanks to numerous downed trees that prevented our roads from being cleared for several days. Yes, I have an emergency generator, and it worked great. But after 48 hours, my generator fuel ran out and in spite of keeping the fireplaces going, it got really cold. As temperatures dipped to single digits outside on the third night, the inside temperatures in my home fell into the mid-thirties.Fearing burst pipes and other damage, I broke down and fired up the Mr. Heater propane heater, right in my kitchen. About an hour of operation brought most of my large home back to about 50 degrees, and from there, we were able to stay warm by running the heater about half an hour every four hours. I know this isn't the intended use of the product, and I suspect it was somewhat dangerous to operate this way - but, boy am I glad I had one of these units (and a bottle of propane!) on hand when I needed it.People might complain about the noise or the flame, and debate whether it's safe to use one of these in an enclosed area But I know that without it, the Blizzard of 2013 would have been a much worse event for me and my family. For the price, it's definitely a lot of peace of mind to have one of these pups on hand, "just in case".

InterDesign Una Mesh Storage Hanging Shower Caddy hangs on the shower curtain rod, keeping your shower basics handy without taking up wall space in the shower.  There are no annoying suction cups to mess with, as with most regular shower caddies, which is a big bonus, since those never seem to work quite right.InterDesign Una Mesh Storage Hanging Shower Caddy provides three large pockets and three smaller pockets, so it will hold virtually everything you need to store inside the shower.  The mesh is easily to rinse and dries quickly.This caddy was a handy addition to my small bathroom, providing additional, much-needed storage space inside the shower.
summary: There are no annoying suction cups to mess with

reviewText: The length of the metal piece that attaches the closet pole to the wire rack shelf does not need to be as long as it is. Making it shorter would increase the hanging distance another inch or two which would be just enough to prevent many items from dragging on either the lower closet pole or the bottom rack shelf.These are not the same dimensions as NSF wire racks.
summary: Assembles very easily, rolls nicely, but closet pole could be designed better

reviewText: The quality of these is good and the non-stick surface seems durable. The crevase around the edge can be difficult to clean though.

I have this mitt in black, its the best quality that i have seen around i had a silicone mitt before that started to crack and pretty much met. but not this one, this its made out of twill i belive with silicone lines along the hand part to insure a great grip. the inside its really comfortable as well and warm my wife was joking around but she said shes getting 2 for winter haha!
I love that it is all one piece, nothing to break off or come apart.I woulld definitely buy again, also love the color.
Sturdy, easy to put together.  crisp and clean.  My girls love the new bed.  Just what I was looking for.
I brought these because the colors are so lovely and they also wash so easy after use which is why I love using these.

This will make your grating project fly by, just be very careful to keep fingers clear of the razors that make mincemeat of fingers.  For the lady (Mrs. C) who said she didn't like the texture of her grated parmesan, she must have been using the large side.  I grate parmesan on the fine side and it is slightly curled and very fluffy... and melts instantly when sprinkled onto hot pasta!  We grate softer cheeses (cheddar, swiss) on the larger side and no longer buy the bags of shredded cheese because we found freshly grated melts so much more smoothly.  This has to be among my favorite kitchen utensils because not only does it work just as it claims, it is made of quality materials.
These boxes are great!  Made of hard durable plastic keep your batteries safe.  Small storage boxes fit in any drawer or tool box.  Bought several as gifts.  Highly recommend!

I was a little skeptical when my aunt told me about the product she saw on Pinterest. Once we received it, I have to say I was impressed that it held the ziploc bag as I poured in left over sauce and continued to hold it as it cooled. Folds flat for easy storage.
This is the coolest product and works perfectly in our motor home. It collapses so fits well in small spaces.  Made well and holds quite a bit of dishes if you're good at stacking! :-)
Good fit and good use with my new Bunn Coffeemaker.  Liked them so well, I bought a box of 1000!

I have a Delonghi oil filled heater that I purchased 20 years ago. I use it each year.  After 20 years use, it still working flawlessly.  Quiet, produce heat, turn itself on and off based on the heat setting. The relay is also very quiet during switch on and off.
summary: Trust this brand name after 20 years still working heater

reviewText: Going back to maybe 1997 I have owned a Panasonic Toaster Oven. The bottom heating element on my first unit burnt out early on, however it was still under warranty so I got it repaired. After many years of use it started to look shabby and I replaced it with a new unit around 2008. Last year I noticed that some bread was toasting unevenly so thinking that perhaps I would need to replace it down the road I started to look at what the market had to offer and I was disappointed that Panasonic no longer sold a toaster oven. For me the COMPACT SIZE is most important. I toast bread--warm pastries--melt open faced cheese sandwiches--and crisp cookies.  All I need is a basic oven and the units that offer so much more are over sized for my counter space.  It is just what I am looking for.  GLAD IT IS BACK.

My sister and I both love this dish drain - it folds away when you want to store it and doesn't have any nooks and crannies for nasties to form. It holds a surprisingly large amount of dishes and supports quite a bit of weight, yet weights almost nothing. Bought it on a whim and just had to replace it a few years later. Highly recommend!
Cooks low and slow,  it is deeper than most small ovens so great for pizza, and will go low, below 200 so great as a warmer or even a slow rib cooker.
summary: Low and slow, fast and deep, Pizza and Ribs does them great..

reviewerName: J. J. Burtch "In Life, Try to be the Type of ...
reviewText: In the build that I work in there is a small cafe that sells drinks.  It's really the only option for getting a drink in the building, unless of course you bring your own from home.  They charge $2.25 for a cup, then you get free refills for the day.So, I was buying a cup and filling it up on average about twice every single day that I worked.  So I was spending $2.25 per day, or $22.50 every two weeks on nothing but drinks at work.  I wanted to try and cut back on that expense a tad, so I started looking around at all of the options out there.  I knew I didn't want an actual water bottle, and a lady I work with recently got one of the Copco cups in purple.  She really seemed to like it, so I took to Amazon to find one.As is the norm for Amazon, the cup arrived really quickly in a nice sized box.I like it a lot.  It's built well, the straw is nice, and the top screws on securely.  It also seems to keep drinks cold for a really good amount of time.This cup has allowed me to save quite a bit of money.  Now, instead of spending $2.25 per day, I'm buying a single two liter bottle every two days and keeping that in the break room at work, then filling this cup with ice.  The two liter bottle is costing me on average about $1.50 every time I buy it, so I'm spending on average 75 cents per day on my soda, instead of $2.25.  Basically, I'm spending $7.50 every two weeks on soda instead of $22.50.So, this cup paid for itself basically in the first 7 days of me using it, and it's now helping me to save money...and as an added benefit, I'm not throwing away a foam cup and plastic lid every day!I like it.  Anything that saves me money pretty much every single day is a good buy in my opinion.

Love this pan.  I hang it on the wall in the pantry and it gets used every morning for breakfast.  The sausages, eggs and hashbrowns all cook on the same pan and come out great.  Be careful not to touch the silver part of the handles however, they are HOT!

i am single and male. the george foreman lean mean fat reducing grilling machine is what all single men need in their lives. it heats up quickly and cooks BOTH sides of your food evenly. the clean up is pretty easy too. ive been cooking chicken breasts lately and what little fat is on them rolls down right into the drip tray. this product is the bomb and will help the single male species include more nutrition in their diet and a healthier alternative to pizza delivery. im a BIG fan of the infomercial too. george is so engaging, entertaining, and witty! come on george, come on america, lets KNOCK OUT THE FAT!
summary: this grill is the undisputed champion of my kitchen

reviewText: 12/26 UPDATE:  My opinion of this pillow has changed for the better and I just ordered another one.  Apparently, the price keeps going up on these pillows, however I got free shipping from Amazon ($25 minimum order, now $35) on my recent order which more than offset the shipping I paid for direct purchase from the seller last time.  I don't know if the pillow has softened up slightly, settled more in its case, or I have just adjusted to its feel. I'm a semi-side sleeper with large shoulders that I keep angled during sleep (<90 degrees to the bed) and it provides about the right amount of loft for my neck.  Because it barely fits into a stand pillow case when new, the only way it could provide more loft support would be to keep it squeezed up while you're sleeping.9/27/13 - 3 star review:  For my needs, it's slightly too firm.  I think this pillow would have worked well when I was younger and liked a firmer pillow.  It completely fills a standard pillow case but I don't think it overfills the case such that that contributes to its firmness.  I don't know how it can be considered a "down alternative" in that it is significantly firmer than any down pillow I've slept on, but maybe that's why it's an alternative.  It's too firm and solid to "fluff" up by punching it.  It's firm enough not to"swallow" your head and cause breathing pre-warmed air (I like sleeping in a cool room).  This being said, I'm not sure that any pillow can be completely judged objectively, being mostly subject to the individual preferences of the reviewer.

I like the feel and they are a very pretty design.  BUT the fitted sheet rides up and barely hangs onto the corners.  The sides between the corners ride up and don't even come close to the bottom of the mattress.  Conclusion?  Nice cotton just not enough of it.

Inspect any professional baking station and what do you see - aluminum...Nordic Ware is well constructed and bakes beautifully!! Toss the dark Teflon pans because these pans clean just as easy...aluminum is the only way to bake!

This box grater is very good.  Each of its sides grates, shreds, or slices beautifully.  The cut-outs are very sharp, and the removable, sturdy base fits well and snugly, but is easy to remove.  Shredding cheese goes quickly with this large, sturdy, very stable grater.  And, it is super easy to clean.  It's large, but that's not a problem--I just store it in a cupboard with other gadgets.The handle is sized well and is sturdily attached to the body.  I am a woman with fairly large hands, and the handle is comfortable for me.  Even my son, who has very big hands, finds this grater comfortable and easy to use.  This is a well-made product with attention to detail.  I can highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for an excellent box grater.

I already have a set of these, and I love them. I take them to company potlucks, etc., and my boss commented that she really liked them. When she got married, I gave her this set for a wedding gift, and she loves hers too.

Easily our favorite recent family purchase.Easy to put just about any kind of treat inside, freeze it, toss it in a lunch, take on the road, you name it.I really enjoy having the control of what we put inside and knowing the ingredients.So easy to cleanup, refill, and toss right back in the freezer.
summary: Kids, adults, lunch, snack, treats - basically anytime family favorite

reviewText: This is a top of the line rice cooker. I've used several rice cookers over the years (at various price points). This is, by far, the best one. It's easier to clean, easier to use, there's no leakage out the back, and the rice cooks much more quickly.

I'm doing away with toxic products in my house and it took a while to find a non plastic storage bag, but I'm glad I did.  Yes, it bulges a bit, but it is well made and durable and I'm very happy with it.
Again, I love this pattern, the shower curtain is also very easy to care for, and it really makes your shower "POP."

I had these style cutting boards before and loved them - this brand is garbage though, totally useless.  They curl up and will not stay flat... this makes all the juices from stuff fall all over and make a mess everywhere.  They are useless!  I threw them out

I own this juicer and I've tested it against some of the vertical, auger-driven models (all are masticating, meaning the vegetables and fruits are "chewed" up and pressed out through a kind of sieve.) An auger acts to cut the veg into chunks and then as it screws past, presses it with great force. The Omega is an older, horizontal design, but it juices better than anything I've tried.Pros:You will get the most juice out of your vegetables and fruit.It doesn't heat the juiceIt will handle leafy vegetables like kale and wheat grassIt doesn't make a lot of loud noiseIt is relatively easy to clean.It does multiple things; can be used to mince meat very finely or press out pasta via a nozzle (you can make spaghetti.)Cons:You have to cut your veg and fruit very thin--even large carrots need to be trimmed. Apples not only in 1/8ths, but even those slices cut in half longitudinallyIt is slow; the ads showing you tossing a whole apple into a Breville Fountain (spinning cup type) juicer are true--but you will get wet pulp and you can't do tough leaves with spinning cup juicers. Even lighter leafy veg--they say "put the pulp through a second time.)It is large and heavy--and being horizontal, takes up the footprint of a large shoebox.Even with the "con" points, I've found nothing that juices better. Faster? Yes. But not better.
summary: Slow, perhaps, but juices reliably and thoroughly

reviewText: I bought this for shipping on ebay and it has worked very well.  It is extremely accurate and because it's so thin, it takes up very little room.  Many "mailroom" scales are big and bulky, so this one works well for me although it was designed as a kitchen scale.  I found it easy to use and think it's a good buy.
summary: Use for shipping and love how small it is

reviewText: So I'm getting to old to peel my own organges and grapefruit because of arthritis. I kept saying how I wish I had a Tupperware orange peeler like we had when I was a kid back in the late 1960s and 70s. People would look at me like I was daft. They didn't know what that was. My mom sold Tupperware when I was a kid so we always had these peelers in a drawer in the kitchen. I recall the joy of getting to peel my own fruit for the first time and learning to use this gadget. It's so simple and a child doesn't make a mess peeling their own fruit. Anyway, my hubby said why not do a Google search to see if anyone was selling these throwbacks to days gone by and sure enough they are! I was thrilled.  No more bugging my husband to peel my fruit or waiting for him to get home to have my favorite peeled grapefruit simply because I can't manage it on my own. This seller shipped super fast and had the best price. Now every time I peel my fruit it brings back memories and I get to retain a bit more of my independence for that much longer. <3

Miele RX1 Scout it so wonderful. It's beyond excellent on hard floor and does a good job on carpeting in between vacuuming. It's a sweeper, not a vacuum. If you have pets that shed and haven't vacuumed lately the brush with become thick with fur and who know what else. I found that out! But using it a day or two after I've done a deep vacuuming it worked fine picking up little bits of this or that.I love using it in the kitchen and bathroom. Those rooms have vinyl flooring and this little Miele RX1 Scout just scoots about doing its thing without a care in the world.One of my cats is terribly fascinated with the RX1 Scout and follows it around and seems to love it. I do too. I'm happy letting it do my work for me while I do other things. Wonder if Miele has any plans for an upgrade of this robotic sweeper that puts the dishes in the dishwasher in addition to sweeping?
summary: Excellent On Hard Floors And Some Carpet

reviewText: One reviewer claimed to have fixed the whistle by pointing the slots on the knob toward the spout. I did so on my third attempt to make this sorry excuse for a kettle whistle at the boiling point. No whistle, no "hum". No go, Cuisinart. You just took yourself off my favored list of kitchen products, a place you held for decades. I am so disappointed. And if it's true that you make customers pay shipping to return this thing, shame on you.
summary: Tried the fix - still doesn't whistle

reviewText: Did not expect the power or the performance.  I'm extremely pleased.  I bought it for my stairs.  I made the right choice.
They are breaking constantly and I am used to have my plastic clothes pins for more than one year. I have only a handful left by now.

Purchased this for my Husband and it is an excellent fryer. Easy to use and also to clean. Would recommend it to anyone who wants a good fryer.  The last one I purchased did not have the inner pan which comes out for cleaning and although it cooked very well it  was very hard to clean.  This why I replaced the other,  I am sure you will enjoy it if you decide to buy one.
summary: Very good appliance and great buy.

reviewText: Came out of the box surprisingly sharp - I was really impressed. Even more impressing, though, was how it maintained its sharpness through a lot of tough use. Also, it's not too shabby looking.
summary: What a killer deal - Delivered sharp and stays that way

reviewText: I have to admit that I was surprised when the rolling pin arrived. I'm used to OXO quality, but this is over the top. It is a big rolling pin, with an ideal diameter. It is also heavy. It's heft helps keep it where it belongs, instead of bouncing around on the dough and making you work harder. It has a strong axle, which glides remarkably smoothly, even when the pressure is on. The hard non stick surface works very well, and does not pick up butter grease like some other coatings. The handles are simply the best I have have encountered. This is a very well designed kitchen tool that fully lives up to the "Good Grips" promise of quality.

I bought this so I could start buying whole beans to grind as needed each morning for coffee. It works great, and is very compact so it does not take up a lot of counter space. Perfect for small apartment kitchens.I have since gotten too lazy, and haven't used it as much, but for more die-hard coffee bean over coffee grounds enthusiasts, it's great for the price.
Great product, works add advertised. Only issue was absolute no instructions of use or anything in the box. The box looked slightly used, which made me question newness.

Purchased this 18 mos. ago and it gets used 5 days a week making 2 pots per day on many occasions. I doesn't leak, makes a full 30 cups in 15 minutes and it doesn't burn the coffee. A tip...I use coffee filters to keep from getting too many grounds floating in the coffee and it helps to keep the pour valve trouble free.

I bought these for a garage sale. I love the fact that you need no tools to put them together. When I was done using them i just took them apart and put them back in the box for storing them. I put lots of clothes and bags on these and they were very sturdy. Great price too!

I'm 76 and just don't have the strength I used to have. This opener is exactly what I needed. I haven't found a size jar or bottle that it doesn't fit and it takes very little pressure or strength to get really good leverage to open easily. It's a good, solid item that I highly recommend.

This machine was delivered fast!  It was well packed!  the instructions were easy to follow.  My first loaf of bread was a 1-pound white bread, very simple.  I use saf-instant yeast in bulk package (keep it in the fridge).  Rose beautifully, baked light and beautifully.  I had too much water so had to add a bit of extra flour.  Tastes great!  This is my fourth machine and I think I like this one the best!11/25/2013  Followup:  I still bake only 1 pound loaves, mostly white and whole wheat.  I have found that using good ingredients is so important!  I have uploaded a photo of 2 loaves I baked this week.  The short one was made with store-brand all-purpose white flour with some added gluten.  The tall loaf was made with organic flours and the same amount of gluten added.  So I say it's all about the ingredients!

5/20/13:This coffee maker does what it promises, it makes great coffee and is easy to operate. I like the integrated coffee bean grinder, I appreciate less clutter on my counter. It works very well to get a pot started in the evening for the next morning and I love the programmable feature. The only problem is if you want to make a second pot of coffee immediately after finishing the first you need to carefully clean and dry the grinder part because it gets wet from steam during the brewing process and it doesn't grind well when wet.4/28/14: I have been less and less happy with this pot because of the tediousness of cleaning the grinder section every time I want to make a fresh pot of coffee. But now the basket has began to pop open during the brewing process, spewing coffee all over my counter. The coffee pot is less than one year old and I'm back on Amazon searching for a new one. The pot is way too expensive for these design flaws. Do NOT purchase this pot. I'm giving it one star since it makes good enough coffee until it breaks down...
love this little kitchen tool.  I works so well to skim fats, or scoop veggies, etc. from broths.  Seems well made.
I brought another because they are cool to have, but kind of weak if its to many clothes on. Get too if you have a lot of clothes.

I like this vacuum and it does a good job and the price was fair.  The hose is annoying as it does not stretch very far.  You also have to hold the vacuum or it will fall right over.  My old sears upright had a hose you could walk across the living room with.The first time I cleaned the filter my rating went from a 3 to a 4.  It was pretty easy and it cleaned up nicely.  The cord is pretty long and emptying the container is very easy.  Dust gets caked up but is easily wiped away with a damp cloth.Overall it was a 3 out of 5 when I got it and used it but the first time I cleaned the filter I decided to give 1 more star.  I usually try and wait a while before reviewing a more substantial product.  I wish I could anchor it to the floor while using the hose so it doesn't go flying around.but overall 4 out of 5.
All you have to do is unpackage, unfold, screw in the leg levelers, and pop in the shelves.  I just bought my third, and I wish I had room in my closet to double stack them.

This thing seems to work well. It's efficient and easy to clean. My husbands only complaint about it is that it may chop things a little too well if you are trying to make something like chilli or a chunky salsa.

The tapwater in my house tastes pretty bad, and this filter did the job quite well. Most of the unpleasant taste is removed, and it works very quickly. You can run the faucet at full speed into the pitcher without any trouble, and then pour it right out again into your glass. There is also a dial you can set as a reminder to replace the filters.I compared this filter in a taste test with my Pur filter which attaches directly to the faucet. The water from the Pur filter did taste a bit better, but the difference was minimal. That said, if you don't like the clunkly faucet attachments, this filter does perform well.

Hamilton Beach Model 54245 Wave Action 14- Speed Blender is an excellent blending device and it ranks among the best small appliances I have ever purchased for several reasons. First among them is the size. When I went blender hunting on the internet, I insisted on finding a blender with a larger jar. My old blender held only 36 oz. and I discovered through experience that this size is much too small. I wanted something larger and this blender, with its 48 oz. glass jar, was exactly the size I was looking for. I also wanted more power and that is exactly what I got: A blender with 700 watts of force at its peak.Next, I really like the stylish appearance of this blender. All of my new kitchen appliances are black in color and this appliance is no exception (it is also offered in white, for those who prefer it). Not only does the color make it look slick and attractive, it is also more slender in shape than the blenders of old. The base does spread out a little at the bottom but the overall shape tends toward the vertical, making it easier to fit into a small countertop space and also easier on the eyes.Now for the most important factor: The blending ability. One of the reasons I selected this Hamilton beach model was because of its patented "Wave Action" technology. For those who are unfamiliar with this, it is a system that helps to blend drinks and other foods more thoroughly and efficiently via the design of the blades. Most blenders contain four blades that are more or less parallel to the countertop. But with Hamilton Beach Wave Action, two of the four blades are bent upward. This design helps to push ice and liquids down toward the blades for better blending.I was skeptical about the claims made by Hamilton Beach at first but one use made an instant believer out of me. I started by mixing up a frozen drink- something that requires the ice to be crushed into tiny bits. This blender crushed the ice down to tiny particles in a matter of seconds. There was no need to stir the mixture by hand and try again, like with other blenders. The drink was completely mixed, smooth, and delicious. I could not detect even a single piece of ice that was too large. Every last bit of ice was crushed to perfection!Overall, I am very happy with my Hamilton Beach Ensemble Model 54245 Wave Action Blender and I have no regrets about spending the extra money to obtain it. It not only looks good, it performs its main task with ease and perfection. Drinks come out silky smooth in a matter of seconds thanks to the Wave Action technology, making this Hamilton Beach Blender an appliance that I will continue to use and enjoy for a good long time.
summary: Wave Action Technology? Trust Me- It Works!

reviewText: I love this bread box. It seemed to have completely redecorated my kitchen. I was amazed that a few minor touches could revamp my kitchen. Holds two loaves of bread and I would highly recommend buying!If this review was helpful please select the ‘yes’ button below.

Buy a KitchenAid mixer.  Bring it home.  Mix up a cake.  Hover over the gleaming, stainless steel bowl, watching the mixing paddle sweep through the batter, and meditate on cakes.  Bake your cake.  Eat it.  Was there ever anything so tender?  So moist?  So delicious?  Pat your KitchenAid lovingly as you replace the bowl and paddle after washing.  This could be the beginning of a beautiful friendship.Seriously, though, I never realized the difference a high-quality piece of equipment can make to your cooking and baking until I bought this mixer.  It does what I ask it to, never complains, never stalls out on me.  It's well designed, it has the power I need, and the accessories I want.If you're serious about your cooking, spend the money and buy a KitchenAid.  You'll have it forever, and you'll always be glad you bought it.
summary: How to have a relationship with a mixer

reviewText: Ordered this for my husband and I when we renewed our vows in September, after 34 years of marriage. I have a beautiful reminder of a wonderful day every time I look at it. I did not have a topper at first ceremony. It's Willow, so I shouldn't have to tell anyone with any pieces, that they are just lovely.

reviewText: I've read the reviews and I liked the price.  After a couple of weeks worth of research (reading reviews and looking at other handblenders at Target and Macy's home) I decided to buy the smartstick.  I've owned it for over a month and I am impressed overall by this product.Pros:-It feels very sturdy in your hands-Great product for the price-Power (it crushes ice very well)Cons:-Only one speed

We got this fan to plug into our receiver and use in our cabinet where our receiver, dvr, PS3, etc is and it works great.  It also works great when I am heavily using my computer editing photos.  I am about to order a second.
This item was sent to me in error but I didn't return it because my sister and her husband use it a lot in the winter you see I ordered a fan and I got a heater instead.

I love these Taylor Digital Kitchen Timers, and I've been using them for years. However, after purchasing this new timer. I noticed that the magnet on the back of the timer is not as large or as strong as it was on the older models. Since I keep these mounted on a metal chalkboard above the stove, this has proven to be somewhat of a problem, as this newer timer has repeatedly fell of the board onto the floor or the stove. I'm considering removing the magnet that comes with the timer and super gluing a much stronger magnet onto the back... but considering I am looking at replacing three other older timers, this seems like it might be a bit too much work.

I own the Omega 1000 juicer for many years, but the plastic handle broke due to aging.  So we did not hesitate to look at another model under the same brand.  We loooooooove this one, so easy to put together and sooooo extremely easy to clean, much easier than the 1000 model.  It was helpful to watch YouTube videos on the juicer as I was able to use it and clean it straight out of the box.  I cAn see why the auger may cause a problem later, in fact the whole plastic will see wear and tear and will weaken from aging as what we have experienced in our old model; so I hope the 15 year warranty is going to come into use!I actually didn't have much an issue with the 'thin feed tube' as this appears to be a feature of the Omega models.  Someone had mentioned to rejuice the pulp twice: I don't recommend it as I tried it and since the pulp was quite dry, the pulp just stayed stuck in the auger-zero benefits.  (I was juicing apples and carrots).I have juiced for many many decades and the immediate heath benefits include rosier skin, better bowel movements, loose stress fat and felt soooo much more energy!  We are not vegetarians, but eat more fish than meat.  Just juicing a few fruits and vegetables can make a huge difference.Just love this new juicer for the easy cleaning alone!  Look forward to trying to make noodles with the other pieceestate came with the appliance  (i am gluten intolerance so this will interesting)!
summary: Very easy to use and extremely easy to clean.

reviewText: My wife wanted this for Christmas and read the reviews.  After her research and reviews, this is the one she wanted.  It is simple as can be.  Follow the instructions and the bread comes out perfect.  Not a product review, but the variations of mixes are endless and fun to try different things for sizes, flavors, etc.  But the product meets all of our needs and looks good as an appliance on our counter.

You don't need to pay hundreds of dolars to make great bread.  This one will do it for you.  i would also recommend getting The Bread Machine Cookbook - these recipeis never fail in machine (as long as your yeast is not expired).

I really like the simple design on the Timer. Its easy to set as well as reset no need to read directions! "haha no one has time for that" Just hold set and go…The peeper is loud so i am able to hear it on the other side of the house!Great product that can withstand falls from the top of the fridgethats why i gave it 5 stars!

You can feel that it does a great job of circulating the air.It also produces a great white noise. It is not too loud and not to quite. Just right. I can bring it into the living room when company is over and it is not a bother to anyone.I'm thinking about getting another for the living room.

Thanks to existing review, I also needed a 4th item for the buy 4 & pay for 3 offer.  Although the largest spatula of the 3 is mostly too big for most things, the other 2 are perfect.  Strong with just enough flex and all 1 piece, not just silicone on a stick. I also like red color.

I should have hid it better when she came over. I want it back.

The only con about this pitcher is that the lid sometimes comes loose or even falls off while we are pouring.  This only began happening after about the first year or so of use.
