I used it on in a grill cooking a filet. Did nothing special, grill was not set at its highest temp.This is the second one and the last one I try.

So far this toaster has done well. It browns very evenly and has a large range from barely toasted to ashes. It does quite well with bagels, even frozen waffles. The top is metal and easily cleaned, but is does get pretty hot if you're doing an assembly line of toasting.

This is a vast improvement over my old basic Crock-Pot. As a working mom and wife, I use it all the time. Especially now, with winter coming, it is so great to come home to a hot meal. I can put meals in before I leave for work, and by the time I get home I can just whip up a side dish (rice, potato, etc) and we are ready to eat.  I don't necessarily need the locking lid feature (in fact the buckles get in my husband's way and he gets rather fussy), but the "keep warm" function is fantastic. I am typically gone from my house for 11 hours, so cooking a meal for 10 hours and then keeping it warm for 1 is perfect, whereas with my old unit (2 temps - low or high only) would cook and cook and cook until I came home to turn it off, resulting in some overcooked and dried out meals. It is also a little bigger than my old one, affording me the space to prepare a meal for 10 people. Highly recommended.

reviewerName: Raquel S. "Avid Amazon Fan and Kindle User"
reviewText: I had no major problems with my Pyrex digital thermometer - it even survived rain (once it dried) after my husband used it outside to keep check on the smoking temperatures of his Weber Bullet. Then I broke the silly thing permanently when I dropped it to the floor while cooking. (I proceeded to destroy another analog dial probe forgetting that not all probes are made alike - the face melted in the oven. It was never meant to be kept inside the oven. Oops. I got spoiled with the Pyrex.) I never realized how much I relied on this thing until it was gone.Our Pyrex probe was awesome. It did exactly what we wanted it to do. I like how the alarm goes off when it reaches the temperature you desire. I don't have to keep running back, opening the oven, and play the guessing game or use a smaller or bulkier probe in a hot oven. And because the main unit stays outside the oven, I don't have to worry about opening the door and letting the heat out. My foods never came out undercooked when I used the probe to the temperatures I needed. My cooking became almost carefree. I didn't have to worry anymore about incessantly watching the clock and wondering if the meat's done.My minor complaints are similar to others: the magnet could be stronger (I still might have mine now) and storing the probe can be a pain since it's so wiry. But it's not enough to make me not want to buy another Pyrex probe. This is a great product - more like essential - to have in the kitchen for worry-free cooking.I am buying another digital thermometer probe and I have no problems with buying this model again. In fact, I think I'm going to buy this also as part of a wedding gift. No kitchen should be without one.I thank Alton Brown for making my husband and I aware that such a gadget existed...it's our favorite, most used gadget.Update 05/2008: My second Pyrex thermometer is still going strong as old as it is now. It's been used for both indoors and outdoors cooking - and it's been left out in the rain several times (thanks, hubby). It still going strong. It gets flaky a bit after getting wet (no kidding) but comes out like a champ when it dries. Still haven't had the need to replace it.
summary: No More Undercooked Turkeys, Roasts, or Chickens

reviewText: The plates are the right size. I really like the coffee cups. The color is really nice on the table.

Liked the 4oz one so much, decided to get the 8oz. The 8oz one had different shape, very thick & heavy, differenet glaze, different color, etc.Disappointed as now have to return it. I tried to upload photo comparing the 2 to warn others. The 8oz size came with a top that looks like a toilet seat.

reviewText: We have had this clothesline since May and all of the lines (strings) have broken. I would not recommend this product at any price. I would have to hang one item on each of the 5 strings because if I hung more on it they would break. The last one broke today! We are going back to the old fashioned string your own clothesline on the poles we put in for this unit.Very unhappy with this product line. I would like to have known that the lines are not meant to hold anything of any weight. We used it for our bathing suits, towels and light sheets and it did not hold.

My 5-quart Kitchen Aid Artisan allows me to make 1-1/4 pints of ice cream at a time. This container holds 1 pint but that's not a problem since it's hard to resist eating the other 1/4 on the spot.  I got all 4 colors of the ZAK Pint tubs so I can make different flavors and tell them apart quickly in my freezer. My contribution to dinner parties is homemade ice cream. The hostess always love this container. So, it has become my hostess present. It is true that the lid is really hard to get off straight out of the freezer. Take the tub out 30 minutes before you want to serve. Hold the top under hot water for a minute before you try to open it. The ice cream will be rock solid inside so it needs to thaw a bit. They always tell you to do this with ice cream anyway but few of us have the patience. Also, leave a bit of space when you fill it. It makes it easier to open. Besides ice cream, this container is handy for packed lunches.  I use it for fruit & yogurt or cottage cheese on early morning road trips. The longest I've waited to open it so far is 5 hours and the contents were still cold.
summary: Love these but it is hard to open

reviewText: Bought these because I was slipping regularly in the tub (I once brought down the entire shower rack and nearly shattered my elbow). At first I was dismayed at how sparsely they covered the tub (only eight per pack) and assumed I'd have to purchase a second pack, but it turns out I didn't need to. Ever since installing them I haven't fallen once. These things are still 100% stuck on with no peeling a year after installation. The only thing I dislike is that a few orange rust-looking stains have developed UNDER the treads which are impossible to get to without uprooting all the treads.

I may be biased since I've always used upright vacuums, but I found this vacuum to be quite clunky and hard to get around.  It didn't seem to clean as well as my usual uprights either.  There's no way to test the sanitizing function either, you just have to take their word for it. For the price I don't think it's worth it.
summary: Hard to get around, not enough suction

reviewText: Lets begin with me saying that, This item is fantastic!! Using it has literally changed my life. I was always on the lookout for a product that sanitizes my toothbrush and keeps it bacteria free! It was so important for me to find such an item, because I always wanted to make sure that my toothbrush was as clean as possible before I actually put it in my mouth and brush my teeth.Bacteria is EVERYWHERE and so when I found this product, I feel like it changed my life!! It sanitizes my toothbrush, keeps bacteria away. And most of all it makes me feel good knowing that my toothbrush wasn't just out in the open... while people use the facilities etc.Thank GOD for this item. I am so happy with it!I recommend this product and brand, I did major research on this company and all I can say is FANTASTIC JOB!! Award winning item in my book, A++!!!

I was very interested in having popcorn without all of the chemical additives in microwave products.  Difficult task???? Apparently so.  I ordered this product twice, both times Amazon sent it without padding and the plastic base of the popper was broken.  Stove top models cannot be used on a smooth ceramic cooktop.  That leaves me one option:  I am going to go back to using my old hot air popper and dodge the kernels that pop all over the place.  Who would have thought making popcorn the old-fashioned way would be such a pain??????
summary: Ordered Twice -- Both Poppers Arrived Broken

reviewText: This isn't a vacuum you'd want to use to clean your entire house. The bag is small and would fill up fast, and a full-size vacuum is much more efficient. However, this little vacuum is great for quick touch-ups when you want to keep things looking fresh and don't want to haul out your big heavy vacuum. For its size it has great suction, and there's a nice variety of attachments. There's not really any convenient way to store all the attachments, but I've found that to be the case with every vacuum I've ever owned. I just pulled out an old gym bag and stashed all the attachments in there.One of the things I love best about this vacuum is the soft brush attachment I can use for dusting. I'm a big Dustbuster fan, and have always wished I could use it for dusting, but it scratches wood surfaces. So this Oreck is a great solution. I do wish the hose and maybe even the wand attachment were even longer, but I understand the limitations of keeping the unit compact.If you have back or neck or shoulder problems, this is probably not the vacuum for you. It doesn't have wheels, so you have to either hold it by the handle or sling it over your shoulder while you're vacuuming. If you set it on the floor, it falls over on its side during use, and if you don't want to carry it you have to drag it along the floor while you vacuum.I like this unit most for hard surfaces such as wood and linoleum. For carpet I prefer a larger, more efficient vacuum.
Received within scheduled time frame and product was as advertised.  Only wish that the Silpat mats would come in sizes that match standard baking sheets.

My husband has wanted this mug for awhile and I decided to get it for him for his birthday. He LOVES it! He said it keeps his coffee hot for up to 8 hours, so he is able to slowly enjoy it all day. I call that a winner.

This appliance is designed to wear down over time and break ensuring that the company gets repeat business after a year or two.This unit does clean well and I've used it numerous times. However, the brushes stopped turning so I followed online advice and cleaned the filter on the bottom of the unit but it didn't help. I took apart the unit and removed the turbine and gear assembly. Once I opened the gear assembly up, I found the problem. There is a metal gear that meshes against a center plastic gear. Over time, the metal gear started to grind off the plastic gear until they no longer meshed causing the brushes not to turn. Cost for a new turbine and gear unit is $37. You can't buy the ruined gear alone. For a unit costing this much, the high wear parts should all be made from metal.
summary: High priced appliance made with CHEAP PLASTIC PARTS!!

reviewText: UPDATE  May 26, 2009 - nonstick finish is definitely not holding up at all.When I got these pots about 8 months ago I really loved them - they look great, and distribute heat well. I have noticed, however, that the non-stick coating has become easily scratched, which surprises me because I am quite careful to use only plastic/wooden utensils in them when cooking. Possibly when noshing out of the pot someone scratched the surface with their fork or spoon or something - I don't know - but the inside is a little scratched. Ya gotta be careful!!!!I'd say they are worth the price, and they really do look nice in the kitchen. And if you keep kosher, as I do, and you need 2 sets of easily distinguishable separate cookware for meat and dairy dishes, the availability of different colors makes these sets a real blessing!
summary: OK pots  for the price but the nonstick finish wears off quickly

reviewText: I love the way that the handle of the bag causes the hole to be covered before you take it out of the machine.  Nice touch!  Easy to put in, to take out, and has good volume.

reviewerName: Kelli Avery "Say what you Mean, Mean what you...
reviewText: This mattress pad is truly a moisture barrier. I bought this for the sole intention of using it on my couch bed for when family comes over. This past weekend, my cousin and her two young children (3,2) stayed at our home. I realized Sunday morning while making up the bed to fold away, that is was soaking wet! Sitting smack dab in the middle was lil misses sippy cup spilled out all over..  I immediately ripped of the covers, sheets etc and proceeded to removed the mattress pad. I honestly thought with as wet at the linens were my mattress was going to need to be spot cleaned and dried with a hair dryer. It did not. The actual mattress was not wet in the slightest. Not even damp. Maybe I just got to it fast enough it didn't have time to seep completely through, I don't know, all I know Is I am glad there is a barrier!Would definitely recommend for anyone with small kids. Accidents happen....
This lid was a perfect fit for the old copper bottom 2 quart Revere saucepan that I got from my grandmother.

These stands are very nice looking. The way all the pieces were laid out was very well done. But they don't support my samsung (ht-c5500) rear speakers. It does come with a bunch of ways to hold the speaker on the stand but the speakers I have has little feet on the bottom stand on the edge of the speaker stand. :( Right now, the speakers are sitting on it lop sided. I might sell the stand locally.
summary: looks great but not good with my speakers

reviewText: OXO products are always well made and are pretty durable. This is no exception. The spout is just a little difficult to clean. It is so small, and because it is plastic, oil/fat of course sticks to it and makes it feel oily unless well cleaned. I use Dawn, so that works ok. Also, it separates the fat really well until you get to the last 1/2 cup or so, then it no longer is able to separate the fat. The strainer holes are large enough so that they let little pieces of skin slip thru when making chicken broth, and I have to restrain it with a smaller strainer.

This is another excellent product I would have been dubious about save for the wonderfully good rating amazon's customers gave it! The blade doesn't look much at all like a blade and appears to be poorly suited to grind up material placed in the device, that is until you see it in action! It actually creates a vortex of air and guides the material into the blade causing it to be ground up in quite a quick order. I was extremely impressed with how efficient and well this design works! I use it daily to grind up toasted flax seeds as well as herbs and other things like dehydrated tomatoes.I only wish it wasn't against the directions to use warm soapy water to immerse the bowl of the grinder when washing it, if that was listed as acceptable to do it would be pretty much perfect!I highly recommend this product!

I got this back in December, & use it every day. At first I had unacceptable results with too many unpopped kernels, but that was from using oil that was out of date. As another reviewer said, it's a good idea to let it warm up while getting & measuring out your oil & popcorn.  One thing I would say is be careful not to put too much butter in the well on top. While the steam from popping melts it so it drops on the popcorn, too much liquid causes the popcorn to shrivel up. I learned that one the hard way. Some people have mentioned the bowl cracking- if one washes the bowl in the sink after using, do not try to pick it up while it's full of water, it will crack or break off the handles.  Just tip it to drain the bowl  first then clean the well area.
summary: Experiment with to get your best results

reviewText: I ordered a pair of these mainly because I wanted height-adjustable stands - in my home theater room, the left-side stand sits on an elevated stone platform while the right sits on the carpet. They delivered the goods, mostly, as far as height adjustment is concerned and that made me happy but there were some issues. What follows is my evaluation and the overall star-rating.3-stars - Height adjustment. Height can be set easily but the plastic ring used to lock in a specific height cracked while I was turning it, probably because I used too much force. It's good that it extends a lot but it's not clear who would want speakers sitting on top of a 50-inch tall thin pole. Maybe a lower minimum height would have been more helpful.4-stars - Stability. It's okay when set at the minimum height but I don't know how steady it would be if extended to the max and placed on a carpeted floor.4-stars - Design. They look alright with black speakers on them. Speaker wire goes through the tube. The 'oak accents' reference in the Amazon description must have come from another product - there are no oak accents of on these stands.3-stars - Speaker mounting. The 4 holes provided should work well with satellite speakers that have 4 holes in the base but mine didn't. I had to use the provided sticky tape and this should do but I'm ready to replace it with Velcro if needed. It wasn't easy to get the 16-gauge wire out of the tube and around the screws keeping the mounting platform in place but, eventually, all was okay.I had issues with mounting the speakers, running the wire through the poles and one plastic part cracked but, in the end, I am using these stands. My rating overall is 3 STARS - that translates to "it's Okay" and I won't return them but it doesn't raise to the 4-stars' "I like it".
summary: I can live with them but there's a lot of room for improvement

reviewText: Our former coffee maker had been good enough for the last 6 years, so when I received theBlack & Decker 12-Cup Programmable CoffeemakerI didn't get rid of it right away.  But now several weeks later the old one was donated and the new one is going strong.Pros:Loud beep signifying the coffee is finished brewing (I like it. I can hear it upstairs from bed, letting me know my coffee is ready)Strong brewing feature for full pot. Also one for 1-4 cup brewing.Easy to set brew timer.More compact than my old coffee maker.Attractive design.Basket filter which I prefer for brewing, both in flavor and cost.Cons:Loud beep signifying the coffee is finished brewing (He hates it. Says it's unnecessary since he uses the pause & serve feature.)Pause and serve isn't fail proof. Sometimes when I pull the carafe out, some coffee still drips onto the burner.
summary: Out with the old and in with the new

reviewText: The product came in a clear OPP bag.  I made ice right away, and put them in a glass of water.  They were nice to look at and the sound of ice bullets touching each other was soothing.  Nice products.  I would buy another one if there are different color choices.

I've been unhappy with my Back and Decker toaster for years.  Wish I had bought this much sooner.  This toast has 4 heating elements; two top and two bottom.  You MUST have this for a decent toaster oven.  The only problem I see is it's hard to tell what position the knobs are in because they depend on a raised ridge on the black rubber part of the knobs.  Very hard to see. I was able to remedy this quickly with a Sharpie and made some marks on the front of the knobs on the stainless steel surface.  Bakes well too.  Four slices of toast brown evenly.  Specs say six slices of toast. You'd have to buy special bread for 6 pieces to fit.  No regrets over this one.  It's almost as compact as the B&D pezokrap it replaced - and way better.
same as original Johnson and Johnson product,, a mild wax product.On the frig, in left streaks. Used on wood cabinets did a good job.Tried on formica countertop, added a shine..

this is a very good basic apron. & it seems to be well made. I'm 5'10" and 185 and it fits me great. I never had anything leak though that got on my pants, this apron is easy to clean and didn't shrink in the dryer with temp set on low. this was well worth the money and I plan on buying a few more.

This product looks just like the picture and is as described. My bathroom is brown and teal so the color fit in perfect with the decor. I used standard hand towels and they fit just fine. I am happy with my purchase!

good quality

These things are amazing!  I put ice water in it at night and  when I wake up in the morning, there is still ice!  And that is without the lid on.  I am a slow coffee drinker so great that my coffee literally stays hot to warm all the way to lunch.  Aluminum inside so flavors do not absorb in.  Size fits in car cup holders perfect.  (may want to get the model without the handle though) We love them.  Buy one or two here and there since pretty expensive and we like having a few around.

Drawer space is limited in my apt but I have plenty of room in my closet so I got this to hang my scarves. Works like a charm. I am a very VERY organized person so I just love space savers like this one.

I've used these on my wedding gown and keeping the air out is what the goal is so it won't age.  But these bags are also wonderful for storing bulky items.  I like how the comforters bounce back after being stored all spring and summer.

need to have this in a shower stall that is already too crowded; this 'fits' well; hang it on the shower door rail

reviewText: This is a very nice 3 tiered spice rack, it helps so that you can see the spices & saves on space in your cupboard. Glad that I found this!

Great for everyday use.  It's very durable and scratch resistant. It maintains it's bright white and glossy finish after washing and use in the microwave. It's perfect for those smaller meals that don't require a full size plate.
I set this in my old umbrella holder and it works very well.  The stretchy lines are annoying, but it's simple enough to pull them taut.

In general, this is a decent container; seems to be perfectly fine in terms of quality of materials, seal, etc.BUT:BEWARE THE DIMENSIONAL DESCRIPTION - we ordered this because of our need for storing loaves/baguettes of home-made bread, and the description seemed to provide just the right size for our needs, but it's NOT.  Though the dimensions are described as 16.5"L x 11.5"W, the angling of the sides is such that by the time you get to the bottom of the container, it's only (approximately) a mere 12"L by only 7"W.  Yup - it loses an entire 4.5" of length and 4.5" of width by the time you reach the bottom. That is a DRAMATIC difference from the provided dimensions in the item description.  So if you're looking for something that holds 40 cups, presumably this DOES.  But it you - like we - were looking for a dimensional item - and did consider the fact that it would be tapered (as shown in the pictures) but had no idea how MUCH it tapers?  Be forewarned!  We'll keep it, but won't be able to use it for its intended purpose and will now be shopping for a DIFFERENT container that WILL actually do what we need.
summary: Size DOES matter - especially when it's DECEPTIVE

reviewText: Cheap pretty much sums it up. Perfect for birthday party favors. A nice touch for our Hello Kitty birthday party.

After a lifetime of using the old-style oven mitts and feeling intense heat after just a moment of holding a hot cookie sheet, these were great. No warmth at all! Plus they won't have to go in the wash after just a couple of uses. I'm sold.

This is my first cooking  thermometer pocket size digital by Magic Touches  that I have purchased. It is accurate and very useful for cooking meats. This product is easy to clean what I really like is how small and cute very easy to bring around with me I would recommend this product and the price is certainly right. I 'am a new owner so far and already I love this product. Thanks Courtesy of magic touches .

reviewText: While I'm sure this isn't the best on the market it does a great job for the price.  I've had one for myself now for about four years and just purchased this one for my daughter and her husband.  Guess that means I feel it does the job and would recommend it.

I just updated my cooking tools with many Berard items. They are stunning and are great quality. I don't mind oiling them, and find a tad bit of olive oil works best. Using these beautiful artisan tools makes me feel somehow more creative in the kitchen!

There isn't much to say about these, they're hangers. If you're looking at this product page, then chances are you already know what they do. And in that capacity, they work. So why 3 stars? Because I find the velvet to be clingy. It's a little more work than I'd like to get my clothes off of them because the velvet clings to the fabric as opposed to just a regular plastic hanger. And that's really all there is to say.

This unit is large, so make sure you have enough countertop space to accomodate this toaster oven.  The oven cooks fine, but my main complaint relates to the dials and the timer.  The timer is very stiff and hard to use.  It's very difficult trying to figure out how to set it and the maximum 30 mins of timed cooking is not adequate.  It's also difficult to hear the timer's alarm when it sounds.It's difficult to get the exact temperature that you are seeking because the dials are so loose and imprecise.Despite the complaints about the timer and controls, it does cook well once you have things properly set.  However, it would be a much better product if they'd update this oven's controls.  If you need a precise temperature, good luck!  It cooks evenly and is a very nice looking oven.  Build quality seems quite good.So in short, it's very good oven with lousy controls.  If the price is right, it's worth considering, but Cuisinart would do themselves and their customers a favor if they'd update the timer and controls.
summary: A very good oven with lousy controls.

reviewText: We have had this thing for most of a year now, and have used it every day to make a big pot of green tea.  Here are some tips on doing that.We bought a 2.2 liter pump thermos.  Yes, this kettle is 1.7 liter, but wait.  Every day we throw in 5 bags of green tea and a little less than a cup of cold water.  Careful how you rip off the string so you don't open up the bags; we find that holding the staple between finger and thumb while pulling the string keeps the bag intact.  We somewhat overfill this kettle (no sign of a problem ever) with water to the middle of the circle you'll see on the inside, bring that to a boil, and add it to the thermos.With green tea you do *not* want to add boiling water, because it makes the tea bitter.  But the bit of cold water you put in first brings the temperature down just enough, and adds enough volume that it fills the 2.2L container.  That's one day of tea for the two of us -- imagine the antioxidants!  Note that the tea darkens throughout the day, so that by the end it is more like oolong tea.We have done this 200-300 times now, and all is well.  This is hugely more convenient, and faster, than either heating water in a microwave or heating water on the stove.  And it doesn't heat up the house like the stove does.  We try to avoid ingesting foods/liquids heated in plastic, so stainless steel was a must for us even though it added a lot to the price.Sounds like some other folks have had reliability problems -- it may be that heating full loads is the best case for kettles like this, since there's no chance of the element being exposed and overheating.-- An update --This thing is still going after several years.  The only problem is that the button which opens the lid doesn't always work.  It's no big deal -- I can just pull the lid up with my hand -- but of course it would be better if it just worked!  :^)
summary: Works great for making a thermos of green tea

reviewText: I have wanted a wall mounted ironing board or years. I finally got tired of hulking out my big board and finding a place to set up "ironing" shop. Had this put in my laundry room, I love, love it! Sturdy, great size easy to fold up. We placed one set of screws in a stud and the other side with three anchors that will hold 80 pounds apiece. Will not go stud to stud. My best home purchase of the year, should have done it years go.
So, Call me silly, but I bought this strawberry slicer. It works and makes dicing strawberries for salads quick and easy. a knife works just as well.

This is a good product at a reasonable price from a Japanese Trading Company in NYC. It takes time to learn how to use a waterstone to sharpen knives, but it won't damage the edges of expensive Japanese cutlery like an automatic sharpener might. Another plus from Korin is they send you a catalogue with your purchase that contains a lot of valuable information on Japanese cutlery.

The sheets are okay for a guest room, but would never last long if used regularly.  The hem tends to fray and come apart even when washed in the gentle cycle.  I would not purchase again.  On a positive note, the color is great and the delivery was swift.

reviewText: I used this on three old pruning shears.. made them all sharper. They all have serious dings that did not come off.. but they were so much sharper.  Very please with how easy they were to use.  Recommend you watch video on how to use this sharpening tool on YouTube "How to Sharpen Corona Tools" [...]

reviewText: I bought one of these from a different source, not Amazon, and have used it several times.  I do like it and it works well.  It's easy to clean.I wouldn't say it fits ANY size of strawberry; I've bought some pretty huge berries.  But, I simply cut those berries in half if I need to.Two or three times, though, this gadget has come apart at the hinge and I've had to carefully get the metal pin back into place. reviewText: Not much to say, Brita replacement filter 6 pack is a good value.  I have well water which has a lot of sediment, even after the whole house filter and the Brita clears it up.

I hate having my counter tops cluttered & never wanted an electric can opener. I've always used hand operated can openers & would rinse it off after use but there was always the thought in my mind that I wouldn't be able to see the tiny stuff that could cause problems. The Kuhn never touches any part of your food...so no worries The Kuhn opener seems to find & lock onto the can as you turn the knob....so easy!The newer water bottles now use less plastic to help our environment, but it caused issues with me trying to get a good hold onto the cap to twist off,,,,Kuhn makes it easy again. Love that little "beak" that gets under the tab to pull open soup can or what have you..can't tell you how many times I've broken a nail doing that.This item is just the best can opener on the market & so glad I found it!
...but it doesn't toast the bread evenly. The bottom is usually more toasted. The best feature is that it allows for cooking long slices of artisan bread. It is quite pricey also.

It's true that this pillow is heavy, but I don't think it's as bad as some people make it out to be. In order to make it lighter, you'd have to take away all the things that make it wonderful, so I don't mind a little lifting. The actual pillow part is smaller than the fluffy pillow top cover, which makes the fluffy pillow top extend all the way around the pillow. Also, the fluffy pillow top is on both sides of the cover so that it doesn't matter which side is on top. Both of these parts of the design are genius! I also love that the machine washable pillow cover is included! It's soft and not hot at all. I'm a pregnant dance teacher with back and hip problems, and this body pillow is a life saver!!

My family eats pizza at least once a week. Its quick, easy and customizable. A big problem is getting the bottom crisp so I heat my oven to 425 with the pizza pans in it in an attempt to crisp the bottom. The heat from a stone should crisp the bottom not unlike a pizzeria oven. I knew i needed a stone so i bought this one. In order to properly use, it should be in the oven as it heats as to not "shock" it with a sudden heat change. The first time i put it in the oven and heated it, i heard a pop from the oven. I went to check on it and it cracked in half. The oven hadn't even made it to 425 yet. I was surprised because the core temp of this stone shouldn't be high enough to crack and yet it did. This means there are flaws to it, whether it's air or impure materials. I haven't bought a new stone yet but i am planning on getting a different, more expensive stone.

Toast is done in 2 minutes flat.  Oven gets hot very fast.  I find that the waffle and pizza buttons work quite well for their intended purpose too.  The unit does cycle on and off quite a bit to keep temperature, depending on what you're doing.  That's a small annoying to hear the click and see the bright light flash on and off, but it's not worth deducting any points over.

Worked fine first few times. Since then appears to seal, but within a few hours, air leaks into package. Not bothering to return since I bought a ton of bags. Is use them as regular bags instead of vacuum sealed fresh storage. Would not recommend.

This is a comfortable Travel Pillow.  It kind of has a beanbag feel to it and it conforms to your head and neck very nicely and comfortably.  Also, I didn't really feel like it got too hot either.The price of this is just a little over a regular travel pillow.  For that couple of dollars extra you get the massage option.  For me personally, I thought even the lowest frequency was too fast for a nice massage.  Too me this is a buzz type vibration instead of boat rocking or pendulum speed vibration. I would have preferred about 1/2 to 1/4 of the vibration speed.  My wife, however, thought the massage feature was very nice and enjoyed it.So if you are thinking about this for the massage feature, figure out if a buzz vibration is slow enough for you.I was provided a sample for review.

As with the trashcans I purchased, this product was out of necessity, given that our newly adopted cat LOVES my fresh baked bread. Tired of torn bags and breadcrumbs on the floor, I bought this breadbox for the counter.  I've only had it a few days, so can't say yet how the bread will hold up in it, but so far, so good. Living in the Southwest, it is pretty dry here and bread either dries out quickly if left in a towel, or molds quickly if left in a bag with any moisture still in the bread. I have the dial set so only a very few holes are open and the bread seems to be doing ok.  I mill my own wheat and make the bread immediately, so the bread will spoil much more quickly than store-bought bread. But if I can get 5 days from this breadbox I'll be happy. I think I'm on my way to happiness. I have it in a spot on the counter where it is unlikely that the cat will push it off, but it would surely crack and be useless if it fell--it is heavy plastic, but plastic nonetheless.  The little "cutting board" that comes with it is just a little square (as you can see in the product photo), so you have to stick it just under the part you are cutting. The pieces fit together nicely, and the back piece has a little piece to hold onto while you open it, which is handy. It's a nice design. Glad I bought it.If you've been stuffing your bread in the microwave to keep it out of the way (or safe from cats), this is a much better solution.
summary: humidity control and keeps cats out!

reviewText: I think this is the highest quality canvas print you can get for this price. Great mix of value and quality. Very glad with the result!

My husband wanted this for making fizzy water. I have never cared for Club Soda, but I do like my own well water carbonated.  I drink it all the time and use this more than my husband does. It works better than I expected and sits on our counter top for daily use.  We are finding flavors of soda that we like - Root Beer is good, cherry cola is alright.  Since having this I really don't care for soda because the fizzy water has all the bubbles I need.

First, a little physics: Wattage of a unit results in 100% heat.  In other words, there's no such thing as a 1,500 Watt unit that gives more heat than another of the same wattage in the same enclosed space.This unit uses a quiet, but relatively high volume fan that puts out a lukewarm heat.  It isn't hot and isn't an IR radiant heater. It isn't going to be a dramatic warmer for somebody standing/sitting in front of it just in from the cold.  It is designed to maintain the warmth of the air of a room.The fan is very safe and will shut down if it gets too hot.  It doesn't use an old fashioned 'tip over' sensor (which was typically mercury based), which means you could mount this to the ceiling or wall if you wanted to, for whatever reason.The thermostat is a bit unconventional.  When set, it will keep the room at the temp set... as long as the room is already at that temp.  You'll likely want to keep it maxed out to get full heating.  On the flip-side, you can dial it down at night until the fan speed is on low to keep things quiet.  It will still be hot, but automatically kick up as things cool to try to warm you up.It's very light in weight, has high/low controls for temp, continuous/auto fan. You can use it as a regular fan in the summer without heat. And, it doesn't reset controls when the power is lost so you can use it with a wall timer or power switch.Last note, it may interfere with electronics, namely audio equipment with a 'buzz' as it draws a lot of electrical current using it's electronic thermostat.
Looks good. Solid construction. Stable on the counter. Doesn't leak. To my eye, it looks no bigger or smaller than the dimensions listed in the product description. No issues here.
summary: Well, it's a bucket with a bar...

reviewText: I absolutely love these baking mats. Saves me money in aluminum foil because these are non stick and easy to clean.  I love, love these and give them out as presents.
I LIKE IT. IT'S SMALL AND CUTE. IT IS MADE IN JAPAN . I BOUGHT 2 PCS OF TOTAL. IT'S USEFUL .IT'S JUST WHAT I NEED FOR USE TO MAKE FOOD.
summary: THIS IS CUTE ONE. IT 'S USEFULL. IT'S MADE IN JAPAN.

reviewText: I love this vacuum.The Bissel Clean View plus is a great vacuum. It assembled very quickly and with no stress or hassle. The parts go together easily. There is room for all the onboard tools that is out of the way. All the parts feel very secure. Emptying the dirt cup is no problem and everything goes right back together easily and with no force.And boy does this clean.I used it to vacuum my stairs and I got a lot out of them. But what was really amazing is how much really fine powdery dirt I am getting. I am used to pulling up regular junk with my vacuum. But I am getting the fine stuff that has been ground into the carpet and pads for a while. I am very happy with it. The dual edge clean feature is great because I don't have to keep turning around to get both edges of my long hall. There is a little rotating brush attachment that is fantastic too.I highly recommend this vacuum.

I'm impressed with the durability of this cart and the all metal parts and bolts for the wheels, nothing is being supported by the plastic. We keep our dogs in the laundry room when we go shopping and they can't be trusted to not tear up clothing, so we needed something that made clearing the space easy. Even when all baskets are full, this cart can easily be rolled right out without trying to bend or wobble. When it first arrived and we started putting it together I thought the canvas bags to be a little on the small side, but these can really hold a lot! I have probably placed at least 10 pairs of jeans in one of the bags alone at a given time. I also really appreciate the hanging bar for placing damp kitchen towels and washcloths to dry before placing in the bags. This was money well spent, I only wish I had seen these sooner.

Works way better than the type that goes on the stove as it doesn't burn the juices that fall off the vegetables. Even broccoli tastes great out of this unit, like at the restaurant. We do both fresh and frozen vegetables in it. Even have fit asparagus in it. Yes, you only put 1/4 cup of water in the tray. Watch out for hot steam when you open it -- a hot pad is needed to move it from the microwave.
If you have non-stick cookware, this set is a must-have.  The handles are a good weight.  I would recommend them!

You can use your own coffee if you use the Ecopad. Use can use one or two. For one cup, you simply place in the bottom. Then you can put up to 8 oz. water in. For two cups they recommend 12 oz.. For two, you lift up the little hinged part in the holder, put one in, put down the hinged thing, put the second in on top. It's a snug press fit to insert the whole thing but it works fine. This is a nice small size and fits in luggage well for travel. Use  Ecopad 6-Pack The Permanent Refillable Coffee Filter for the Classic Senseo models HD7810-HD7819.
summary: NICE! and you can use the Ecopad holders also to save $

reviewText: When I say this is like a scene from Middle Earth's Shire, my meaning may be unclear. What I mean is that this piece reminds me of the peaceful, joyous atmosphere of the Shire. This print set is a depiction of nature at its purest, and the image is incredibly soothing and relaxing.
summary: Like a Scene from Middle Earth's Shire

reviewText: I am extremely happy with this mattress pad -- the cushioning is very thick and the bottom/side panels are nice and stretchy.  I'll definitely order another one for the guest bedroom!

These sheets are great!  They're soft and although my mattress is not that deep, these sheets still fit well - and there would be plenty of room for deeper mattresses.  The sheets washed well and wrinkling was minimal.  Love, love, love these sheets.  Shipping was quick and love the little personal touches and great service ExceptionalSheets provides!

This could easily be one of the best purchases I've made in a long time.  This product is amazing and just what I've been looking for; something lightweight/portable with enough suction to do a fantastic dusting job.  It has a nice long cord so you don't have to be constantly switching outlets whenever you move more than 10 feet in any direction.  It comes with a handy shoulder strap and all the basic cleaning attachments you need, plus as a neat tool carrier that attaches to the vacuum.  One of the things that really stands out is, that for the money, this vacuum is especially well-built. Also, not having to replace vacuum bags and having a hepa-filter are two more pluses.Please don't misunderstand my enthusiasm, I'm not suggesting that this should be a replacement for your standard rug vacuum or shop-vac, although in a pinch I'm sure it could do the job.  But for me, it's more for picking up dust that continually clings to electronic devices, i.e. computers, monitors, tv's, stereos, etc.  It's also very nice for getting dust and cob-webs off ceilings, ceiling fans and the upper molding/edges of your rooms. Works well on venetian blinds and for getting dust/dirt out of close quarters like closets.  If you're in the market for a handy to use, well made small portable vacuum that's reasonably priced, then this is something to consider.  Hope this helps :)Happy shopping,Dennis
summary: Wish I Could give this Puppy 10 stars, because it's that worthy....

reviewText: I actually bought this to keep my MacbookPro laptop from slipping off an Ikea laptop/reading stand that is sloped.Works brilliantly for that. And i have lots left for other stuff. Good quality and value. Better than others I've tried.

It is a very nice item, but I guess I did not read carefully enough to realize it is plastic. Something in the wording  caused me to think it was silver colored. It is a nice item, but please read description carefully before ordering.

We live in a 100-year-old building and it gets dusty. Plus, there's the cat. This vacuum is excellent on the hard floors - picks up everything, it is easy to use, very light. I love it. An excellent machine for an excellent price. The included attachment for fabric works great - pulled all the cat hair off the sofa and the bed skirt!I don't think this is a vacuum for carpet - but it is PERFECT for hard floors.
summary: I love this vacuum (but only for floors - not carpet)

reviewText: These work perfectly.  They do the job very well.  However - stay alert - a hot cast iron pan WILL melt these little guys while you are scraping gunk off.  Ask me how I know?  :-)

I had bought a huge rice maker that probably made rice for 20 so I rarely used it.This one I think makes a little under 2 cups. I find that 1 cup is enough for 3-4.This smaller size is just right and you can steam some veggies on the top rack while the rice is cooking.My son uses his for oatmeal that is cooked when he gets up in the morning.
summary: Perfect size for a small family of 3-4

reviewText: Does a great job.  Only complain is that it sounds like a toilet sucking down ALL the water out of the tank.  But, then it wouldn't work well if it didn't, right?!  Good price for a good item.  Aeration for red wines does work; it's not in your head!
We have used a brita pitcher for years now and these were a good price for a 10 pack! Will buy again

Initially when we first purchased the cup it did a good job when we would make our coffee.  It had always allowed fine pieces of coffee grounds to get into the mug, but it was tolerable.  Now after about six weeks of use, the cup is starting to allow larger pieces of grounds into the mug, making the cup of coffee unpleasant.  I don't know if it's the gold filter itself, or poor workmanship that's allowing the filter to separate from the plastic cup.  The fact that it's allowing grounds into the mug combined with the trouble of having to add coffee into the cup, we probably wouldn't have purchased the product in retrospect.  Maybe looking for sales on Vue cups is easier.
Great for carrying food, especially my much loved deviled eggs, to church pot lucks. I've used mine for years and bought a second set for our RV. They are also great for freezing leftovers in.
summary: Great for Carrying Food to Pot Lucks

reviewText: Very cheap and not well built. When assembling it's hard to keep the sides together while putting the shelves in. very cheap construction. Would not recommend it
These work great for storing food but it's hard to get the top on properly. I will continue to use these for my small business.

The lid is secure, no issues with leakage. Only issue is it is prone to stains, however it is easily remedied with spritz of a mild bleach and water blend. The cup reheats in the microwave very well even with the sleeve on. It is not an insulated cup so it does not keep a drink hot very an extended period of time. My other travel mugs don't reheat in a microwave very well so this is my preferred cup for the office.
summary: Cute cup but not my go to for travel

reviewText: I bought several 9oz,15oz, 2oz, and 21oz.  They look great keep my drinks cold longer...BUT they are fragile...My wife tipped one glass over in the sink and it shattered....Our glass's they replaced we dropped banged etc, and never broke.  So if you are hard on glasswear then look for another type of glass, if you are gentle this is your glass..

This deep fryer is a nice size, has an accurate thermostat and it fully submersible. I really like it. Its well worth the money and I would gladly recommend it to someone looking for a basic, easy to use, and submersible fryer-steamer.My only complaint is that it has to be completely put together upon arrival. Legs, handles, etc. Annoying! If not for that, I'd have given it 5 stars.Once put together it doesn't fit back into the box very well (we store this type of item back in their boxes between uses) but that isn't a big deal unless you needed to return it for some reason. Then you'd have to take it back apart.

This was a nicely made spoon.  The only problem is everything seems to be made with right hand people in mind.  I'm left handed so the spoon "bowl" is backwards for me.  Mine was made from a nice strong piece of bamboo with no cracks or rough edges.

I love rice and cook it often (not pre-boxed stuff).  I know lots of people who use rice cookers. I get that it can be set and kept warm, but I think it's tricky getting the right water ratio to the type of rice you use (we use more than white or brown).  It also takes 10 min cooking on a stovetop then 10 to cool -----this thing takes more than that and I'm not getting better or equally good rice. It might just be me.......but I would sell mine to YOU :-)
summary: Takes longer than stove top, so what's the benefit?

reviewText: Love this bowl...especially when I make bread.  The bowl is larger than the stainless bowls that came with my mixer, so I can make more dough.  I also like the fact that you can see that all the ingredients are getting incorporated when using the clear bowl.

The top racks and the bottom "feets" can actually be pushed inward to save space when stored away and pulled out to put in use. It looks nice and is sturdy enough to put the volume of clothes advised. I place mine near a window so that the breeze dries the clothes down. The clothes look perfect the next day unlike machine drying which makes wrinkles and it ruins the fabric.

reviewerName: My 2 Cents "and a penny for your thoughts"
reviewText: I own the first generation Tassimo (by Braun). It works fine but I love the Tassimo system so much, I upgraded for the improvements mentioned by previous reviewers. If you entertain at all, would like cappuccino, latte etc without the headache of a huge milk steaming machine - you will love the Tassimo. The only bad thing I can say is  about Tassimo.com's automatic delivery program. It's not good and their customer service is frustrating at best. I buy my discs from Amazon.
This thing makes my life so much easier! It's so easy to use and makes rolling out the dough quick and painless.  Perfect circle every time
This popcorn popper is so easy to use.  It is a healthy snack that kids can make for themselves.  Shake alittle cheese on it and it is even better.

Bought two of them, one for freezer, one for fridge. Swapped back and forth a few times, get same readings, so either both are wrong, or both correct. Easy to read, good for the money. My old fridge slowly quit last month, spoiled food, no warning. Couldn't repair, old R12 refrigerant, so with new fridge, decided some thermometers could give advance warning. Also an idea of how to set temperature controls. These fit the bill.

These are the worst glasses I have ever bought. Save your time and money. When the package arrived, I opened it to discover one of the rims was sharp and missing it's rim. There weren't even any broken pieces of glasses in the package so who in the world placed that glass in the package to begin with? Because it sure wasn't a delivery problem. Ok, perhaps that was a fluke --- but then two of them broke in my hand while I was gently washing them. Gently!!! Overall, a real flimsy piece of crap and I'm glad I didn't get cut. I saw the same exact glasses at an close out place called Ocean State Joblot and they were made out of perfectly sturdy thick glass, unlike these ones...and for the same price. What's the deal? Thankfully I got my money back! I'm at a total loss for all the 5 star reviews this product got... just blows my mind.
According the the Fagor pressure cooker manual, I expect to go through one of these gaskets a season. A little pricey for a piece of silicon but a necessary item.

Have used this only 4 times (in 2 weeks) but love it.  I use a little non-stick spray in the egg cup and the eggs come out very nicely.  Do have to reduce heat or water does splash out around the edges of the lid at full boil.
They are very sturdy and well made. Nothing more to add other than, they should reduce the word requirement on these requested reviews.. Sometimes, like this, more words are not needed....

Wifey loves them ...  That makes me happy.The pan's metal seems thick enough.The handles are not very stylish.I hope the "stainless" lasts.The glass-lids are pretty thick, with nice steam-vents,but I hope the metal hardware does not rust.Metal handles do get warmish.hmm.. there is NO labelling/branding on box or items(except: made in "you know where" )note: goodbye to the worn-out, "cheap" non-stick set.

Four kids, two cats, one large dog, and lots of gardening on a mini farm. Even though we don't wear shoes in the house, the floors get nasty pretty fast. I've used the steamer several times and have tested the results with either a white paper towel or by wearing white socks on the barely-damp floors (tile and sealed wood). No grime. This hasn't happened before, so I'm pleased.

I had wanted a juicer for a long time, but couldn't decide what brand. I kept hearing how great it is to have one, but was worried I would use it a couple times and get frustrated with the process cleaning it etc. I saw this one and noticed it had great reviews. The price was right (under $100). I also liked that it seemed more compact than others. I am running out of space in my kitchen! Ordered this. I am not one to sit and read directions beginning to end. This one, I took out of the box and scanned the safety precautions etc. In 5 minutes I had juice--it was that easy to work. There aren't a lot of complicated parts. The clean up was also easy--two minutes tops. There are four major parts--the top, the blade part and the encasement for that, the plunger. Easy-peasy. The amount of juice this machine produces is incredible! I can't believe I lived without this thing. I make juice twice a day since it arrived 8 days ago. It sits neatly on my counter top and is not intrusive at all. If I want juice, it's probably 5 minutes--make the juice and clean up all in 5. Done. It's so easy to clean that I do it immediately and reassemble for next time. They also supply a very sturdy brush for the blade attachment. I would recommend!

I have made my favorite banana bread in this and it cleaned up like a dream. Silicone products are some of my favorites to use and this loaf pan is no exception. Bread slides out very easily after baking and the crust was cooked perfectly with no burning. This will get lots of use in my kitchen in the future!
summary: A great pan for loaf cooking

reviewText: I am buying a house and I bought this because of price.  If I had known about its high quality, I would have ordered at least four more cases, so that I can have a big family union and serve everyone with this pretty set.
summary: wish I had ordered more cases of this high quality product

reviewText: Great huge bento box.  I can pack a good size lunch for 2 adults.  Draw back is that there is no strap to keep it together.  I used a stretchy headband.

I expected 2 yards by 2 yards . . . not 2 yards by 1 yard . . . I am very upset that it is useless for what I intended and not worth the expense of sending them back!  Definitely not worth more than 2.50 let alone more!

Sounds silly, but no instructions came with this tie hanger and since I've never owned one before I wasn't sure how to use it. I experimented and found a secure method. It seems to be a quality product and I am happy with my purchase.

I've had a few of these fall from 4 and 5 1/2 feet off my shelf and these smaller ones have survived the fall. The bigger ones will usually shatter but the smaller ones (no larger than 25 1/4 or 33 1/3 ounce) usually survive the fall.
I bought it for my airfryer, and they were perfect for it. You can use them in your airfryer to toast or grill meat.
They work great for mini wedding cakes or three tiers when you don't want it to be HUGE, you know?

If I can get my husband to eat spinach then this does work.  I love spinach and my husband dislikes it.  I served him spinach made from this steamer and he loved it.  It is great for vegetables and hard boiled eggs.  My big complaint and I am surprised that more people have not commented on this.  There are no recipes with this machine. The book leaves a lot to be desired.  The times given for cooking are an estimate.  You try it at the suggested time and if it works - great, if not you adjust for it till you get the right time.  Then mark the time in the book that comes with the steamer.  Once you get the time down for each vegetable, cooking it is a breeze.  I always boiled my potatoes - never knew potatoes tasted so good since I tried them steamed.  I have not had much success with rice.  I am still experimenting with rice to get the right time & water both for white and brown rice.  You will not be sorry you bought this.
summary: This really does work for vegetables & eggs

reviewText: Wife uses it most of the time...( all the time). Cooks rice great and clean up is easy . I would recommend this for anyone that likes rice cooked easy .
I needed a bigger container for storing coffee and this airtight one fit the bill. A nice silicon gasket and a clean metal finish.
Not the best materials were used but it does hold smaller preserved materials for our labs with out too many problems

I wanted this to put in my every day silverware due to limited drawer space.  Unfortunately, it's not tall enough to hold the heavy weight of silverware.  Otherwise the quality is good and it would be great for plasticware for your BBQ or picnic.

This stunning set of art will look great in the lounge o the kitchen. It's just like having another window to look out of, straight into the arms of Nature.  It's realistic in colour and springs to life and will brighten up any plain wall in your house.

To the people who are surprised by the size of this pan, I have to say (and this goes for all such purchases, folks):Don't buy from the picture. Read the description. They tell you the size.If I see one more person complain in a review that they "were expecting an Irish Setter puppy, but all I got were some smelly sticks," I'm going to scream.Just because the rawhide chews had a PICTURE of hunting dog on the front panel doesn't mean they were selling you a damned dog in a plastic baggie.This pan has 12 cavities that make delightful individual loaves of breads both quick and yeast-risen, as well as mini breads for hosting or gifting that are just the right size.If you want a neat way to present a dinner roll or drop biscuit, this is brilliant.Try pressing your canned biscuit dough in each well, cut a slit down the center lengthwise in each, and let them crown. Brush the tops with melted butter, sprinkle on herbs, oats, seeds, whatever you like, and bake.You don't have to stick your finger in some fat little white blobby guy's belly to get giggles of delight.A great option versus muffin tin for cupcakes and sweet treats like muffins and banana bread. And anything you'd serve with a meat and cheese board looks more creative and couture when it's shaped like a loaf and not a glop.Stop hating, and start baking. Clean up is a snap and a spray of nonstick before use insures perfect unmolding each and every time.
well this little guy is spot on. I have weighted it on 3 scales and puff!!! Perfect!........Buy it you won't be sorry.
Love the bamboo for our utensils, matches other kitchen accessories we have and is just the right size to hold spoons, tins, spatulas and more.
LOVE the price! I bought the filter unit which already comes with one cartridge and since I change them every 3 months, this pack will last me for over a year! Great tasting and smelling water!!

awesome. that's all i have to say.  all my hamilton beach products have broken at one point or another.  decided to drop 2x the $ on this one and well worth the investment.lots of juicedrier pulpThe only downside is where the juice comes out, there is a small lip that is near impossible to clean...so it's kinda gross.But for the price, it cannot be beaten. =)

I have now used this Steamer about 10 times and can confidently post my review. I used this once on a business trip and the rest of the time at home. First, follow the directions and don't overfill the water and it will work like it should. However, I find it silly to travel with as most hotels have an iron available. Luggage space is precious these days and even though its not a large item, it will take up quite some room in a carry-on. So the product removes wrinkles with ease and heats up quickly. The power cord is plenty long and I love that it comes with a very nice storage bag. If you "need" a travel steamer, this unit will work great.
summary: Nice portable travel steamer IF you need one.

reviewText: Note well - the good reviews are for NEW toppers.  This topper was great for about 9 months.  Now, the gel material has no integrity in the areas under our bodies.  We sink down to the mattress underneath. There are firmer areas surrounding, making it uncomfortable to roll over as it's uphill.  I weigh 125 lbs,  so it's not a weight issue.  We rotated the topper several times during use.The 3 year warranty is worthless.  Amazon won't honor it,  the seller - "LinenSpa" had to be contacted multiple times and then shunted us to "Lucid Mattress" .  Lucid has told me that their mattress is designed to do this. Really?  We have  similar toppers on three other beds and none of them compress to the point of zero support.  What would be the point of the topper?This topper would only be useful for a guest room.  It is certainly not up to daily use and it's very expensive for it's useful life span.
summary: Life span only 9 months.  Worthless warranty

reviewText: This is a great item.  I have been using a regular bowl but lose some rice when I wash and drain. This works great.
This works great for pulling dough out of a bowl. It's stiff, which is good. Hardly a necessity but it does make that task easier. A nice product for the gadget freaks out there.
I got this to go with other fish-themed kitchen gear for my Pisces sister. It's soap-dish-sized and could probably be used for that too.
I love this tea infuser and I use it constantly. It is big enough to hold enough tea leaves for a big cup of tea, it is easy to clean by hand, and dishwasher safe too.

I got this to replace the metal one I had, which got smeared when I misjudged and bent the livings out of it with a file cabinet.  This one is better than the one it replaced and I will be more careful if I move heavy items with its measurable distance.  Plus it really grips the roll make dispensability a happy occasion as well!
We have two of these for our kitchen drawers, one for silverware and one for larger common kitchen tools. They're fantastic for keeping things organized, easy to set up, and durable.
works great w/ my small scale.
I love this! ForThe price of 2, can't beat it!  I bought 2 more sets of this for the king size pillows I bought and because I have allergies and my son has asthma, it's great and very affordable.

1st one lasted over 2 years and I gave it away.  The 2nd one last only one winter season.  The 3rd lasted 3 months.  I am not happy.  From what I have been told by people that sell humidifiers the Hunter is the best and none of them should be considered lifelong units.  If they last a year or 2 be happy.  If they don't then they don't.  I have bought a 4th one now and hopefully it will be as good as my 1st one.  If it was not a necessity I would not put my money on a humidifier at all but without one I have problems.  In summary it is what it is and don't expect miracles.
summary: Hit or miss is what this humidifer is

reviewText: The steam from this steamer is always HOT.  That is occasionally a good thing.The problem is that sometimes "just" Hot will do and you don't get a choice.  Also, it is very difficult to fill.  You can either bring water to it in a pitcher and struggle pouring it into the small opening or you can take it to a faucet and wrestle around trying to fill it directly.  Either way, it's no fun.  Finally, it just feels flimsy.We prefer ourHAAN SI-60 Select Multi-Level Steamer.  Easier to fill, feels better built, hot when we need it, and hotter at the press of a button.  Beyond that, it seems to get our floors noticeably cleaner.
summary: Akward to use and not *that* environmentally friendly

reviewText: All my family members have one of these after using mine, I keep one in the car, and it is the first thing we grab when travelling because we don't want to go to bed without it.

I bought this item this month and have used it for the first time this week.  The knife feels balanced and looks nice.I have some other knives in my kitchen, but a good serrated knife can not be replaced.  I wanted a good serrated knife for slicing bagels and other breads.  This will do nicely for that job.  I was concerned about a 4.5" knife working well enough.  This is not an issue.I have even used it to slice onions and other veggies.  Last night I used it to slice the end off of a garden hose!  It cut right though the reinforced hose.This will become my 2nd favorite knife in the house.  The #1 "fav" is my kyocera ceramic blade that I have had for several years. Drop that fragile knife and all you have will be nice memories; this Wusthof knife is tuff.Thanks to all who have left feedback.  I rely on the feedback when making purchases.

My old steamer--25 years old or more--had lost its stainless steal coating and had become a sad-looking, mottled, banged-up lump of aluminum.  Time for something new!  This Paula Deen steamer is a wonderful piece of cookware.  It has a large capacity steamer basket for vegetables and cooks them perfectly.  I appreciate the see-through glass lid, which lets me check on the progress of my cooking without having to lift the lid and wind up with a blast of hot steam in my face.  I am glad that I made this purchase.

I am very impressed with the OXO Good Grips Cookie scoops.  I own them in a variety of sizes.  They don't slip out of my hands when I am using them.  They do not aggravate my arthritis.  Nothing is better to for scooping cookies, making meatballs or filling large pasta shells.  What a time-saver when one has to make 10 dozen cookies quickly :)

Bought this as a kinda stocking stuffer for my wife. Got a kick out of the fact that it was battery operated. She REALLY likes to use it and it sifts flour really fast. So Far so Good. We don't really sift a lot of flour but she uses this when she does.
summary: Nothing quite like a vibrating flour sifter...

reviewText: this set of blender accessories was just what i needed to update my old blender.  seperatly these items become more costly but here they are at a great value and shopping is made easy because this set has it all !

Just as I was thinking that I needed to replace my bedroom side tables , a link advised that selected furniture items were 1/2 off... I found this perfect size table for a terrific price and ordered 2..They arrived FAST..were very easy to assemble and looked very nice.
This is a great bath mat, and great for the price.  Washes well, very cushy.  We love it, would buy again.
Yup, this was the right one for my blender. This one didn't split when I cranked down on it. Solid replacement.

I was looking for a pillow for my Euro shams. I have no intention of sleeping on them, I just wanted something inexpensive that would make my shams look fluffy and comfortable. These fit the bill. Supper fluffy, so my shams look full.

This is giving me a lot of extra storage space for sweaters and could be used for other items. I'm just a little disappointed that I will have to buy casters to raise my bed just a smidge so these stacked boxes can fit under. From the measurement details described when ordering, I expected it to fit under my bed.
Works as expected.  I like the cast iron insert.  Makes it easy to clean.  This is the second Slow cooker I've ever owned..  The first one had a ceramic insert which I was always afraid of breaking.

I realize that this mesh shaker is described as being small, which it is, but I found that the holes are too small for this shaker to be very functional.  I feel that it would work better with fewer holes that are larger than the numerous ones that are quite small.  For this reason alone, I find this product to be disappointing.

I wanted a dehydrator that was reasonable and easy to use. I needed to buy more layers and then inserts for drying pumpkin pulp.  I almost wish there was a timer so you could set and forget.  It does have settings for different temperatures.  I use for drying, vegetables, herbs, pumpkin, pulp, etc.  There are bigger and fancier ones, but this one works great for me.
summary: Works great for what I need

reviewText: This came in a pack of two, this size and a full size.  The price was reasonable.  I like that they are one piece with the handle part being a little rounded which makes it more comfortable to use.  They are super easy to clean or you can put them in the dishwasher.  I will be buying this kind in the future but not too soon as they will likely last a long time.  Make sure you get a couple of the mini size as well.  Very useful.

I have a back problem (stenosis) and it affects my spine, my neck, and of course, my back.  I have tried the memory foam pillows, which I love, but the best for my problem are the DogBone pillows.  I bought one for my daughter, my granddaughter and myself.  I find I slip off of the pillows and sleep on the edge, which does not help my problem at all.  The DogBones stay where you want them.  Sometimes I twist them so I sleep on the hard end, and put the middle under my chin.  No matter what you do with these little gems, they work.  I bought one for my sister, who has chronic neck pain, and she places it under her knee and she sleeps like a baby.  Who knew.?

This came in the mail today, and I have to admit that I'm not as pleased as I thought I'd be, but I'm honestly not completely disappointed either.I find the colors and pattern to be quite attractive. Unlike several people on here, I don't see where the camo pattern is "cartoon-ish" or anything of the sort. The leaves aren't ultra bright yellow (sure, they could have made them a browner color) and there aren't big blotches of pink area and little camo pattern. The lighter colored (tan) branches could have been designed to appear more lively, but I wouldn't classify them as "cartoon-ish".The things I am, however, displeased with are the size, thickness, and material of the comforter. I purchased a queen comforter and it barely covers my queen bed. The material is NOT microfiber; it feels like a cheap, scratchy material. It also is very, very thin. It's about as thin as a duvet cover. Thankfully, I have a white down/alt. comforter that I use with everything; so it makes my bed look a bit fuller and adds to the length of the comforter. If you DO like the pattern and are displeased with the thickness/length as I was, purchase a white comforter to put underneath. I would not recommend using this to cover up with, either.Also, I don't know what sort of comforter comes without pillow shams. Solid black will do, I guess.Let's be honest: This comforter was barely $40. It's not going to be Realtree, Mossy Oak, or Browning. Those are more than double the price. This is equivalent to the fake leather Coach bags sold at flea markets, but I'm not complaining too much. It still looks cute on my bed.Update: I've had this comforter for nearly a week now and am noticing how thin its getting, as I have been covering up with it at night. The stuffing is starting to bunch up and move around, leaving a ton of excess material on the perimeter of the blanket. Also, a friend of mine has the actual Realtree set and I got to see it over the weekend. Now that I've seen it in person, I can understand why people say that this one is cartoon-ish. The Realtree one looks incredibly realistic, and is very fluffy and substantial. While I'm still not complaining too much because this was inexpensive, I am going to invest into purchasing a real Realtree set. This one is great for covering up while on the couch or to use at camp.If you are expecting this to closely match up to a Realtree design, I wouldn't recommend purchasing. While the design does resemble a woods-like camo, it does not have that "lively" factor that Realtree delivers.
summary: I don't love it, but it'll do.

reviewText: I used these to make sauerkraut and pickled vegetables. They block out air so the brine doesn't get contaminated. Everything worked .
Excellent shower drape, folks!  I like it a lot, and the picture's colors are dead-on.  It's not thick at all (though not shear, either), so if you use a colored plastic liner, it may show through.

We followed directions, handwashed, but in a short time (couple months) all developed cracks in the bottom and no longer sealed. When they worked, they were great. We have had 6 of these crack, so there is clearly a major design flaw.

We are quite happy with this purchase.  We have used it for entertaining and also just to keep dishes warm while only the two of us are dining.  The power light seems to light up inconsistently, but we can live with that problem.  We like the design and over all functioning of this unit to not want to give it up long enough to exchange it for another one.

reviewerName: Nicki Heskin "Editor, Early Childhood and Bre...
reviewText: This is basically a reusable snack size and sandwich size zip lock bag.  We don't use zip locks anymore, preferring various reusable products like tupperware, snack taxis and wrap n mats.  These are a really nice addition to our collection.  I like them better than the heavy snack taxis for things like grapes, pretzels, cheese sticks, celery sticks, etc.  They are easy to wash as they are nice and sturdy.  They do need to be propped open to dry on the drying rack, but can also be very easily wiped dry.  The zip closure is really easy to use, though my sense is that it will eventually break... I don't have a feel for how long it will last, but it actually does feel a lot sturdier than I would expect..it might surprise me and last a good long time.  Also, for those with concerns about plastic, the packaging does specify "Tested for lead safety and phthalates.  PVC, BPA and latex-free."However, be aware that these are more for the types of snacks I described.  The snack size bag is too narrow and trim to fit a half sandwich and the sandwich bag won't actually fit a full sandwich.  For those, we stick with the wrap n mats or snack taxis.Also, as other posters have described, this has nothing to do with the description currently listed with this product, which I imagine will eventually be fixed.  They do not stand for loading and are not insulated, among other mis-described things in the listing.UPDATE: After about one or two more uses the zip closure on the big bag broke.  :-(If you are looking for a reusable-type zip lock bag, this does seem like a cute one.  In the past month, I have grabbed it as my first choice several times when running out of the house for a snack.  One final caveat.. great for early elementary school, but probably too "cute" for older elementary school and above.
summary: Good Reusable Zip Lock type bags

reviewText: Couldn't be happier,This is just what we needed on our bed. I got it for my husband as he was not sleeping well. Its like sleeping on a cloud!! While my husband is sleeping, I must share with you that my Chihuahua not only is sleeping all night long, but I now have to Drag him out of bed in the mornings!! He really couldn't be happier!!

I purchased two sets of these ottomans in beige.  The first set was so great that I had to get another set.Inside them, we store our video games, controllers, dvds, throws, and dog toys.  The one that holds our dog's toys is simple enough for our dog, Leo, to open.  He goes over the ottoman, and with his head, pushes off the top and then grabs his toy of choice.  lolThese blend well with my decor, make great additional seating for when we have company, are excellent for storage, and also make a great ottoman (of course)!  They are pretty sturdy as well.  In regards to children, these are safe, as there are no sharp corners.Two thumbs up!
summary: Pleasing to the eye and practical

reviewText: This product does what it is supposed to, but it's delicate.  When I wash it afterwards I feel like I need to be very careful or the screen will fall out from the frame.  It feels cheap, but it does the job. If you want a splatter screen for occasional use this one is worth the money.  If you want something for using more often, I'd suggest getting a better quality one.

When you wash the hepa filter on your Hoover vac, it takes 24 hours to dry (can't use a hair dryer as it will damage the filter)--can't put a wet filter in the vac, so you need this to use while the washed filter dries.
summary: if you have the vacuum this fits, you need this as a spare

reviewText: Easy to put together. Very sturdy and compact. Fits well in my tiny kitchen, but gives me prep area and a place to eat.
summary: Easy to assemble, great for small kitchens that need a table that can be tucked away

reviewerName: Wharton Woman "I learned to read at 3, by 6 i...
reviewText: works great for near our letterbox... the smells are totally managed. The unit is quiet and only gets noisy when the filter needs changing.
A positive indication that American products are in the world class "elite" range.  Consistent with superb quality- Do consider thisproduct when choosing.
summary: The 2nd (II) piece ordered & the same excellent quality. We highly recommend there products.

reviewText: I also have the bigger pot from Nordic Ware, and I have been nothing but pleased since my first use. Heats quickly and evenly, and food doesn't stick.  Very, very nice saucepan.

My husband and I were looking for a bench to store shoes in and under.  This bench is beautiful and I can't believe it wasn't more expensive.  It is made very well and I was skeptical at first that it was going to be made poorly.  The inside is very roomy and it could be used for many things.  The one thing I could not tell before purchasing this item was how long the legs were.  I didn't measure the legs but it was a large enough space to fit shoes underneath. It is very easy to put together, just attach the legs and it is ready to use. The top of the bench is very soft if you plan on using it to sit on.

I won't have to use this most of the year since the climate tends to be mild. However, my apartment faces due south and all my windows are on that wall. That means direct sunlight and no cross- ventilation. These apartments have efficient gas heat, but no cool air for summer. That is why I got this air conditioner.This Honeywell is portable and no trouble at all to operate. The only problem I had is that the window install kit wasn't quite long enough to fit my large picture window. I fixed it during the insulation process. I also insulated the hose with pipe insulation wrap and "designer" duct tape.It doesn't do too badly on my entire living and kitchen area if I close my bathroom and bedroom door. It won't keep a whole apartment cold but it will keep the basic living area of an apartment from being sweltering if you close off all the other rooms.

I HATE mopping.  Until I got this mop.  I've been looking at steam cleaners and mops for months.  Reading reviews and trying to decide which one would be best--probably just like you are.  Finally decided on this one, and I couldn't be more pleased with my purchase.My floors are sparkling clean now, but they used to be perpetually grimy because I hated mopping. I hate buckets and wet sloppy messes.  I hate chemicals--the way they smell and the way they make me feel.
