I hate having to buy proprietary products and disposable mop covers when I want to be green and economical.  This product solved all these problems for me and it was fun and easy to use, too.  My floors will be much cleaner from now on.BTW, the folks complaining of the product leaving water everywhere probably didn't let the mop heat up long enough.  I was eager to start too and the same thing happened to me.  But when I gave it a few minutes more to heat up, I did NOT have that problem.  I use reverse osmosis filtered water in it and it cleaned dried-on, sticky messes fast and easily without streaks!  Amazing!  I have an 18 month old boy and a 6 year old boy, so you can imagine what I'm dealing with here!  I'm so happy with this mop, I'm thinking about buying a small steam cleaner to clean everything else!
get used like every day! they are great. especially when cooking multiple things - keeping utensils with appropriate dish as well as the mess over the pot. less clean up.
summary: didn't know i needed these so much!!

reviewText: Okay, it is not like having an electric blanket, but it might be even better.  This is not a lightweight comforter, i.e. you will not be using it in the summer. The only negative I can find is what others have mentioned, but it is not the extreme disappointment for me, hence only 1 star is deducted.  I imagine that the production process has been reduced to the point where they make no effort to remove the pils that occur during processing.  the result is that this thing puts off a lot of fluff and if you have dark sheets, you will notice it.  And yeah, I am using a duvet, which is hunter green, so in the process of stuffing the thing in the duvet, it managed to shed everywhere.  A minor annoyance for me and overall I am pleased.  Recommend.

I bought this serving spoon after buying the Rosle Serving Spoon because I wanted another one and the WMF is cheaper, so I thought I'd try it.Being that spoons last nearly a lifetime, it is somewhat important to buy one that you really like.  They is a little different in spoon size and handle size.  I prefer the spoon configuration on the Rosle as it seems to pick up food a little more conveniently.
summary: WMF Bistro Serving Spoon vs. Rosle Serving Spoon

reviewText: The best Stainless - Steel Electric Kettle available. this is the second one that we have purchased after almost 2 years of every day use.
summary: Breville SK500XL Ikon Cordless 1.7-Liter Stainless-Steel Electric Kettle

reviewText: It's actually one of the best electric kettle's out there but the plastic handle goes through the kettle so hot steam will come in contact with the plastic then drip down into the water.  The lid has a little bit of plastic too that goes through the metal which allows for hot steam to contact the plastic then drip down back into the water.Hot water and plastic is not a good combination for health reasons as well as taste reasons.  True, the boiling water doesn't touch those plastic parts but the hot steam does and then just drips back down.

I immediately added this to my bed and got immediate relief.  I can't wait to go to bed this evening and not have my hip hurt right out of bed.For the money it's a no brainer.And really quick shipping as usual from AMazon

This tie rack takes up little space and holds a lot for its size.  The product description notes that it is also a belt rack, but I feel it works better as a tie holder, as I found belts with wide buckles to be too close together.

Mine arrived in perfect condition. It was tucked inside styrofoam inside its own box and then was placed inside a huge box with paper packing material. Both boxes were intact. The feet were just fine with no glue globs. I have wanted one of these for years and am so happy I purchased it before it went up $10 (what's with that?). It is beautiful!
summary: Don't Wait for Years Like I Did!

reviewText: This iced coffee maker does its job, however it isn't anything special. If you drink iced coffee daily it would be worth the money, but otherwise it's just another kitchen appliance that will one day make its way to a garage sale. If you want to be frugal and save counter space, just make regular hot coffee the night before and refrigerate it for iced coffee the next day.Another concern for the health conscious people out there, is that the hot coffee makes its way to the ice via the plastic container, and could potentially be releasing chemicals from the plastic. Other than that, this appliance is reliable and quick, and I would recommend it for someone who regularly drinks iced coffee.
summary: Works fine but takes a lot of counter space

reviewText: It looks great in my closet. My jewelery fit perfectly, earring, bracelets, bangles, necklaces, pendants. Everything I had went in there and it looks organized and beautiful. I actually cant help myself and keep bringing people to my closet to show it, and ofcourse everyone thinks its great. The color and quality of product is great, love that it swivels. I love that you can see everything you have instead of having everything in a drawer or in boxes like I had it. It looks Tre tre chic almost like it should be hanging in a store displaying jewelry

The whole family likes "Minty".  We turn him on and there he goes.  We have learned to pick up the rugs and move chairs out of his way and he does just fine.  I only had one problem, he went in a closet and then closed the door on himself. LOL

Seems like a silly thing to get so excited over, but I love this cookie scoop. I bake pretty often, and it is amazing how quickly you can get raw dough to the pan with consistent sizes. This also helps ensure cookies are baked evenly (assuming your oven doesn't have a hot zones/spots).The action on the scoop is smooth and comfortable with very little play. Also very easy to hold with the shaped/molded rubber hand grips. Probably have made several hundred cookies with it so far and have experienced no problems.

Just received this set and I am already very impressed with it! The first thing that I noticed when I opened this set is that the set is so well made and the utensils are heavy, yet fit perfectly in my hand and comfortable to hold and the set overall feels and looks like a professional set. Here are the Pros I have found:PROS:+ Each utensil is coated with a non-slip surface, making it easy to handle and grip. I have already used this set for making hamburgers and the slotted spatula did a wonderful job with my hamburgers. Also the Spoonula I used to mix a serve a casserole dish and it did a great job.+ Replaced 10 of my old utensils with these 5 essential utensils: 1) Slotted Spoon, 2) Stirring Spoon, 3) Slotted Turner 4) Ladle (for soups, stews or gravies) 5) Spoonula (this is a spoon/spatula combination for stir frying, mixing, anytime you need a spatula).+ Like that these are heat resistant and I can use them for stove-top cooking and baking.Hint #1 - These utensils each have a hole in them so you can hang them on a wall in the kitchen so you can get to these easily and they decorate your kitchen as well!Hint #2 - Also a suggestion, what I did was to place 5 piece set into my White Tall Ceramic Holder. I bought my holder a couple of years ago at a Kitchen Supply store, however, Amazon sells it for just 12 dollars, it is called the BIA Gordon Bleu 60 oz crock.Sample provided by StarPack Home.
summary: This red silicone Kitchen Utensil set is both beautiful and very functional!

reviewText: This keeps my tea bags fresh and organized.  It also is very good for presentation for company.
summary: It also is very good for presentation for company

reviewText: As a long time Food Saver owner, I have looked for the best value for the bagging products. From the grocery store on sale to Costco, it has been a long quest. I read the Amazon reviews and settled on this product, buying both sizes.  I am very pleased. Some reviews said the quality was not that good, but if you look closer, you will see that you can buy these bag rolls in regular and commercial grade. The commercial grade is heavier than the Food Saver brand rolls, and I find them to be very, very good. The other objection is that this over-size roll does not fit into the Food Saver.  True.  However, when you lift the Food Saver lid, there is a small gap.  Just put the roll behind the Food Saver, thread through the small gap, and then you can seal the end and cut to the size you wish as you have always done.  This bag roll will hang over the Food Saver controls, but I find that you can still see the controls well enough to operate. I use my Food Saver a lot with bulk purchases and my home smoker. I am writing this review as I went on line to buy more of this size roll.  This time, I will purchase the double roll package to save even more money.

We've had a Farberware stainless steel cookware set for 40+ years and the first problem just occurred. The pan developed a small blister on the bottom... perhaps the metals separating... but nothing shows inside yet. This set has outlasted a Pyrex, T-Fal and some Cuisinart open stock pieces... the only thing it hasn't yet beaten is the Lodge cast iron. The plastic feels a little different but the finish, weight and bottom all look pretty solid. I like that this pan has a pour spout on both sides and the top has a built in stainer for pouring or it can be turned to prevent anything from escaping. I looked at some new sets from others but the bottoms looked like a piece of metal glued on over the pan and it was not a seamless piece like on this pan. I'll likely buy a larger stock pot for soups and based on this... and what I see in stores... it'll definitely be Farberware. If this pan lasts as long as the other... and that's still usable with the blister... then I'll be over 100 years old and may not need another one.
summary: Looks & feels like the 40 year old it's replacing.

reviewText: I Love it....it saves me the headache of looking for the right color. I can see all my scarfs without the need to take them out.The only thing that I don't like about it, is that:when the scarfs are heavy and big they get wrinkles a littel bit,I overcome this problem by folding the scarfs long wise about 3 times so they are thin enough then i put them inside the circles. I highly recommend buying it..
This is a great product made in the US will repost and tell all of my friends! Great great great!!!!

This is a nice unit for the value,very slim and compact and very easy to assemble. It took less than 30 mins to assemble,once we got the hardware. The hardware was not in the  box so we had to call Sauder to get the hardware.
THE COAT RACK IS NUMBER 1 FOR ME. LOOKS GREAT IN THE ROOM. FITS PERFECTLY IN THE CORNER. NOW MY HUSBAND HANGS HIS COAT. INSTEAD OF THROWING IT IN THE COUCH. VERY VERY HAPPY WIFE.

I wasn't aware that slats were the foundation of this bed.  I was thinking I would be getting a solid foundation that my mattress would lie on top of. With this setup my mattress is below the top of the frame so I am constantly bumping into it. It is very difficult to get up from and uncomfortable as I can feel the slats and I wake with a backache every morning. I rarely sleep more than fours hours.In case you are wondering why this review is being written a year after the purchase is because I just recently assembled it and started sleeping on it. I have slept on futons for the last 30 years since living in Japan so this is a big disappointment and waste of money.

I have seen multiple bad reviews on this product, and they are all on the same issue. The unit bogs down. Now, I have used the 4 gallon commercial juicers (sunkist brand, champion brand and warring brand) and this product. IF maintained and used as it was directed it will produce a better quality juice than the machines I used for my work. The main thing is what you add to the unit. If you use a sweet potatoes and hard gummy pulpy items you will have to watch the filter and feed it slowly and pay attention. You cannot expect the product to run well if you jam items into it and crush it in. When the pulp starts having more juice in it, turn the unit off, remove filter clean it and replace. Simple! I love it. I precut just for an easier juicing and it does help. Please dont let people who cant read the manual dissuade you from a great juicer. Remember maint. is the key to this product!
I really like this curtain liner, it's much heavier duty than the cheap one I had before.I've only had it a few months, but no mildew so far.  Time will tell

I absolutely love these drawers!! They are the perfect size, and the little silver knob in the middle makes it look classy and not cheap like the other plastic drawers that they sell. I am going to get another one to store my cotton pads and q tips.

I brought this product specifically because it was designed to be able to stick onto the inside of the fridge.  I didn't want to take up space in my refrigerator having one on the shelf, and there isn't anywhere for me to hang one inside the fridge, so that wasn't an option for me.  This product looked just perfect, and I liked that the display looked nice and big and easy to read (no having to struggle to read it when it's in a discreet location inside the fridge, I hoped).But, within 1 minute of sticking this product to the fridge, it fell down.  Lucky we had set it in a place where it wouldn't have far to fall (just in case it did fall), or else I suspect this would have broken right then.We stuck it back up, hoping for better luck next time.  Unfortunately, the product stayed put for less than a few minutes before falling down again.We tried a third, a fourth, a fifth time, but this product just won't stay stuck.  We've ended up having to leave it on the refrigerator shelf, which is very annoying when I specifically brought this product so we wouldn't have to do that!  I may buy something better in the future.As for the thermometer itself---we've only been using it a few days so it's difficult to say just how reliable it is.  The temperature readouts do seem to fluctuate - we left the thermometer in the fridge and checked the temperature every 2 hours, and got about six degrees difference in readouts.I brought this product because I need to make sure my medication is stored at the correct temperature, so obviously accuracy of readings is important.  I had hoped to feel assured by the thermometer, but so far its varied readings have left me a bit anxious.

reviewerName: L. Collins ""The future belongs to those ...
reviewText: I had a "nonstick" rolling pin that was starting to corrode around the edges, leaving rust in my food. (EWWwwww!) So I decided to splurge on one that would never have this problem. The marble model is especially good for pastries that are to be kept as cool as possible, and works doubly well when rolling out on a marble slab. I really like this product and intend on using it for a lifetime.
summary: Nice, heavy, durable rolling pin great for pastries and dough.

reviewText: This is the best lunch bag you can buy. It is the perfect size,very durable, and keeps food cold. My son loves it so much that he rarely has the school lunch since he got it. We are able to send him with a much healthier lunch than the school provides plus he eats it. THE BEST LUNCH BAG. Thank you amazon.
These cookie sheets seem to be extremely consistant.  I have used this many times and nothing changes.  Nothing sticks and everything on the sheet is exactly the same every time.

This arrived this afternoon, and it comes with a small cardboardish wrap on it for the product info.  Holding it in one hand, ripping that off with another, and a huge splinter went right into my index finger from the bottom of the unit.Felt around, and didn't feel any other rough areas on it, so pulled the splinter out and got the knives in.Fit well, even the large ones.  I put my largest knifes on here, and still the drawer closed fine.The top and sides are nicely finished, smooth.Only wish that the slots were just slightly wider apart, so it was easier to grasp the knives to pull them out.
summary: Works great, other than a huge splinter...

reviewerName: Chris Swanson "I'm just this guy, you know?"
reviewText: To begin with, it's a pain in the backside to assemble. You'll need a good, solid Philips screwdriver, and a lot of patience. The grainy photos included in the quick-start guide (photos that look like eighth generation Xerox), are less than helpful, and the directions are a bit vague.That said, once you've got the vacuum assembled, I think you will be quite happy with it. This is a good, solid machine, if a bit bulky. It cleaned my floors in no time at all, and they are far cleaner than they've been in ages. I haven't bothered with the turbo attachments or anything like that (as I don't need such things), but as a good, solid, basic vacuum, I haven't ever owned a better one.
summary: It sucks and doesn't blow! (sorry, sorry...forgive me!)

reviewText: Putting this thing together was beyond annoying.  I had to hold a flashlight in my teeth to line up the screws that were in a black and recessed part.  I literally could not see to line them up.  Then, the screws stripped.  I was turning the screws by hand and the tops all stripped with just the torque from the pudgy hand of a chubby middle aged woman.  Several parts look quite similar to each other and the diagram of where to put things was vague and useless.About 45 minutes in, I wished I had paid money for it so I could return it to someone (possibly by throwing it through a window) and give some poor innocent clerk the scolding of a lifetime.  I seriously think that for a product to need this level of home assembly at this price is not very reasonable.So zero stars for the required assembly.But once it got put together, the vacuum worked beautifully.  My first floor is marble, hardwood and two small area rugs.  The vacuum transitioned fine.  Upstairs, I have the worlds longest hallway (100 ft).  The long chord made that job much quicker.  We live on a farm and have just gone through harvest season so there was a tremendous amount of fine dirt and dust along the edges that my last vacuum (a riccar) did not get.  This vacuum cleaned the edges nicely.  I was particularly happy with the turbo brush tool on my stairs.  I am not sure what I was thinking when I picked buff colored carpet for a farmhouse but this vacuum made my poor decision look a lot nicer.Once put together, this is a fantastic vacuum.  The hose flops about annoyingly in the back and doesn't seem to have any real home.  But I can live with that in exchange for one pass cleaning of my floors.
summary: I have mixed feelings so this is a 3 1/2 star review

reviewText: These spoons are slightly smaller than the average size spoon. They go through the dishwasher wonderfully. It is a great set for church dinners.
As good as usual. Soft and comfortable. Wish there is double size or full size of this color so I could buy one for my daughter. Also, it is a little thin.
summary: My second buy from this store

reviewText: This is a loud, powerful, basic blender that does exactly what a blender should.  It's so easy to get additional blender jars and upgrade the blade that I've decided to have two additional jars with the ice-blade (ordered three of the six pronged ice crushing blades as an upgrade, two more glass blender jars, and two more jar accessory kits) so that there will be plenty of slushy chilly drinks at the next party :)The leaky plastic Vitamix has nothing on the steel and glass Oster when it comes to making speedy icy drinks (for a fraction of the price) and the heavy retro battleaxe Oster Beehive is far more attractive.
I bought the smaller size thinking that would be plenty, however after using it a few times the bigger size would definitely have been more useful! Love the OXO stuff, they really do it right!
summary: Work Very Well! I reccomend getting the bigger size!

reviewText: I purchased this cart so that I could transport food and dishes from the kitchen, which is in the front of my house, to the patio bar-b-q in the back and because I could fold it and put it away.The construction is not that good.  The slats are bowed and one joint in the bottom shelf came apart as soon as we put it together. Also, when folded, there is no way for it to stand up, so now it sits in my kitchen full time, which I didn't want.It does give me a lot of room to bring everything outside in one trip.

So far I've enjoyed my cutting board set. I like that I have different sizes so if I have a small job, which I usually do, I can just grab the mini and rinse without a lot of fuss.They're attractive and wipe well. Although, I did notice I had to pull the scrubber out after I chopped strawberries because the strawberry juice started to soak into the wood. If I didn't attend to it right away I could foresee it staining. I was under the impression there was a coating to prevent that from happening, but I guess not.Lastly just wanted to point out that although it clearly has handles in the board, just understand that means you really aren't getting the full dimension of the board. So if you were planning to use this for the dimensions described (like rolling out dough or something)you won't have the full capacity due to the handle.I love that they are slimmer than most wood boards so they're easy to use and tuck away again.Overall I'm satisfied with this purchase.
summary: Like them, handle cut out limits space

reviewText: It works great.  We use it for blt mornings.  I can cook several slices of bacon at once and watch it through the lid, so I don't get burned of splattered.  If says dishwasher safe, but if you hand-wash it, it will keep forever.

I make a ton of sweet tea in this and love it. So quick and easy and the tea taste great! Just pour the water in, bag in and a few minutes later mix in the sugar and you're done. Looks great to and love the glass. Just has a nicer look and feel to it than the plastic ones that I normally use. Haven't found a con yet to this, just all pros. After weeks of use, I can highly recommend this. Hope you enjoy it! :)
This was the best value I could find in the search for a cutting board this size. It looks very nice and is functional.

This product works well and seems very durable.  I dont think it will bend or warp like other cooking sheets ive seen.The downside of this is it is pretty heavy.  loaded up with food it is almost unmanageable with one hand.

I already owned aDirt Devil BD10100 Gator 10.8-Volt Cordless Handheld Vacuum Cleaner, and got the opportunity to test theDirt Devil BD10125 Gator 15.6-Volt Cordless Handheld Vacuum Cleaneras well as theDirt Devil Extreme Power Wet/Dry Cordless Hand Cleaner - M0944. Of the three, the Extreme Power came out ahead of the pack. I like that it has a base rather than just a plug, and it had slightly better suction than the 15.6 volt Gator. It was significantly better than the 10.8 Gator, which had a hard time getting cat fur off a futon cover. If you're just picking up crumbs from the floor, the 10.8 is fine, but if you're trying to get up pet fur or something similarly difficult, I suggest you get the Extreme Power.Between the Gators and the Extreme Power, I do like the "mouth opening" style of the Gators, which allows you to dump out dust and such without getting your hands dirty. Extreme Power requires pulling the whole thing apart and getting inside the filter to clean it out. That said, this was not significantly messier or more difficult. It's worth it to get the base and the slightly better suction power.
summary: Best of 3 Dirt Devil handheld vacuums I tried

reviewText: This is a great little accessory for any baker.  It is much longer than a toothpick, when inserted into a cake it will give you a better idea of the doneness of your cake.

The KRUPS XP10050 Steam Espresso Machine is simple to use and great for making small servings of capuccinos. It's a quiet machine and exceptional, considering the price. One caveat: the steamer part doesn't fit snugly, so sometimes heat (and moisture) leak out (which can burn, if you're not careful). That's why I gave this machine four stars instead of five.
summary: Easy to use, but the steamer part doesn't fit snugly.

reviewText: These are so handy with their lids....I love them!  The handles make for easy removal from the oven and transport!
Love the color, love the size and love the fact that it is light weight and works great in microwave or on the table equally.
Why shouldn't a beverage holder also be fun? My son loves this bottle because he can watch the liquid loop through the straw. I love it because it's easy to clean. Match made in heaven.
Bought it for my daughter's queen size duvet from PB teen and it fit perfectly!  Very comfortable and I highly recommend it!
summary: Great comforter for a great price

reviewText: I bought it for my husband and he loves it! It cleans nice and it is well built. Heavy duty cast iron. So far so goos. I will purchase more stuff from Lodge Pro-Logic. Made in the States.

The Wok Shop is very consumer oriented with helpful seasoning instructions, proper care, and use, and even includes a toy back scratcher.  The wok is carbon steel.  From my observation, the heat distribution is not as good as a cast iron wok, so the food needs to be constantly moving or it will burn on the bottom.It will make a big batch of stir fry, and when used for an outing in which I was the cook, the stir fry chicken and broccoli were a big hit, having folks coming back for seconds and thirds.

I bought a set for my dormitory bed and love these!  The sheets fit well on the twin XL mattress and the pillowcase is of a nice quality.  I was skeptical of the concept of high thread count = soft sheets, but WOW! I've been using these sheets for the past 2 months and could not be happier.  These sheets are so soft to the touch and make me feel so comfortable.  These are waaayy better than any other sheets I've purchased for my dorm mattress.*Warning! I cannot assert that the thread count is actually 1500 - I just know these sheets are an improvement to the sheets I've purchased from Kmart, Walmart, Target, and the linen place that gets endorsed by my school

We bought this locally, about 2+ years ago.  It was the best purchase of a little battery vac that we could have made.  We had another little orange one from a major vac manufacturer name, and it was just about useless.  This wins, no questions asked.  You have some maintenance to do, like any vacuum.  You wash and dry the foamy filter.  You need to wash out the inner tank sometimes.  You will have to cut the hair and such from the beater bar.  And you will sometimes need to disconnect the top from the bottom and "fish" through the little suction tunnel from top to bottom.We have a german shepherd, and she sheds like there is no tomorrow.  We use this daily to keep the hardwood floors and tile floors of the first floor clean.  And it works on surface dirt on the carpet that is on the stairs.  It isn't something that gets down deep into pile carpet, but for surface dirt it works great.  And on hardwoods, there is nothing better.Our Shark Navigator Pro is also a winner.  That is mostly used upstairs and for deep cleaning the area rugs downstairs  every so often as this little one cannot get deep down into carpets.The battery still gets at least 20 minutes of use before it stops working.  This is consistent with when it was new, and it is over 2 years old now.  Do yourself a favor and buy this.  It works, and it works great.  It is so easy to use, you will find yourself not minding to vacuum daily.
summary: Best little cordless vac you can buy.....

reviewText: I like how this product does what it is supposed to do: separate egg yolks from the egg whites. The design is adorable (looks like an egg), and it is way better than using a plastic water bottle. It's just sad that the original inventor didn't make this product in the first place. Oh well.
summary: Very cute design! Way better than a plastic water bottle. Thanks for redesigning it!

reviewText: I have tried a big glass measuring bowl with a silicone lid.I had and threw away another plastic microwave corn popper.The Presto works and these concentrator a are requires.Actually just as good to pop without oil and these concentrator so last longer, too.
summary: Why does corn pop better with these?

reviewText: This product worked great at first, I love that it has the lock so that you don't prick yourself when pulling it out of the drawer. I haven't had it very long though and it's blunt. I mean I've had it less than a year. Now if I try to use it I have to push the egg down so hard that most of the time I smash the egg and make a big mess. Maybe it's worth spending more on this kind of thing.

Excellent value. Very well designed and built. Instructions well written and easy to understand. Nice looking on the wall. No fit or assembly problems. We had no problem removing the plastic wrap from the shelves. I think that problem has been resolved. It peeled right off in seconds. The shelves are perfect for my needs. I have only a cable box, blu-ray player and amplifier. It could easily hold 2 more pieces of low-profile equipment. The shelves are a perfect size for a single stack of components. The channel for routing the cables could be larger, though it suits all of my needs fine. We have no problems to report. Total time for assembly, installation and deployment was less than an hour. This is could be a one person job, though it goes faster and easier with two.
summary: Perfect for my needs. Looks great!

reviewText: After having been disappointed by a B&D; Dustbuster with a faulty switch and a Dirt Devil with non-replaceable batteries that stopped holding a full charge after about two years, I thought I'd give this inexpensive little Shark a try.So far I'm quite impressed.  It seems to have a lot of suction, and it weighs much less than either the B&D; or the DD, making it easier to tote around.Most importantly, I see that users can replace the battery on this Shark, and it seems quite easy to do.I have deducted one star just because this vac doesn't have an on-board brush or crevice tool, features I liked about the Dirt Devil.I also appreciate the fact that you can sit this vac upright on the counter when you're not using it, saving valuable counter space.  The Dirt Devil could only splay out on the counter like a beached whale unless you mounted the charger on the wall, which many said wasn't advisable, as the charger kept coming loose from the wall.Some have said that the higher the voltage, the better the performance of a hand vac.  I'm still not convinced that is necessarily true.  This Shark is only 12 volts, but it seems to perform as well as the 18-volt Dirt Devil.I'll report back if this Shark lets me down.  In the meantime, I give it thumbs up, and just wish it had a retractable brush or crevice tool.UPDATE: after using this Shark for a number of weeks now, I must say that I am impressed with how long it continues to work on each battery charge and how powerful the suction is.  This again leads me to believe that higher voltage alone does NOT mean a better cordless vacuum, as this 12-volt model works better than the higher-voltage Dustbuster and Dirt Devil units I had before. Plus, this Shark is lighter weight, and thus easier to tote about, than those two.  Really, the only negative I can report is the lack of an on-board brush or crevice tool.  Otherwise this is a great hand vac and a bargain to boot.PROS:* Powerful suction.* Long run time on each battery charge.* Reasonably priced.* Lightweight.* Replaceable battery.CONS:* No on-board brush or crevice tool.

I bought this model and 3 of the tall ones because i loved the description and they truly are beautiful when they are finally assembled.Two things i would like to mention which are the reasons why i cut a star off is one that the screws for the top shelf especially are not conveniently located because you cannot do a full turn with the allen key.The other is that the top isn't really made specifically for the bookshelf you get in the box so it might kind of seem off a bit but at the end of the day the simple fact that i was able to get REAL wood in the US has made me extremely happy and for the price hands down its a great deal all around!!I would definitely recommend and buy this again..:)

I'm returning this Krups grinder.  Wish I read the reviews before I bought it.  This grinder does NOT cut a coarse grind which I need for my French press.  I'm going to buy a Bodum grinder.  French press users don't waste your money on this grinder.

I've had this product for 9 months now, and have really tried giving it a chance.  When I bought this pillow, I really wanted to like it - despite some of the other unhappy reviews.  Overall, the pillow was comfortable and seemed to help a bit.  But if you tend to toss & turn while sleeping, you end up snoring even more becuase the pillow puts your head at an odd angle - especially if you sleep on your back.  I'm sure the pillow would probably work if you don't move around too much while you're asleep, and you're head stays at the angle it should.
These are nice bread bags.  They keep the large 2 pound loaves from my bread machine fresh much longer and can be reused.  I highly recommend them.

My husband and I recently bought a Tempurpedic mattress with an adjustable frame. It was important to my husband that we not have to buy all new bedding since we were already spending so much on the mattress. Since we already had deep pocket sheets, I thought we were good. What I didn't take into consideration is the way the sheets would ride on the sides when we adjusted the head or foot of the bed up in any way. Researching solutions to our problem, I stumbled upon sheet suspenders. I was elated today when I received them with the additional set of mini suspenders. Contrary to the instructions, I have the two longer suspenders spanning the bed at the points when the frame adjusts up and down. I then used two of the mini suspenders on the corners at the head of the bed. The difference is amazing, and this solution sure beats paying mega $$$$ for special order sheets!
summary: Perfect solution for using regular sheets on adjustable frame beds

reviewText: We bought the microwave popper that uses these and it works excellently.My only objection is that microwaving may not be good for you.
This is an exact replacement part, and changing the filters is strongly recommended.  It's an easy fix and it allows the machine to work better.

I bought this on clearance at Target, along with a several-year supply of filters also on clearance, so I paid next to nothing for this system. Yes, the downside is that if you have a fancy kitchen faucet, it might not work- mine is one of those pull-out aerators and it won't accept the Clear20 attachement at all.  So -  I attached it to my laundry sink and it works like a champ. Not only does my clean-but-sickening-tasting tap water now taste great, the best part is that I no longer have to lug bottles of water from the supermarket, and I'm saving money by not doing so, too.  So, if you have a faucet that will work with this product, I highly recommend it.
summary: truly green: no more bottled water for me

reviewText: I hate washing glasses because my hands are too big to fit in them. These glasses, with their wide openings, are easy to wash. They also hold 24 oz, which is great when I want to fill a glass of ice and then a soda. Having 10 means that there aren't an even number of each color, but who likes the orange ones anyway?

This is such a tiny iron! I was so surprised when I saw it for the first time, but it works really really well! It doesn't even take a minute for it to heat up when you first plug it in. This is amazing for the price. I've had it for a couple months now, using it regularly, and it still works like i got it yesterday. So happy with this product!!
This storage device definitely helps keep my countertop clear of my 3 hair-care devices.  It's a little snug, though, for my hot brush.  It holds my flat iron and hair dryer very nicely.

I seem to go through a new humidifier every year or two. When I noticed my year-old GE 50-pint dehumidifier leaking what appeared to be anti-freeze, I knew it was time to find a new one.This dehumidifier was easy to set-up and the controls are easy to understand. I currently have it operating with the fan blowing, and it will "kick in" when the humidity level rises about a certain setting (I have mine at 55%). I wish there was a more energy efficient option, such as having the fan run automatic to check humidity levels every hour or two, rather than continuously.I am using the hose for drainage - not the bucket - and it was easy to attach. The design is ingenious, with a plus that removes, and a hose that came with the appliance to be used at the back. Unfortunately, you must retain the plug if you want to return to bucket mode - I wish the plug was attached to the appliance somehow, so that it wouldn't get lost.Overall, this is an attractive appliance that gets the job done. I haven't tried (and hope that I'll never have to use) the pump. If you have a basement area that floods, you might find this feature to be just enough of a useful feature to add it to your cart. Otherwise, it's possible to purchase a 70-pint dehumidifier for considerably less.
summary: Interesting with the pump feature, but is it needed?

reviewText: It's a toilet brush and plunger set...it serves its purpose.  Fast delivery, cheap, and the caddy makes storage easy...so five stars.
summary: How could you rate it lower?

reviewText: This Frigidaire Air Conditioner will help you keep your cool on the hottest days, with plenty of deluxe features to help you save money, and enjoy excellent air quality. The air conditioner comes with a remote, so you can set the temperature, or turn it on or off, without needing to get out of bed.  The deluxe features are all you could ask for.  For example, the fan has three speed settings, along with an AUTO setting, which changes the fan speed to correspond to higher heat levels. You can also select FAN ONLY, to circulate air without chilling it.  The SLEEP function raises the temperature of the room by 4 degrees over a 1 hour period. The machine also has a CLEAN AIR button, that uses an ionizer to help remove dust and pollen from the room.  You can also turn the device on and off with a timer, which is perfect if you want the air conditioner to kick on about an hour before you get home from work.  Another excellent idea is this indoor/outdoor lever.  If you want to draw in cool air from outside, the air conditioner offers you that option.  You save money not only through the efficiency of the machine's design, but also thru smart use of these auto on and off features (Energy Saver mode, sleep mode, timer, etc).  When you are asleep, or not at home, why keep the room at 72 degrees F?Setting up the Frigidaire air conditioner is a breeze.  However, make sure you READ THE DIRECTIONS FOR INSTILATION FIRST!  The plastic louvers on either side of the air conditioner need to slide into place BEFORE you put the machine in the window.  Also the air conditioner is heavy, and requires two people to lift it, and place it in the window.  When you get the box from UPS, it will have a TEAM LIFT sticker on the box, because one person shouldn't try to lift it themselves.  Once you get the louvers slipped into place, after you take it out of the box,  it only takes a few minutes before you plug it in, and have cool air.  I really like how it works, and how it looks.

In love at first use! This automatic chopper is great, but it's not the best at big chunks, at least not with me maybe I'm doing it wrong but it doesn't matter because it's great at doing its job and I love it....and yes rumor is correct it does great at chopping up and even mincing garlic. I can put two halves of a medium onion in it and it can still do its job without error! It's very simple and useful!

PROS: good price, nice colors, good sizeCONS: lip of tumblers have not been buffed down so it can hurt your lip if not careful. We used a ceramic stone to go around the top to take the sharp edge down

I LOVE this George Foreman grill.  The waffles are perfect...just wait until the steam diminishes before opening the grill and they will be cooked (if you have used a waffle iron it is the same)!  I really like the multiple uses of this grill.  I have cooked steak, fish, burgers, waffles, chicken and mostly with the setting between 2 1/2 to 3.  Everything I have tried cooks very well on this grill.I had a large George Foreman for over 10 yrs. which I used a lot.  When it finally died I chose this G5 and am so happy with it!  The only possible con is the space it takes up for storage.  My adult sons are wanting this grill now.

The plate and cover are very thin. I certainly didn't feel that it was worth $23 dollars. The book was only a few pages and very simplistic. I gave it two stars because it may be what somebody needs but not me. It also shipped very quickly. I sent it back.

I use these filters at a property of ours where the water supposedly isn't the greatest. These things seem to work great. I change the filter every couple of months and its amazing to take a close look at it and see what it has trapped. If you use water filters I highly recommend these.

I had a knife sharpener in the past, same brand, and it was loud and clunky and never actually sharpened my knives. I took a chance on this one because all my knives (Komachi) are now 15 degrees and my manual sharpener just didn't do a good enough job. I read the manual carefully, as other reviewers suggested, followed the directions faithfully, and one after another our knives went from "probably won't cut your hand if you try" to "glides through a piece of paper like magic." Love it!After almost every use, I clean them and then hone them in the 3rd slot. Once a week or so, if I've used a knife several times, I run it through the second slot a few times and then hone it. The results are just lovely.If you've been on the fence about this sharpener, give it a try. If you follow the directions, I think you'll soon be hooked.
summary: OMG I never expected my knives to really get sharp, but they did!

reviewText: I have used this on what appeared to be old dead wood and it restores it to amazing! I also love the boos oil for all my chopping blocks and cutting boards but this stuff is thicker and if you have something - like old furniture -  or in my case some old carvings that were sunbleached - holy cow this stuff works well!

When I moved into my house, I went a little crazy buying stuff for my dream kitchen. While I'd lived in houses, even technically owned houses before, this was the first home I picked for myself, and I think this lead to imagining a Martha Stewart vision of myself. So, I bought dishes, and pots and pans, and bake wear that fit this fantasy. Some of it worked out and some didn't. What seems perfect in a catalog or in a store can perform differently when put into use in an actual kitchen.One of my early purchases was mixing bowls. Really heavy mixing bowls. They looked like something from an earlier generation, and that appealed to me. For the past several years, every time I've needed one of those bowls, I'd stood on tiptoe to reach them and braced myself for the weight. My grandmother, who lives with us, had a hard time handling them as well. With my new kitchen island, I've eliminated the tiptoe thing, and now -- with these new OXO bowls -- I've eliminated the other issue.I like that the colors are still in line with the look I like and remind me of my childhood and bowls passed down from an even earlier generation than that. They have a modern light-weight feel though, and are made not to skid. The heavier bowls can stay up on the high shelf in the cabinet -- I've found the bowls I can use daily. Yesterday I marinated chicken drumsticks in the large bowl and today I might try a test run of a cupcake recipe I want to use for Valentine's Day.In the end, what I craved when I bought the original kitchen supplies was a sense of home and belonging -- consumerism and advertising at its best. However, practical supplies for a working, functioning kitchen -- supplies that help produce nutritious and delicious meals -- do a better job of making home a reality.
summary: The Right Bowls For My Kitchen

reviewText: Let me start off by saying that I have been a long time fan of Henkel Four Star knives. They are expensive but are definitely a cut above the rest. (Sorry for the pun) When I first received this Wusthof Executive Chefs Knife Set my immediate thought when taking them out was Wow. They are impressive to look at. What was even more impressive was the way they cut. You don't push down on these knives, you simply glide them over the food and the knife falls to the table. I was able to cut near see through thin slivers of tomatoes. These are scary sharp.The balance, the way the handle cradles your hand, the action of cutting all add up to more than just something to chop vegetables, these actually create a top chef feeling and experience. You almost want to hold your hand graciously when using these. It makes you want to up your entire cooking game. I know this sounds like an exaggeration but it is true. I love these things.Although there is everything you may need to dress your veggies, the main event is the 3 piece knife set. I was seeing pro chefs on TV making cuts into veggies in a rocking motion, and they were using the same style of knife, one where the wide part of the knife takes up the greatest amount of its length, and the taper drops off more quickly at the end. So I got a craving for one of them, and this set has two variations of that exact same configuration.I am not a professional chef but I have a good deal of money invested in my Henkel's, and let me tell it to you straight, these are on a different shelf, strictly top drawer. The difference is immediately noticeable. Highly recommended.
Good quality, deep, handle is a good length.  Got two for scooping detergent.  Would imagine it would work just as well for coffee.

Don't throw away the box this comes in, because it contains more useful consumer information on the outside than what's provided in the owner's manual, which contains two sparse pages of "instructions."Nowhere does it explain what the Ion setting is for or what it does. While it references the power button, it does not identify it (I guess consumers must figure that out on their own). It does not identify the three fan speeds/cleaning power settings (you finally understand how to select them when you read further in the instructions).While the product may have been designed in the U.S., I'm guessing the owner's manual was produced overseas, by a foreign team with no clue regarding owner manual usability or information development.Once you get past that, the product seems to work as advertised.UPDATEWhen the unit is powered off, the green LED Power button light cycles on and off continually. It's especially annoying at night. I sent an email to Hoover customer service outlining in detail the issue, asking if that's usual/typical or if it indicated that something needed to be addressed. I received an email response addressing the red light that indicates the HEPA filter needs to be changed -- which has absolutely nothing to do with my particular issue. Huh? I called Hoover customer service, and after holding for the next available representative for 15 minutes, selected the option for a call back. Four hours later, I spoke with a CS representative, who was unaware of my issue, and placed me on hold a couple of times for 5 minutes while I assume she went to another location to actually test the model. She finally stated that the "cycling" Power button light was normal. Hmmmmm. Might be useful information to include in the owner's manual, ya think?I'm really disappointed that a quality company like Hoover, that manufactures quality products, would completely drop the ball on something as important as an owner's manual. Hate to say it might be a deal-breaker for me in the future.
summary: Great product, unbelievably bad owner's manual

reviewText: My old roaster died a tragic death this past summer. It was an old Nesco that I had for the past 20 years and I inherited from my aunt who had owned it for several years. Faced with the prospect of trying to cook both and turkey and a ham for Thanksgiving, I did a no-brainer and bought this item which was seasonally priced.I decided that in anticipation of the holiday and not wanting to have any issues or surprises, i'd take it on a test ride with a 12 pound bird. I'm not sure if the newness of this roaster compelled me to move forward with this test, but it turned out to be a good idea.The cooking instructions are pretty basic in regard to what the manufacturer provides so i ended up winging this with cookbook instructions for roasting a small bird. As it turned out, this little gobbler was done earlier than anticipated by a good 45 minutes. I had liberally greased this bird up with a combination of unmelted butter and sage liberally spread under the bird's skin and turned the unit on set to 350 degrees fahrenheit and ignored it until the last hour and a half. By the time the thermometer registered done, the skin was a beautiful golden dark brown and the skin was very crisp. From the drippings I made gravy which was excellent.Clean up was pretty easy but it did require nominal elbow grease. To make the process easier, i filled the porcelain well which is removeable with water and a squirt of Dawn. Dawn is the magic bullet because it breaks grease down quickly. I let the Dawn/water simmer on my stove top as I washed my other pots, pans, and serving ware. Took about 20 minutes total. Most of the nasty mess was emulsified. I scrubbed a couple of stubborn spots, washed the lid and well, and wiped down the exterior surface with a damp paper towel.While an 18 quart capacity might seem iffy if you cook big turkeys, this roaster can accommodate a 23 pound turkey because my old roaster did and this is the same size.My only advice regarding this roaster is that this cooks fast, so be prepared if the turkey cooks quickly. My advice is to turn off the heat source and keep the bird in the roaster with the lid on until you are ready to carve the bird.Pluses are large capacity, a well fitting lid that retains moisture, and the porcelain interior that is either chip proof or chip resistant. The only negative is that this cooks quickly.This is a nice roaster given its price and its performance.

I have 4 of the bodum double wall  cups, two 10 ounce and two 15 ounce cups. They keep hot drinks warmer for a longer period of time and the outside of the cup stays much cooler to the touch. Everyone in my family loves these cups and we are thinking of getting the 12 cup set.  The cups arrived in good shape and they were well packed. I would recommend these cups to all my friends even though they are a little pricey, I think they are worth the money.

The product itself is solidly built, and has served its purpose very well. The lid really snaps on tightly and is great. My wife's complaint is that the size options for the containers are too limited. We would have bought more if there were more sizes - and - if they were a little less expensive.
summary: Good, safe - wish there were more size options

reviewText: The tablecloth is a perfect fit for our table and it is exactly what we wanted for our special occasions.

This is a nice solid contoured spoon. It's untreated and so will probably colour a bit over time, but other than that is exactly what I was looking for; a solid spoon capable of stirring vats of things!

This knife will replace half the gadgets and appliances in your kitchen if you learn how to use it properly...It will also last a lifetime. The balance is excellent and these molded handles are much more comfortable  than the old riveted ones.
I bought these for my daughter in law for Christmas.  When she opened them, she said, "That's what I'm talkin' about!"  She loves these tongs!  Worth the $$.
Simple reusable coned coffee filter!  Fits more than just Cuisinart (I have a Gevalia and it works great) and there isn't a 'metal' taste as one might expect!  Great buy!

reviewerName: Patricia M. "Telling It Like It Is"
reviewText: Excellent. Used them for years. Light weight and yet super sturdy. After doing some cutting it is super easy to funnel the chopped up items into the pan or bowl. Easy clean up also and the color coding helps to prevent cross contamination.
summary: A Great Addition To Any Kitchen

reviewText: My only problem with this item is that you have to unplug it to move it. This was a deal breaker for me. I wanted a pitcher that detaches from the base.
Make English muffins in a square.  Spray them good with a non stick because they stick just a little.  If I needed more I would order more.
Fast delivery.  Sent to my son in Italy, so I'm not sure how he likes the product. But, all the contents were in the box when I shipped it.

I have had products like this in the past that were far better. The screws don't match the finish, the feet are not adjustable or sturdy in the slightest. It's shorter and for $18, it's more of a dorm or 1st apartment item than a grown up product. I spent $18, and expected that since it was marked down from $40 that it would be an improvement from the ones I'd seen elsewhere around $20. But after putting it together it will have to do. But I wouldn't recommend it. Mine did not come with screws to mount to the wall.

So far, this shower curtain has certainly met my expectations. Contrary to previous reviews, it did NOT smell when I removed it from the package.  It is completely clear, as I wanted.  It is long enough to work in a shower/tub combination.  I haven't had it long enough to know whether it is truly mildew resistant.  Overall, it's a nice, heavy duty, clear shower curtain.
The best thing I could say about these is they arrived on time and unbroken.  Nice quality, which I expected, decent price and, again, unbroken.  Obviously the packaging is done right.
summary: What can you say, they are jelly jars

reviewText: I recently was released from the hospital after a long illness. I lost 33 pounds in the process and was told I was going to have to gain half that weight back before I could resume normal activities and return to work. I wanted to monitor my weight on a daily basis, but only had an old analog wheel type scale that had to be reset to zero constantly and never gave out the same reading 2 times in a row.A quick search on amazon led me to this scale and after reading several reviews and finding the price to be more than tolerable I bought one.It definitely fills the bill for my purposes. I weigh myself 3 times a day and reweigh again sometimes just to make sure the scale is calibrated to zero. I've yet to get a different reading when weighing my self that second time. And the digital readout is so much easier to read than the old style scale.I did take some advice from one of the other reviewers and put a smooth, flat 12 X 12 tile underneath the scale to make sure it was evenly balanced. The tile on my bathroom floor is of a rough texture with etchings and I knew the scale would not be on a level surface if I placed it directly on the floor.Overall, I'm 100% satisfied with this scale and not only would I buy it again, I'd recommend it to my friends,

reviewerName: My Life is Just One Drama After Another
reviewText: Saw this on Shark Tank and went online and bought it right away! I hate using Toxic chemicals. It's a VERY GOOD product that's also good for Mother Earth. So, why is it 4 times more expensive than CHEMICAL products? They had it ON SALE when I first bought it. Not anymore. I wish they wouldn't charge so much money for something that is better for everyone. MORE PEOPLE could afford it if they lowered their cost. It's MUCH SAFER than CHEMICAL cleaning products.

I found this item easy to install and it does just the job it is sold for.  Great for stability but will come unstuck if you put your whole weight on it.  This is just as advertised so the comment is not a criticism but a caution.

Put it up in minutes.  Was worried about how the toilet paper would unroll, but works really well.  Wish the magazine holder was a little bigger, but it holds quite a few.  Very happy with the purchase.

Works great and looks nice.  I ended up buying 2 so I could stack them.  Decently built and sturdy enough for shoes (I wouldn't try to climb on it or anything).  It is very stable, not at all tippy.  I did have to get a replacement of the 2nd one as it arrived missing a piece that would allow it to connect to the first one.  Amazon shipped it out right away and I just had to return the one with the missing piece (at their expense - not mine).

We use this in our master bathroom which is directly connected to our closet which is where our cat litter box is. As with any cat owner the odor from the box can roam through a room or two when you're at work. This purifier neutralizes any unpleasant odor within minutes. If you have any room in your residence with a stale, musty smell this will work wonders for it.Months later....it makes a noise that one can hear from 30 feet away. Cleaned it per instructions. Still LOUD!!!So...I opened the unit up and sprayed a little WD-40 on the fan. Works good as new.

I was operating this product in a small bathroom at it's lowest setting.  My eyes were burning and watering.  I Googled "ozone toxicity", found this Environmental Protection Agency report: [...]EPA Report Conclusions:Whether in its pure form or mixed with other chemicals, ozone can be harmful to health.When inhaled, ozone can damage the lungs. Relatively low amounts of ozone can cause chest pain, coughing, shortness of breath and, throat irritation. It may also worsen chronic respiratory diseases such as asthma as well as compromise the ability of the body to fight respiratory infections.Some studies show that ozone concentrations produced by ozone generators can exceed health standards even when one follows manufacturer’s instructions.Many factors affect ozone concentrations including the amount of ozone produced by the machine(s), the size of the indoor space, the amount of material in the room with which ozone reacts, the outdoor ozone concentration, and the amount of ventilation. These factors make it difficult to control the ozone concentration in all circumstances.Available scientific evidence shows that, at concentrations that do not exceed public health standards, ozone is generally ineffective in controlling indoor air pollution.The concentration of ozone would have to greatly exceed health standards to be effective in removing most indoor air contaminants. In the process of reacting with chemicals indoors, ozone can produce other chemicals that themselves can be irritating and corrosive.Top of pageRecommendationThe public is advised to use proven methods of controlling indoor air pollution. These methods include eliminating or controlling pollutant sources, increasing outdoor air ventilation, and using proven methods of air cleaning.

If you are already thinking about buying at this product and willing to read through all the reviews - you should just buy it! No one else has anything less than perfect to say about this one!* They are extremely sharp and solid, should be able to satisfy the most discriminating chefs.* This is a very complete set of knives, and should get you started on just about anything. There are couple extra slots in the block, just in case if you have extra knives.* Sure, there are better knives out there (not many, though) However, be prepare to pay a pretty penny. In terms of value/dollar, you can't beat this one.* It's a personal preference - but I don't really like the shape of the handle for the 4 stars set. They feel kind of awkward when I hold them in my hands.* With normal care and use, these knives will last you for 10 years and beyond - which beats the cheap supermarket knives one has to replace every 6 month.  It's a good investment for the long run.

My wife thought this was the greatest thing since sliced bread.  I have bought her many things for the kitchen, both big and small ticket items.  She couldn't stop talking about this pizza pan.  It is well made and the pizza turns out great.
summary: Big hit from the chef who has everything

reviewText: I bought this memory foam to put on top of a full-size futon mattress so it would be more comfortable for sleeping and sitting, and it works great! Additionally, there was no horrible smell as some people have claimed. I'm very happy with my purchase, however, I got it when it was in the $40-$50 range (and now it says it costs $95), so do some price comparisons before you decide to go with this one.
I use this to display my business and professional licenses.  I like the way I can overlay them and have them "floating" without it looking too busy.

I love having Brita 3-pack because the price.  It was on sale and these filters usually run $15 if you buy them locally one at a time.  This 3-pack is well worth it and you only have to change your filters every 2 months so this last half a year!  Well worth it.

Purchased this item because it offered a 15 year warranty (unusual for a bedding product). Seems to be very well made with high-quality stitching. The only shortcoming I've found is that it has a very slippery surface. So, in the morning, you will find your sheets wrinkled up and they have to be stretched out again.

This did not fit where I wanted it, as it don't fit bathroom sinks with a lever type stopper, but I found it is great for a laundry sink to keep lint from clogging the drain. I had been looking for something like that for a long time as the lint traps that fit over the hose still do not catch everything, and I have needed to have a plumber clear the drain when drano did not work. This has now become my second line of defense and it seems to work.
summary: Don't fit sinks with lever type stopper but great for laundry sink

reviewText: We have a large soaking tub with shower and the wall to wall distance is larger than normal.  Our previous shower curtain was constantly falling down as it was a fraction too short to have the proper tension to stay in place.  We live at THE GREENE apartments which bills itself as Dayton's premier luxury apartments and they can't even provide proper fitting shower rods....this place is a dump with management that won't spend a penny to fix ANYTHING....we moved in to find seriously stained toilet seats in both bathrooms...which I'm pretty sure that county health code requires landlords to provide NEW toilet seats to new residents).  We purchased our own properly fitting shower rods and these rods (two bathrooms) fits tight and firm and gets the job done.  It looks like quality instead of cheap plastic from Wal-Mart (where one only finds cheap...never lasting quality).  If you need a new rod that looks good and works great....this is the one.  Have no doubts about making this purchasing decision.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
summary: A ROD THAT CAN REALLY GET LONG

reviewText: I was pensive about purchasing this frame because of the negative reviews. Still, I thought I would try it out. I'm very glad I did. This is a very nicely put together frame that can be used for a variety of things.I used it to frame a custom-made 11x14 poster I had printed. You could also use it for 8x10 photos, documents, even a variety of 4x6 photos. It's a "floating" frame so the options are unlimited.It's nicely put together and looks great on the wall. I will be buying more. You wont see any frames like these at the store - and you especially wont fine one for such a great price.

Just don't drop it.  Ceramic knives are the sharpest around and need little sharpening throughout it's lifetime.  Yet they are brittle, so watch the "dropseys" with this and all ce4ramic knives.  Cleans up easy and nothing is soaked into the blade as well as the abs plastic handle.  Want to eat half of a package of food and store the rest.  Don't open it first, just slice to whole package in half with this knife.  Also be careful as it will cut into any cutting board shy of a ceramic one.  Worth the cost and will most heinously last you a lifetime.  Excellent top notch, grade A product.  And it's black as well.  Awesome!
Makes black cast iron sink shine and repels the water for about 3 days and reapply.  Wish they made some kind of selent for cast iron sinks.
This is a wonderful fan with a small footprint.  You would be amazed at how much air this fan moves for its size.

These are very bright pretty mugs in six different solid bright colors that look exactly as they are pictured.  I also own Francois et Mimi's 16 oz mugs that are the same colors only with dots and though I like that set the 14 oz cups are really a bit more practical in size  for me and my family. reviewText: After requiring to put together a home office, it was really refreshing to open this and see that it was not going to take long to assemble it. I skipped over putting in the screw covers because I am hardly looking to be featured in some home office magazine and they are hardly noticeable where the shelf is, but it may have taken an extra 3 minutes. You need NO tools, the screws are all the same. and it's pretty basic. The longest board goes on top and the shorter ones in between. Bet you will do it faster than I did, because you won't assemble it at 4am and put the boards upside-down. Even with that I think 15 minutes and it was sturdy. I really recommend this. I am holding a basic-sized flat screen television (21 inches approx) and cable box on top, and graduate books on the shelves. It is VERY solid wood, not cheap, thin plywood that is going to cause problems.
summary: Very Sturdy and Easy to Assembly

reviewText: This pasta fork is perfect when you need it for cooking any type of pasta or noodles.  It's a very sturdy tool.  It is so handy and does a great job of grabbing the noodles or pasta out of a pan.  It is very easy to grip and feels comfortable in the hand.  It also holds up to the boiling heat.  Great tool to have on hand at all times.

I like to get replacement filters bought from before, kept packed in my drawer for one of those times when I realize that my current filter expired last month. Getting it ordered from amazon on a 2 month basis makes sure that I don't have to run out to the store and also helps me keep track of when I have to change it. I am one of those fanatic people who cannot compromise on water and will never drink water out of an expired filter, forget about drinking it from the tap directly; so having a recurring amazon order really keeps me happy. :)
...and my favorite color is red.  Very pretty and just the right size for my hand.  I really like it that it is flexible.

It's cheap plastic but what do you expect at this price, I like the set of meat, fish and veggie or fruit cutting boards however the down side is as you chop, the plastic slips on the surface (in my case granite) causing a potentially hazardous situation. Still better than a hard wood or plastic cutting board simply for it's ease of use but there should be a slip resistant bottom, don't recommend it.
Product is not very durable. Easily breaks and can disconnect for some problems. It is cheap all around, but with a careful crowd you can enjoy this product.

The strong plastic smell mentioned in several reviews here is not from the water tank, it's from the internal regions of the brewer. A simple rinse of the tank and my first cup was perfect. Everything else seems to be working swimmingly................so far. Otherwise it's a solid machine and is working like it should just out of the box.

This is my first small blender, and very pleased with the easy to clean drinking/mixing container and low noise level. I own a large blender and recently gave away an expensive juicer after deciding that the Tribest Single Serving Blender is far more practical for my type use. First, the small footprint for this blender is a big plus as it resides on the kitchen countertop ready for instant use. Clean-up relative to the juicer and large blender is a huge time saver, and makes this device extremely versatile and easy for everyday use. It seems well made and durable. A small distraction is that frozen fruit or ice sometimes gets lumped and requires unscrewing the lid and stirring with a spatula (shaking sometimes alleviates this minor problem). Another minor inconvenience is the polycarbonate containers and blade assembly are not dishwasher safe, and must be hand-washed. Overall, however, this is a fantastic kitchen appliance.Tribest's marketing of it's single serving blenders is a bit confusing. The base motor is the same regardless of which series you decide to purchase (i.e., 200 watt; 1/4 hp), and your decision comes down to accessories you want. The following breakdown may help you:* PB-100 (2 blender containers & 1 four-prong blender blade; $50 price range)* PB-200 (same as PB-100 PLUS 2 grinder containers & 1 two-prong grinder blade; $60 price range)* PB-300 (1/ea. blender & grinder containers instead of 2/ea. w/ PB-200 PLUS 4 glass mason jars & mason jar attachment; $70 price range)* For more precise details of included accessories, see the following reference sources:[...]Depending on their marketing channels, the three main series (i.e., PB-100, 200, or 300) may be sold by distributors by another number so carefully check what is included. The bottom line is to purchase the accessories pieces that you think you might use as it will be considerably more costly to buy these separately in the future, especially if having to pay for shipping. For that reason, the $10 price difference between the PB-200 & PB-300 series made it seem sensible for me to buy the Tribest PB-350 Mason Jar Personal Blender & Grinder as featured here. While I've only used several of the accessories so far, the others are expected to be used as I further explore more possibilities for this time saving blender.While wondering whether this kitchen gadget would be put to good use, it has far exceeded my expectations. I won't be without one of these small blenders going forward!!

I received this product to make sugar-free jelly candies from jello and gelatin, and it works perfectly!  Placing the product on a cookie sheet allows you to move it easily (it is silicone after all) and also makes clean-up if there are spills a snap.  My next project will involve chocolate, I think.  I may also experiment with using it to bake teeny bite-sized cakes, though the mold shapes are not uniform and they might burn.  Still, it would be a neat twist on tiny desserts if it worked well.

It is hard to find a lunch bag that will hold enough for lunch and a significant after school/before sports snack, but this one fits the bill.  The bottom portion comes with a tupperware like lidded container that holds a lot of food. It is great for salads, and can hold 3-4 sandwiches.  The front pocket is a great place for a small bottle of hand sanitizer, cutlery, etc.  the area between the handles can hold a thermos, small water bottle, ice pack, etc.  It is also machine washable, which is a big plus.  The insulation value of the bag is excellent as well.
summary: Roomy & stylish with a great handle
